notes.feature_name: Enhance Attribute Management

notes.feature_name: Bidirectional Milestone Visibility

notes.feature_name: Knowledge Maps

notes.feature_name: Archive App

notes.feature_name: Email Builder Lite
notes.description: Use the new Email Builder Lite to quickly create and send batch emails to your Sales contacts and leads.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Data Pipelines
notes.description: Securely access your Amazon Redshift data by using a virtual private connection. Take advantage of OAuth functionality in your Microsoft Azure SQL Database connection.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Scheduler Enhancements
notes.description: Get a faster, more secure, and more efficient Salesforce Scheduler experience with enhancements that include Scheduler flow components in LWR sites, increased service resource capacity for appointments, and a simplified flat list view for waitlist participants.

notes.feature_name: Prepare for Shorter Certificate Lifespans
notes.description: If you use features that rely on certificates, prepare to update the related certificates more frequently. An upcoming industry-wide change decreases the maximum allowed Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate lifespan over the next 3 years. Also, Salesforce plans to stop public certificate rotation announcements.

notes.feature_name: Get Ready for IPv6
notes.description: To help mitigate the IP address scarcity of IPv4, Salesforce is working behind the scenes to support IPv6. If you use an IP allowlist to restrict network traffic or you restrict access to Salesforce via IP address, consider implementing a preferred alternative. Otherwise, prepare to update your allowlists to include IPv6 addresses.

notes.feature_name: Update Your mTLS Certificates
notes.description: If you use publicly trusted certificates for mTLS (Mutual Transport Layer Security) and the Public Root CA (certificate authority) is in the Chrome Trusted Root List, transition to separate certificate hierarchies. Google Chrome is enforcing policy changes that limit the use of those certificates to TLS (Transport Layer Security) server authentication only.

notes.feature_name: Elevate Your Salesforce Go Experience with Smarter Filters and Enhanced Search
notes.description: Tailor your Salesforce Go home page to focus on the features that matter most to you by rearranging or removing specific sections. When you filter your view by cloud, add a subvertical filter to see which feature sets and features apply to specific verticals within the cloud. Also, use enhanced search to spot the differences between features and feature sets with the same names.

notes.feature_name: Capture Employee Details for Unified Employee License Holders
notes.description: Designate employees who have the Unified Employee license as employee users and capture more details for your reports, such as employee status and number.

notes.feature_name: Styling Change to Highlighted and Selected Content
notes.description: To meet the Web Content Accessibility Guideline (WCAG) 1.4.11 standard for non-text accessibility, we changed the styling of highlighted and selected content throughout the Lightning UI. Previously, we applied our own styling to show when content was highlighted or selected, but have determined that the styling didn’t meet this WCAG standard. Now when you highlight or select content, the Lightning UI uses the styling applied by the user agent, which is your browser or device. The user agent determines the color contrast ratio.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200%
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of page headers and modal windows when viewed at high magnification. This is the beginning of our effort to comply with WCAG 2.2 Resize and Reflow guidelines. Expect accessibility enhancements to other UI elements in future release updates.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Cards, Docked Containers, Menu Lists, and Panels
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of cards, docked containers, menu lists, and panels when viewed at high magnification. This release update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update. Make sure to enable that update first.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Date Pickers, Popovers, Bottom Utility Bars, Record Headers
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of date pickers, popovers, bottom utility bars, and record headers when viewed at high magnification. This release update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update.

notes.feature_name: Prepare for Shorter Certificate Lifespans
notes.description: If you use features that rely on certificates, prepare to update the related certificates more frequently. An upcoming industry-wide change decreases the maximum allowed Transport Layer Security (TLS) certificate lifespan over the next 3 years. Salesforce plans to stop public certificate rotation announcements. This change applies to Lightning Experience, Salesforce Classic, and the Salesforce mobile app in all editions. As we reach each milestone, the lifespans apply to all new certificates that a public Certificate Authority (CA) signs, regardless of whether you, Salesforce, or a third party purchases the certificate. Existing certificates keep their expiration dates, and self-signed certificates aren't subject to the new lifespans. In August 2025, the Certification Authority Browser Forum (CA/Browser Forum) announced a phased approach to shorten the lifespan for new TLS certificates. That lifespan decreases from 398 days to 200 days on March 15, 2026, to 100 days on March 15, 2027, and to 47 days on March 15, 2029. As certificates rotate more frequently, Salesforce plans to stop the existing announcements for certificate changes for first-party (1P) production orgs through the Certificate Changes Trailblazer Community group. There's no specific target date for the end of those announcements. Salesforce plans to announce that date at least 90 days in advance. Review your certificate use and plan to rotate the certificates that you own more frequently and stop using certificate pinning. To receive notifications about upcoming certificate expirations for certificates that are stored in your org, assign the Expired Certificate Notification permission to specific admins. To automate the creation and update of self-signed and Certificate Authority-signed certificates in Salesforce, use the Certificate Metadata API type.
notes.security_notes: Salesforce complies with the guidance of the CA/Browser Forum, the organization that sets most Web Public Key Infrastructure (WebPKI) rules.

notes.feature_name: Get Ready for IPv6
notes.description: To help mitigate the IP address scarcity of IPv4, Salesforce is working behind the scenes to support IPv6.

notes.feature_name: IPv6 Support for Salesforce
notes.description: Salesforce is announcing upcoming support for IPv6 addresses. This change applies to Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in all editions. Currently, IPv6 is supported only for the Salesforce Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Experience Cloud sites. Users and integrations will be able to connect to Salesforce via an IPv6 address. Organizations using IP allowlists will need to update them to include IPv6 addresses to avoid disruptions. Full IPv6 support will be rolled out in stages, starting with Salesforce Government Cloud orgs, with IPv6 addresses provided by December 31, 2025.
notes.timeline: IPv6 addresses for Government Cloud orgs by December 31, 2025; specific timing for other stages to be announced in future release notes.
notes.security_notes: If you restrict access to Salesforce by IP address, ensure your allowlists include Salesforce IPv6 addresses when they become available to prevent disruptions.

notes.feature_name: Update Your mTLS Certificates
notes.description: If you use publicly trusted certificates for mTLS (Mutual Transport Layer Security) and the Public Root CA (certificate authority) is in the Chrome Trusted Root List, transition to separate certificate hierarchies. Google Chrome is enforcing policy changes that limit the use of those certificates to TLS (Transport Layer Security) server authentication only. This change applies to certificate-based authentication and API client certificates that enforce TLS mutual authentication in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic. Certificate-based authentication is available in Personal, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, and Database.com editions.
notes.edition: Personal, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Database.com
notes.timeline: Google Chrome enforces these policy changes on June 15, 2026.
notes.breaking_changes: Google Chrome Root Program Policy v1.7 prevents the purchase and use of dual-use certificates that are issued by Public Root CAs in the Chrome Trusted Root List. The new policy requires dedicated Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) hierarchies for different certificate purposes.
notes.security_notes: Salesforce Customer Support can’t troubleshoot issues related to this change beyond sharing the information published in the knowledge article.

notes.feature_name: Elevate Your Salesforce Go Experience with Smarter Filters and Enhanced Search
notes.description: Tailor your Salesforce Go home page to focus on the features that matter most to you by rearranging or removing specific sections. When you filter your view by cloud, add a subvertical filter to see which feature sets and features apply to specific verticals within the cloud. Also, use enhanced search to spot the differences between features and feature sets with the same names.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition
notes.security_notes: To view Salesforce Go, you must have the View Setup and Configuration user permission. To turn on features in Salesforce Go, you must have the Customize Application user permission.

notes.feature_name: Capture Employee Details for Unified Employee License Holders
notes.description: Designate employees who have the Unified Employee license as employee users and capture more details for your reports, such as employee status and number. To designate a user as an employee user, first create a Person Account for this user and associate the account to the user’s Employee2 record. Then, on the person’s User page, click Enable Employee User and fill out the necessary details. After you designate someone as an employee user, the button changes to View Employee User, and you can view the user’s Employee2 record page.

notes.feature_name: Styling Change to Highlighted and Selected Content
notes.description: To meet the Web Content Accessibility Guideline (WCAG) 1.4.11 standard for non-text accessibility, we changed the styling of highlighted and selected content throughout the Lightning UI. Previously, we applied our own styling to show when content was highlighted or selected, but have determined that the styling didn’t meet this WCAG standard. Now when you highlight or select content, the Lightning UI uses the styling applied by the user agent, which is your browser or device. The user agent determines the color contrast ratio.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200%
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of page headers and modal windows when viewed at high magnification. This is the beginning of our effort to comply with WCAG 2.2 Resize and Reflow guidelines. Expect accessibility enhancements to other UI elements in future release updates. With this update, content is visible for users who view Salesforce via a browser at 200% magnification or greater. Without this update, you can have trouble seeing the content on a page when you zoom in over 200%. The page headers can block content as you scroll. In modal windows, buttons and other content can display outside the viewport, requiring horizontal scrolling, which can make modal windows unusable. These changes help you support users who want to zoom 300% to 400%. The page header scrolls with the page and doesn’t block the content. In modal windows, buttons and content display within the viewport and the window is fully functional.
notes.activation_required: Follow testing and activation steps in Release Updates
notes.timeline: Salesforce enforces this update in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Cards, Docked Containers, Menu Lists, and Panels
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of cards, docked containers, menu lists, and panels when viewed at high magnification. This release update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update. Make sure to enable that update first. With this update, content displays correctly in cards, docked containers, menu lists, and panels for users who view Salesforce via a browser at 200% magnification or greater. Without this update, these parts of the Salesforce UI aren’t compliant with WCAG 2.2 guidelines for Resize and Reflow. Content potentially displays only partially. These changes help you support users with visual impairments. Cards, docked containers, menu lists, and panels are accessible and usable at 1280px page width and 400% magnification. The header content in these UI elements isn’t clipped. Instead, it wraps to the next line.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Date Pickers, Popovers, Bottom Utility Bars, Record Headers
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of date pickers, popovers, bottom utility bars, and record headers when viewed at high magnification. This release update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update. Make sure to enable that update first. With this update, content displays correctly in date pickers, popovers, bottom utility bars, and record headers for users who view Salesforce via a browser at 200% magnification or greater.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Enhancements for UI Components
notes.description: Without this update, these parts of the Salesforce UI aren’t compliant with WCAG 2.2 guidelines for Resize and Reflow. Content potentially displays only partially. These changes help you support users with visual impairments. Date pickers, popovers, and page headers are accessible and usable at 1280px page width and 400% magnification. Bottom utility bars truncate button labels to fit within the height of the utility bar. The full text of a truncated button label appears in a tooltip if you hover a mouse over a button or place keyboard focus on it.

notes.feature_name: Archive App
notes.description: Manage growing data volumes and improve system performance by autoarchiving old or inactive data. Keep only important and reliable information in production. Archive App is now available on Hyperforce in Japan and India. New customers in these regions can store their data locally to meet residency requirements. This update also streamlines the onboarding experience by removing the OAuth 2.0 flow requirement.

notes.feature_name: Migrate to the Archive App for Enhanced Infrastructure
notes.description: Transition from the Archive Managed Package to the Archive app to get the latest infrastructure updates. This two-phase migration includes automated preparation and a scheduled cutover with zero downtime. Following the cutover, you have a 30-day grace period to update configurations, including custom permissions and Apex references.

notes.feature_name: Anonymize Archived PII - for Compliance (Beta)
notes.description: Anonymize personally identifiable information (PII) directly in archived records to comply with Right to Be Forgotten (RTBF) requests and meet data retention obligations. Anonymize Archived PII (beta) replaces sensitive fields with non-identifiable placeholders so that data remains available for audits and analytics.

notes.feature_name: Migrate to the Archive App for Enhanced Infrastructure
notes.description: Transition from the Archive Managed Package to the Archive app to get the latest infrastructure updates. This two-phase migration includes automated preparation and a scheduled cutover with zero downtime. Following the cutover, you have a 30-day grace period to update configurations, including custom permissions and Apex references.
notes.activation_required: Contact your Account Executive to schedule migration.

notes.feature_name: Anonymize Archived PII - for Compliance (Beta)
notes.description: Anonymize personally identifiable information (PII) directly in archived records to comply with Right to Be Forgotten (RTBF) requests and meet data retention obligations. Anonymize Archived PII (beta) replaces sensitive fields with non-identifiable placeholders so that data remains available for audits and analytics.

notes.feature_name: Email Builder Lite
notes.description: Use the new Email Builder Lite to quickly create and send batch emails to your Sales contacts and leads. Choose from a library of ready-made layouts, or build your own with our new component-based authoring experience. All emails you create are automatically saved to your CMS Content Workspace for easy access and reuse. It's all accessible right from your Sales list views, so you can automate your outreach via an intuitive interface, without having to open another tab.

notes.description: The marketing dashboards in Salesforce Foundations have just gotten an upgrade, courtesy of Tableau! Once configured, you'll find these new visualizations under the Performance Tab, helping you see what's working and optimize your marketing strategy faster than ever.

notes.feature_name: Secure Connection to Amazon Redshift
notes.description: Integrate data from your private Amazon Redshift data warehouse into Salesforce Data Pipelines. Use a virtual private connection (VPC) to make sure that all data transfer happens over an internal network, bypassing the public internet for enhanced security and compliance.
notes.security_notes: Enhanced security and compliance through VPC.

notes.feature_name: OAuth Security with Microsoft Azure SQL Database
notes.description: Take advantage of OAuth functionality in your Microsoft Azure SQL Database connection.

notes.feature_name: Connect to Microsoft Azure SQL Database using OAuth 2.0
notes.description: Increase data security by connecting to Microsoft Azure SQL Database using OAuth 2.0 authentication. You can now provide Azure authentication values directly, eliminating the need for a separate external authentication provider setup.

notes.feature_name: Improve Snapshot Data Recipe Performance with Optimized Upsert and Delete Actions
notes.description: Decrease processing time with quicker data recipe runs. Instead of processing all rows in the snapshot data, the optimized upsert and delete actions run incrementally on subsets of the snapshot data, resulting in faster runs. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Securely Connect Your Private Redshift Data to CRM Analytics
notes.description: Integrate data from your private Amazon Redshift data warehouse into Salesforce Data Pipelines. Use a virtual private connection (VPC) to make sure that all data transfer happens over an internal network, bypassing the public internet for enhanced security and compliance. This change applies to Salesforce Data Pipelines in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic. Salesforce Data Pipelines is available for an extra cost in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions. Salesforce Private Connect is required.

notes.feature_name: Improve Snapshot Data Recipe Performance with Optimized Upsert and Delete Actions
notes.description: Decrease processing time with quicker data recipe runs. Instead of processing all rows in the snapshot data, the optimized upsert and delete actions run incrementally on subsets of the snapshot data, resulting in faster runs. This feature is now generally available.
notes.activation_required: Re-create your recipes to take advantage of this optimization.

notes.feature_name: Run Salesforce Scheduler Flows More Efficiently in Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) Sites
notes.description: Get a faster and more secure scheduling experience with Scheduler Lightning Web Components in LWR sites. All Salesforce Scheduler flow components are now available as Lightning Web Components, making them compatible with LWR sites. Previously, some flow components used Aura components and were limited to Aura-based sites.

notes.feature_name: Add More Service Resources to Appointments
notes.description: Salesforce Scheduler now supports adding up to 20 mandatory service resources to a single appointment in appointment booking flows. Now, when scheduling an appointment in the user interface, you can add more service resources and find the right slot. This change supports complex scheduling scenarios, such as tribunals, court hearings, panel reviews, team presentations, and so on.

notes.feature_name: Easily View Waitlist Participants With a Flat List
notes.description: More efficiently manage large waitlists with a flat waitlist of participants. This change improves the readability of waitlists by grouping and displaying waitlist participants in a single list ordered by check-in time. When enabled, you can also use custom appointment groups. Previously, participants were always grouped by work type group.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Scheduler Flow Components as Lightning Web Components
notes.description: All Salesforce Scheduler flow components are now available as Lightning Web Components, making them compatible with LWR sites. Previously, some flow components used Aura components and were limited to Aura-based sites.

notes.feature_name: Add More Service Resources to Appointments
notes.description: Salesforce Scheduler now supports adding up to 20 mandatory service resources to a single appointment in appointment booking flows. This change supports complex scheduling scenarios, such as tribunals, court hearings, panel reviews, team presentations, and so on.

notes.feature_name: Easily View Waitlist Participants With a Flat List
notes.description: More efficiently manage large waitlists with a flat waitlist of participants. This change improves the readability of waitlists by grouping and displaying waitlist participants in a single list ordered by check-in time. When enabled, you can also use custom appointment groups.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce My Trust Center (Beta)
notes.description: Salesforce My Trust Center (beta) provides authenticated access to service health information tailored to your specific Salesforce products and services. Based on customer feedback, the renamed Salesforce My Trust Center (beta) has been improved. Subscribe to notifications, access 1 year of extended incident and maintenance history with enhanced navigation, and view details on org location and MyDomain information. The public Status site now supports Heroku and Spiff.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce My Trust Center (Beta)
notes.description: Salesforce My Trust Center (beta) provides authenticated access to service health information tailored to your specific Salesforce products and services. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Escape the Label Attribute of <apex:inputField> Elements to Prevent Cross-Site Scripting in Visualforce Pages
notes.description: To prevent malicious code from executing in cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks on your Visualforce pages, this release update escapes the label attribute of your <apex:inputField> tags. First available in Spring ’23, this update is enforced in Spring ’26.
notes.security_notes: Escapes label attribute to prevent XSS attacks.

notes.feature_name: Update References to Legacy Host Names
notes.description: Prevent disruption for your customers and end users when the temporary redirection of legacy (non-enhanced) Salesforce host names ends. With this release update, those redirections end in all orgs. First available in Spring ’25, this update is enforced in Spring ’26.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Date Pickers, Popovers, Bottom Utility Bars, Record Headers
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of date pickers, popovers, bottom utility bars, and record headers when viewed at high magnification. This release update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200%
notes.description: To help meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow, enable Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of page headers and modal windows when viewed at high magnification. This is the beginning of our effort to comply with WCAG 2.2 Resize and Reflow guidelines.

notes.feature_name: Migration from Single-Configuration SAML Framework
notes.description: With the Summer ’26 release, Salesforce will no longer support the single-configuration SAML framework. Users must migrate to the newer multiple-configuration SAML framework to ensure that their SSO configurations do not break. If migration is not completed, SAML single sign-on configurations will stop working when this release update is enforced.
notes.breaking_changes: Single-configuration SAML framework will no longer be supported.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce-Managed X (Formerly Twitter) Authentication Provider Retirement
notes.description: The Salesforce-managed app for the X (formerly Twitter) authentication provider is being retired. This update will break any SSO configurations that use the Salesforce-managed X app. Users are advised to create a custom X app and update their SSO configurations to avoid disruptions.
notes.breaking_changes: Retirement of the Salesforce-managed X app will break existing SSO configurations.

notes.feature_name: Update Instanced URLs in API Traffic
notes.description: To prevent disruption when Salesforce ends support for API traffic that uses an incorrect instanced URL, ensure that API traffic to your org uses the org’s My Domain login URL. This release update was first available in Summer ’25 and was scheduled to be enforced in Spring ’26, but the enforcement has been postponed to Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Use Visualforce PDF Rendering Service with Apex Blob.toPdf()
notes.description: With this update enabled, the Apex Blob.toPdf() method for PDF rendering will use the same rendering service as Visualforce. The Visualforce PDF rendering service offers improvements such as additional fonts and multibyte character support, making PDF rendering more consistent on the Salesforce Platform.

notes.feature_name: Adopt Authorized Email Domains
notes.description: Salesforce is retiring the existing exemption process for disabling email change verifications. Users who previously worked with Salesforce Customer Support to disable email change verifications should set up authorized email domains instead, which provide the same benefit.
notes.breaking_changes: Retirement of the exemption process for disabling email change verifications.

notes.feature_name: Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Cards, Docked Containers, Menu Lists, and Panels
notes.description: This release update enables Lightning Experience to adapt the behavior of cards, docked containers, menu lists, and panels when viewed at high magnification, helping to meet Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2 for Resize and Reflow. This update is dependent on the Enable Accessibility Enhancements for Page Headers and Modal Windows When Zoom Is Greater Than 200% release update.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce to Salesforce Is Being Retired
notes.description: Salesforce to Salesforce is being retired in Spring ’27. Salesforce has more powerful and integrated solutions that align with modern business needs. To prevent disruption when Salesforce ends support for the Salesforce to Salesforce product, make sure that you migrate your integrations to one of these recommended solutions: Partner Cloud, Data Cloud One, MuleSoft Anypoint, or MuleSoft for Flow.

notes.feature_name: Update Apex Code and Flows for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior
notes.description: To optimize performance after large-scale updates to groups or roles, Salesforce now performs some sharing recalculations asynchronously. If Apex code and flows require that share records be updated immediately, the code and flows can break when this release update is enforced. Update Apex classes, tests, and flows that update group membership or roles if they rely on synchronous sharing recalculation. This update is available starting in Spring ’26.
notes.breaking_changes: Code and flows that rely on synchronous sharing recalculation may break.

notes.feature_name: SOAP API login() Call in SOAP API Versions 31.0 Through 64.0 Is Being Retired
notes.description: In Summer ‘27, the SOAP API login() call in SOAP API versions 31.0 through 64.0 will no longer be supported and no longer be available.

notes.description: The new Agentforce Builder now supports the creation of Employee agents, allowing users to build agents that assist both customers and employees.

notes.feature_name: Validation Enhancements in the New Agentforce Builder
notes.description: In the new Agentforce Builder, we’ve added validation checks to agent actions, so you can be confident that your agent has all of the tools it needs to do its jobs. Plus, we’ve made it easier to get the error messages you need to make quick fixes.

notes.feature_name: Migrate Your Agents’ Connected Apps to the External Client App Framework
notes.description: With the Spring '26 release, you can no longer create connected apps. For the best customer experience, migrate your connected apps to external client apps. External client apps provide enhanced security, streamlined packaging, and a more robust framework for your apps. Existing connected apps and connected apps for Slack in the legacy Agentforce Builder aren’t impacted.
notes.breaking_changes: You can no longer create connected apps.

notes.feature_name: Connect Agents to Your Knowledge Sources in the New Agentforce Builder
notes.description: Now, you can use the Answer Questions with Knowledge action via an Agentforce Data Library in the new Agentforce Builder. Agents built in the new Agentforce Builder can access the knowledge you’ve added to their assigned data library, ensuring they provide the most accurate and up-to-date responses.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Agents Settings Have Moved
notes.description: The Enable the Agentforce (Default) Agent and Select the Model for Agentforce settings have moved to the Einstein Audit, Analytics, and Monitoring Setup page. These settings were previously on the Agentforce Agents page in Setup. The Migrate to an Agentforce Employee Agent section has been replaced with a Migrate to an Employee Agent action in the action dropdown for the Agentforce (Default) agent.

notes.feature_name: Agent Optimization: Voice Session Playback and Dashboard Enhancements
notes.description: Get deeper insights into your customer interactions with integrated voice playback and enhanced dashboard filtering. You can now drill down into voice recordings, toggle between processed and unprocessed session data, and export transcripts for offline analysis.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Standard Agent Topics and Actions
notes.description: Quickly add powerful functionality to an agent with new and changed standard agent actions and topics.

notes.feature_name: Build Complex Agents Faster with the Latest Enhancements to Canvas View
notes.description: In the new Agentforce Builder, Canvas view now includes powerful features that were previously only available in Script view. We also introduced new features and improvements that streamline the agent development process.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions

notes.feature_name: Automatic Action Addition to Reasoning Actions
notes.description: When you add an action to a topic, the action is automatically added to the topic’s reasoning actions. Previously, you had to manually reference the action in your topic before the agent could use it.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Variable Management in Canvas View
notes.description: Create, add, and manage variables on the Variables page in Canvas view. Also, you can create a variable that's set to an action output in a topic’s actions available for reasoning (reasoning actions). Previously, you could only create, add, and manage variables in Script view.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Filters in Topic Selector and Reasoning Actions
notes.description: Add filters in the Topic Selector and in a topic’s reasoning actions. When a topic or action has a filter, your agent can use it only when the filter conditions are met. Previously, you could only create filters in Script view.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Follow-up Actions in Reasoning Actions
notes.description: Add follow-up actions in a topic’s reasoning actions. Follow-up actions let you tell an agent what to do immediately after an action runs. For example, you can have the agent chain actions or transition to a specific topic. Previously, you could only define follow-up actions in Script view.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Agent-Level Instructions in Canvas View
notes.description: Add agent-level instructions on the System Messages page in Canvas view. Agent-level instructions apply to all of an agent’s reasoning and interactions. You can use them to define an agent’s tone, persona, style, and goals.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Renaming of Filter Setting
notes.description: The Filter from agent action setting on agent action outputs has been renamed to Include in agent context, to better reflect its functionality in the new Agentforce Builder. When the setting is enabled, the output is added to the agent’s conversation history and made available for reasoning. Disable the setting for any underlying reference action outputs you don’t want to use with your agent.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Chat v2 Connection
notes.description: You can now add the Enhanced Chat v2 connection to an Agentforce Service agent in the new Agentforce Builder. This connection gives the agent context and structure that helps it deliver conversational messages on Enhanced Chat v2 deployments. You can also create and view your agent’s Enhanced Chat channels and Enhanced Chat v2 deployments on the connection's routing page. Previously, Messaging was the only connection available in the new Agentforce Builder and you couldn’t remove it from agents.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Chat v2
notes.description: The Enhanced Chat v2 connection can be added to agents in the Agentforce Studio app. Users can create and view Enhanced Chat channels and Enhanced Chat v2 deployments by selecting Routing under Enhanced Chat v2 on the Explorer panel.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026

notes.feature_name: Create Employee Agents in the New Agentforce Builder (Beta)
notes.description: The new Agentforce Builder now supports Agentforce Employee agents, allowing you to build agents that support both customers and employees. Previously, only Agentforce Service agents could be created from scratch. Now, you can choose the default Agentforce Employee Agent template to get a head start with prebuilt topics and actions. Any agents built in the new Agentforce Builder appear in the agent list views in the Agentforce Studio app and Agentforce Agents Setup pages, and they open in the new Agentforce Builder regardless of where they are accessed.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026
notes.security_notes: The new Agentforce Builder is a beta service subject to the Beta Services Terms and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this beta service consumes usage types per the Agentforce and Generative AI Usage and Billing documentation.

notes.feature_name: Build High-Quality Agents with Validation Enhancements in the New Agentforce Builder (Beta)
notes.description: In the new Agentforce Builder, validation checks have been added to agent actions, ensuring that your agent has all the necessary tools to perform its tasks. It also provides easier access to error messages for quick fixes. When saving changes to an action, Agentforce Builder notifies you if any underlying flow, prompt template, or other reference action is missing, or if there are issues with names or data types.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of January 5, 2026
notes.security_notes: The new Agentforce Builder is a beta service subject to the Beta Services Terms and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this beta service consumes usage types per the Agentforce and Generative AI Usage and Billing documentation.

notes.feature_name: Error Information in Canvas and Script View
notes.description: When an agent has errors, you now see information about the errors in Canvas view as well as Script view. For more detailed error information, switch to Script view. Previously, errors were only available in Script view.

notes.feature_name: Migrate Your Agents’ Connected Apps to the External Client App Framework
notes.description: With the Spring '26 release, you can no longer create connected apps. For the best customer experience, migrate your connected apps to external client apps. External client apps provide enhanced security, streamlined packaging, and a more robust framework for your apps. Existing connected apps and connected apps for Slack in the legacy Agentforce Builder aren’t impacted.

notes.feature_name: Access Knowledge with Agentforce Data Library
notes.description: Now, you can use the Answer Questions with Knowledge action via an Agentforce Data Library in the new Agentforce Builder. Agents built in the new Agentforce Builder can access the knowledge you’ve added to their assigned data library, ensuring they provide the most accurate and up-to-date responses.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Builder
notes.description: The new Agentforce Builder makes it possible to build more complex, more reliable agents in a text editor-inspired interface. From the App Launcher, find and select Agentforce Studio, and then click Agents. There are two steps to ground your Agents on your knowledge: 1) add a data library that contains the knowledge you want your agents to use, and 2) add the Answer Questions with Knowledge action. To add a data library to a new or existing agent, in the Explorer click Data, then select Data Library. A Data Library tab opens in the canvas and your available data libraries appear in the dropdown list. Select a data library and, to show citations, select Show sources. To create a data library, go to Agentforce Data Library in Setup. From the new Agentforce Builder, you can add and configure the Answer Questions with Knowledge action from the Asset library, and then preview your agents with live or mock data.
notes.edition: Agentforce for Service, Agentforce for Sales, Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions
notes.security_notes: The new Agentforce Builder is a beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or your written Unified Pilot Agreement, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this beta service consumes usage types per the Agentforce and Generative AI Usage and Billing documentation and is at the Customer’s sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Agents Settings Have Moved
notes.description: The Enable the Agentforce (Default) Agent and Select the Model for Agentforce settings have moved to the Einstein Audit, Analytics, and Monitoring Setup page. These settings were previously on the Agentforce Agents page in Setup. The Migrate to an Agentforce Employee Agent section has been replaced with a Migrate to an Employee Agent action in the action dropdown for the Agentforce (Default) agent.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions
affected_components: Einstein Audit, Analytics, and Monitoring Setup

notes.feature_name: Agent Optimization: Voice Session Playback and Dashboard Enhancements
notes.description: Get deeper insights into your customer interactions with integrated voice playback and enhanced dashboard filtering. You can now drill down into voice recordings, toggle between processed and unprocessed session data, and export transcripts for offline analysis. Integrated Voice Playback allows you to drill into any voice session and listen to the recording using the integrated player directly from the Sessions page.

notes.feature_name: Filtering Sessions According to Modality
notes.description: Use the new filter to filter your sessions according to modality type: Voice, Chat, All Modalities.

notes.feature_name: Processed and Unprocessed Sessions
notes.description: The Sessions & Intents page is now organized into two distinct views. Processed Sessions contain interactions enriched with insight data, while Unprocessed Sessions provide access to raw data from active or recently closed interactions.

notes.feature_name: Transcript Export
notes.description: Download single or multiple session transcripts (up to 100) as CSV.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on

notes.feature_name: Deeper Session Insights
notes.description: Track performance via duration metrics in the Sessions & Intents tab. Chat logs now display a total session duration at the top and specific duration calculations for every agent response. Note Duration metrics currently support Chat only; Voice support is coming soon.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on

notes.feature_name: Shorter Intent Pipeline
notes.description: A streamlined intent-triggering pipeline produces insights faster than before.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Einstein for Sales, Einstein for Platform, or Einstein for Service add-on

notes.feature_name: Updated Topic: Appointment Management for Field Service
notes.description: This topic is included in the Scheduling template and the Agentforce Service Agent template. To make sure that Agentforce verifies that an appointment is eligible for scheduling changes, these actions were updated: Cancel Appointment for Field Service, Get Appointment Time Slots for Field Service, Schedule Appointment for Field Service, Update Appointment Times for Field Service. To make sure that the agent can resolve relative date expressions, such as ‘today’ and 'tomorrow', a new action was added to the topic: Get Current Time for Field Service.
affected_components: Get Appointment Time Slots for Field Service
Update Appointment Times for Field Service
Get Current Time for Field Service

notes.feature_name: New Topic: ESG Data Collection
notes.description: Engage with multiple stakeholders and collect environmental, social, and governance (ESG) information. This topic includes these new actions: Get Vehicle Asset Emission Source Data, Get Sustainability Stakeholder Data, Manage Sustainability Task Group, Get Sustainability Task Group Data, Create Sustainability Task Group.
affected_components: Get Vehicle Asset Emission Source Data

notes.feature_name: FinServ Package Wealth Advisor Client Meeting Preparation
notes.description: Help wealth advisors gather, review, and organize client details to prepare for a client meeting. This topic includes these new actions: FinServ Package Summarize Financial Details, FinServ Package Summarize Financial Goals, and FinServ Package Summarize Portfolio Performance.

notes.feature_name: FinServ Package Wealth Advisor Client Post Meeting Follow Up
notes.description: Help wealth advisors manage post meeting tasks by creating financial goals, and life events. This topic includes these new actions: FinServ Package Create Financial Goal, FinServ Package Create Life Event, FinServ Package Extract Financial Goals, FinServ Package Extract Life Events, and FinServ Package Structure Financial Advisor Meeting Notes.
affected_components: FinServ Package Structure Financial Advisor Meeting Notes

notes.feature_name: Manage Gift Commitments
notes.description: Fulfill donor requests to modify, pause, resume, or close their existing gift commitments or recurring donations. This topic includes these new actions: Close Gift Commitment and Manage Recurring Gift Commitment.

notes.feature_name: Match Volunteers to Shifts
notes.description: The Match Volunteers to Shifts action finds suitable volunteers to fill open shifts based on the time, location, and qualification requirements. The output of this action can be compiled into a list of potential volunteers to be contacted to sign up for the open shift.

notes.feature_name: Account Performance
notes.description: Summarize an account's financial health, retrieve total revenue, analyze performance metrics, and identify top-selling and bottom-selling products within a specified time period. Help users quickly understand sales trends and financial metrics of an account. This topic includes these new actions: Get Retail Execution Account Performance Data: Calculates total revenue, minimum and maximum order values, and identifies top N% and bottom N% selling products based on order quantities. Get Retail Execution Orders By Account: Gets order information, including order header details and corresponding detailed order item data for each order of the account.

notes.feature_name: Account Compliance
notes.description: Analyze store compliance by using past visits, audits, and customer tasks to identify ongoing retail execution issues and gaps. Help users track consistency and adherence to promotional, shelf, and display standards. This topic includes these new actions: Get Retail Execution Visits By Account: Get completed visits for the account based on the preconfigured visit types in Retail Execution. Get Retail Execution Customer Tasks By Account: Get customer tasks that are ready or released for an account optionally within a date range.
affected_components: Retail Execution Customer Tasks By Account

notes.feature_name: Last Visit Summary
notes.description: Get a summary of the most recent store visit, including key activities, compliance outcomes, overdue tasks, and associated order data. Help users streamline visit closure and follow-up activities by providing a snapshot of the most recent account interaction. This topic includes these new actions: Get Retail Execution Customer Tasks By Account: Get customer tasks that are ready or released for an account optionally within a date range. Get Retail Execution Visits By Account: Get completed visits for the account based on the preconfigured visit types in Retail Execution. Get Retail Execution Orders By Visit: Get order information, including order header details and corresponding detailed line-item (order item) data for each order of the visit.
affected_components: Retail Execution Customer Tasks By Account

notes.feature_name: Product Upsell
notes.description: Summarize product recommendations, personalized sales pitches, and out-of-stock (OOS) analysis based on account history and visit notes. Help users identify growth opportunities and customize their product pitch while in the store. This topic includes these new actions: Get Retail Execution Visits By Account: Get completed visits for the account based on the preconfigured visit types in Retail Execution.

notes.feature_name: Get Retail Execution Orders By Account
notes.description: Gets order information, including order header details and corresponding detailed order item data for each order of the account.

notes.feature_name: Configure Your Agent to Apply Coupon to B2C Cart
notes.description: Applies the specified coupon code to the B2C Commerce cart to calculate the discount.

notes.feature_name: Get Rule-Based Product Recommendations
notes.description: The Get Rule-Based Product Recommendations agent action returns recommended products for a quote based on configuration rules in Product Catalog Management (PCM). The action evaluates the products already added to a quote, applies relevant recommendation rules, and returns a list of up to five recommended product IDs and names that can be used in Product Selection workflows in Agentforce.

notes.feature_name: Get Account Balance
notes.description: The Get Account Balance agent action retrieves a customer’s billing balance for a specific account. It summarizes posted invoices, credits, debits, payments, and refunds to provide a clear view of the net amount due. This action supports quick, conversational inquiries about what a customer currently owes.

notes.feature_name: Get Next Due Payment
notes.description: The Get Next Due Payment agent action identifies the next upcoming payment for an account. It returns the earliest due date and the total amount due on that date. This action helps teams answer questions about what customers need to pay next.

notes.feature_name: Get Payment Plan Details
notes.description: The Get Payment Plan Details agent action returns the payment installment schedule for an invoice. It lists each payment amount, date, and status so teams can explain how an invoice will be paid over time.

notes.feature_name: Get Latest Invoice and Document PDF
notes.description: The Get Latest Invoice and Document PDF agent action retrieves the most recent posted invoice for an account and provides access to its document. This includes a link to download the invoice PDF when available. The action supports common requests such as viewing the latest bill or accessing the corresponding document.

notes.feature_name: Article Answers for Einstein Bots Retirement
notes.description: Article Answers for Einstein Bots is scheduled for retirement on February 28, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Article Answers for Einstein Bots Retirement
notes.description: Article Answers is scheduled for retirement on February 28, 2026. Bots that already use Article Answers can continue using it until that date. On that date, bots with Article Answers will no longer deliver content from your knowledge base. To prevent service disruptions, turn off Article Answers and remove the Article Answers dialog from your bots’ conversational flow. Also, consider transitioning enhanced bots to Generative Knowledge Answers.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Custom Lightning Type Creation for Agentforce with the Lightning Types MCP Tool
notes.description: The Lightning Types Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool in the Salesforce DX MCP Server provides a dynamic way to create and enhance your custom Lightning types. Salesforce DX MCP Server uses large language models (LLMs) to generate the necessary LightningTypeBundle metadata files, including schema.json, editor.json, and renderer.json. You use these custom Lightning types to generate the custom Lightning Web Component (LWC) responses that you’re looking for. This feature supports Agentforce Employee agents in Lightning Experience and Agentforce Service agents via Enhanced Chat v2. You can also define structured outputs in Prompt Builder with these Lightning types.

notes.feature_name: Lightning Types MCP Tool
notes.description: The Lightning Types MCP tool allows you to use large language models (LLMs) to generate the necessary LightningTypeBundle metadata files, including schema.json, editor.json, and renderer.json. You can use these custom Lightning types to generate the custom Lightning Web Component (LWC) responses. This feature supports Agentforce Employee agents in Lightning Experience and Agentforce Service agents via Enhanced Chat v2. You can also define structured outputs in Prompt Builder with these Lightning types.
notes.availability: Available starting the week of February 9, 2026.
notes.timeline: Available starting the week of February 9, 2026.
notes.breaking_changes: All commands, parameters, and other features are subject to change or deprecation at any time, with or without notice.

notes.feature_name: Claude 3.7 Sonnet Reroute Date
notes.description: Claude 3.7 Sonnet is deprecated on Amazon Bedrock (Anthropic). Claude 3.7 Sonnet model requests will be rerouted to Claude Sonnet 4.5 on February 26, 2026. It is recommended to test your prompts and apps with the new model in Prompt Builder and Einstein Studio as soon as possible, because expected responses can change.

It is recommended to test your prompts and apps with the new model in Prompt Builder and Einstein Studio as soon as possible, because expected responses can change.
