We recommend that you test your prompts and apps with the new model in Prompt Builder and Einstein Studio as soon as possible, because expected responses can change.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Tableau Next
notes.description: Tableau Next integrates the #1 analytics platform with Agentforce context-aware AI and the Data Cloud semantic layer that unifies business knowledge across your organization. Build and deliver personalized, contextual, and actionable insights for every user, backed by Salesforce enterprise-grade performance, security, and scalability.

notes.feature_name: Lightning Reports and Dashboards Enhancements
notes.description: Save time and reduce errors when adding tables to dashboards by retaining existing report settings. Ensure policy and regulatory compliance with custom disclaimers on exported reports.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 Reports and Dashboards
notes.description: Calculate deeper insights with more row-level formulas.

notes.feature_name: Tableau Next
notes.description: Tableau Next integrates the #1 analytics platform with Agentforce context-aware AI and the Data Cloud semantic layer that unifies business knowledge across your organization. Build and deliver personalized, contextual, and actionable insights for every user, backed by Salesforce enterprise-grade performance, security, and scalability.
notes.timeline: Check back in this section throughout Spring ‘26 for enhancements.

notes.feature_name: Use Existing Report Settings When Adding Tables to Dashboards
notes.description: Save time and reduce manual configuration of report settings, such as groupings, custom formulas, and bucketing when adding lightning tables to dashboards. This feature reduces the risk of errors and ensures that the tables in the dashboard retain the same configuration as the report. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Ensure Compliance with Custom Disclaimers on Exported Reports
notes.description: Ensure that your exported reports meet corporate policies and regulatory requirements by appending custom disclaimers to the reports.

notes.feature_name: Share Reports and Dashboards Folders Using Usernames
notes.description: Securely share report and dashboard folders using precise usernames. Search for users by their usernames, and reduce the risk of sharing sensitive information with the wrong users. Previously, only the name was shown.

notes.feature_name: Embed Custom Lightning Web Components in Dashboards for Interactive Data Views (Beta)
notes.description: Add custom Lightning Web Components (LWC) directly into Lightning Dashboards to create interactive, real-time data views that go beyond standard dashboard capabilities. Filter, explore, and act on data immediately without leaving your dashboard. For example, a business analyst can use a custom LWC to display a waterfall chart or other visualizations that are not available in standard dashboards.

notes.feature_name: Use Existing Report Settings When Adding Tables to Dashboards
notes.description: Save time and reduce manual configuration of report settings, such as groupings, custom formulas, and bucketing when adding lightning tables to dashboards. This feature reduces the risk of errors and ensures that the tables in the dashboard retain the same configuration as the report. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Ensure Compliance with Custom Disclaimers on Exported Reports
notes.description: Ensure that your exported reports meet corporate policies and regulatory requirements by appending a custom disclaimer after the standard Salesforce disclaimer.

notes.feature_name: Share Reports and Dashboards Folders Using Usernames
notes.description: Securely share report and dashboard folders using precise usernames. Search for users by their usernames, and reduce the risk of sharing sensitive information with the wrong users. Previously, only the name was shown.

notes.feature_name: Embed Custom Lightning Web Components in Dashboards for Interactive Data Views
notes.description: Add custom Lightning Web Components (LWC) directly into Lightning Dashboards to create interactive, real-time data views that go beyond standard dashboard capabilities. Filter, explore, and act on data immediately without leaving your dashboard. For example, a business analyst can use a custom LWC to display a waterfall chart or other visualizations that are not available in standard dashboards.
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer’s sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Expand Reporting Capabilities with More Row-Level Formulas
notes.description: Save time on reporting and generate deeper insights by including up to five row-level formulas in your Data 360 reports. Calculate values directly in the report without adding formula fields on an object. For example, calculate both the commission rate and the time-to-close metric in a single report without adding a formula field on the object. Previously, reports supported only one row-level formula.

notes.feature_name: Download Data 360 object data from lenses and widgets
notes.description: Download Data 360 object data from lenses and widgets to CSV or Excel files. Take action across many assets with bulk actions. Query data more effectively with the new Data 360 SQL variant (beta).

notes.feature_name: Write and schedule custom CRM Analytics recipes
notes.description: Write and schedule your custom CRM Analytics recipes to output your transformed data directly to Data 360 data lake objects. Securely access your Amazon Redshift data by using a virtual private connection. Take advantage of OAuth functionality in your Microsoft Azure SQL Database connection.

notes.feature_name: Export data directly from lenses and widgets
notes.description: Export data directly from lenses and widgets that use data from Data 360 objects, such as data lake objects, data model objects, and calculated insights. Save up to 50,000 rows as an Excel or CSV file to use offline features, such as applying advanced filters, integrating with external tools, and performing complex calculations.

notes.feature_name: Download CRM Analytics Dashboard Images
notes.description: Share insights faster by directly downloading an image of your CRM Analytics dashboard from the dashboard view. Previously, you had to use the Share window to download dashboard images.

notes.feature_name: Manage CRM Analytics Assets with New Bulk Actions
notes.description: Minimize the risk of human error associated with repetitive manual tasks and manage multiple CRM Analytics assets efficiently with new bulk actions. You can now add or remove Favorites, and hide or show assets. You can perform bulk actions on up to 50 assets at a time. Previously, bulk actions were limited to Change Owner and Add to Collection.

notes.feature_name: Speed Up Queries and Improve Data Handling with Data 360 SQL
notes.description: Enhance data handling, strengthen security, and speed up query responses by using Data 360 SQL. New compact form queries and custom SQL queries now run on Data 360 SQL by default. Existing custom SQL queries continue to use legacy SQL, and you can manually switch them to Data 360 SQL for improved performance.

notes.feature_name: Repeat Groupings in Compare Tables with Repeat Row Values
notes.description: You can now configure a compare table to replicate group dimension values on every row with Repeat Row Values. Tables with group dimensions, such as name or product, automatically repeat the group value on every row. This enhancement helps improve readability of large datasets without constant scrolling back to the first occurrence.

notes.feature_name: Gain Full Control over Number Widget Tooltips
notes.description: You can now suppress default tooltip bubbles on number widgets that don't have custom messages. Get more control over the widget’s visual presentation and give your users a cleaner dashboard experience.

notes.feature_name: Explore Pivot Tables with Expand and Collapse
notes.description: You can now expand and collapse groups and sub-groups in pivot tables to help you focus on specific insights and customize your view of large datasets.

notes.feature_name: Keep Widget Action Menus Visible
notes.description: Keep important widget actions, such as downloading and sharing, always in sight for chart, number, text, repeater, list, toggle, date, range, and table widgets. Quickly access widget actions without needing to hover over the widget.

notes.feature_name: Analyze Data Offline with CSV and Excel Exports of Data 360 Objects
notes.description: Export data directly from lenses and widgets that use data from Data 360 objects, such as data lake objects, data model objects, and calculated insights. Save up to 50,000 rows as an Excel or CSV file to use offline features, such as applying advanced filters, integrating with external tools, and performing complex calculations.
notes.activation_required: Requires Download CRM Analytics Data permission

notes.feature_name: Download CRM Analytics Dashboard Images
notes.description: Share insights faster by directly downloading an image of your CRM Analytics dashboard from the dashboard view. Previously, you had to use the Share window to download dashboard images.

notes.feature_name: Manage CRM Analytics Assets with New Bulk Actions
notes.description: Minimize the risk of human error associated with repetitive manual tasks and manage multiple CRM Analytics assets efficiently with new bulk actions. You can now add or remove Favorites, and hide or show assets. You can perform bulk actions on up to 50 assets at a time. Previously, bulk actions were limited to Change Owner and Add to Collection.

notes.feature_name: Speed Up Queries and Improve Data Handling with Data 360 SQL (Beta)
notes.description: Enhance data handling, strengthen security, and speed up query responses by using Data 360 SQL. New compact form queries and custom SQL queries now run on Data 360 SQL by default. Existing custom SQL queries continue to use legacy SQL, and you can manually switch them to Data 360 SQL for improved performance.

notes.feature_name: Improved Data Handling with Data 360 SQL
notes.description: Data 360 SQL is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer’s sole discretion. To use this feature, select a lens that contains a custom SQL query. In the custom SQL query editor, click the SQL Version dropdown and select Data 360 SQL. In the confirmation window, click Change to Data 360 SQL, and then click Update. Note that you can't change the SQL version of a query back to Legacy SQL once you have changed it to Data 360 SQL.
notes.edition: Developer Edition, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited (extra cost)
notes.breaking_changes: You can't change the SQL version of a query back to Legacy SQL once you have changed it to Data 360 SQL.

notes.feature_name: Repeat Groupings in Compare Tables with Repeat Row Values
notes.description: You can now configure a compare table to replicate group dimension values on every row with Repeat Row Values. Tables with group dimensions, such as name or product, automatically repeat the group value on every row. This enhancement helps improve readability of large datasets without constant scrolling back to the first occurrence.
notes.edition: Developer Edition, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited (extra cost)

notes.feature_name: Gain Full Control over Number Widget Tooltips
notes.description: You can now suppress default tooltip bubbles on number widgets that don't have custom messages. Get more control over the widget’s visual presentation and give your users a cleaner dashboard experience.

notes.feature_name: Explore Pivot Tables with Expand and Collapse
notes.description: You can now expand and collapse groups and sub-groups in pivot tables to help you focus on specific insights and customize your view of large datasets.

notes.feature_name: Keep Widget Action Menus Visible
notes.description: Keep important widget actions, such as downloading and sharing, always in sight for chart, number, text, repeater, list, toggle, date, range, and table widgets. Quickly access widget actions without needing to hover over the widget.

notes.feature_name: Analytics Data Integration
notes.description: Write and schedule your custom CRM Analytics recipes to output your transformed data directly to Data 360 data lake objects. Securely access your Amazon Redshift data by using a virtual private connection. Take advantage of OAuth functionality in your Microsoft Azure SQL Database connection.

notes.feature_name: Use CRM Analytics Datasets in Data Cloud
notes.description: Take advantage of the latest Data 360 features while retaining the functionality of CRM Analytics recipes. Write and schedule your custom CRM Analytics recipes to output your transformed data directly to Data 360 data lake objects (DLO). Then you can use your CRM Analytics data to create calculated insights, semantic models, and Data 360 reports and dashboards. This feature, now generally available, includes a change since the last release: Users can now select a category on the DLO.

notes.feature_name: Securely Connect Your Private Redshift Data to CRM Analytics
notes.description: Integrate data from your private Amazon Redshift data warehouse into CRM Analytics. Use a virtual private connection (VPC) to make sure that all data transfer happens over an internal network, bypassing the public internet for enhanced security and compliance.
notes.security_notes: Enhanced security and compliance through VPC.

notes.feature_name: Use OAuth Security with Your Microsoft Azure SQL Database Connection
notes.description: Increase data security by connecting to Microsoft Azure SQL Database using OAuth 2.0 authentication. You can now provide Azure authentication values directly, eliminating the need for a separate external authentication provider setup.

notes.feature_name: Improve Snapshot Data Recipe Performance with Optimized Upsert and Delete Actions
notes.description: Decrease processing time with quicker data recipe runs. Instead of processing all rows in the snapshot data, the optimized upsert and delete actions run incrementally on subsets of the snapshot data, resulting in faster runs. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Securely Connect Your Private Redshift Data to CRM Analytics
notes.description: Integrate data from your private Amazon Redshift data warehouse into CRM Analytics. Use a virtual private connection (VPC) to make sure that all data transfer happens over an internal network, bypassing the public internet for enhanced security and compliance.

notes.feature_name: Use OAuth Security with Your Microsoft Azure SQL Database Connection
notes.description: Increase data security by connecting to Microsoft Azure SQL Database using OAuth 2.0 authentication. You can now provide Azure authentication values directly, eliminating the need for a separate external authentication provider setup.

notes.feature_name: Improve Snapshot Data Recipe Performance with Optimized Upsert and Delete Actions
notes.description: Decrease processing time with quicker data recipe runs. Instead of processing all rows in the snapshot data, the optimized upsert and delete actions run incrementally on subsets of the snapshot data, resulting in faster runs. This feature is now generally available.
notes.activation_required: Re-create your recipes to take advantage of this optimization. The snapshot data must contain a primary key field. In the output node, select Existing Dataset and then select either the Upsert or the Delete operation to use the optimized features.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Enhancements in Analytics
notes.description: Learn about small but important changes that make analytics more accessible. Keyboard users can now interact with column headers in custom report types to access sorting and action buttons. Horizontal scrolling in report tables now adjusts automatically to provide full visibility of cell content when navigating with a keyboard at 200% zoom. The Year selection combobox is now correctly identified as an interactive control to ensure screen readers announce it accurately. Column header text now meets minimum color contrast requirements on hover to improve label visibility for users with low vision. Screen readers now announce the success message when a recipient is added in the Edit Recipient dialog. Focus behavior in the Edit Subscription dialog is improved to ensure that the focus moves to newly added fields after clicking the Add Condition button. Keyboard focus now returns to the table after exiting Navigation Mode with Shift+Tab to ensure predictable and consistent navigation. Grid cells in report tables no longer announce 'not selected' by default to reduce unnecessary verbosity for assistive technology users. Accessible names for X-axis and Y-axis fields in chart properties now match visible labels to provide clearer context for screen reader users. The Category list in the Choose Report Type modal now includes a defined accessible name to ensure accurate identification of list items for screen readers. Tooltips triggered by the Close Filter Panel button are now dismissible and remain visible on hover to improve usability and clarity. The vertical scroll bar now functions correctly when the dashboard page is zoomed to 400%.
notes.edition: Group, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer

notes.feature_name: Screen Reader Announcements for Accordion State
notes.description: Screen readers now announce the expanded or collapsed state of the Who Can Access accordion in the Share Folder dialog to provide accurate context for non-visual users.

notes.feature_name: Keyboard Navigation for Tooltips in Sales Dashboards
notes.description: Tooltips in Sales Dashboards can now be activated using the Enter or Space key to provide access for users who can't use a mouse.

notes.feature_name: Improved Visibility for Measure Lines in Vertical Bar Charts
notes.description: Measure lines in vertical bar charts now use a color distinct from the chart bars to improve visibility and contrast.

notes.feature_name: Localized Close Button Announcement in Dashboard Widget Modals
notes.description: The close button in dashboard widget modals is now announced in the user’s selected language to ensure a consistent and localized experience.

notes.feature_name: Status Update Announcement for Refresh Button
notes.description: Screen readers now announce the status update for the As of timestamp when users activate the Refresh button to provide clear feedback on data freshness.

notes.feature_name: Accessible Name for As of Tooltip Link
notes.description: The As of tooltip link now includes an accessible name to ensure that screen reader users understand its destination and purpose.

notes.feature_name: Structured Navigation for Action Buttons
notes.description: Action buttons, such as Share, Refresh, and Edit are now marked up as a list to provide more efficient and structured navigation for assistive technology users.

notes.feature_name: B2B Commerce Quote Request from Cart
notes.description: Give buyers the option to request a quote directly from their cart.

notes.feature_name: Complex Pricing Rules with Context Extension Services
notes.description: Customize your pricing setup to support complex pricing rules by using context extension services.

notes.feature_name: Streamlined Procurement for Configurable Products
notes.description: Streamline procurement by offering products that buyers can configure and purchase.

notes.feature_name: Simplified Delivery Estimations
notes.description: Simplify delivery estimations by configuring locations and shipping methods in the same window.

notes.feature_name: New Analytics Dashboard for Order Fulfillment Performance
notes.description: Monitor critical order fulfillment performance in a new analytics dashboard.

notes.feature_name: Increased Flexibility for Payment Capture
notes.description: Enjoy more flexibility and customization when capturing payments.

notes.feature_name: Quote Request from Cart
notes.description: Give buyers the option to request a quote directly from their cart.

notes.feature_name: Complex Pricing Rules
notes.description: Customize your pricing setup to support complex pricing rules by using context extension services.

notes.feature_name: Product Configuration and Purchase
notes.description: Streamline procurement by offering products that buyers can configure and purchase.

notes.feature_name: Increased Searchable and Filterable Field Limit
notes.description: Allocate resources strategically for larger, more complex product catalogs with an increased searchable and filterable field limit.

notes.feature_name: Multi-Language Support for B2B Guided Shopping Agent
notes.description: Configure the B2B guided shopping agent to interact with buyers in their preferred language based on the buyer's locale. Previously, the agent interacted with buyers based on the default language.

notes.feature_name: Subscription Bundling
notes.description: Bundle multiple digital subscription products together to enable buyers to add related products to their cart in a single action. Buyers can also view their subscription history from the Commerce subscriptions page.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Catalog Management
notes.description: Simplify catalog management with dynamic rules that automatically show or hide products based on buyer eligibility.

notes.feature_name: Add Multi-Language Support to B2B Guided Shopping Agent Interactions
notes.description: Configure the B2B guided shopping agent to interact with buyers in their preferred language based on the buyer's locale. Previously, the agent interacted with buyers based on the default language configured in the agent settings.

notes.feature_name: Let Buyers Request a Quote from Their Cart
notes.description: Streamline negotiations by giving B2B buyers the option to request a quote directly from their cart. After the buyer submits the request, your team can review the details, negotiate as needed, and place the order on the buyer’s behalf. Manage pricing and shorten deal cycles by reducing handoffs for complex purchases that require negotiation and approvals.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions where Revenue Cloud Advanced or Sales Cloud Advanced is enabled

notes.feature_name: Extend B2B Store Pricing Rules with Custom Context Definitions
notes.description: Customize pricing rules for complex business scenarios by integrating custom fields into your pricing procedure. Extend the Commerce cart context definition to inherit standard components, such as nodes, attributes, and mappings. Tailor the pricing procedure by adding account and product attributes to the extended context definition.

notes.feature_name: Extend B2B Store Pricing Rules with Custom Context Definitions
notes.description: Customize pricing rules for complex business scenarios by integrating custom fields into your pricing procedure. Extend the Commerce cart context definition to inherit standard components, such as nodes, attributes, and mappings. Tailor the pricing procedure by adding account and product attributes to the extended context definition.

notes.feature_name: New Commerce LWR Store Components
notes.description: Build richer, more dynamic storefront experiences with Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) store components. New components improve the user experience by providing merchandisers with greater flexibility and capabilities.

notes.feature_name: New Commerce LWR Store Components
notes.description: Build richer, more dynamic storefront experiences with Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) store components. New components improve the user experience by providing merchandisers with greater customization options for streamlining workflows.
notes.edition: B2B Commerce in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Identify Products at Risk of Being Unsearchable
notes.description: To avoid indexing failures, an error message now prompts you when a product SKU is assigned to more than 250 categories. This message helps you identify and adjust category assignments to make sure that your buyers can find the relevant products in the search results.
notes.edition: B2B Commerce in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Product Catalogs Include More Searchable and Filterable Fields
notes.description: Previously, the search index was limited to 25 searchable fields and 50 filterable fields. Now, you can have a total of 100 searchable and filterable fields, enabling you to allocate resources strategically for larger, more complex product catalogs.
notes.edition: B2B Commerce in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Product Catalogs Include More Searchable and Filterable Fields
notes.description: Previously, the search index was limited to 25 searchable fields and 50 filterable fields. Now, you can have a total of 100 searchable and filterable fields, enabling you to allocate resources strategically for larger, more complex product catalogs.

notes.feature_name: Sell Subscription Product Bundles in Your Commerce Store
notes.description: Bundle multiple digital subscription products together to enable buyers to add related products to their cart in a single action.
notes.activation_required: Contact your Salesforce Account Executive and republish your B2B Commerce store after enabling the feature
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with a Revenue Cloud Advanced license and a Commerce Cloud Growth or Advanced license

notes.feature_name: Enable Buyers to View Subscription History
notes.description: Buyers can now view their subscription history, including amendment, renewal, and cancellation details, to help better plan future subscriptions.

notes.feature_name: Sell Configurable Products in Your B2B Store
notes.description: Streamline procurement and reduce the need for sales rep involvement by offering products that buyers can configure and purchase. Pricing updates as the buyer adds or changes the configuration. Buyers can discover products through search, configure them to their needs, and either place an order or request a quote via a self-service flow.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions where Revenue Cloud Advanced or Sales Cloud Advanced is enabled

notes.feature_name: Determine Product Visibility Dynamically by Using Qualification Rules
notes.description: To evaluate product and product category eligibility, your B2B Commerce store applies entitlement policies that you’ve configured. However, if you have thousands of products, preconfiguring entitlement policies can get challenging. To make it easier to manage large numbers of products and product categories across your stores, create qualification rules that dynamically evaluate eligibility based on account or category attributes. You can also set up a disqualification rule to exclude products and product categories from a buyer’s view. If you enable qualification rules, your store uses qualification rules instead of entitlement policies.

notes.feature_name: Determine Product Visibility Dynamically by Using Qualification Rules
notes.description: To evaluate product and product category eligibility, your B2B Commerce store applies entitlement policies that you’ve configured. However, if you have thousands of products, preconfiguring entitlement policies can get challenging. To make it easier to manage large numbers of products and product categories across your stores, create qualification rules that dynamically evaluate eligibility based on account or category attributes. You can also set up a disqualification rule to exclude products and product categories from a buyer’s view. If you enable qualification rules, your store uses qualification rules instead of entitlement policies.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Inventory Suppression with Safety Stock Caps
notes.description: Prevent overstocking by adding a safety stock cap. The cap limits how much of your inventory is designated as safety stock, so you can ship out more inventory from your distribution locations.

notes.feature_name: Monitor AI-Generated Insights and Fulfillment Data in a Single Dashboard
notes.description: The real-time analytics dashboard shows performance and key insights across order fulfillment metrics. Customize the display to view order fulfillment processing by location or category, and filter by date range. Make confident decisions with critical order fulfillment data.

notes.feature_name: Control the Order of Payment Capture
notes.description: Define a sequence when capturing funds from multiple payment methods. Previously, default logic was used.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Payment Control in Ensure Funds Async Flow
notes.description: You can now add an action element to the Ensure Funds Async flow or implement your own default payment sequence using Apex to rank payment summaries and specify capture amounts.

notes.feature_name: Manage Locations While Configuring Shipping Methods
notes.description: Assign locations and control pickup times for individual locations in the Shipping Method setup window without switching between multiple tabs.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce for Salesforce Order Management
notes.description: Transform order management routing from a reactive to a proactive process through agentic location exclusion and rerouting.
notes.security_notes: Agentforce Agentic Order Routing is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or your written Unified Pilot Agreement, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service consumes Einstein Requests, as applicable, and is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Monitor AI-Generated Insights and Fulfillment Data in a Single Dashboard
notes.description: The real-time analytics dashboard shows performance and key insights across order fulfillment metrics. Customize the display to view order fulfillment processing by location or category, and filter by date range. Make confident decisions with critical order fulfillment data.
notes.activation_required: Requires Data 360 license with CRM Analytics and Data 360 set up for B2B Commerce

notes.feature_name: Control the Order of Payment Capture
notes.description: Define a sequence when capturing funds from multiple payment methods. Previously, default logic determined how to apply funds to an invoice, which limited control over split fulfillments or specific payment types. You can now add an action element to the Ensure Funds Async flow or implement your own default payment sequence using Apex to rank payment summaries and specify capture amounts.
notes.availability: Available in sandbox orgs; rolling basis in production Spring '26.
notes.timeline: Available in production on a rolling basis in Spring '26.

notes.feature_name: Manage Locations While Configuring Shipping Methods
notes.description: Assign locations and control pickup times for individual locations in the Shipping Method setup window without switching between multiple tabs.

notes.feature_name: Setup with Agentforce (Beta)
notes.description: Simplify administrative tasks by using the new AI-powered agent in Setup.

notes.feature_name: Translation Workbench Enhancements
notes.description: Import and export translation files more easily with enhancements to the Translation Workbench. Apply export filters from Translation Workbench. Import valid files, even when there are invalid files in the bundle. Update Custom Labels from Translation Workbench.

notes.feature_name: Updated Translations for Standard Objects
notes.description: Get updated translations for some standard objects in Canada and Japan.

notes.feature_name: List View Sorting Behavior
notes.description: When you sort a list view, blank fields are sorted as the highest value in the list instead of the lowest value. In list views rendered with Lightning Web Components (LWC), you receive an error notification earlier in the edit process if you try to edit more than 200 records at a time.

notes.feature_name: Request Approval Component
notes.description: Add the Request Approval component to record pages so users can submit records for approval without the need for a custom button. Install a release update to address new sharing recalculation behavior.

notes.feature_name: Setup with Agentforce (Beta)
notes.description: Simplify administrative tasks by using the new AI-powered agent in Setup. This feature is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Streamline Administrative Tasks with Setup with Agentforce (Beta)
notes.description: Salesforce’s new agent-driven Setup experience integrates Setup with an AI assistant to simplify administrative tasks. Chat with the agent to issue commands or ask questions by using natural language. The agent makes activities like creating objects and flows, managing user access, and troubleshooting formulas more intuitive and efficient, reducing navigation and clicks.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Open Setup Pages in a Dedicated Tab (Beta)
notes.description: In Salesforce orgs that have enabled Setup with Agentforce, Setup pages open in a single dedicated tab instead of overwriting the Setup Home page. Now you can context switch between Home, agent conversations, and Setup pages without losing work.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Setup with Agentforce
notes.description: Setup with Agentforce is available from every page in Setup. You can chat with the agent in the Agentforce panel while still viewing and navigating through Setup. And when necessary, the conversation can transition into a full-sized agentic experience that opens new conversations in different console tabs and includes a canvas to display rich content such as record details, list views, and metadata previews.
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Setup with Agentforce
notes.description: Setup with Agentforce also updates the Setup Home page released in Winter ’26 with a prompt bar, org health and usage metrics, and conversation recommendations to get you started working quickly with an agent to complete common tasks.

notes.feature_name: Setup with Agentforce
notes.description: The new Setup agent supports many more Setup tasks than the previously released Agent for Setup, including managing users, troubleshooting user access, managing permission sets, permission set groups, organization-wide defaults, and sharing rules, creating custom objects and fields, creating and managing flows, getting information from Salesforce Help, navigating to the right Setup page to complete a task, creating a custom report type, creating Lightning pages, fixing issues and getting an explanation of formulas, and getting information about usage and licenses.
notes.security_notes: Ensure that Data Cloud is set up in your org before enabling.

notes.feature_name: Ask Agent for Setup (Beta)
notes.description: On Setup Home, start a conversation by using the prompt bar, conversation recommendations, or the Ask Agentforce buttons in the Org Health and Usage section. On any other Setup page, click the Ask Agent for Setup (Beta) button. During the conversation, you see record details, list views, documentation, and other items that you can expand for additional information.

notes.feature_name: Open Setup Pages in a Dedicated Tab (Beta)
notes.description: In Salesforce orgs that have enabled Setup with Agentforce, Setup pages open in a single dedicated tab instead of overwriting the Setup Home page. Now you can context switch between Home, agent conversations, and Setup pages without losing work.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Apply export filters from Translation Workbench
notes.description: Reduce metadata translation file size and complexity with export filters. Now, you can filter metadata translation files for export from the Translation Workbench when you select metadata components and date ranges. To improve the import experience, when you import translated files that contain invalid records, the valid records are imported.

notes.feature_name: Speed Up Custom Label Updates in Translation Workbench
notes.description: Save time by updating custom labels directly within the Translation Workbench user interface, instead of navigating to the Custom Labels setup section.

notes.feature_name: Use Updated State Codes for Picklists
notes.description: When you use standard country/territory address picklists, some country and territory states/provinces have special considerations for their state codes. You can now access the updated state codes for Canada and Japan in Salesforce orgs created in Spring ’26 and later, helping you maintain data quality.

notes.feature_name: Review Updated Label Translations
notes.description: To improve accuracy and your users’ experience, we updated the translations for some standard object, tab, and field names for these languages: Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Dutch, Finnish, French, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Slovenian, Thai, and Turkish.

notes.feature_name: Enable ICU Locale Formats (Release Update)
notes.description: With this update, the International Components for Unicode (ICU) locale formats replace Oracle’s Java Development Kit (JDK) locale formats in Salesforce. Locales control the format for dates, times, currencies, addresses, names, numeric values, and the start day of the week. ICU sets the international standard for these formats. The ICU locale formats provide a consistent experience across the platform and improve integration with ICU-compliant applications across the globe. This update was first made available in Winter ’20. Orgs that haven’t already switched to ICU locale formats are encouraged to manually update.

notes.feature_name: Granular Control for Translation Packages
notes.description: Filtering provides granular control, helps create smaller, more efficient translation packages, and you can create highly precise translation files. For example, you can limit the export to only records modified since a specific date. Or, you can focus on recently changed items when you define a date range based on the source’s last modified date. When you import translated files that contain invalid records, the valid records are imported. All errors are reported and the error report is a link to a .zip archive. Previously, only up to 50 errors were reported, there was complete failure or success, and the error report was available as an email attachment.

notes.feature_name: Speed Up Custom Label Updates in Translation Workbench
notes.description: Save time by updating custom labels directly within the Translation Workbench user interface, instead of navigating to the Custom Labels setup section.

notes.feature_name: Use Updated State Codes for Picklists
notes.description: When you use standard country/territory address picklists, some country and territory states/provinces have special considerations for their state codes. You can now access the updated state codes for Canada and Japan in Salesforce orgs created in Spring ’26 and later, helping you maintain data quality. For Canada, the state/province name Yukon Territories (YT) is available in orgs created in Winter ’26 and earlier. The state/province name Yukon (YT) is available in orgs created in Spring ’26 and later. For Japan, the state codes for 02 (Aomori), 05 (Akita), and 23 (Aichi) and their state/province names have changed.

notes.feature_name: Updated State Codes for Address Picklists
notes.description: The state code for the state/province Akita for orgs created in Spring ’26 and later is 05. For orgs created in Winter ’26 and earlier, the state code is 02. The state code for the state/province Aichi for orgs created in Spring ’26 and later is 23. For orgs created in Winter ’26 and earlier, the state code is 05.

notes.feature_name: Updated Label Translations
notes.description: Translations for some standard object, tab, and field names have been updated for languages including Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Dutch, Finnish, French, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Slovenian, Thai, and Turkish. This change applies to Lightning Experience, Salesforce Classic, and all versions of the Salesforce mobile app in all editions.

notes.feature_name: Enable ICU Locale Formats
notes.description: The International Components for Unicode (ICU) locale formats replace Oracle’s Java Development Kit (JDK) locale formats in Salesforce. This update provides a consistent experience across the platform and improves integration with ICU-compliant applications. Orgs that haven’t switched to ICU locale formats are encouraged to manually update. To use the ICU locale formats, all Apex classes, Apex triggers, and Visualforce pages must use API version 45.0 or later.

notes.feature_name: ICU Locale Formats Activation
notes.description: The English (Canada) locale (en_CA) requires separate activation. From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter User Interface, and select User Interface. Then select Enable ICU formats for en_CA, and save your changes. The enablement of this release update is not enforced in Spring '26. If your org is already using ICU locale formats, those locale formats remain enabled. For any org still using JDK, we recommend that they use the release update to manually enable ICU locale formats.

notes.feature_name: List View Edit Limits Communication
notes.description: List views rendered with Lightning Web Components (LWC) now prevent you from selecting or attempting to edit more than the supported maximum of 200 records at one time. Previously, if you selected more than 200 records, the edit icon still appeared and Salesforce didn’t restrict you from changing a field. However, when you attempted to apply your changes, an error notified you that your changes were unsaveable. To save you time and prevent the input of changes that can’t be saved, list views now enforce the 200-record limit earlier in the edit process.

notes.feature_name: Updated Empty Value Placement in List View Sorting
notes.description: When you sort a list view, blank fields, or null values, now are treated as the highest value in the dataset. For example, let’s say you have a column with the data 5, 9, null, and 2. If you sort this column in ascending order, you see 2, 5, 9, null. Previously, Salesforce treated blank fields as the lowest value, so that in the example given, you saw the data as null, 2, 5, 9.

notes.feature_name: Use Updated Empty Value Placement in List View Sorting
notes.description: When you sort a list view, blank fields, or null values, now are treated as the highest value in the dataset. For example, let’s say you have a column with the data 5, 9, null, and 2. If you sort this column in ascending order, you see 2, 5, 9, null. Previously, Salesforce treated blank fields as the lowest value, so that in the example given, you saw the data as null, 2, 5, 9.

notes.feature_name: Configure New Trialforce Login Pages Before Summer ’26
notes.description: If you plan to configure a new branded login page for your AppExchange solution’s Trialforce Source Org (TSO), complete the configuration before Summer ’26. With that release, existing branded login pages continue to work but you can’t configure new branded login pages.
notes.timeline: Salesforce starts deploying the Summer ’26 release to Developer Edition orgs on May 15, 2026.
notes.breaking_changes: Salesforce plans to retire the .cloudforce.com host name that serves Trialforce branded login pages.

notes.feature_name: Submit Records for Approval by Using the Request Approval Component
notes.description: Add the Request Approval component to record pages so users can submit records for approval without the need for a custom button. Install a release update to address new sharing recalculation behavior.

notes.feature_name: Submit Records for Approval by Using the Request Approval Component
notes.description: Add the Request Approval component to record pages to integrate autolaunched flow approval processes into your record pages. Configure the component in Lightning App Builder to require submitters to select the first approver and add comments about their approval request. The component works only with Flow Approval Processes, not with Classic Approval Processes.

notes.feature_name: Update Apex Code and Flows for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior
notes.description: To optimize performance after large-scale updates to groups or roles, Salesforce now performs some sharing recalculations asynchronously. If Apex code and flows require that share records be updated immediately, the code and flows can break when this release update is enforced. Update Apex classes, tests, and flows that update group membership or roles if they rely on synchronous sharing recalculation. This update is available starting in Spring ’26.
notes.breaking_changes: Code and flows that rely on synchronous sharing recalculation may break.

notes.feature_name: Button Order Was Updated on User Records
notes.description: For a more consistent navigation experience, the Cancel button now appears first when you edit user records in Setup.
notes.edition: Contact Manager, Group, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Database.com

notes.feature_name: Update Apex Code and Flows for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior

notes.description: Functionality to clean up Data 360 metadata in older sandboxes.

notes.feature_name: Protect Active Connector Settings During DevOps Data Kit Deployment in Data 360 Sandbox
notes.description: Enhancement to protect active connector settings during the deployment of DevOps Data Kit in Data 360 sandbox.

notes.feature_name: Activate Segments with Consistent Order of Attributes or Columns
notes.description: New capability to activate segments while maintaining a consistent order of attributes or columns.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Activation Payloads with the Is Changed Operator
notes.description: Enhancement to optimize activation payloads using the Is Changed operator.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 Clean Rooms Are Now Generally Available
notes.description: Data 360 Clean Rooms feature is now generally available for users.

notes.feature_name: Ingest Data Faster with Ready-to-Use Data Lake Objects
notes.description: Ingest data more efficiently by using standard data lake objects (DLOs) and mappings in Data 360. Previously, each DLO and mapping required manual configuration. Now, ready-to-use DLOs reduce setup time and ensure that data is immediately available for use.
notes.edition: Data 360 Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions. Not available in Government Cloud.

notes.feature_name: Clean Up Data 360 Metadata in Older Sandboxes
notes.description: Remove outdated Data 360 metadata from sandboxes created before August 2024 and use them for a new setup without a refresh. The cleanup process identifies any non-Data 360 entities that reference Data 360 entities and packages containing outdated metadata.

notes.feature_name: Protect Active Connector Settings in Data 360 Sandbox
notes.description: Ensure configuration stability and reduce the manual work required to re-authorize connections in Data 360 sandboxes. If a connector is active in the target org, DevOps data kit deployments now ignore changes to connector attributes to avoid overwriting your settings. This protection applies to all data stream connectors except for Ingestion API and Streaming app connectors.
notes.activation_required: To begin data ingestion for connectors, activate the connection in the target org. View connector details on the Data Stream Bundle page.
notes.edition: Data 360 Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Clean Up Data 360 Metadata in Older Sandboxes
notes.description: Remove outdated Data 360 metadata from sandboxes created before August 2024 and use them for a new setup without a refresh. The cleanup process identifies any non-Data 360 entities that reference Data 360 entities and packages containing outdated metadata.
notes.activation_required: Go to Data Cloud Setup. If your sandbox contains outdated metadata, click Clean up and Reset.
notes.edition: Data 360 Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Leverage Currency Fields in Copy Field Enrichments
notes.description: You can now copy financial data from Data 360 data model objects (DMOs) to your Salesforce objects using currency fields. Accelerate calculations for key metrics such as lifetime value (LTV) and total customer value (TCV). Use this capability in single currency orgs only. Multi-currency orgs aren't supported.
notes.edition: Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Merge Copy Field Enrichments from Sandbox to Production
notes.description: Streamline the development lifecycle by using the Data Kit and Change Set framework to merge copy field enrichments from a development sandbox into a production environment. This capability reduces the risk associated with manual configuration and ensures consistency across environments. The merge-back process comprises all necessary dependent metadata. The migration includes Data 360 metadata such as source data model objects, calculated insight objects, and required identity resolution configurations. It also includes CRM metadata, such as referenced custom fields and custom objects, on the target CRM record.
notes.edition: Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Data 360 Clean Rooms Are Now Generally Available
notes.description: Use Data 360 clean rooms to partner with other organizations and analyze your combined data while maintaining strict privacy. Compare and verify your clean room data mappings in a sandbox org before moving them to a production org. Delete unused mapped templates, and end clean room collaborations as needed.

notes.feature_name: Activate Segments with Consistent Order of Attributes or Columns
notes.description: If an activation is run multiple times, the order of attributes or columns in the activated file is now consistent, when activating to file storage targets like Amazon S3, SFTP, GCS, or Azure. Consistent order of attributes or columns helps in easy consumption of the activation output by a downstream system.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 Clean Rooms Are Now Generally Available
notes.description: Use Data 360 clean rooms to partner with other organizations and analyze your combined data while maintaining strict privacy. Compare and verify your clean room data mappings in a sandbox org before moving them to a production org. Delete unused mapped templates, and end clean room collaborations as needed.
notes.edition: Data Cloud Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Activate Segments with Consistent Order of Attributes or Columns
notes.description: If an activation is run multiple times, the order of attributes or columns in the activated file is now consistent, when activating to file storage targets like Amazon S3, SFTP, GCS, or Azure. Consistent order of attributes or columns helps in easy consumption of the activation output by a downstream system. Note: For activations created prior to January 2026, you must edit and save your activation to ensure its future runs have consistent order of attributes or columns.
notes.edition: Data 360 in the Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Visualize Your Data Without SQL in Data 360
notes.description: Validate data quality and structure without using SQL. Powered by Data Lens, the Preview button in Data 360 provides a view of sample data and profiling insights. Data Lens maintains the same permission model as other Data 360 viewing applications, such as Data Explorer. Dynamic PII masking protects data displayed in the Preview window. The Preview button appears on Data Lens-powered tabs in Data 360. Currently, this includes Einstein Studio and Segmentations.

notes.feature_name: Data Lens Preview Feature
notes.description: Validate data quality and structure without using SQL. Powered by Data Lens, the Preview button in Data 360 provides a view of sample data and profiling insights. Data Lens maintains the same permission model as other Data 360 viewing applications, such as Data Explorer. Dynamic PII masking protects data displayed in the Preview window. The Preview button appears on Data Lens-powered tabs in Data 360, currently including Einstein Studio and Segmentations.
notes.security_notes: Dynamic PII masking protects data displayed in the Preview window.

notes.feature_name: RunRelevantTests (beta) Test Level
notes.description: Run only Apex tests that are relevant to a deployment by using the RunRelevantTests (beta) test level.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Apex Cursors and Pagination Cursors
notes.description: Apex cursors and pagination cursors are enhanced and generally available.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.RecordUi.getPicklistValuesByRecordType() Method
notes.description: Extract picklist fields by using the ConnectApi.RecordUi.getPicklistValuesByRecordType() method.

notes.feature_name: Expose Apex REST and AuraEnabled Controller Methods as Agent Actions
notes.description: Exposing Apex REST and AuraEnabled controller methods as agent actions is generally available.

notes.feature_name: Blob.toPdf() Method
notes.description: The Blob.toPdf() method uses the same PDF rendering service as Visualforce.

notes.feature_name: Prepare Apex Code for Changes to Sharing Recalculation Behavior
notes.description: Prepare your Apex code for changes to sharing recalculation behavior.

notes.feature_name: Filter Test Discovery API Results
notes.description: Filter Test Discovery API results by using the category query parameter.

notes.feature_name: Purge Old Async Jobs Method Overload
notes.description: Specify the number of oldest, completed async jobs to delete by using the method overload for purgeOldAsyncJobs().

notes.feature_name: Monitor Sandbox Copy Progress in Greater Detail with an Updated UI
notes.description: The updated UI for sandbox copies and refreshes now provides a detailed visual progress bar and real-time status updates for each stage. Users gain greater insight and transparency into the process, enabling better tracking of sandbox progress and completion.

notes.feature_name: Use complex expressions in your LWC templates
notes.description: Users can now use complex expressions in their Lightning Web Component templates, enhancing the flexibility and capability of component development.

notes.feature_name: Lightning base components for empty states and illustrations are in beta
notes.description: New Lightning base components for empty states and illustrations are now available in beta, providing developers with additional tools for creating user-friendly interfaces.

notes.feature_name: Screen flows now support Lightning Web Component local actions
notes.description: Screen flows now have the capability to support local actions for Lightning Web Components, allowing for more interactive and dynamic user experiences.

notes.feature_name: Update the API version for your components to use new features and improvements
notes.description: Update the API version for your Lightning web components to ensure that existing components aren’t affected when Salesforce ships new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements that change existing behavior.

notes.feature_name: Display Consistent Empty State Illustrations With Theme Support
notes.description: Use the new lightning-empty-state component to add meaningful visuals and content to your components that show empty states. This component displays the latest Salesforce Lightning Design System (SLDS) empty state illustration and correctly sizes it for the container, simplifying your UI development. The SVG illustrations automatically adjust to the user's selected theme, and can adapt to dark mode in SLDS 2 themes, for a consistent look and feel across your app. The new lightning-illustration component displays the same set of illustrations without text.

notes.feature_name: Lightning Component Library Is Retiring
notes.description: It’s time to say goodbye to the Lightning Component Library, our legacy hub of Lightning component information. The legacy Component Library pages will redirect users to the new Lightning Component Reference in the Spring ’26 release. The tools for Lightning Web Security and Lightning Locker are also scheduled to redirect to their new locations.

notes.feature_name: Get Complete Type Definitions for Lightning Base Components
notes.description: Build your apps with confidence with the completion of the TypeScript rollout for all Lightning base components.

notes.feature_name: Update Your Custom Components for Use in Setup with Agentforce
notes.description: Make your custom Aura and Lightning web components accessible to Agentforce in Setup by adding AI-related component and property descriptions to their js-meta.xml and .design files. AI component and property descriptions are used only in orgs that have Setup with Agentforce (beta) enabled.

notes.feature_name: Check For Errors From the Disconnected DOM Node Rehydration Fix
notes.description: To improve framework consistency, Lightning web components now rehydrate only when they're actively connected to the DOM. For example, rehydration skips detached nodes to prevent lifecycle methods like renderedCallback from firing multiple times. Previously, certain edge cases allowed disconnected DOM nodes to be rehydrated, which could trigger reactive state updates or function invocations on detached components.

notes.feature_name: Manage Page Errors with Error Console
notes.description: Enable the Error Console to capture and display component and page errors without interrupting your work in Salesforce. The console collects non-fatal errors so you can see them when it’s convenient for you, and they don’t require interaction. Fatal errors still show in modal error panels that you must dismiss before continuing. Fatal errors are also collected in the Error Console for later inspection.

notes.feature_name: LWS Trusted Mode Enablement Is Discontinued
notes.description: In Spring ’26, we’re no longer enabling Lightning Web Security (LWS) Trusted Mode. Salesforce briefly released LWS Trusted Mode in Winter ’26. We re-evaluated LWS Trusted Mode and decided to make it available only as a beta service in the same Winter ’26 release. This feature gives customers great responsibility for the security of scripts allowed to run in their org. We want to make sure that the customers that enable LWS Trusted Mode have a strong security posture both as a company and built into their processes.

notes.feature_name: API Distortion Changes in Lightning Web Security
notes.description: Lightning Web Security (LWS) includes new security protections with more distortions for web APIs. ESLint rules matching the distortions are also available.

notes.feature_name: Work with More MCP Tools for LWC Development
notes.description: Build apps faster with MCP tools for LWC development.

notes.feature_name: Update the API version for your components
notes.description: Update the API version for your components to use new features and improvements. Versioning your Lightning web components ensures that your existing components aren’t affected when Salesforce ships new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements that change existing behavior. Versioning also helps Salesforce deprecate legacy features. This change applies to custom Lightning web components in Lightning Experience, Experience Builder sites, and all versions of the Salesforce mobile app. You can change a component’s API version in its .js-meta.xml file.
notes.breaking_changes: We recommend that you upgrade your component API version one version at a time. For example, from 58.0, upgrade from 58.0 to 59.0, fix any errors or warnings you encounter, and then repeat until you get to the latest API version.

notes.feature_name: Use Complex Template Expressions in Your Lightning Web Components
notes.description: Add sophisticated presentation logic to your Lightning web component template files, and remove extra code from your component implementation. A component that renders a user interface can now use complex JavaScript expressions directly in its HTML template file. Use complex template expressions anywhere you use basic properties.

notes.feature_name: Complex Template Expressions
notes.description: Complex template expressions allow the use of complex JavaScript expressions directly in HTML template files. This feature extends the templating capabilities of Lightning Web Components, enabling more dynamic and expressive templates while maintaining performance and security. To enable complex template expressions, set the apiVersion of your component to 66.0 or later.

notes.feature_name: Display Consistent Empty State Illustrations With Theme Support
notes.description: The new lightning-empty-state component allows developers to add meaningful visuals and content to components that show empty states. It displays the latest Salesforce Lightning Design System (SLDS) empty state illustration, adjusts to the user's selected theme, and can adapt to dark mode in SLDS 2 themes. The lightning-illustration component displays the same illustrations without text.

notes.feature_name: Lightning Empty State Component
notes.description: You can provide more clarity or lead users to the next step of their journey with the new <lightning-empty-state> component. This component allows you to depict an empty state without an illustration, title, or call-to-action button; only the description is required. You can include the <lightning-empty-state> tag in your Lightning web component and pass the illustration name and title using attributes. The description and call-to-action (cta) can be passed using slots. The component automatically detects the SLDS version of the theme and presents the correct version of the illustration.

notes.feature_name: lightning-illustration Component Enhancement
notes.description: The lightning-illustration component can display the same empty state illustrations without descriptive text or buttons. We’re working on more illustrations to use with this component. This example component shows only the empty cart illustration in SLDS 2 themes and the gone fishing illustration in SLDS 1 themes.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of Lightning Component Library
notes.description: The Lightning Component Library, our legacy hub of Lightning component information, is retiring. The legacy Component Library pages will redirect users to the new Lightning Component Reference in the Spring ’26 release. The tools for Lightning Web Security and Lightning Locker are also scheduled to redirect to their new locations.
notes.timeline: January 2026, as the Spring ’26 release rolls out to customers.
notes.breaking_changes: The Lightning Component Library that’s published on the external website is going away. The Lightning Component Library that’s accessible in your org remains available but will not be updated.

notes.feature_name: Get Complete Type Definitions for Lightning Base Components
notes.description: Build your apps with confidence with the completion of the TypeScript rollout for all Lightning base components. When using a base component, import its type definition in your component. Type definitions for base components are available in the @salesforce/lightning-types Node Package Manager (npm) package. If you have defined your own type definitions for base components, we recommend using the npm package in your LWC project instead.

notes.feature_name: Update Your Custom Components for Use in Setup with Agentforce (Beta)
notes.description: Make your custom Aura and Lightning web components accessible to Agentforce in Setup by adding AI-related component and property descriptions to their js-meta.xml and .design files. AI component and property descriptions are used only in orgs that have Setup with Agentforce (beta) enabled. When Setup with Agentforce is enabled, the Setup agent can recommend custom components when creating a Lightning record page from a user utterance. For the Setup agent to successfully analyze whether your custom component fits the requirements for it to be included on the suggested record page, the component must contain an AI-related description of what it does and descriptions of its properties.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Foundations or Agentforce 1 editions
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Check For Errors From the Disconnected DOM Node Rehydration Fix
notes.description: To improve framework consistency, Lightning web components now rehydrate only when they're actively connected to the DOM. For example, rehydration skips detached nodes to prevent lifecycle methods like renderedCallback from firing multiple times. Previously, certain edge cases allowed disconnected DOM nodes to be rehydrated, which could trigger reactive state updates or function invocations on detached components.
affected_components: Lightning web components in Open Source
notes.breaking_changes: If your implementation created a dependency on the previous rehydration behavior, review your logic for breakages.

notes.feature_name: Manage Page Errors with Error Console
notes.description: Enable the Error Console to capture and display component and page errors without interrupting your work in Salesforce. The console collects non-fatal errors so you can see them when it’s convenient for you, and they don’t require interaction. Fatal errors still show in modal error panels that you must dismiss before continuing. Fatal errors are also collected in the Error Console for later inspection.

notes.feature_name: Lightning Out 2.0 Improvements
notes.description: Improvements to Lightning Out 2.0 and the Lightning Out 2.0 App Manager include the ability to add domain names of external apps that host your Lightning Out 2.0 app, support for Lightning web components (LWC) with complex namespaces, and the use of a forward slash (/) or a hyphen (-) to separate the namespace from the component name. Additionally, the Lightning Out 2.0 app component now supports the app-id attribute, which is automatically included in the app code block.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Lightning Out 2.0
notes.description: To add an LWC component to a Lightning Out 2.0 app, open the App Components tab and enter the name. This example shows the complexNs/lwcComponent component added to a Lightning Out 2.0 app. Salesforce converts all components to the standard syntax for custom HTML elements. The generated code block doesn’t include the frontdoor_url attribute on the lightning-out-application component because this attribute is set at run time.

notes.feature_name: LWS Trusted Mode Enablement Is Discontinued
notes.description: In Spring ’26, we’re no longer enabling Lightning Web Security (LWS) Trusted Mode. Salesforce briefly released LWS Trusted Mode in Winter ’26. We re-evaluated LWS Trusted Mode and decided to make it available only as a beta service in the same Winter ’26 release. This feature gives customers great responsibility for the security of scripts allowed to run in their org. We want to make sure that the customers that enable LWS Trusted Mode have a strong security posture both as a company and built into their processes.
notes.breaking_changes: LWS Trusted Mode is no longer enabled.
notes.security_notes: Salesforce provides a secure by default environment. Although we recognize the functional advantages and third-party compatibility that LWS Trusted Mode offers, we’re limiting its availability.

notes.feature_name: API Distortion Changes in Lightning Web Security
notes.description: Lightning Web Security (LWS) includes new security protections with more distortions for web APIs. ESLint rules matching the distortions are also available. These APIs have new distortions documented in the LWS Distortion Viewer (can be outdated or unavailable during release preview).
affected_components: Lightning web components in Aura sites

notes.feature_name: Work with More MCP Tools for LWC Development (Beta)
notes.description: Build apps faster with MCP tools for LWC development.

notes.feature_name: MCP Tools for LWC Development
notes.description: The lwc-experts toolset includes several more tools to assist with LWC development. The create_lds_graphql_mutation_query tool provides guidance for creating GraphQL mutation queries. The guide_utam_generation tool provides UI Test Automation Model (UTAM) Page Object generation guidelines and best practices. Note that the guide_utam_generation tool is not yet generally available (NON-GA). To use this tool, specify the --allow-non-ga-tools flag in your DX MCP Server configuration.

notes.feature_name: Dark Mode in More Editions
notes.description: You can now enable dark mode for Salesforce Lightning Design System 2 (SLDS 2) themes in Free Suite, Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, and Developer edition orgs. Previously, dark mode was available only for Salesforce Starter Suite orgs. Dark mode shows light-colored text and visual elements on a dark background, which lays the foundation for richer theming opportunities and more customization of Lightning base components. With dark mode enabled, your users can select an appearance that reduces eye strain in low-light conditions and enhances readability.
notes.edition: Free Suite, Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Developer

notes.feature_name: New Component Designs for Empty State and Illustration
notes.description: We added two new component designs for empty state and illustration. Both are implemented as Lightning base components, lightning-empty-state and lightning-illustration, and they’re available as beta features. The empty state component is designed to show visuals that adapt to your brand, helpful messages, and guidance when there’s no content to display. The illustration component is designed to add visuals that adapt to your brand, and enhance communication and engagement. The lightning-illustration component currently can display the same illustrations as lightning-empty-state without descriptive text or buttons. We’re working on more illustrations to use with lightning-illustration. Depending on the SLDS version in your org, both the illustration and empty state components switch between SLDS 1 and SLDS 2 automatically. Additionally, SLDS 2 illustration and empty state colors are optimized for dark mode.

notes.feature_name: Modification to Meet WCAG 1.4.11 Standard
notes.description: To meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 1.4.11 standard for non-text accessibility, we modified the root ::selection pseudo-selector by removing the background, text-shadow, and color properties and values. These changes allow the user agent, or web browser, to control the styling of highlighted and selected content.

notes.feature_name: Dark Mode Availability for More Editions
notes.description: You can now enable dark mode for Salesforce Lightning Design System 2 (SLDS 2) themes in Free Suite, Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, and Developer edition orgs. Previously, dark mode was available only for Salesforce Starter Suite orgs. Dark mode shows light-colored text and visual elements on a dark background, which lays the foundation for richer theming opportunities and more customization of Lightning base components. With dark mode enabled, your users can select an appearance that reduces eye strain in low-light conditions and enhances readability.
notes.edition: Free Suite, Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Developer

notes.feature_name: Dark Mode
notes.description: To enable dark mode, from Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Themes and Branding and select it. Click New Theme, or click next to an existing SLDS 2 theme and then select Edit. In the Dark Mode section, select Let users enable dark mode. After you enable dark mode, a user can click their profile image and select how they want Salesforce to appear. Not all Salesforce apps and features are fully optimized for dark mode yet, including Analytics, reports, and dashboards; Rich text editors and their outputs; Builders; Setup.

notes.feature_name: Escape the Label Attribute of <apex:inputField> Elements
notes.description: To prevent malicious code from executing in cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks on your Visualforce pages, this release update escapes the label attribute of your <apex:inputField> tags. This update was first available in Winter ’23.
notes.security_notes: This update is a security measure to prevent XSS attacks.

notes.feature_name: Escape the Label Attribute of <apex:inputField> Elements to Prevent Cross-Site Scripting in Visualforce Pages
notes.description: To prevent malicious code from executing in cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks on your Visualforce pages, this release update escapes the label attribute of your <apex:inputField> tags. This update was first available in Winter ’23. This update improves the security of your Visualforce pages by automatically escaping the label attribute of all your existing <apex:inputField> elements. It also escapes the label attribute for <apex:inputField> elements that you create after enabling the update. After this update is enforced, label attributes that you already escaped are double-escaped. Double-escaped attributes don’t render correctly on Visualforce pages.
notes.timeline: Salesforce enforced this update for most orgs in Spring ’23. Salesforce enforces this update for all remaining orgs in Spring ’26.
notes.breaking_changes: Double-escaped attributes don’t render correctly on Visualforce pages.
notes.security_notes: This update improves the security of your Visualforce pages.

notes.feature_name: Deploy Apex Components Faster by Running Only Relevant Tests
notes.description: To reduce Apex component deployment time, use the new RunRelevantTests test level to run only the tests relevant to your code changes. This feature automatically determines which tests to run.

notes.feature_name: Apex Cursors for Expanded SOQL Query Result Support
notes.description: Use Apex cursors and pagination cursors to work with large SOQL query result sets in manageable parts. This feature, now generally available, includes enhancements since the beta release. Standard cursors, when combined with queueable Apex, address the limitations of batch Apex. Pagination cursors are designed for UI elements, such as multipage record lists. Both Apex cursor types can traverse forwards and backwards through result sets and can handle high-volume, high-resource processing.

notes.feature_name: Extract Picklist Values Based on Record Type
notes.description: Get the values for all picklist fields for a particular record type by using the new ConnectApi.RecordUi.getPicklistValuesByRecordType(objectApiName, recordTypeId) method. We delivered this feature due to your idea on IdeaExchange.

notes.feature_name: Expose Apex REST and AuraEnabled Controller Methods as Agent Actions
notes.description: Create agent actions based on Apex classes by annotating methods in those classes, generating an OpenAPI spec document, and deploying that document to your org. Manage the exposed methods as APIs in API Catalog. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Use Visualforce PDF Rendering Service with Apex Blob.toPdf()
notes.description: With this update enabled, the Apex Blob.toPdf() method for PDF rendering uses the same rendering service as Visualforce. The Visualforce PDF rendering service offers improvements such as additional fonts and multibyte character support. This change makes PDF rendering more consistent on the Salesforce Platform.

notes.feature_name: Review Apex Code for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior
notes.description: To help you prepare your Apex code for changes to sharing recalculation behavior, Salesforce created a release update that walks you through identifying and fixing affected code. For more information, review the related release note and the Update Apex Code and Flows for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior release update in Setup.

notes.feature_name: Filter Test Discovery API Results by Test Category
notes.description: To retrieve only flow tests or only Apex tests, use the new category query parameter in calls to the Test Discovery API endpoint. Previously, you could filter tests only by namespace prefix and test method visibility. Filtering by test category is helpful in orgs with large test suites across different namespaces.

notes.feature_name: Specify the Number of Async Jobs to Delete
notes.description: Use the new method overload for purgeOldAsyncJobs() to specify the number of oldest, completed async jobs in your org to purge. Providing an upper bound for the number of records to delete enables incremental progress when large volumes of records are to be deleted.

notes.feature_name: Use DataWeave in Transformations with Nested SOQL Queries
notes.description: DataWeave supports nested SOQL queries, which improves development time and enables easy integration and efficiency with your transformations. We delivered this feature due to your idea on IdeaExchange.

notes.feature_name: Deploy Apex Components Faster by Running Only Relevant Tests (Beta)
notes.description: To reduce Apex component deployment time, use the new RunRelevantTests test level to run only the tests relevant to your code changes. This feature automatically determines which tests to run based on an analysis of the deployment payload and the payload dependencies. For fine-grained control, you can annotate test classes so that they either run regardless of the deployment payload, or run when specified components are new or modified. This targeted approach boosts the speed and reliability of your deployment while maintaining code quality and coverage requirements.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.api_version: API version 66.0 and later for annotations
notes.security_notes: The RunRelevantTests test level and the associated @IsTest() annotations are pilot or beta services that are subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements — Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory.
