Use of these pilot or beta services are at the Customer’s sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Apex Cursors for Expanded SOQL Query Result Support
notes.description: Use Apex cursors and pagination cursors to work with large SOQL query result sets in manageable parts. This feature, now generally available, includes enhancements since the beta release. Standard cursors, when combined with queueable Apex, address the limitations of batch Apex. Pagination cursors are designed for UI elements, such as multipage record lists. Both Apex cursor types can traverse forwards and backwards through result sets and can handle high-volume, high-resource processing.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Apex Test Class Annotations
notes.description: If a test class must always run regardless of the classes or triggers in the deployment payload, annotate the test class with @IsTest(critical=true). If a test class must always run whenever specified classes or triggers are new or changed in the deployment payload, annotate the test class with @IsTest(testFor='ApexClass:ClassName, ApexTrigger:TriggerName').

notes.feature_name: Limits.getApexPaginationCursorRows() and Limits.getLimitApexPaginationCursorRows() method
notes.description: Cursor and pagination cursor support in AuraEnabled serialization and deserialization. You can serialize a cursor in an @AuraEnabled response and deserialize a cursor as an input parameter in an @AuraEnabled method.

notes.feature_name: Extract Picklist Values Based on Record Type
notes.description: Get the values for all picklist fields for a particular record type by using the new ConnectApi.RecordUi.getPicklistValuesByRecordType(objectApiName, recordTypeId) method. This method is especially useful for getting dependent picklist values.

notes.feature_name: Expose Apex REST and AuraEnabled Controller Methods as Agent Actions
notes.description: Create agent actions based on Apex classes by annotating methods in those classes, generating an OpenAPI spec document, and deploying that document to your org. Manage the exposed methods as APIs in API Catalog. This feature is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Use Visualforce PDF Rendering Service with Apex Blob.toPdf()
notes.description: With this update enabled, the Apex Blob.toPdf() method for PDF rendering uses the same rendering service as Visualforce. The Visualforce PDF rendering service offers improvements such as additional fonts and multibyte character support. This change makes PDF rendering more consistent on the Salesforce Platform. Blob.toPdf() still accepts any string as an argument, and still returns a Blob result. Other than using a different PDF rendering engine, the shape of Blob.toPdf() is unchanged. Important: The Visualforce PDF rendering service offers an expanded range of fonts, and the default font is changed from serif to sans-serif. If your PDF string doesn’t include explicit font styling, this change might result in different line lengths, and different line and page breaks for PDFs rendered compared to the old service.
notes.activation_required: Follow the testing and activation steps from Setup.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.timeline: Salesforce enforces this update in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Review Apex Code for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior
notes.description: To help you prepare your Apex code for changes to sharing recalculation behavior, Salesforce created a release update that walks you through identifying and fixing affected code.
notes.activation_required: Review the related release note and the Update Apex Code and Flows for Changed Sharing Recalculation Behavior release update in Setup.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Filter Test Discovery API Results by Test Category
notes.description: To retrieve only flow tests or only Apex tests, use the new category query parameter in calls to the Test Discovery API endpoint. Previously, you could filter tests only by namespace prefix and test method visibility. Filtering by test category is helpful in orgs with large test suites across different namespaces. Where: This feature is available in API version 66.0 and later. This feature is available in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions. How: To retrieve tests in a specific test category, make a GET request to the Test Discovery API endpoint, which is a Tooling API resource. Set the category query parameter to either flow or apex. For example, this call returns only Apex tests: https://MyDomain.my.salesforce.com/services/data/v66.0/tooling/tests?category=apex. You can’t specify multiple categories in the same call. However, you can combine the category query parameter with other query parameters. For example, this call returns only automated flow tests from the ourManagedPackage namespace: https://MyDomain.my.salesforce.com/services/data/v66.0/tooling/tests?category=flow&namespacePrefix=ourManagedPackage.

notes.feature_name: Specify the Number of Async Jobs to Delete
notes.description: Use the new method overload for purgeOldAsyncJobs() to specify the number of oldest, completed async jobs in your org to purge. Providing an upper bound for the number of records to delete enables incremental progress when large volumes of records are to be deleted. Where: This feature is available in API version 66.0 and later. This feature is available in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions. How: Specify the number of completed async jobs to delete, starting from the oldest jobs that finished before the specified date. This example shows how to delete up to 1000 job records for jobs that finished before today’s date.

notes.feature_name: Use DataWeave in Transformations with Nested SOQL Queries
notes.description: DataWeave supports nested SOQL queries, which improves development time and enables easy integration and efficiency with your transformations. We delivered this feature due to your idea on IdeaExchange. Previously, when performing transformations involving subqueries or nested SOQL queries with parent-child relationships, Apex failed with a DataWeaveScriptException.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Expose Custom SOQL in REST API Calls Using Named Query API
notes.description: Use Named Query API to define and expose custom SOQL queries, or Named Query APIs, as scalable actions for REST API clients. Named Query APIs can retrieve data quickly and more efficiently than existing Flow or Apex processes.

notes.feature_name: Update Instanced URLs in API Traffic
notes.description: To prevent disruption when Salesforce ends support for API traffic that uses an incorrect instanced URL, make sure that API traffic to your org uses the org’s My Domain login URL. First available in Summer ’25, this release update was scheduled to be enforced in Spring ’26, but we postponed the enforcement to Summer ’26.
notes.timeline: First available in Summer ’25, enforcement postponed to Summer ’26

notes.feature_name: EventBusSubscriber Object’s Position and Tip Fields Are Being Deprecated
notes.description: The EventBusSubscriber object’s Position and Tip fields are being deprecated. They are being replaced with the new fields LastProcessed and LastPublished. The field type is changing from int to string in order to handle large replay IDs. We recommend updating your code to use LastProcessed and LastPublished to avoid issues when the replay ID exceeds the maximum integer size.

notes.feature_name: Sending Session IDs in Outbound Messages Is Being Removed
notes.description: Sending Session IDs in Outbound Messages is being removed.

notes.feature_name: Session ID Removal in Outbound Messages
notes.description: To align with modern security best practices, you can no longer send session IDs in outbound messages starting February 23, 2026. Instead, use OAuth to authenticate. When this change goes into effect, the new outbound message form won't include the option to send a session ID, the IncludeSessionId flag in the API will be ignored and set to FALSE, and the <sessionID></sessionID> element of an outbound message payload won't include a session ID.
notes.breaking_changes: Session IDs will no longer be sent in outbound messages.
notes.security_notes: Aligns with modern security best practices.

notes.feature_name: Metadata Deployments and Retrievals Have New Limits
notes.description: To maintain predictable performance, we're now applying limits to the volume of metadata deployed and retrieved for four specific metadata types: AIAuthoringBundle, AnalyticsDashboard, AnalyticsWorkspace, and AnalyticsVisualization. These limits restrict the number of metadata components allowed within a single package zip file, and the total number of deployments or retrievals permitted within a 24-hour period.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 SOQL Query Results Limit
notes.description: To prevent large queries from crashing the app server, Data 360 limits Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) results to 12-MB. SOQL returns the results up to the size limit with a query more link to paginate through the rest of the results. If a single query result exceeds the size limit, SOQL rejects the query and you can’t retrieve the results.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of SOAP API login() Call
notes.description: In Summer ‘27, the SOAP API login() call in SOAP API versions 31.0 through 64.0 will no longer be supported and no longer be available.
notes.breaking_changes: SOAP API login() call will be retired.

notes.feature_name: Expose Custom SOQL in REST API Calls Using Named Query API
notes.description: Use Named Query API to define and expose custom SOQL queries, or Named Query APIs, as scalable actions for REST API clients. Named Query APIs can retrieve data quickly and more efficiently than existing Flow or Apex processes. Note: Using Named Query APIs as agent actions remains a beta feature that must be enabled in Setup. Use of this beta feature is available for an additional cost. Required add-on licenses vary by agent type. Setup for AI agents is available on the desktop site.

notes.feature_name: Update Instanced URLs in API Traffic
notes.description: To prevent disruption when Salesforce ends support for API traffic that uses an incorrect instanced URL, make sure that API traffic to your org uses the org’s My Domain login URL. First available in Summer ’25, this release update was scheduled to be enforced in Spring ’26, but we postponed the enforcement.

notes.feature_name: Decommissioning of Hard-Coded References in API Traffic Routing
notes.description: Salesforce is decommissioning the service that supports hard-coded references to an incorrect instance name in API application traffic routing. This approach helps make sure that integrations continue to function smoothly while improving security, because My Domain URLs are unique to each org.
notes.timeline: Salesforce enforces this update on a rolling basis shortly after Summer ’26 deployment.
notes.breaking_changes: SOAP login URLs via Visualforce pages can return a 400 Bad Request error if this change is enabled before the related known issue is resolved.
notes.security_notes: This change improves security by ensuring that My Domain URLs are unique to each org.

notes.feature_name: Deprecation of Position and Tip Fields in EventBusSubscriber Object
notes.description: The EventBusSubscriber object’s Position and Tip fields are being deprecated. They are being replaced with the new fields LastProcessed and LastPublished. The field type is changing from int to string in order to handle large replay IDs. We recommend updating your code to use LastProcessed and LastPublished to avoid issues when the replay ID exceeds the maximum integer size.
notes.edition: Developer, Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Removal of Session IDs in Outbound Messages
notes.description: To align with modern security best practices, you can no longer send session IDs in outbound messages starting February 23, 2026. Instead, use OAuth to authenticate. When this change goes into effect, the new outbound message form won't include the option to send a session ID, the IncludeSessionId flag.
notes.security_notes: This change aligns with modern security best practices.

notes.feature_name: SOAP API login() Call Retirement
notes.description: In Summer ‘27, the SOAP API login() call in SOAP API versions 31.0 through 64.0 will no longer be supported and no longer be available.
notes.breaking_changes: The login() call will not be available in the specified versions.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 SOQL Query Results Limit
notes.description: To prevent large queries from crashing the app server, Data 360 limits Salesforce Object Query Language (SOQL) results to 12-MB. SOQL returns the results up to the size limit with a query more link to paginate through the rest of the results. If a single query result exceeds the size limit, SOQL rejects the query and you can’t retrieve the results.

notes.feature_name: Metadata Deployments and Retrievals Limits
notes.description: To maintain predictable performance, we're now applying limits to the volume of metadata deployed and retrieved for four specific metadata types: AIAuthoringBundle, AnalyticsDashboard, AnalyticsWorkspace, and AnalyticsVisualization. These limits restrict the number of metadata components allowed within a single package zip file, and the total number of deployments or retrievals permitted within a 24-hour period.

notes.feature_name: Session ID Removal from Outbound Message Payload
notes.description: The API will be ignored and set to FALSE, and the <sessionID></sessionID> element of an outbound message payload won't include a session ID.
notes.activation_required: Follow the guidance in Authorize Apps with OAuth instead of using a session ID.
notes.breaking_changes: Session ID will no longer be included in outbound message payloads.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of login() in SOAP API
notes.description: The login() function in certain SOAP API versions will be retired and unavailable. Applications using login() in these SOAP API versions will experience disruption, with requests failing and returning an error message indicating that the login() endpoint has been deactivated. Customers and partners must modify or upgrade their applications to use external client apps for authentication before Summer '27 is released.
notes.breaking_changes: Applications using the deprecated login() will fail after retirement.

notes.feature_name: Recommend a Package Version to Your Subscribers
notes.description: You can now encourage your subscribers to upgrade to a specific version of a package by setting a recommended version. When a package version is set as the recommended version, subscribers will see an 'Upgrade to Recommended Version' option on the Installed Packages page in their org. Only released package versions can be the recommended version.

notes.feature_name: Enable Debug Logs for Subscribers
notes.description: You can now self-serve enabling your access to a subscriber’s Apex debug logs using the License Management App (LMA). This allows you to troubleshoot issues specific to the subscriber without needing access granted by the subscriber’s system admin or Salesforce Partner Support.

notes.feature_name: Enable Debug Logs for Subscribers
notes.description: You can now self-serve enabling your access to a subscriber’s Apex debug logs by using the License Management App (LMA). Use debug logs to troubleshoot issues that are specific to the subscriber. Previously, access to a subscriber’s debug logs could only be granted by a subscriber’s system admin or Salesforce Partner Support.
notes.security_notes: When you enable debug logs for a namespace, the Apex code across managed packages in the namespace becomes visible to the subscriber org.

notes.feature_name: Data Mask
notes.description: Click into specific information about each mask, Automate how frequently Data Mask runs. Enjoy faster job processing times, better handling of complex data, and protect your data with automation bypasses.

notes.feature_name: Access Information About Specific Data Mask Job
notes.description: The Run Logs tab in Data Mask is now the Jobs tab. From a list view in the Jobs tab, you can click the Data Mask name to view specific information about each mask, such as configured objects, current job progress, and any errors thrown by the current job.

notes.feature_name: Automate the Running of Data Mask Processes with Job Scheduler
notes.description: Configure how frequently you run Data Mask, daily, weekly, or monthly, to mask all new data in your sandbox.

notes.feature_name: Other Improvements to Salesforce Data Mask
notes.description: We’ve optimized the record loading and transformation so Data Mask jobs complete faster. When it completes a job, Data Mask now bypasses automation rather than deactivating or reactivating when a job is complete. Data Mask deletes field-history tracking instead of turning it off for the masking process. Serial mode is removed as jobs automatically retry records when row-locked.

notes.feature_name: Updated UI for Sandbox Copies and Refreshes
notes.description: The updated UI for sandbox copies and refreshes now provides a detailed visual progress bar and real-time status updates for each stage. Users gain greater insight and transparency into the process, enabling better tracking of sandbox progress and completion.
notes.timeline: Override available until the Summer ‘26 release

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Vibes IDE
notes.description: Agentforce Vibes IDE is a web-based integrated development environment that has all the power and flexibility of Visual Studio Code, Salesforce Extensions for VS Code, and Salesforce CLI in your web browser.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Vibes Extension
notes.description: Agentforce Vibes Extension is an AI-powered developer tool that’s available as a Visual Studio Code extension in VS Code desktop and Agentforce Vibes IDE. Agentforce Vibes Extension is built with the SFR model, a secure and custom AI model from Salesforce.

notes.feature_name: Build Enterprise-Ready Agents with Agentforce DX and Agent Script (Beta)
notes.description: Use pro-code tools, such as VS Code and Salesforce CLI, to build hybrid reasoning Salesforce agents. These new types of agents have both the predictability that your business demands and the creativity that large language models (LLMs) make possible.
notes.availability: Available in Salesforce CLI version 2.115.15 and Agentforce VS Code Extension version 1.6.0
notes.security_notes: This feature is a beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Agent Script
notes.description: Author agents by using Agent Script, the language for building Salesforce hybrid reasoning agents. Agent Script combines the flexibility of natural language for code generation with the reliability of programmatic expressions for handling business rules.

notes.feature_name: Agent Script VS Code Extension
notes.description: Easily edit Agent Script files in the VS Code editor with the new Agent Script VS Code extension, which provides standard code editing features: syntax highlighting, visual syntax cues (such as red squiggles for errors), internal validation, and outline support.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce DX Preview
notes.description: Preview an agent conversation from its Agent Script file with the updated Agentforce DX VS Code Extension. With preview, you get behind-the-scenes details of how your agent is working. The preview supports two modes: simulated (which uses mocked actions) and live mode (which uses real Apex classes, flows, and other resources).

notes.feature_name: CLI Commands for Authoring Bundles
notes.description: Generate, validate, preview, and publish an authoring bundle with these new CLI commands. An authoring bundle is a new metadata type (AiAuthoringBundle) that represents an agent that uses Agent Script as its blueprint. Commands include: agent generate authoring-bundle, agent validate authoring-bundle, agent publish authoring-bundle, and agent preview.

notes.feature_name: Agent Publishing
notes.description: When you're ready to publish your agent to your org, you can use this CLI command or the AFDX: Publish This Agent VS Code command.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce DX MCP Server
notes.description: The Salesforce DX MCP Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation designed to facilitate interaction between LLMs and Salesforce orgs.

notes.feature_name: Improve Deploy Performance by Running Only Relevant Apex Tests
notes.description: Run only relevant Apex tests when you deploy metadata to your org. Use the new RunRelevantTests value of the --test-level flag of the project deploy start|validate commands. You can also use the same flag with the project delete source command. Salesforce automatically identifies the relevant tests based on an analysis of the deployment payload and the payload dependencies.

notes.feature_name: Run Apex and Flow Tests with a Single CLI Command
notes.description: Ensure interoperability between Apex classes and flows by running their tests in a single and unified way with these new CLI commands: logic run test to run tests for Apex and Flows in an org, and logic get test to get the results of an async test run, or if it timed out. Many flags of these new commands mimic the flags for the existing apex run|get test and flow run|get test commands, such as --tests, --test-level, --code-coverage, --class-names, and --output-dir. The new logic run test command expands the --tests flag so that you can specify both Apex and flow tests and adds a --test-category flag to narrow the type of tests you want to run. By default, the logic run test command runs asynchronously and returns a test run ID. Then use the logic get test command to retrieve the results.

notes.feature_name: Retrieve Package Metadata for a Specified Package Version
notes.description: You can retrieve package metadata for only second-generation managed package versions or unlocked packages. This example shows how to retrieve package metadata for a converted subscriber package version ID (starts with 04t) into my-directory in your Salesforce DX project directory: sf package version retrieve --package 04tXXX --output-dir my-directory --target-dev-hub devhub@example.com.

notes.feature_name: Customize the Timeout When Attempting to Log Into an Org
notes.description: If you try to authorize an org with the org login web CLI command, and it runs into an issue, the CLI command now times out after 2 minutes, rather than hanging indefinitely. Customize the number of milliseconds that the command waits to time out with the new SF_WEB_OAUTH_SERVER_TIMEOUT environment variable. The default value is 120000 (2 minutes). This example sets the timeout to 3 minutes: export SF_WEB_OAUTH_SERVER_TIMEOUT=180000.

notes.feature_name: Customize the Apex Test Polling Interval
notes.description: Specify the number of seconds to poll the org to check for the test status when you run apex test run with the new --poll-interval flag. Previously the poll interval was hard-coded to 1 second. This example shows how to set the poll interval to 5 seconds: sf apex run test --class-names MyClassTest --result-format human --poll-interval 5 --target-org my-org.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Vibes IDE
notes.description: Agentforce Vibes IDE is a web-based integrated development environment that has all the power and flexibility of Visual Studio Code, Salesforce Extensions for VS Code, and Salesforce CLI in your web browser.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Vibes Extension
notes.description: Agentforce Vibes Extension is an AI-powered developer tool that’s available as a Visual Studio Code extension in VS Code desktop and Agentforce Vibes IDE. Agentforce Vibes Extension is built with the SFR model, a secure and custom AI model from Salesforce.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Pages with Lightning Experience Insights
notes.description: Analyze performance trends and improve slow pages, components, and actions using Lightning Experience Insights. This feature, now generally available, includes some changes since the beta release. Now, you can generate these insights for production orgs with low page views and for all sandbox orgs. The Key Insights section includes new settings to improve org performance. Finally, the new format and documentation of the High Impact, Slow Performing Pages table make critical insights more accessible.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Code with ApexGuru
notes.description: ApexGuru is now available in Salesforce Code Analyzer for VS Code and Code Builder, offering inline visibility into performance hotspots while writing Apex. Scan Apex classes directly in the IDE, receiving inline recommendations with context and severity.

notes.feature_name: Plan and Peak Load Test with Scale Test
notes.description: Use the Test Reports tab on the Test Execution page to see how your test performed. View important takeaways about Requests per Second (RPS), throttles, and governor limits. On the New Booking page, enter inputs for trial runs, including date, time, and the anticipated size of the final test.

notes.feature_name: Deploy Scalable Apps with Scale Center
notes.description: Generate on-demand insights. Use the Lightning Experience Insights (Beta) page to get insights about Experienced Page Time (EPT) and slow pages. Use Database Insights to improve SOQL performance. The Org Overview page gives you weekly insights about errors during peak hours.
notes.edition: All major editions in Production and Full sandbox environments

notes.feature_name: Optimize Pages with Lightning Experience Insights
notes.description: Analyze performance trends and improve slow pages, components, and actions using Lightning Experience Insights. This feature, now generally available, includes some changes since the beta release. Now, you can generate these insights for production orgs with low page views and for all sandbox orgs. The Key Insights section includes new settings to improve org performance. Finally, the new format and documentation of the High Impact, Slow Performing Pages table make critical insights easier to understand.
notes.edition: Full sandbox and production environments with Scale Center enabled
affected_components: High Impact, Slow Performing Pages table

notes.feature_name: ApexGuru
notes.description: ApexGuru is now available in Salesforce Code Analyzer for VS Code and Code Builder, offering inline visibility into performance hotspots while writing Apex. Scan Apex classes directly in the IDE, receiving inline recommendations with context and severity.
notes.edition: All major editions in Production and Full sandbox environments. All Signature, Scale Test, and Partner Large Data Volume (LDV) orgs have access.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Functions Retirement
notes.description: Salesforce Functions is no longer available for purchase or renewal. You can continue using your subscription through your existing order term. To preserve the capabilities that Salesforce Functions provided to your org, deploy an alternative solution before your existing order term ends.

notes.feature_name: Change Data Capture Events No Longer Support Custom Formula Fields
notes.description: You can no longer include custom formula fields in change data capture events. After this update, change data capture works as it did before Winter ‘26.
notes.breaking_changes: Custom formula fields are no longer supported in change data capture events.

notes.feature_name: The Timeout of Outbound Messages Is Reduced to 20 Seconds from 60 Seconds
notes.description: With the lower timeout value, the system makes better use of resources and can process more messages. Also, the lower timeout value prevents long-running messages from delaying the processing of other messages in the queue.

notes.feature_name: Identify Outbound Messages in Queue with a Renamed Heading
notes.description: We renamed the 'Oldest failures in queue' heading to 'Oldest messages in queue' on the Outbound Messages page in Setup. The renamed heading helps you identify the queued messages. The queue contains messages that didn’t fail but haven’t been delivered yet, in addition to messages that failed delivery.

notes.feature_name: Identify Outbound Messages in Queue with a Renamed Heading
notes.description: We renamed the 'Oldest failures in queue' heading to 'Oldest messages in queue' on the Outbound Messages page in Setup. The renamed heading helps you identify the queued messages. The queue contains messages that didn’t fail but haven’t been delivered yet, in addition to messages that failed delivery.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: lightning-empty-state
notes.description: Adds meaningful visuals and content to your components that show empty states. For more information, see Display Consistent Empty State Illustrations With Theme Support (Beta).

notes.feature_name: lightning-illustration
notes.description: Displays empty state illustrations without descriptive text or buttons. For more information, see Display Consistent Empty State Illustrations With Theme Support (Beta).

notes.feature_name: lightning-combobox
notes.description: This component now correctly participates in validation and form submissions, so the browser can set focus on the component when it contains an invalid value and the form is validated on submission.

notes.feature_name: lightning-datatable
notes.description: The height of the table container has been reduced by 3rem to display the horizontal scrollbar when the status bar is present, such as when data is changed in a cell during inline editing. New accessibility behaviors include: When you specify displayReadOnlyIcon: true and editable:false, the lock icon now displays inside a <span> element that contains aria-label="Locked Column Name" and role="image", where Column Name refers to the label that you define for the column. The <span> element that contains assistive text for the lock icon has been removed.

notes.feature_name: lightning-flexcard
notes.description: This attribute is new: lwr —Determines whether the component is compatible with Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) sites. Set this parameter to true if you want to embed your Flexcard on an LWR site.

notes.feature_name: lightning-input
notes.description: The calendar on the input fields of type date and datetime have these accessibility changes: The <select> element for month and year selections now specify the aria-describedby attribute. The <div> element that specifies role="status" contains an empty <div> element. When a field-level error occurs, the element renders assistive text for screen readers. The tabindex attribute has been moved from the <td> elements on the calendar to the day buttons, which are inner <span> elements that specify role="button".

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Changes for aria Attributes
notes.description: The aria-selected, aria-current, and aria-disabled attributes have been moved to the inner <span> element that specifies role="button". The aria-label attribute has been added to the <span> element that specifies role="button", which indicates day month year, button. For example: 8 October 2025, button, depending on the screen reader. Required fields of type checkbox, date, datetime, time, and file have these accessibility changes. The <abbr> element specifies aria-hidden="true".

notes.feature_name: Geolocation API Timeout Handling
notes.description: If the Geolocation API times out after 10 seconds, the address lookup field defaults to San Francisco, CA with a latitude of 37.790091 and longitude of -122.396848 instead of your current position. A timeout can occur due to factors such as browser security settings, network conditions, and device capabilities.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Changes for Date Input Fields
notes.description: The calendar on the input field of type date and datetime has the same accessibility changes as those for lightning-input.

notes.feature_name: Default Font Size for Rich Text Input
notes.description: The default font size is now 13, which you can also select from the font menu.

notes.feature_name: Omniscript Compatibility with LWR
notes.description: This attribute is new. lwr —Determines whether the component is compatible with Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) sites. Set this parameter to true if you want to embed your Omniscript on an LWR site.

notes.feature_name: Field-Level Error Assistive Text for Radio Group
notes.description: A <div> element that specifies role="status" has been added to contain an empty <div> element on load. When a field-level error occurs, the element renders a <span> element with the field label as assistive text for screen readers.

notes.feature_name: Field-Level Error Assistive Text for Select
notes.description: The <div> element that specifies role="status" now contains an empty <div> element on load. When a field-level error occurs, the element renders a <span> element with the field label as assistive text for screen readers.

notes.feature_name: Chevron Icon Update for Tree Component
notes.description: The chevron icon next to the tree item now uses the bare variant and displays in blue.

notes.feature_name: lightning/industriesConfigureApi
notes.description: Uses the Configuration API of Revenue Management to manage the configuration, pricing, and lifecycle of carts and cart items, retrieve product, category, and bulk product details, and manage saved configurations and rules.

notes.feature_name: executeMutation
notes.description: Create, edit, or delete record data from your JavaScript code. Use executeMutation imperatively with these parameters: query —Parsed GraphQL query. Parse the query using the gql JavaScript template literal function. gql parses the GraphQL query into a format that executeMutation can use. gql isn’t reactive; variables —An object that provides GraphQL variables for the query.

notes.feature_name: lwc:on={eventHandlers}
notes.description: Adds event listeners to an element dynamically. You can also use this directive if you want to add event listeners whose event types are computed dynamically, for example, when passed from the owner component via @api.

notes.feature_name: lightning:combobox
notes.description: This component now correctly participates in validation and form submissions, so the browser can set focus on the component when it contains an invalid value and the form is validated on submission.

notes.feature_name: lightning:datatable
notes.description: The height of the table container has been reduced by 3rem to display the horizontal scrollbar when the status bar is present, such as when data is changed in a cell during inline editing. New accessibility behaviors include: When you specify displayReadOnlyIcon: true and editable:false, the lock icon now displays inside a <span> element that contains aria-label='Locked Column Name' and role='image', where Column Name refers to the label that you define for the column. The <span> element that contains assistive text for the lock icon has been removed.

notes.feature_name: lightning:input
notes.description: The calendar on the input fields of type date and datetime have these accessibility changes: The <select> element for month and year selections now specify the aria-describedby attribute. The <div> element that specifies role='status' contains an empty <div> element. When a field-level error occurs, the element renders assistive text for screen readers. The tabindex attribute has been moved from the <td> elements on the calendar to the day buttons, which are inner <span> elements that specify role='button'. The aria-selected, aria-current, and aria-disabled attributes have been moved to the inner <span> element that specifies role='button'. The aria-label attribute has been added to the <span> element that specifies role='button', which indicates day month year, button. For example: 8 October 2025, button, depending on the screen reader.

notes.feature_name: lightning:inputAddress
notes.description: If the Geolocation API times out after 10 seconds, the address lookup field defaults to San Francisco, CA with a latitude of 37.790091 and longitude of -122.396848 instead of your current position. A timeout can occur due to factors such as browser security settings, network conditions, and device capabilities.

notes.feature_name: lightning:inputField
notes.description: The calendar on the input field of type date and datetime has the same accessibility changes as those for lightning:input.

notes.feature_name: lightning:radioGroup
notes.description: A <div> element that specifies role="status" has been added to contain an empty <div> element on load. When a field-level error occurs, the element renders a <span> element with the field label as assistive text for screen readers.

notes.feature_name: lightning:tree
notes.description: The chevron icon next to the tree item now uses the bare variant and displays in blue.

notes.feature_name: lightning:treeGrid
notes.description: After you press the Right Arrow key on a row to expand the row, the subsequent Right Arrow key press now focuses on the checkbox column, if the column isn't hidden.

notes.feature_name: lightning:omniChannelStatusChanged
notes.description: This event attribute is new. reason —The reason for the Omni-Channel user’s status change. Possible values are OmniToolkitStatusChange, OmniPushTimeout, OmniDeclineWork, OmniManualStatusChange, OmniSupervisorStatusChange, and OmniLoginStatusChange.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi Namespace Changes
notes.description: The ConnectApi namespace (Connect in Apex) has new or changed classes, methods, or enums. Many Connect REST API resource actions are exposed as static methods on Apex classes in the ConnectApi namespace. These methods use other ConnectApi classes to input and return information.

notes.feature_name: CommercePayments Namespace Changes
notes.description: The CommercePayments namespace has new or changed classes, methods, interfaces, enums, or exceptions.

notes.feature_name: New RetryCategory Enum
notes.description: Specify the payment failure category used to determine retry eligibility using the new RetryCategory enum.

notes.feature_name: New RetryDecision Enum
notes.description: Determines whether the payment operation can be retried based on the retry category using the new RetryDecision enum.

notes.feature_name: Paginate large SOQL query result sets
notes.description: Use the fetchPage(), fetchDeleted(), and getNumRecords() methods in the PaginationCursor class. Use the getNextIndex(), getNumDeletedRecords(), getRecords(), and isDone() methods in the CursorFetchResult class.

notes.feature_name: Create an Apex pagination cursor to paginate large SOQL query result sets
notes.description: Use the Database.getPaginationCursor() and Database.getPaginationCursorWithBinds() methods.

notes.feature_name: Get the number of Apex cursors that are created and their upper bounds
notes.description: Use the Limits.getApexCursors() and Limits.getLimitApexCursors() methods.

notes.feature_name: Get the number of Apex pagination cursors that are created and their upper bounds
notes.description: Use the Limits.getApexPaginationCursors() and Limits.getLimitApexPaginationCursors() methods.

notes.feature_name: Get the number of rows returned by an Apex pagination cursor and their upper bounds
notes.description: Use the Limits.getApexPaginationCursorRows() and Limits.getLimitApexPaginationCursorRows() methods.

notes.feature_name: Specify the number of oldest, completed async jobs in your org to purge
notes.description: Use the new method overload for System.purgeOldAsyncJobs().

notes.feature_name: Use improved PDF rendering
notes.description: The Blob.toPdf() method now uses the same PDF rendering service used by Visualforce.

notes.feature_name: Use Apex Cursors for Expanded SOQL Query Result Support
notes.description: This feature allows developers to use Apex cursors to handle larger SOQL query results more efficiently.

notes.feature_name: Specify the Number of Async Jobs to Delete
notes.description: Developers can now specify the number of asynchronous jobs to delete, providing more control over job management.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi (Connect in Apex): New and Changed Classes and Enums
notes.description: New classes and enums have been added to the ConnectApi namespace, enhancing the capabilities for creating custom experiences in Salesforce.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi Rate Limit Changes
notes.description: To avoid potentially restrictive per user, per namespace, per hour ConnectApi rate limits, orgs are being migrated to a per org, per 24-hour Salesforce Platform API rate limit. Orgs created in Summer ’24 and later are already using this new rate limit. For migrated and new orgs, only method calls that require Chatter are subject to the per user, per namespace, per hour rate limit.
notes.timeline: Migrations occur on a rolling basis without notification.

notes.feature_name: Get a wrapped list of sequenced amounts for order payment summaries
notes.description: Use the getSequenceOrderPaymentSummaryInputList(List<SequenceOrderSummaryPaymentInputRepresentation> sequences) method.

notes.feature_name: Get a sequenced list of amounts to apply to an order payment summary
notes.description: Use the getSequenceOrderPaymentSummaryInputRepresentation(orderPaymentSummaryId, amount) method.

notes.feature_name: Remove an external auth identity provider
notes.description: Use the deleteExternalAuthIdentityProvider(developerName) method.

notes.feature_name: Remove an external credential
notes.description: Use the deleteExternalCredential(developerName) method.

notes.feature_name: Remove a named credential
notes.description: Use the deleteNamedCredential(developerName) method.

notes.feature_name: Update an external auth identity provider
notes.description: Use the updateExternalAuthIdentityProvider(developerName, requestBody) method.

notes.feature_name: Update an external credential
notes.description: Use the updateExternalCredential(developerName, requestBody) method.

notes.feature_name: Update a named credential
notes.description: Use the updateNamedCredential(developerName, requestBody) method.

notes.feature_name: New method in the Orchestration class
notes.description: This new method is in the ConnectApi.Orchestration class.

notes.feature_name: Get orchestration instances associated with another orchestration
notes.description: Use the getOrchestrationInstanceCollection(relatedRecordId, relatedOrchestrationId) method.

notes.feature_name: Get the values for all the picklist fields of a specific record type
notes.description: Use the getPicklistValuesByRecordType(objectApiName, recordTypeId) method. New output class: ConnectApi.PicklistValuesCollection. This method is useful for getting dependent picklist values. For example, if an object has a tree of dependent picklists, such as Continents__c, Countries__c, Cities__c, use this method to get all the values for each picklist in one request.

notes.feature_name: Get digital asset management (DAM) providers for a managed content space
notes.description: Use the getManagedContentProvidersForSpace(contentSpaceId) method.

notes.feature_name: Update a digital asset management (DAM) provider instance
notes.description: Use the updateManagedContentProviderInstance(providerInstanceId, providerInstanceInput) method.

notes.feature_name: Get the status and available actions for flow approval processes
notes.description: Use the getFlowApprovalProcessWithStatus(relatedRecordId, processNames) method. New output class: ConnectApi.FlowApprovalProcessCollection.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.EnsureFundsAsyncInputRepresentation
notes.description: This input class has these new properties: isAllowPartial — Specifies if the invoice can be funded through multiple, partial payments; SequenceOrderPaymentSummaryInputList — Order payment summary preferred sequence list.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.ManagedContentDocument
notes.description: This output class has these new and changed properties: contentVersion — Content version of the managed content; variantVersion — Variant version of the managed content; version — This property is no longer returned. For version information, use contentVersion and variantVersion.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.ManagedContentProviderCollection
notes.description: This output class has this new property: contentSpaceId — ID of the managed content space, if provided.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.ManagedContentProviderInstance
notes.description: This output class has this new property: isEnabledForSpace — Specifies whether the provider instance is enabled for the managed content space.

notes.feature_name: ConnectApi.EmailMessageCapability
notes.description: This output class has this new property: emailSize — Size of a case’s email message HTML body.

notes.feature_name: API Version 66.0
notes.description: Access more data objects and metadata types in API version 66.0.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Standard Platform Events
notes.description: Receive real-time notifications from Salesforce by subscribing to the channels of these new and changed standard platform events.

notes.feature_name: Connect REST API
notes.description: Integrate mobile apps, intranet sites, and third-party web applications with Salesforce using Connect REST API.

notes.feature_name: CRM Analytics REST API
notes.description: Set conditions and options in connector properties, configure table repeat grouping row values and persist action menus on dashboard widgets.

notes.feature_name: Invocable Actions
notes.description: Invocable Actions represent the actions that can be accomplished on Salesforce with APIs.

notes.feature_name: Metadata API
notes.description: Access more metadata through these new and changed metadata types.

notes.feature_name: REST API
notes.description: These calls are new, changed, or deprecated in Platform REST API version 66.0.

notes.feature_name: Tooling API
notes.description: Filter Test Discovery API results by using the new category query parameter. Access more metadata through new and changed Tooling API objects.

notes.feature_name: User Interface API
notes.description: Build Salesforce UI for native mobile apps and custom web apps.

notes.feature_name: Use Employee2 as a junction object between Contact and User
notes.description: Use the new User field on the Employee2 object to reference a Unified Employee user record.

notes.feature_name: New Fields on the Brief Object
notes.description: Use additional fields on the Brief object to provide context that Agentforce can use when helping you create campaigns. Specify your calls-to-action and key performance indicators, and provide guardrails to protect your brand’s reputation.

notes.feature_name: StagedUnmtchedEmailAddr Object
notes.description: See the email addresses included in at least one email or event but who aren’t saved as a contact or lead. Use the new StagedUnmtchedEmailAddr object. The new StagedUnmtchedEmailAddrRela object relates an unmatched email address to the activity (email message or event) where it appeared.

notes.feature_name: EventInviteeEmailRelation Object
notes.description: See the email addresses invited to at least one event but who aren’t saved as a contact or lead. Use the new EventInviteeEmailRelation object. The new EventInviteeEmailRelation object relates an unmatched email address to the email message where it appeared so that the contact information and the event are associated as an activity.

notes.feature_name: BotDefinitionId Field
notes.description: Get the bot record with a template name that matches the value in the Sales Management agent template. Use the new BotDefinitionId field on the existing AiGenActionItem object.

notes.feature_name: BotVersionId Field
notes.description: Get the bot version from the bot record with an ID that matches the ID of the Sales Management agent bot record. Use the new BotVersionId field on the existing AiGenActionItem object.

notes.feature_name: LogsEnabledFlowVersion Field
notes.description: Get the version number of the flow that enabled persistent logging. Use the new LogsEnabledFlowVersion field on the existing FlowRecord object.

notes.feature_name: ViolationImpact Field
notes.description: Distinguish between enforced and reported content security policy (CSP) violations. Use the new ViolationImpact field on the existing BrowserPolicyViolation object.

notes.feature_name: RedirectWhitelistUrl Permission Change
notes.description: BEHAVIOR CHANGE: The Customize Application permission is required to access RedirectWhitelistUrl. Previously, the Customize Application permission was required only for edit access to the RedirectWhitelistUrl object. Now that permission is required for read access, too.

notes.feature_name: Passwordless Passkey Login Tracking
notes.description: Track usage of passkeys for passwordless login (Beta). Use the new supported value PasswordlessPasskeyLogin in the existing LoginType field on the LoginHistory object. Use the new supported value PwlessPasskey in the existing VerificationMethod field on the VerificationHistory object.

notes.feature_name: PasswordlessPasskeyLogin
notes.description: Use the new supported value PasswordlessPasskeyLogin in the existing Policy field on the IdentityVerificationEvent object. Note Passwordless login via passkeys is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Removed OptionsAppIssueJwtTokenEnabled
notes.description: The OptionsAppIssueJwtTokenEnabled field on the ConnectedApplication object is removed. Removed in API version 64.0, this field has been removed from the Object Reference for the Salesforce Platform.

notes.feature_name: Removed IsInboundReceiptsEnabled, IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled, IsTypingIndicatorDisabled
notes.description: The IsInboundReceiptsEnabled, IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled, and IsTypingIndicatorDisabled fields on the ConversationChannelDefinition object are removed. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknwOptionExposed field instead of IsInboundReceiptsEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsRoutingWorkResultSupported field instead of IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorOptionHidden field instead of IsTypingIndicatorDisabled.

notes.feature_name: Removed HasInboundReceipts and HasTypingIndicator
notes.description: The HasInboundReceipts and HasTypingIndicator fields on the CustomMsgChannel object are removed. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknowledgementEnabled field instead of HasInboundReceipts. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorDisabled field instead of HasTypingIndicator.

notes.feature_name: OmniCallbackHandler and OmniCallbackFallbackQueueId
notes.description: Store callback routing information for a contact center channel with Omni-Channel Unified Routing. Use the new OmniCallbackHandler and OmniCallbackFallbackQueueId fields in the existing ContactCenterChannel object.

notes.feature_name: AvailableCallbackAttempts and DelayBetweenCallbackAttempts
notes.description: Configure callback details on a contact request for Omni-Channel Unified Routing. Use the new AvailableCallbackAttempts and DelayBetweenCallbackAttempts fields in the existing ContactRequest object.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Standard Platform Events
notes.description: Receive real-time notifications from Salesforce by subscribing to the channels of these new and changed standard platform events.

notes.feature_name: WebCartAbandonedEvent
notes.description: Subscribe to WebCartAbandonedEvent to receive notifications related to abandoned carts.

notes.feature_name: Connect REST API Rate Limit Changes
notes.description: To avoid potentially restrictive per user, per application, per hour Connect REST API rate limits, we’re migrating orgs to the per org, per 24-hour Salesforce Platform API rate limit. Orgs created in Summer ’24 and later are already using the Salesforce Platform API rate limit. For migrated and new orgs, only requests that require Chatter are subject to the per user, per application, per hour rate limit.
notes.timeline: Org migrations to the Salesforce Platform API rate limit continue on a rolling basis. Migrations occur in the background without notification.

notes.feature_name: Get the Commerce subscription action history
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /commerce/webstores/webstoreId/subscriptions/subscriptionId/action-history resource.

notes.feature_name: Exclude dynamic attributes information for the product from the response
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /commerce/webstores/webstoreId/products/productId resource. New request parameter: excludeDynamicAttributeInfo.

notes.feature_name: Get the pending configuration for a custom domain
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /connect/custom-domain/domains/domainId/pending-configuration resource. New response body: Custom Domain Pending Configuration Detail.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of data clean room collaborations
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Collaboration Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Create a data clean room collaboration
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Collaboration Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Collaboration Output.

notes.feature_name: Accept a data clean room collaboration invitation
notes.description: Make a PUT request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations/collaborationIdOrApiName/actions/accept-invitations resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Accept Invitation Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Member Output.

notes.feature_name: Reject a data clean room collaboration invitation
notes.description: Make a PUT request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations/collaborationIdOrApiName/actions/reject-invitations resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Reject Invitation Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Member Output.

notes.feature_name: Run a data clean room query
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations/collaborationIdOrApiName/actions/run resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Query Job Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Query Job Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of data clean room query jobs
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/collaborations/collaborationIdOrApiName/jobs resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Query Job Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of data clean room providers
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/providers resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Provider Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Create a data clean room provider
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/providers resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Provider Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Provider Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a data clean room provider
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/providers/providerIdOrName resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Provider Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of all templates associated with a data clean room provider
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/providers/providerIdOrName/templates resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Template Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of data clean room specifications
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/specifications resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Specification Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Create a data clean room specification
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/specifications resource. New request body: Data Clean Room Data Specification Input. New response body: Data Clean Room Data Specification Output.

notes.feature_name: Get a list of data clean room templates
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /ssot/data-clean-rooms/templates resource. New response body: Data Clean Room Template Collection Output.

notes.feature_name: Get supported notification type details and actions (beta)
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /connect/notifications/types resource. New response body: Notification Type Collection.

notes.feature_name: Execute an action for a notification (beta)
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /connect/notifications/notificationId/actionKey resource.

notes.feature_name: Get orchestration instances associated with another orchestration
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /connect/interaction/orchestration/instances resource.

notes.feature_name: Get the specified version of a piece of managed content
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /connect/cms/contents/contentKeyOrId resource with a new optional request parameter: contentVersion.

notes.feature_name: Get digital asset management (DAM) providers for a managed content space
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /connect/cms/digital-asset-management-providers resource with a new request parameter: contentSpaceId.

notes.feature_name: Update a digital asset management (DAM) provider instance
notes.description: Made a PATCH request to the existing /connect/cms/digital-asset-management-providers/providerInstanceId resource.

notes.feature_name: Get the status and available actions for flow approval processes
notes.description: Make a GET request to the new /connect/interaction/flow-approval-process/status resource with a new response body: Flow Approval Process Collection.

notes.feature_name: Create, list, get, and delete engagement signals
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /personalization/engagement-signals resource to create an engagement signal.

notes.feature_name: Engagement Signals API
notes.description: New resource to list engagement signals. Make a GET request to the new /personalization/engagement-signals/idOrName resource to get a single engagement signal. Make a DELETE request to the new /personalization/engagement-signals/idOrName resource to delete an engagement signal. New request body: Engagement Signal Input. New response bodies: Engagement Signal, Engagement Signal Collection.

notes.feature_name: Engagement Signal Metrics API
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /personalization/engagement-signals/idOrName/metrics resource to create an engagement signal metric. Make a DELETE request to the new /personalization/engagement-signals/idOrName/metrics/idOrName resource to delete an engagement signal metric. New request body: Engagement Signal Metric Input. New response body: Engagement Signal Metric.

notes.feature_name: Engagement Signal Compound Metrics API
notes.description: Make a POST request to the new /personalization/compound-metrics resource to create a compound metric. Make a GET request to the new /personalization/compound-metrics/compoundMetricIdOrName resource to get a compound metric. Make a DELETE request to the new /personalization/compound-metrics/compoundMetricIdOrName resource to delete a compound metric. New request body: Engagement Signal Compound Metric Input. New response body: Engagement Signal Compound Metric.

notes.feature_name: Ensure Funds Async Input
notes.description: This request body has these new properties: isAllowPartial —Specifies if the invoice can be funded through multiple, partial payments; SequencePaymentInputRepresentation —Payment sequence input for capturing and applying funds to the invoice; sequences —Specifies the payment sequence in which the funds are captured for the invoice.

notes.feature_name: Product Details
notes.description: This response body has this new property: dynamicAttributeCount —Count of dynamic attributes associated with a product.

notes.feature_name: Managed Content Document
notes.description: This response body has these new and changed properties: contentVersion —Content version of the managed content; variantVersion —Variant version of the managed content; version —This property is no longer returned. For version information, use contentVersion and variantVersion.

notes.feature_name: Managed Content Provider Collection
notes.description: This response body has this new property: contentSpaceId —ID of the managed content space, if provided.

notes.feature_name: Managed Content Provider Instance
notes.description: This response body has this new property: isEnabledForSpace —Specifies whether the provider instance is enabled for the managed content space.

notes.feature_name: Email Message Capability
notes.description: This response body has this new property: emailSize —Size of a case’s email message HTML body.

notes.feature_name: Use the new property conditions and options in data connections
notes.description: Make a GET request to the /wave/dataConnectors resource. Response body includes the new Property Condition and Property Option representations.

notes.feature_name: Use the new update data cloud node in recipes
notes.description: Make a GET request to the /wave/recipes/${id} resource. Response body includes the new Update Data Cloud Node and Update Data Cloud Parameters representations.

notes.feature_name: Number Widget Input Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Output Data Cloud Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: eventTimeField —The event time field.

notes.feature_name: Pill Box Widget Input Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Repeater Widget Input Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Selector Widget Input Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Table Widget Parameters Input
notes.description: The request body has these new properties: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false); repeatGroupingRowValues —The repeat row values in a table.

notes.feature_name: Text Widget Input Parameters
notes.description: The request body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Changed CRM Analytics REST API Response Bodies
notes.description: These response bodies have changes. The response body has these new properties: conditions —The conditions for the property; options —The options for the property.

notes.feature_name: Number Widget Parameters
notes.description: The response body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Output Data Cloud Parameters
notes.description: The response body has this new property: eventTimeField —The event time field.

notes.feature_name: Pill Box Widget Parameters
notes.description: The response body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Repeater Widget Parameters
notes.description: The response body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Selector Widget Parameters
notes.description: The response body has this new property: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Table Widget Parameters
notes.description: The response body has these new properties: persistActionMenu —Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false), repeatGroupingRowValues —The repeat row values in a table.

notes.feature_name: persistActionMenu
notes.description: Indicates whether to persist the widget actions menu (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: canUpdateDataCloudObject
notes.description: Indicates whether update Data Cloud object is enabled for the org (true) or not (false).

notes.feature_name: Control payment capture sequence
notes.description: Use the new isAllowPartial field and SequenceOrderPaymentSummaryInputList representation with the existing InvocableEnsureFundsOrderSummaryAsync action.

notes.feature_name: Remove individuals from a flow
notes.description: Use the new exitIndividualsFromFlow action to remove individuals from a single segment-triggered, automation event-triggered, or on-demand flow.

notes.feature_name: Identify the asset related to an external service registration
notes.description: Use the registrationProviderAsset field on the existing ExternalServiceRegistration metadata type. Available in API version 66.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Turn on Advancement Generative AI features for Education Cloud
notes.description: Use the enableAdvancementGenAI field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type. Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Advising Agent
notes.description: Turn on the Advising Agent feature for Education Cloud. Use the enableAdvisingAgent field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Advanced Academic Operations
notes.description: Turn on Advanced Academic Operations features for Education Cloud. Use the enableEduAdvncdAcadOper field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Student Recruitment Agent
notes.description: Turn on the Student Recruitment Agent feature for Education Cloud. Use the enableStudentRecruitmentAgent field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Mobile App Push Notifications Actions
notes.description: Allow users to complete actions from Salesforce mobile app push notifications (beta). Use the actionGroups field on the existing CustomNotificationType metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.
notes.security_notes: actionGroups is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Gift Entry Grid
notes.description: Turn on the Gift Entry Grid feature for Nonprofit Cloud. Use the enableGiftEntryGrid field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Philanthropic Research Agent
notes.description: Turn on the Philanthropic Research Agent feature for Nonprofit Cloud. Use the enablePhilResearchAgent field on the existing IndustriesSettings metadata type.
notes.availability: Available in API version 64.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Flow Screen Customization
notes.description: Customize your flow screens and screen components with style settings. Use the new styleSettings field, which is on the existing FlowScreen subtype of the Flow metadata type and on the FlowScreenFieldStyleProperties subtype of the FlowScreenField subtype.

notes.feature_name: Flow Test Version Assignment
notes.description: Assign flow versions to a flow test. Use the new flowTestFlowVersions field on the existing FlowTest metadata type.

notes.feature_name: Segment-Triggered Flow Enhancements
notes.description: Configure a segment-triggered flow to run with more granularity using new fields on the FlowSchedule subtype of the FlowStart subtype: dayOfMonthToRun, daysOfWeekToRun, and frequencyNumber. New values for the frequency field include Monthly, Yearly, Hourly, and Weekdays. Specify whether a segment-triggered flow sends messages to all contact points or a single contact point using new fields on the FlowStart subtype: activationTemplate, prioritizedContactPointsList, and sendMsgToOneContactPtPerIndv.

notes.feature_name: Invocable Action in Broadcast Flow
notes.description: Specify an invocable action in the Start element of a broadcast flow using the new fanOutAction field on the existing FlowStart subtype of the Flow metadata type.

notes.feature_name: Reference Metadata Types in Invocable Actions
notes.description: Reference metadata types as input parameters on invocable actions using the new SetupReferenceObjectNameForAutomaticSetup, SetupReferenceObjectLabelForAutomaticSetup, and SetupReferenceFilterConditionForAutomaticSetup values, which are in the existing keys field on the InvocableActionExtensionTargetAttribute subtype of the InvocableActionExtension metadata type.

notes.feature_name: Behavior Change for RedirectWhitelistUrl
notes.description: The Customize Application permission is now required to access the RedirectWhitelistUrl metadata type for both read and edit access. Previously, that permission was only required for edit access.

notes.feature_name: Canvas Settings for External Client App
notes.description: Configure the canvas settings for an external client app using the new ExtlClntAppCanvasSettings metadata type. Available in API version 66.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Enable Canvas App Plugin
notes.description: Enable the canvas app plugin for an external client app using the new isCanvasPluginEnabled field on the existing ExtlClntAppConfigurablePolicies metadata type.

notes.feature_name: Removed Fields from ConversationChannelDefinition
notes.description: The isInboundReceiptsEnabled, isRoutingWorkResultEnabled, and isTypingIndicatorDisabled fields are removed from the ConversationChannelDefinition type. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknwOptionExposed field instead of IsInboundReceiptsEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsRoutingWorkResultSupported field instead of IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorOptionHidden field instead of IsTypingIndicatorDisabled.
notes.breaking_changes: The specified fields have been removed and should be replaced with the new fields.

notes.feature_name: Omni-Channel Unified Routing Callback Fields
notes.description: Store callback routing information for a contact center channel with Omni-Channel Unified Routing. Use the new omniCallbackHandler and omniCallbackFallbackQueue fields on the ContactCenterChannel subtype of the existing CallCenter type.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Query Limit Usage for Scheduled Flows
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /services/data/vXX.X/limits resource to obtain the new ScheduledFlowRunLimit and ScheduledPathRunLimit values.

notes.feature_name: Tooling API Category Query Parameter
notes.description: Filter Test Discovery API results by using the new category query parameter. Access more metadata through new and changed Tooling API objects.

notes.feature_name: Filter Test Discovery API results by test category
notes.description: Make a GET request to the existing /services/data/v66.0/tooling/tests resource. The new query parameter is category. Existing categories are apex and flow.

notes.feature_name: Identify the asset related to an external service registration
notes.description: Use the registrationProviderAsset field on the existing ExternalServiceRegistration type. Available in API version 66.0 and later.

notes.feature_name: Represents an individual action definition within a custom notification type
notes.description: Use the new CustomNotifActionDef (Beta) object. This object is available in API versions 66.0 and later. Note: Actionable notifications is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Represents a collection of related actions associated with a custom notification type
notes.description: Use the new CustomNotificationActionGroup (Beta) object. This object is available in API versions 66.0 and later. Note: Actionable notifications is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Removed features
notes.description: REMOVED: The IsInboundReceiptsEnabled, IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled.

notes.feature_name: IsTypingIndicatorDisabled fields removal
notes.description: IsTypingIndicatorDisabled fields on the ConversationChannelDefinition object are removed. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknwOptionExposed field instead of IsInboundReceiptsEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsRoutingWorkResultSupported field instead of IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorOptionHidden field instead of IsTypingIndicatorDisabled.
notes.breaking_changes: The fields are removed and replaced with new fields.

notes.feature_name: CustomMsgChannel fields removal
notes.description: The HasInboundReceipts and HasTypingIndicator fields on the CustomMsgChannel object are removed. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsInboundAcknowledgementEnabled field instead of HasInboundReceipts. Use the EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorDisabled field instead of HasTypingIndicator.
notes.breaking_changes: The fields are removed and replaced with new fields.

notes.feature_name: User Interface API enhancements
notes.description: Build Salesforce UI for native mobile apps and custom web apps. New and Changed User Interface API Resources. These resources are new or have changes. Changed User Interface API Response Bodies. These response bodies have changes. All new standard objects are auto-enabled for use with User Interface API.

notes.feature_name: New Connect in Apex Classes
notes.description: Get the values for all the picklist fields of a specific record type. The GET request to the existing /ui-api/object-info/{objectApiName}/picklist-values/{recordTypeId} resource is now available in Connect in Apex in the ConnectApi.RecordUi class.

notes.feature_name: Changed User Interface API Response Bodies
notes.description: These response bodies have changes. This response body has these new properties: defaultValue — Default value for the field; defaultedOnCreate — Indicates whether the field is defaulted when created.

notes.feature_name: GraphQL API Mutations
notes.description: GraphQL mutations, which is now generally available, includes some changes since the beta release. The RecordUpdatePayload type includes a Record field that defines the fields that you want the response to return. For example, use this mutation query to update a contact record and specify the ID and name fields that you want the response to return.

notes.feature_name: ContactUpdate Mutation
notes.description: The ContactUpdate mutation allows for updating contact records in Salesforce. It accepts an input object containing the contact's first name and last name, along with the contact's ID. The mutation returns the updated record, including the ID and the new values for first name and last name.
notes.breaking_changes: Previously, the RecordUpdatePayload included a success field that returned true or false.

notes.feature_name: executeMutation Method
notes.description: The new executeMutation method is available via the GraphQL wire adapter, allowing developers to perform mutations more effectively.

notes.feature_name: Update Last Viewed Date on Records
notes.description: Query objects with the new updateMRU argument set to true, which also updates the LastViewedDate field on the records that are returned. This feature allows you to query accounts with their IDs and names while also updating the LastViewedDate fields on the account records.

notes.feature_name: Generative Engine Optimization
notes.description: Make your Aura and LWR site pages more discoverable to AI-powered search engines and improve the precision of AI-generated answers with generative engine optimization.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Redirect Rules
notes.description: Send your Aura site visitors to another URL with easily implemented dynamic redirect rules.

notes.feature_name: Session Timeout Return
notes.description: Improve your LWR site visitors’ experience by returning them after a session timeout to the page they were viewing before their session ended.

notes.feature_name: Expanded HTML Allowlists
notes.description: Create rich HTML content in your Aura and LWR sites with the expanded allowlists for tags and attributes in the HTML Editor components.

notes.feature_name: New Components for Personalization
notes.description: Use new components in your Aura and LWR sites to personalize visitors’ home pages and let visitors submit records for approval.

notes.feature_name: Custom Property Editors and Types
notes.description: Make component configuration more intuitive for Aura and LWR site builders with custom property editors and types, now generally available.
notes.breaking_changes: The performance-related setting for connect APIs, previously beta in enhanced LWR sites, was removed.

notes.feature_name: Scan files for viruses or malware
notes.description: With the new Scan files for viruses or malware (beta) setting, users are blocked from uploading or downloading malicious files. The file size limit has increased from 2 GB to 10 GB. And to keep your files list organized and tidy, you can now enable more users to delete files that they don’t own. Several of these features are ones that you requested on IdeaExchange.

notes.feature_name: Generative Engine Optimization (GEO)
notes.description: To make public site pages more discoverable by AI-powered search engines and enhance the precision of generated answers, enable generative engine optimization (GEO) in Experience Builder. When you enable GEO, AI bots can request content snapshots of your site’s pages to generate answers more effectively.
