notes.feature_name: Dynamic Redirect Rules in Aura Sites
notes.description: Redirect users from your Aura site to another URL without any coding. Configure dynamic redirect rules that use a pattern to identify a URL from your site and redirect it. Previously, dynamic redirect rules were available only for LWR sites.

notes.feature_name: Return Users to Their Previous Page After Session Timeout
notes.description: In all LWR sites, authenticated users are now returned to the page they were viewing before their session ended. Previously, the session timeout notification redirected users to the login page, and upon logging back in, they were returned to the Home page.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Redirect Rules in Aura Sites
notes.description: Redirect users from your Aura site to another URL without any coding. Configure dynamic redirect rules that use a pattern to identify a URL from your site and redirect it. Previously, dynamic redirect rules were available only for LWR sites.

notes.feature_name: Return Users to Their Previous Page After Session Timeout
notes.description: In all LWR sites, authenticated users are now returned to the page they were viewing before their session ended. Previously, the session timeout notification redirected users to the login page, and upon logging back in, they were returned to the Home page.

notes.feature_name: Expanded Allowlists for HTML Editor Components
notes.description: Create rich HTML content in your Aura and LWR sites with the expanded allowlists for tags and attributes in the HTML Editor components. A wider array of components is available to LWR site builders in orgs without an active Community license, offering more expansive design possibilities.

notes.feature_name: More Standard Component Options for LWR Sites
notes.description: Sixteen standard components are now available for use on all Lightning Web Runtime sites, even in orgs without an active Community license. Now you have a wider array of options to build and refine your LWR site pages. For example, add a banner, navigation menu, button, or video.

notes.feature_name: Personalized Task and Activity Components
notes.description: Help Experience Cloud site users stay oriented and complete key actions with two personalized home page components: the Pending Task banner and the Activity Timeline. These components surface relevant tasks and recent activity to guide users when they return to your site.

notes.feature_name: Request Approval Component
notes.description: Your credentialed site visitors can now submit records for approval directly from your site. Add the Request Approval component to an object detail page. Then configure the component to require submitters to select an approver and add comments about their request. The Request Approval component works only with Flow Approval Processes, not with Classic Approval Processes.

notes.feature_name: Standard Component Options for LWR Sites
notes.description: Sixteen standard components are now available for use on all Lightning Web Runtime sites, even in orgs without an active Community license. Now you have a wider array of options to build and refine your LWR site pages. For example, add a banner, navigation menu, button, or video.

notes.feature_name: Create Richer HTML Content with More Supported Tags and Attributes
notes.description: The HTML Editor component for Aura and Lightning Web Runtime sites supports an expanded list of HTML tags and attributes. Organize visual content with the figure and figcaption tags and sidebars or other tangential content with the aside tag. Use the audio tag to embed audio files for rich media experiences. Boost SEO with the footer, header, main, and section tags. Make your content readily accessible to screen readers with aria-* attributes.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Guide and Inform Experience Cloud Users with Personalized Task and Activity Components
notes.description: Help Experience Cloud site users stay oriented and complete key actions with two personalized home page components: the Pending Task banner and the Activity Timeline. These components surface relevant tasks and recent activity to guide users when they return to your site.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Professional, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Submit Records for Approval by Using the Request Approval Component
notes.description: Your credentialed site visitors can now submit records for approval directly from your site.

notes.feature_name: Request Approval Component
notes.description: The Request Approval component can be added to an object detail page. It requires submitters to select an approver and add comments about their request. This component works only with Flow Approval Processes, not with Classic Approval Processes.

notes.feature_name: Custom Property Types and Editors for Lightning Web Components
notes.description: Make your custom Lightning web components highly configurable in Experience Builder by adding custom property editors and property types. This feature is now generally available and includes some changes since the beta release.
notes.breaking_changes: For previous beta participants who created custom property types using the ExperiencePropertyTypeBundle, it is recommended to replace that bundle with the new LightningTypeBundle and redeploy the components.

notes.feature_name: Connect API Performance Beta Setting Was Removed
notes.description: The Improve performance of Connect APIs in your LWR site (Beta) setting in the Preferences section of the site’s Administration workspace was removed. This beta feature was originally available in enhanced LWR sites that made Connect REST API calls from Lightning web components.

notes.feature_name: Connect API Performance Beta Setting Was Removed
notes.description: The Improve performance of Connect APIs in your LWR site (Beta) setting in the Preferences section of the site’s Administration workspace was removed. This beta feature was originally available in enhanced LWR sites that made Connect REST API calls from Lightning web components.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Site Performance
notes.description: Reduce the risk of downtime for custom domains that are served by a third party. For Visualforce sites, leave an empty value in the Site Favorite icon field and show your site visitors a cleaner browser tab. In 2026, Salesforce begins to migrate enhanced and custom domains that use the Salesforce Content Delivery Network to the Cloudflare CDN.

notes.feature_name: Visualforce Sites Display Only the Specified Favicon
notes.description: Visualforce sites now support an empty value in the Site Favorite Icon field. The small icon appears in browser tabs, bookmarks, and search results for your site. Previously, when no icon was specified, users could see the Salesforce logo.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Migrates Enhanced and Custom Domains Serving Digital Experiences to Cloudflare CDN
notes.description: Beginning in 2026, Salesforce is migrating all enhanced and custom domains serving Digital Experiences that use the Salesforce Content Delivery Network (CDN) from Akamai to Cloudflare. Starting with the Spring ’26 release, all enhanced and custom domains that use the Salesforce CDN service are created using the Cloudflare CDN as the default service provider. You can manually migrate custom domains to the Cloudflare CDN ahead of the Salesforce-initiated migration.

notes.feature_name: Finish Updating Your Legacy Force.com Site URLs
notes.description: To ensure continued access to your sites, update references to your old site URLs that end in force.com. Redirections from those site URLs stop working in this release. Look for references to those URLs in Salesforce, such as in knowledge articles, and outside Salesforce, such as integrations and links in your marketing materials.
notes.breaking_changes: Redirections from old site URLs stop working.

notes.feature_name: Custom Domain Target Host Name Update
notes.description: The domain’s target host name must be updated to your org’s My Domain login URL to ensure continued functionality when your Salesforce instance changes. This applies to custom domains configured to use a third-party service or CDN. If the target host name is not updated, the custom domain may stop working during an org migration.

notes.feature_name: Visualforce Sites Favicon Support
notes.description: Visualforce sites now support an empty value in the Site Favorite Icon field, allowing for no icon to be displayed. Previously, if no icon was specified, the Salesforce logo would appear in browser tabs, bookmarks, and search results.

notes.feature_name: Migration of Enhanced and Custom Domains to Cloudflare CDN
notes.description: Beginning in 2026, Salesforce is migrating all enhanced and custom domains serving Digital Experiences that use the Salesforce Content Delivery Network (CDN) from Akamai to Cloudflare. Starting with the Spring ’26 release, all enhanced and custom domains that use the Salesforce CDN service are created using the Cloudflare CDN as the default service provider. You can manually migrate custom domains to the Cloudflare CDN ahead of the Salesforce-initiated migration.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.timeline: Migration occurs from January through June 2026

notes.feature_name: Finish Updating Your Legacy Force.com Site URLs
notes.description: To ensure continued access to your sites, update references to your old site URLs that end in force.com. Redirections from those site URLs stop working in this release. Look for references to those URLs in Salesforce, such as in knowledge articles, and outside Salesforce, such as integrations and links in your marketing materials.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.breaking_changes: Redirections from old site URLs ending in force.com will stop working.

notes.feature_name: Scan files for viruses or malware (beta)
notes.description: With the new Scan files for viruses or malware (beta) setting, users are blocked from uploading or downloading malicious files. The file size limit has increased from 2 GB to 10 GB. And to keep your files list organized and tidy, you can now enable more users to delete files that they don’t own. Several of these features are ones that you requested on IdeaExchange.
notes.security_notes: Users are blocked from uploading or downloading malicious files.

notes.feature_name: Protect Your Salesforce Org and Users by Scanning Files for Malware
notes.description: For improved security in your Salesforce org, files are now scanned for malware in Salesforce Files. When a user tries to upload a file, the process is blocked if the scanned file is malicious. If a malicious file is uploaded via the API, it’s scanned asynchronously, and it appears in the new Malicious Files (Beta) list. When a user attempts to download an existing file, the download is blocked if it’s malicious. This feature was developed based on your idea on IdeaExchange.
notes.availability: Available on a rolling basis starting in Spring ’26
notes.edition: Essentials, Group, Enterprise, Professional, Performance, Unlimited, Contact Manager, Developer editions
notes.timeline: Available on a rolling basis starting in Spring ’26
notes.security_notes: Scan files for viruses or malware is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Manage Files up to 10 GB in Salesforce Files
notes.description: Salesforce Files has increased the file size limit from 2 GB to 10 GB. The increased limit is available to Files home, libraries, and on a record’s Files related list, but not to files uploaded to Chatter or LWR sites in Experience Cloud.

notes.feature_name: Allow More Users to Delete Files
notes.description: Manage files in Salesforce more efficiently by assigning the new Delete Salesforce Files permission to your users. With this permission, a user can delete any file that they have access to view. Previously, only a Salesforce admin or the file owner could delete a file. This feature was developed based on your idea on IdeaExchange.

notes.feature_name: Launch a Flow When a User Changes a File
notes.description: To launch a flow when a user creates, updates, or deletes a file, set up the flow so that it triggers on the Content Document or Content Version objects. Use this new feature to create flows that work with documents in Salesforce Files or Salesforce CRM content. This feature was developed based on your idea on IdeaExchange.

notes.feature_name: Download Malicious Files (Beta)
notes.description: To download files, users need the Download Malicious Files (Beta) user permission. The setting Scan files for viruses or malware (beta) is turned on by default. If a new file isn’t scanned during the initial upload, it’s scanned asynchronously and added to the Malicious Files List (Beta) if it contains malware.
notes.security_notes: Malware scanning in Salesforce Files flags only files that have a high probability of being malicious. If you require more stringent scanning, consider using one of Salesforce's malware scanning partners.

notes.feature_name: Manage Files up to 10 GB in Salesforce Files
notes.description: Salesforce Files has increased the file size limit from 2 GB to 10 GB. The increased limit is available to Files home, libraries, and on a record’s Files related list, but not to files uploaded to Chatter or LWR sites in Experience Cloud.
notes.edition: Essentials, Group, Enterprise, Professional, Performance, Unlimited, Contact Manager, Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Allow More Users to Delete Files
notes.description: Manage files in Salesforce more efficiently by assigning the new Delete Salesforce Files permission to your users. With this permission, a user can delete any file that they have access to view. Previously, only a Salesforce admin or the file owner could delete a file. This feature was developed based on your idea on IdeaExchange.
notes.activation_required: Enable Delete Salesforce Files for a profile or permission set.
notes.edition: Essentials, Group, Enterprise, Professional, Performance, Unlimited, Contact Manager, Developer

notes.feature_name: Streamline Pre-Work Brief with Rich Text
notes.description: Boost mobile worker productivity by transforming Pre-Work Brief from plain text into a rich resource. You can now use Markdown formatting to create content that is easier to read and structure, significantly improving clarity for complex instructions. Additionally, this update supports embedded hyperlinks, allowing mobile workers to access external resources, like collaboration channels and visual aids, without leaving their workflow.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced User Experience for Pre-Work Brief
notes.description: Mobile workers can now benefit from a more human-like voice when using Pre-Work Brief, making content easier to consume and enhancing overall accessibility. The updated voice technology replaces robotic tones with more natural speech patterns, improving clarity and making hands-free data entry more effective.

notes.feature_name: Pre-Work Brief Configuration
notes.description: Configure briefs in Prompt Builder or Flow Builder by utilizing Markdown syntax to organize content with structural elements like paragraphs, bold or italicized text, and lists. The update also supports the insertion of clickable URLs that open directly in the device’s default browser or specific applications, ensuring mobile workers have immediate access to the data they need.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced User Experience for Pre-Work Brief
notes.description: Mobile workers can now benefit from a more human-like voice when using Pre-Work Brief, making content easier to consume and enhancing overall accessibility. The updated voice technology replaces robotic tones with more natural speech patterns, improving clarity and making hands-free data entry more effective.

notes.feature_name: Field Service Go
notes.description: Discover and implement Field Service features with Salesforce Go. Streamline the deployment of Agentforce Field Service, formerly Field Service, so that your teams realize maximum business value faster with more Salesforce Go capabilities. These capabilities include bulk tools for adding dispatchers and technicians, and new functionality for setting up Data Cloud, customer assets, and service agreements. Data capture auto-association rules automatically link new service appointments, work orders, and work order line items to a specified flow. And, teams now have new options to tailor dashboards and the mobile experience to meet their specific operational needs.

notes.feature_name: Work Capacity Limit Enforcement
notes.description: Fixed an issue where a work capacity limit of 0% was not being enforced.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: CSI Invocable Action Parameter Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where the CSI (Conversation Service Integration) invocable action required accountId as a mandatory input parameter, causing errors when Work Orders didn't have an associated Account.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: SOQL Query Optimization
notes.description: Optimized SOQL queries in the InDay composite API to reduce query count and stay within limits during concurrent operations.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: Travel Calculation Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where travel calculations incorrectly used shift intervals from the secondary Service Territory Membership when the primary territory had no availability.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: Missing Travel Times Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where travel times were missing when service appointments were dragged and dropped onto holiday shifts in the flow.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: High CPU Usage Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where sorting on the name in the work order related list caused high CPU usage.
notes.edition: Pro Suite, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer, Agentforce 1 Sales Edition

notes.feature_name: SFS Studio Setup Enabled Permission
notes.description: Fixed an issue where the SFS Studio Setup Enabled permission was incorrectly set to true by default in new Unlimited, Enterprise, and Professional Edition orgs. This permission will no longer be enabled automatically upon org creation.

notes.feature_name: Activity Timeline Component Support
notes.description: Fixed an issue where the Activity Timeline component was not supported on the Work Order object in Lightning communities. The Work Order object now displays the Activity Timeline, allowing users to see New Task and New Event actions as expected.

notes.feature_name: Service Appointment Scheduling Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where scheduling failed because a service appointment slot was taken by another service appointment.

notes.feature_name: Null Pointer Exception in RSO Jobs
notes.description: Fixed an issue where a Null Pointer Exception occurred in the RSOPreProcessor class when running Resource Scheduling Optimization (RSO) jobs with a custom boolean field instead of explicit service appointment IDs.

notes.feature_name: Performance Degradation Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where repeated calls to addTerritoryAttributesToResource caused performance degradation due to inefficient runtime complexity.

notes.feature_name: Resource Absence Gantt Chart Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where a resource absence disappeared from the Gantt chart when the resource’s service territory had a large number of service territory members.

notes.feature_name: Custom List View Offline Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where custom list view record details weren't available when the device was offline.

notes.feature_name: Draft Images Recovery Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where draft images were lost in low connectivity conditions and couldn't be recovered.

notes.feature_name: Picklist Values Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where picklist showed incorrect values for different record types when creating resource absence records.

notes.feature_name: Image Upload Retry Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where image uploads in Lightning Web Components couldn't be retried after failure.

notes.feature_name: Cached Metadata Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where clearing cached metadata cleared pending uploads.

notes.feature_name: Pre-work Brief Refresh Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where Pre-work Brief information couldn't be manually refreshed using pull-to-refresh on the Work Order Overview tab.

notes.feature_name: Feed Tracking Metrics Enhancement
notes.description: Fixed an issue where feed tracking metrics needed enhancement for better analytics alignment.

notes.feature_name: Work Plans Order Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where work plans kept changing order in the sequence, disrupting workflow.

notes.feature_name: Dependent Picklists Population Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where dependent picklists didn't populate with options on initial load when creating new records with default parent field values.

notes.feature_name: Voice to Form Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where voice to form didn't work after closing and opening a form.

notes.feature_name: Default Values Display Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where default values weren't displaying new records.

notes.feature_name: Service Report Header Localization Issue Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where service report headers weren’t loading in localized text when opened through Flow with the Work Order Overview screen.

notes.feature_name: Inventory Tab Performance Degradation Fix
notes.description: Fixed an issue where the inventory tab performance degraded after adding product consume.

notes.feature_name: Android App Fixes
notes.description: Fixed an issue where the app crashed when navigating via deep links to the schedule. Fixed an issue where the profile badge showing pending upload count was missing during file uploads. Improved feed tracking metrics for better analytics alignment. Fixed an issue where technicians couldn't add products required when partial quantity was available in van inventory. Fixed an issue where Agentforce API errors caused the app to crash. Fixed an issue where long text fields in Service Report Templates were truncated in preview. Fixed an issue where NPS Survey wasn't triggering from the legacy work screen. Improved internal logging when stuck on the splash screen.

notes.feature_name: iOS and Android App Fixes
notes.description: Fixed bugs related to Performance Priming. Fixed a bug where Data Capture forms didn’t load offline. Fixed a bug where Data Capture quick actions didn’t load offline. Fixed a bug where lookup fields cleared the local value upon searching for a value that doesn’t exist.

notes.feature_name: iOS App Fixes
notes.description: Fixed a bug where creating product request line items caused a crash while offline. Fixed a bug where when searching for products, the product ID was displayed and not the product title. Fixed a bug where images weren’t uploaded when using a Data Capture flow based on a template. Fixed an issue when creating a new quote on a work order caused an error.

notes.feature_name: Android App Fixes
notes.description: Fixed a bug where the Send button in the Voice to Form bottom bar was hidden for long text. Fixed a bug where the barcode scanner icon was missing from the scan in and scan out quick actions. Fixed a bug where an empty overview was displayed when navigating from work order overview to the work order via the View Detail quick action. Fixed a bug where deep links to create a service report using work order ID weren’t working. Fixed a bug where users couldn't view newly uploaded images in offline mode. Resolved an issue where handling a malformed deep link for login caused the app to crash.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization
notes.description: Benefit from advanced features and better schedule quality with Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization. Experience Faster Dispatching with Enhanced Live Updates.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Live Updates
notes.description: Get near real-time updates when working with the dispatcher console Gantt by enabling the new Enhanced Live Updates setting. This setting’s enhanced capabilities significantly reduce the Gantt’s refresh times, dropping from 15–20 seconds to under 3 seconds. It lets you handle large datasets efficiently, experience a stable environment, and effectively manage time-sensitive and critical tasks. With this new setting, Experience Cloud site users can also benefit from live Gantt updates. Previously, live updates weren’t available to Experience Cloud site users.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Scaling
notes.description: Set up and manage large-scale global and in-day optimization effectively without splitting data due to system limits. Dynamic scaling intelligently structures data into geographical clusters, seamlessly balancing demand and capacity while accounting for all operational work rule constraints. This capability simplifies optimization management by enabling higher system limits, so you don’t need to manually define optimization groups and boundaries. It also prevents conflicts and overlaps that often occur with fragmented, parallel optimization runs. You can now easily select all service territories when you configure a scheduled optimization job without having to select each territory individually. Previously, you had to define boundaries between areas that needed to be optimized together, making workforce planning difficult. Lower system limits meant you had to reduce the number of service appointments or service resources processed in a single request, and configure multiple optimization jobs. This fragmentation was tedious and affected overall business performance.

notes.feature_name: Updated Service Objective Scoring Formulas
notes.description: Achieve improved scheduling outcomes that match your business priorities with refined grading formulas that better reflect your configured service objective weights. The Same Site objective now has a much larger impact on the scheduling outcome. The impact of the Skill Preference and Skill Level objectives has doubled. And, the Resource Priority objective now relies on a fixed scale of 1 to 10 instead of the priority values sent in each optimization request, so that the schedule outcome is more predictable. Previously, some underlying calculations reduced the intended impact of an objective's assigned weight.

notes.feature_name: Optimization Request Files
notes.description: Use Optimization Request Files to retrieve the request and response files of an optimization request. Review the files in a JSON format to find out what happened to a specific request and quickly resolve related issues. Previously, you had to open a Support case and wait to get the files, which delayed the troubleshooting process.

notes.feature_name: Rule Violation Analytics
notes.description: Understand the root causes of rule violations in manual scheduling, such as geographical imbalances or skill gaps, and make data-driven decisions by analyzing trends and patterns. Rule Violation Analytics, built on the Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization Data Model, captures all rules that are manually violated on the Gantt. Easily query this data via a semantic data model and draw insights by creating a comprehensive dashboard in Tableau Next. Visualize rule violations, track metrics like the frequency of specific rule violations, and identify dispatchers or territories with recurring issues.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Scaling for Large Datasets
notes.description: Set up and manage large-scale global and in-day optimization effectively without splitting data due to system limits. Dynamic scaling intelligently structures data into geographical clusters, seamlessly balancing demand and capacity while accounting for all operational work rule constraints. This capability simplifies optimization management by enabling higher system limits, so you don’t need to manually define optimization groups and boundaries. It also prevents conflicts and overlaps that often occur with fragmented, parallel optimization runs. You can now easily select all service territories when you configure a scheduled optimization job without having to select each territory individually. Previously, you had to define boundaries between areas that needed to be optimized together, making workforce planning difficult. Lower system limits meant you had to reduce the number of service appointments or service resources processed in a single request, and configure multiple optimization jobs. This fragmentation was tedious and affected overall business performance.

notes.feature_name: Updated Service Objective Scoring Formulas
notes.description: Achieve improved scheduling outcomes that match your business priorities with refined grading formulas that better reflect your configured service objective weights. The Same Site objective now has a much larger impact on the scheduling outcome. The impact of the Skill Preference and Skill Level objectives has doubled. And, the Resource Priority objective now relies on a fixed scale of 1 to 10 instead of the priority values sent in each optimization request, so that the schedule outcome is more predictable. Previously, some underlying calculations reduced the intended impact of an objective's assigned weight.

notes.feature_name: Access Optimization Request Files on Your Own
notes.description: Use Optimization Request Files to retrieve the request and response files of an optimization request. Review the files in a JSON format to find out what happened to a specific request and quickly resolve related issues. Previously, you had to open a Support case and wait to get the files, which delayed the troubleshooting process.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Field Service managed package installed

notes.feature_name: Get More Transparency into Service Operation Inefficiencies with Rule Violation Analytics
notes.description: Understand the root causes of rule violations in manual scheduling, such as geographical imbalances or skill gaps, and make data-driven decisions by analyzing trends and patterns. Rule Violation Analytics, built on the Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization Data Model, captures all rules that are manually violated on the Gantt. Easily query this data via a semantic data model and draw insights by creating a comprehensive dashboard in Tableau Next. Visualize rule violations, track metrics like the frequency of violations.

notes.feature_name: Rule Violation Analytics
notes.description: This feature allows users to analyze specific rule violations and identify dispatchers or territories with recurring issues. It aims to proactively address inefficiencies for better resource allocation, workforce planning, and dispatcher training.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Field Service managed package installed
affected_components: Data Cloud Home Org for Field Service
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Live Updates
notes.description: Get near real-time updates when working with the dispatcher console Gantt by enabling the new Enhanced Live Updates setting. This setting’s enhanced capabilities significantly reduce the Gantt’s refresh times, dropping from 15–20 seconds to under 3 seconds. It allows for efficient handling of large datasets, a stable environment, and effective management of time-sensitive and critical tasks. Experience Cloud site users can also benefit from live Gantt updates, which were previously unavailable to them.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Field Service managed package installed

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization Insights
notes.description: Bring best-in-class data visualization directly into your field service workflow with Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization Insights. Monitor performance trends through intuitive dashboards that quantify the impact of your optimization, by turning complex data into clear, actionable benefits. By staying ahead of the curve, you can anticipate resource needs and make confident, data-driven decisions to scale automation before service delivery is ever impacted.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, Developer editions with the Field Service managed package installed
notes.security_notes: Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization Insights is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: My Service Journey
notes.description: Maximize your business impact with My Service Journey, designed to align Agentforce Field Service with your strategic goals. Explore Salesforce strategies and best practices for key areas like scheduling, optimization, and mobile workforce management. Get guidance tailored to your specific Salesforce edition, feature complexity, and Einstein AI capabilities to take advantage of the most recent releases. With this resource, you can bridge the gap between technical setup and business value, taking your implementation from capable to exceptional.
notes.activation_required: Launch from the App Launcher; add to console app’s navigation menu for quicker access.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Enterprise and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Enable Private Mobile App Sharing in Visual Remote Assistant (VRA) Sessions
notes.description: Customers can now share an application window from their mobile device during VRA sessions, keeping the rest of their device screen private. Call center reps see only the relevant content. Privacy provides them with a secure and focused way to troubleshoot or review app-specific issues without seeing unrelated information.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Field Service managed package and Visual Remote Assistant installed

notes.feature_name: Preview and Manage Images in the Visual Remote Assistant (VRA) Self-Service Request
notes.description: Guest users on Salesforce Experience Cloud sites can now upload images more efficiently by previewing the images before sending them. They can remove any unwanted images and add images within VRA upload limits and guest security constraints. Previously, guest users couldn’t review their image selections before uploading, requiring them to cancel the upload and start over to make changes.

notes.feature_name: Validate Visual Remote Assistant (VRA) Permissions and User Access Easily from the Configuration Panel
notes.description: Check that permission sets and users have the required VRA access permissions from the new Access Validation tab. Easily identify missing permissions and resolve installation, setup, or upgrade issues quickly and efficiently. Previously, you couldn’t verify whether a permission set or user had VRA access permissions, often leading to manual checks, setup errors, and a longer troubleshooting cycle.

notes.feature_name: Preview and Manage Images in the Visual Remote Assistant (VRA) Self-Service Request
notes.description: Guest users on Salesforce Experience Cloud sites can now upload images more efficiently by previewing the images before sending them. They can remove any unwanted images and add images within VRA upload limits and guest security constraints. Previously, guest users couldn’t review their image selections before uploading, requiring them to cancel the upload and start over to make changes.

notes.feature_name: Validate Visual Remote Assistant (VRA) Permissions and User Access Easily from the Configuration Panel
notes.description: Check that permission sets and users have the required VRA access permissions from the new Access Validation tab. Easily identify missing permissions and resolve installation, setup, or upgrade issues quickly and efficiently. Previously, you couldn’t verify whether a permission set or user had VRA access permissions, often leading to manual checks, setup errors, and a longer troubleshooting cycle.

notes.feature_name: Geospatial Information System (GIS)
notes.description: Help mobile workers access geospatial information focused on their work location with the new Geospatial Information System (GIS). With it, they can view, interact with, and update complex map data—including assets, lines, and polygons—even when offline. Configure authentication and GIS map assignments with GIS’ extensive customization capabilities to deliver an intuitive user experience. Simplify deployment and enhance data integrity with a robust connector that seamlessly pushes Salesforce data to ArcGIS feature layers.

notes.feature_name: Configurable Feed
notes.description: Accelerate work load times and eliminate unnecessary background data usage for improved performance by disabling Feed and Feed Priming, if mobile workers don’t need access to Chatter while they're offline. You can now reduce complexity by removing the Feed entirely from the mobile app interface. Previously, the Feed tab on the mobile app was visible by default and you couldn’t hide it.

notes.feature_name: Deprecation of Android 11 Support
notes.description: As of this release, support for the mobile app on Android 11 and earlier devices is deprecated.

notes.feature_name: Control Bulk Status Change Icon Visibility
notes.description: Avoid mishaps by disabling the Bulk Status Change Icon for Bundled Service Appointments in the Field Service mobile app. Previously, the icon was visible by default. Mobile workers could easily change the status of all bundled appointments with a single tap, potentially causing issues for customers with specific validation rules.

notes.feature_name: Revamped Work Order Overview Page
notes.description: Enhance performance with the fast-loading work order overview screen. Each tab and card on the overview page now loads independently, so you can access critical information faster. The modernized user interface has a sleeker look and feel and optimized screen space, so you now see more content at a glance. Previously, you had to wait for all the tabs to load before seeing the entire user interface.

notes.feature_name: Loading Stages Information
notes.description: Keep mobile workers informed with real-time progress updates on the app's loading status, eliminating guesswork about background processes. Previously, the home screen displayed a static Field Service logo with no visibility into the loading progress.

notes.feature_name: Updated Technical Guidance for Mobile App Performance
notes.description: Get more reliable, long-term performance and lower your team’s total cost of ownership by following the updated technical requirements for the Field Service mobile app.

notes.feature_name: Data Capture Lookup Component
notes.description: Help mobile workers find the exact records they need—like assets or products—by searching and selecting records directly in the Data Capture form, even when offline. With the new Lookup component, they can search by name or by any object field. Previously, mobile workers had to manually enter text fields, which was tedious, slow, and error-prone.

notes.feature_name: Multiple Image Preview in Data Capture Forms
notes.description: Give your mobile workers complete visual context for improved performance by displaying multiple related images directly within the Data Capture form, even when offline.

notes.feature_name: Preview Component for Images
notes.description: Preview component can link to a record and access all images associated with it. Mobile workers can review images from previous jobs, and add images to the record after the form is created. They can preview thumbnails, zoom in on details, and swipe through a full-screen carousel of site photos. Previously, mobile workers could only view a single image that had to be uploaded when the form was created.

notes.feature_name: Data Capture Access from Action Launcher
notes.description: Minimize navigation time with access to Data Capture forms from the action launcher within asset and custom object records. Mobile workers can complete tasks faster by launching relevant forms directly from the specific asset or custom object that they’re viewing. Previously, mobile workers could only launch forms as quick actions from work orders, work order line items, and service appointments.

notes.feature_name: Improved Form Loading Times
notes.description: Improve mobile worker efficiency with faster loading times for complex Data Capture forms. Mobile workers can now access and load these forms within seconds, even those with multiple-choice fields, such as picklists, radio buttons, and checkbox groups.

notes.feature_name: Data Capture Forms in Mobile Timesheets
notes.description: Customize the mobile experience to fit your business needs and centralize data collection by adding Data Capture forms directly to mobile timesheets and service resource records. Expand the Field Service mobile app’s capabilities by configuring screen flows to collect specific data, like meal expenses, mileage logs, or alternate contact details, without the need for custom Lightning web components.

notes.feature_name: Data Capture Voice to Form
notes.description: Simplify tasks that require form entry/Improve speed and accuracy of data entry by integrating the powers of Speech-to-Text (STT) and Large Language Models (LLMs) with Data Capture Voice to Form. Mobile workers can now focus on their tasks instead of manually filling out forms, with a context-aware interface that captures information from natural voice dictation. Data Capture Voice to Form automatically transcribes and populates form fields by translating spoken work summaries into field-level responses. Drive even more accurate recommendations from your LLM by entering a component description in the new LLM Context field.

With the new Lookup component, they can search by name or by any object field. Previously, mobile workers had to manually enter text fields, which was tedious, slow, and error-prone.

Mobile workers can review images from previous jobs, and add images to the record after the form is created. They can preview thumbnails, zoom in on details, and swipe through a full-screen carousel of site photos. Previously, mobile workers could only view a single image that had to be uploaded when the form was created.

Previously, mobile workers could only launch forms as quick actions from work orders, work order line items, and service appointments.
