These DMOs reduce setup complexity and eliminate the need for tedious, error-prone manual mapping to Data 360.

notes.feature_name: Shift Capacity and Coverage Agent
notes.description: Easily identify shifts that need sign-ups and find the right volunteers to fill them by using the Find Unfilled Shifts and Match Volunteers to Shifts custom actions with the Shift Capacity and Coverage Agentforce topic. The Find Unfilled Shifts action searches for shifts by open capacity, time range, and optionally by Volunteer Initiative or Job Position. The Match Volunteers to Shifts action matches volunteers to the shifts by time, location, and qualification requirements.

notes.feature_name: Data Model Objects for Volunteer Management in Data 360
notes.description: Combine the power of Data 360, formerly Data Cloud, with your Volunteer Management CRM data. Data model objects (DMOs) are now available in Data 360 for the entire Volunteer Management data model.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 Integration
notes.description: To complete a Data 360 integration, admins need the Data Cloud Architect and the Manage Volunteer Data permission sets, or the Education Full Access permission set. Turn on Agentforce Nonprofit, formerly Nonprofit Cloud (NPC), and Data 360, formerly Data Cloud. In Setup, follow the steps for Volunteer Management Intelligence.

notes.feature_name: Manage Volunteer Shifts with the Shift Capacity and Coverage Agent
notes.description: Easily identify shifts that need sign-ups and find the right volunteers to fill them by using the Find Unfilled Shifts and Match Volunteers to Shifts custom actions with the Shift Capacity and Coverage Agentforce topic. The Find Unfilled Shifts action searches for shifts by open capacity, time range, and optionally by Volunteer Initiative or Job Position. The Match Volunteers to Shifts action matches volunteers to the shifts by time, location, and qualification requirements.

notes.feature_name: Action Launcher
notes.description: Extend action recommendations by using contextual information from service records to determine user intent.

notes.feature_name: Action Plans and Events and Milestones
notes.description: Customize the quick actions on an action plan template record page. Include document checklist items in actions plans for financial accounts. Learn about the life events in a client’s household at a glance.

notes.feature_name: Actionable Relationship Center
notes.description: View many-to-one relationship type records on an Actionable Relationship Center (ARC) graph.

notes.feature_name: Batch Management
notes.description: Use related object fields to control eligibility criteria and to group records for processing. Make the most of the new enhancements to fast-track batch job runs. All Spring '26 Batch Management changes are available for a limited set of process types, excluding the Flow process type.

notes.feature_name: Business Rules Engine
notes.description: Experience improved scalability in decision tables with increased limits for invocations, output results, columns, and row processing. Expression sets enhancements include support for the IF function, automatic element naming, proactive alerts for constraint violations, and improved Salesforce Flow integration. Deploy rules to context definitions with improved stability. Monitor decision table actions in a centralized dashboard with real-time status and error details. Simplify the discovery and setup Business Rules Engine features with Salesforce Go. Clarify decisions with automated explanations for nested expression sets. Control how your expression set handles null values and no matches in decision tables based on your business requirements.

notes.feature_name: Collections and Recovery
notes.description: Streamline debt recovery with outbound dialer campaigns.

notes.feature_name: Compliant Data Sharing
notes.description: Compliant Data Sharing custom object record owners can now delete custom object participant records by using a new setting.

notes.feature_name: Criteria-Based Search and Filter
notes.description: Use Criteria-Based Search and Filter to design a search experience for your users. You can configure a search based on a single object that unifies complex sets of data, such as inventory and aggregated customer information that’s otherwise spread across multiple objects and fields. Criteria-Based Search and Filter can be customized to meet varied business requirements.

notes.feature_name: Context Service
notes.description: Manage large context definitions with more ease by using the enhanced context definition mapping user interface with inline search and improved sort and filter abilities. Map extended context definitions to custom data spaces that contain preprocessed, harmonized, and unified data from multiple sources. Context Service now supports Second-Generation Managed Packaging (2GP). You can now package and deploy deactivated context definitions.

notes.feature_name: Data Processing Engine
notes.description: Preview how your definitions transform data and instantly validate and debug definition design right for the builder. Create and run definitions in Data 360 companion orgs. Use a unified view to track the performance and key metrics of definitions. Get actionable recommendations for failed runs and download failed records to debug faster. Find and focus the Data Processing Engine canvas on nodes that you want to work on.

notes.feature_name: Discovery Framework
notes.description: Easily present forms in the user's preferred language by storing assessment questions and responses in multiple languages. Save time by creating assessment questions with Generative AI so that you can generate, edit, and refine questions by using natural language instructions.

notes.feature_name: Engagement
notes.description: Users access AI-driven insights on their home page with the Einstein Quick Insights component. The Salesforce Context Service provides more comprehensive, relevant insights by accessing a broader set of data. Additionally, users improve efficiency with Retained Output, which keeps the last run prompt.

notes.feature_name: Donor Support Agent
notes.description: Donors can handle common requests, like changing recurring gifts, by using the self-service Donor Support Agent (beta).

notes.feature_name: Gift Entry Grid Enhancements
notes.description: Customize the Gift Entry Grid with templates and custom Lightning Web Components for faster processing. You can now add up to 50 designations to a single gift and backdate transactions for gift commitments, all from within the Gift Entry Grid.

notes.feature_name: Application Form Object
notes.description: Adopt the Application Form object to future-proof your application process and ensure access to future platform enhancements. All form components are now mobile-friendly for a better user experience on any device. You can also require specific file attachments to prevent incomplete applications.

notes.feature_name: Industries CPQ Enhancements
notes.description: Industries CPQ delivers unified order management and streamlines complex fulfillment by integrating with the Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) for attribute-based decomposition. Boost cart performance for large bundles with level-based loading and enhanced caching. Gain control over the Industries CPQ Cart with custom record types, pricing precision, and customizable fields.

notes.feature_name: Sharing Rules for Tag Categories
notes.description: Use sharing rules to extend sharing access to users for Tag Categories.

notes.feature_name: Data Cloud Segment List Builder
notes.description: Make Data Cloud actionable lists available in Data 360 companion orgs to help teams easily manage all customer interactions, from initial engagement to follow-up.

notes.feature_name: Process Compliance Navigator
notes.description: Use Process Compliance Navigator to ensure your organization meets regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry standards. Compliance governance is strengthened with new validation criteria enforcing auditable transitions for controls, regulations, and policies, ensuring consistent evidence.

notes.feature_name: Participant Lifecycle Management Enhancements
notes.description: Manage the complete participant lifecycle with greater speed and accuracy. Potential participants can now browse programs as guest users on your Experience Cloud site to increase engagement. When participants apply, guide staff through a streamlined intake for one or many programs with real-time eligibility checks.

notes.feature_name: Rollup Definitions Configuration
notes.description: Configure multiple record rollup definitions within one LWC component for improved data management.

notes.feature_name: Unified Catalog Enhancements
notes.description: Expedite fulfillment times for high-volume requests like password resets by using dedicated tracking and tailored workflows. Transfer complex Service Process packages, including all rules and flows, reliably between different orgs without manual fixes. Capture the most current and relevant inputs by directly updating service record attributes within the service design process. Control Service Process availability by using complex qualification logic that designers can easily build and deploy. Optimize your Service Process creation with improved attribute organization, support for more data types, and clearer display of record information. Equip service reps and internal request fulfillers to validate product eligibility for customers and employees by using the Check Product Eligibility Agentforce action.

notes.feature_name: Action Launcher Recommendations
notes.description: Extend action recommendations by using contextual information from service records to determine user intent. Action Launcher automatically identifies the user’s intent from contextual data like the case subject and description in your catalog app. Action Launcher then shows your contact center agents the relevant next action. Admins gain flexibility and control by configuring and deploying their own prompt templates to tailor how Action Launcher determines the best action by using generative AI.

notes.feature_name: Customize Quick Actions on Action Plan Template Record Page
notes.description: Add or remove quick actions available in the highlights panel on an action plan template record page. Show or hide actions based on the user profile or the console app. Previously, the action plan template record page showed a standard list of quick actions that you couldn’t customize.

notes.feature_name: Add Document Checklist Items to Action Plans for Financial Accounts
notes.description: Show users a list of tasks to complete and documents to upload for a financial account. Previously, you could only list the tasks to complete.

notes.feature_name: Get a Unified View of a Household’s Life Events
notes.description: View the significant life events of household members on a timeline and proactively engage with clients. Understand the household’s collective financial journey and identify key planning opportunities. Anticipate the household’s needs after critical life events and offer relevant advice or services, and answer queries with greater context and empathy.

notes.description: Previously, the action plan template record page showed a standard list of quick actions that you couldn’t customize.

notes.feature_name: Actionable Relationship Center
notes.description: View many-to-one relationship type records on an Actionable Relationship Center (ARC) graph.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Professional, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Visualize More Relationships on an ARC Graph
notes.description: Show records related to each other via a many-to-one relationship type in ARC. The many-to-one relationship type uses a lookup relationship to link many records from an object to a single record from another object. In ARC, it shows a lookup field from the child node to the parent node. You can add one-to-many or many-to-many nodes to the child node. Previously, you could create an ARC graph by using only one-to-many or many-to-many relationship types.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Professional, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: ARC Relationship Graph Enhancements
notes.description: See connections and related records in a household on an ARC graph by using the Party Relationship Group object and many-to-one relationship type in ARC. In Setup, create an ARC relationship graph. On the Properties tab, select relationship type as Many-to-One.

notes.feature_name: Batch Management Enhancements
notes.description: Use related object fields to control eligibility criteria and to group records for processing. All Spring '26 Batch Management changes are available for a limited set of process types, excluding the Flow process type. Optimize batch job filters with conditions that use related object fields to ensure jobs process only records relevant to the business process. Group records by using fields such as parent record ID to make batch jobs more reliable and prevent row lock errors. Several enhancements ensure that batch jobs process records most efficiently and faster. Use the new Tooling API objects in Batch Management to view the data sources and filter criteria of batch jobs.

notes.feature_name: Improve Batch Job Reliability by Grouping Related Records
notes.description: Group records by using fields such as parent record ID to make batch jobs more reliable and prevent row lock errors. You can also group records by related object fields to make sure that the batch job processes records with common dependencies together. For example, you can group quotes by their related opportunity accounts to avoid conflicts during parallel processing.

notes.feature_name: Boost Batch Job Performance with the Latest Enhancements
notes.description: Several enhancements make sure that batch jobs process records most efficiently and faster.

notes.feature_name: New Tooling API Objects in Batch Management
notes.description: Use the new Tooling API objects in Batch Management to view the data sources and filter criteria of batch jobs.

notes.feature_name: Business Rules Engine
notes.description: Experience improved scalability in decision tables with increased limits for invocations, output results, columns, and row processing. Expression sets enhancements include support for the IF function, automatic element naming, proactive alerts for constraint violations, and improved Salesforce Flow integration. Deploy rules to context definitions with improved stability. Monitor decision table actions in a centralized dashboard with real-time status and error details.

notes.feature_name: Automated Explanations for Nested Expression Sets
notes.description: Clarify decisions with automated explanations for nested expression sets. This enhancement allows rule designers to offer more detailed, transparent explanations for every rule outcome, building trust and ensuring clarity in complex decision-making processes.

notes.feature_name: Improved Scalability in Business Rules Engine
notes.description: Experience minimized disruption, improved scalability and performance with improved limits on both standard and advanced decision tables. You can also invoke significantly more decision tables in your org per hour, allowing for more extensive and frequent processing.

notes.feature_name: Expression Set Enhancements
notes.description: Business Rules Engine now supports the IF function, allowing for direct logical evaluations and fewer steps. Each element in the Expression Set builder now receives a distinct, automatically generated name, making it effortless to identify, manage, and debug rules. Receive proactive alerts notifying you if you add an element that exceeds system constraints, helping you avoid rework and ensuring your designs are always savable. Execute context-based Expression Sets from Salesforce Flow with more ease by using an enhanced invocable action that handles context hydration.

notes.feature_name: Deployment Stability with Context Definitions
notes.description: Experience greater stability during migrations and upgrades in your Business Rules Engine with rule definitions.

notes.feature_name: Centralized Monitoring of Decision Table Actions
notes.description: Monitor all your decision table actions in a dashboard that shows real-time status and error details. Easily filter and sort tables to prioritize attention, ensuring critical business logic is always current and reliable.

notes.feature_name: Simplified Business Rules Engine Feature Discovery and Setup
notes.description: With Salesforce Go, you can discover and set up Business Rules Engine features, and track feature usage, all from a single location. Learn more about features and get help with configuration by accessing content resources and links. Explore more Business Rules Engine features from Salesforce Go.

notes.feature_name: Control Null Values and No Matches in Expression Sets
notes.description: Configure your expression sets to manage null values and decision table no-matches exactly as your business requires. This enhancement helps maintain the integrity of your calculations, reduces errors, and ensures that automated processes consistently deliver reliable results for better decision-making.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Objects in Business Rules Engine
notes.description: Do more with this new Business Rules Engine object.

notes.feature_name: Increased Limits for Decision Tables
notes.description: The limits for standard decision tables have changed: The number of decision tables invoked per hour has increased from 450,000 to 2 million. The limit of output results that a standard decision table can have has increased from 5 to 10. The maximum number of columns in a standard decision table has increased from 10 to 15 for each combination of Equals, Required, and All conditions are met (AND) columns. The limit of the number of groups that a standard decision table’s rows can be split into has increased from 100 to 200. The limit of input columns that a standard decision table can have has increased from 30 to 100. The number of full refreshes that can be made per hour for all standard decision tables in an org has increased from 20 to 40. Additionally, the limits for advanced decision tables have changed: The number of rows that an advanced decision table can process has increased from 2,000,000 to 20,000,000. The maximum number of rows in an advanced decision table for each combination of Equals, Required, and All conditions are met (AND) columns has increased from 50 to 200. The number of advanced decision tables that can be processed has increased from 60 to 100.

notes.feature_name: Advanced Decision Table Limits
notes.description: The limits for advanced decision tables have been increased. The number of output columns has increased from 5 to 10. The number of output rows that can be returned when multiple sets of inputs are simultaneously looked up has increased from 4,000 to 40,000. The maximum number of advanced decision tables invoked per hour has increased from 1,440,000 to 10,800,000. The number of CSV files that can be uploaded simultaneously has increased from 1 to 5, and the number of rows that can be uploaded in a CSV-based decision table has increased from 10,000 to 50,000. The number of rows updated in an incremental refresh of an advanced decision table has increased from 100,000 to 1,000,000. The number of CSV files that can be downloaded simultaneously has increased from 2 to 5.

notes.feature_name: Expression Set Enhancements
notes.description: Business Rules Engine now supports the IF function, allowing for direct logical evaluations and fewer steps. Each element in the Expression Set builder now receives a distinct, automatically generated name, making it effortless to identify, manage, and debug rules. Receive proactive alerts notifying you if you add.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Invocable Action for Expression Sets
notes.description: An enhanced invocable action that handles context hydration allows for easier execution of context-based Expression Sets from Salesforce Flow, helping avoid rework and ensuring designs are always savable.

notes.feature_name: Improved Deployment Stability with Context Definitions
notes.description: Experience greater stability during migrations and upgrades in your Business Rules Engine with rule definitions.

notes.feature_name: Centralized Monitoring for Decision Table Actions
notes.description: Monitor all your decision table actions in a dashboard that shows real-time status and error details. Easily filter and sort tables to prioritize attention, ensuring critical business logic is always current and reliable.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Go for Business Rules Engine Feature Discovery
notes.description: With Salesforce Go, you can discover and set up Business Rules Engine features, and track feature usage, all from a single location. Access content resources and links for help with configuration.

notes.feature_name: Clarify Automated Decisions with Rule Explanations for Nested Expression Sets
notes.description: Provide users with a deeper understanding of how automated decisions are reached within nested expression sets. This enhancement allows rule designers to offer more detailed, transparent explanations for every rule outcome, building trust and ensuring clarity in complex decision-making processes.

notes.feature_name: Control Null Values and No Matches in Expression Sets
notes.description: Configure your expression sets to manage null values and decision table no-matches exactly as your business requires. This enhancement helps maintain the integrity of your calculations, reduces errors, and ensures that automated processes consistently deliver reliable results for better decision-making.

notes.feature_name: Monitor the status and details of actions performed in a decision matrix
notes.description: Use the Decision Matrix Action Log object to monitor the status and details of actions performed in a decision matrix.

notes.feature_name: Automate Outreach to Delinquent Borrowers to Boost Cash Flow and Reduce Bad Debt
notes.description: Drive successful repayment outcomes with informed and personalized communication. Use Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect to schedule an outbound dialer campaign. Create a targeted list of collection plans and schedule a collection campaign to dial borrowers automatically when a collections specialist is available. Specialists instantly receive the collection plan context and can track all resulting calling activity centrally on the root collection record.

notes.feature_name: Automate Outreach to Delinquent Borrowers
notes.description: Drive successful repayment outcomes with informed and personalized communication. Use Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect to schedule an outbound dialer campaign. Create a targeted list of collection plans and schedule a collection campaign to dial borrowers automatically when a collections specialist is available. Specialists instantly receive the collection plan context and can track all resulting calling activity centrally on the root collection record.

notes.feature_name: New Invocable Actions for Collections Outbound Dialer
notes.description: Use the new invocable actions in Salesforce flows for Collections Outbound Dialer.

notes.feature_name: Compliant Data Sharing Participant Records Management
notes.description: Compliant Data Sharing custom object record owners can now delete custom object participant records by using a new setting. For Compliant Data Sharing custom objects, record owners have more control to manage participant records. Users without delete access to the Compliant Data Sharing parent custom object can delete participant records.

notes.feature_name: Delete Compliant Data Sharing Participant Records
notes.description: For Compliant Data Sharing custom objects, record owners have more control to manage participant records. Users without delete access to the Compliant Data Sharing parent custom object can delete a participant record if they own the parent record.

notes.feature_name: Criteria-Based Search and Filter
notes.description: Use Criteria-Based Search and Filter to design a search experience for your users. You can configure a search based on a single object that unifies complex sets of data, such as inventory and aggregated customer information that’s otherwise spread across multiple objects and fields. Criteria-Based Search and Filter can be customized to meet varied business requirements.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Search Experience with Consistent Data Display
notes.description: Criteria-Based Search and Filter (CBSF) now provides a more intuitive and reliable search experience with consistent data display and clear visibility into when data was last updated. Date-time fields appear in the user’s timezone using standard Salesforce formatting, and currency fields display symbols instead of codes. Any Word Search is enabled by default in all orgs, and users can view the Last Refreshed Date for search results, enhancing clarity and efficiency.
notes.edition: Automotive Cloud, Health Cloud, Manufacturing Cloud, Nonprofit Cloud, and Public Sector Solutions

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Context Definition Mapping User Interface
notes.description: Streamline your context definition mapping experience with a redesigned user interface allowing for more efficient management of large context definitions. Speed up your configuration process by managing Input and sObject mappings from a single interface. Map attributes and fields faster with inline search, and enhanced sort and filter capabilities.

notes.feature_name: Select Data Space for a Context Mapping
notes.description: Use the power of Data 360 for your extended context definition by changing a mapping to a custom data space. Reduce the possibilities of mapping errors by selecting a data space that contains preprocessed, harmonized, and unified data from multiple sources for all data model objects (DMOs).

notes.feature_name: Context Definition Packaging and Migration Enhancements
notes.description: Package and deploy deactivated context definitions. Context definitions also now support Second-Generation Managed Packaging (2GP).

notes.feature_name: Context Service and Data Cloud Integration
notes.description: Harmonized, and unified data from multiple sources for all data model objects (DMOs). This change applies to Lightning Experience in Professional, Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions where Context Service and Data Cloud is enabled. To map your context definition to a custom Data Space, go to Context Definitions in Setup, select an extended context definition with standard DMO mappings, and click Map Data.

notes.feature_name: Context Definition Packaging and Migration Enhancements
notes.description: Package and deploy deactivated context definitions. Context definitions also now support Second-Generation Managed Packaging (2GP). This change applies to Lightning Experience in Professional, Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions where Context Service is enabled.

notes.feature_name: Data Processing Engine Enhancements
notes.description: Preview how your definitions transform data and instantly validate and debug definition design right for the builder. Create and run definitions in Data 360 companion orgs. Use a unified view to track the performance and key metrics of definitions. Get actionable recommendations for failed runs and download failed records to debug faster. Find and focus the Data Processing Engine canvas on nodes that you want to work on.

notes.feature_name: Validate Logic and Debug Faster with Data Preview
notes.description: Validate your definition design instantly during creation. Generate data previews to verify that your configuration meets business needs and to identify logic errors. Use input variables to simulate different runtime conditions and apply data source filters to isolate specific datasets. Easily search the results to check whether definitions are working as expected. Intuitively correlate the results with node configurations and visualize how data flows across nodes.

notes.feature_name: Run Definitions in Data 360 Companion Orgs
notes.description: Enhance your multi-org setup by creating definitions in companion orgs to transform data from data model objects (DMOs), data lake objects (DLOs), and calculated insights. You can decouple central business processes orchestrated in the home org from local processes managed in companion orgs.

notes.feature_name: Get Holistic Insights About Definition Performance
notes.description: Get comprehensive observations about the performance of definitions and their runs on the Analysis tab. Use the tab’s insights to stay informed about duration and data processing volumes for the latest and previous runs. Make informed decisions about your org’s Data Pipeline usage requirements by tracking the execution and writeback utilization numbers. Easily find the reasons and the remedies for failed runs.

notes.feature_name: Get Actionable Guidance for Failed Runs
notes.description: Get actionable recommendations for failed runs and download failed records to debug faster.

notes.feature_name: Monitoring Workflow Services Enhancements
notes.description: Monitoring Workflow Services now provides more contextual messages that identify the root causes of run failure. The messages come with actionable solutions that empower you to fix issues related to definition design, access controls, and runtime platform setup or performance. You also get to know about the exact stage during the execution process when the run failed.

notes.feature_name: Retrieve Details of Records that Failed Writeback
notes.description: Download the details of the records that definitions failed to write back. You can individually download the failed records for each Writeback Object node with failed records. Use the failed record details to diagnose issues in the definition or the records that caused the write back to fail.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Record Group Counts for Composite Writeback
notes.description: Monitor Workflow Services shows the aggregated count of input, output, and failed record groups for Composite Writeback nodes. Record group counts from child tasks roll up to the node's parent task. Unlike tasks for other nodes, Composite Writeback tasks track record groups generated by the node's grouping logic.

notes.feature_name: Locate Nodes You're Looking for with Ease
notes.description: Use advanced search in the Data Processing Engine builder to jump to the node you want to review or reconfigure. When you select a node from the search results, the canvas automatically centers on the selected node and its neighbors.

notes.feature_name: Validate Logic and Debug Faster with Data Preview
notes.description: Validate your definition design instantly during creation. Generate data previews to verify that your configuration meets business needs and to identify logic errors. Easily search the results to check whether definitions are working as expected. Intuitively correlate the results with node configurations and visualize how data flows across nodes.

notes.description: Enhance your multi-org setup by creating definitions in companion orgs to transform data from data model objects (DMOs), data lake objects (DLOs), and calculated insights. You can decouple central business processes orchestrated in the home org from local processes managed in companion orgs.

notes.description: Get comprehensive observations about the performance of definitions and their runs on the Analysis tab. Use the tab’s insights to stay informed about duration and data processing volumes for the latest and previous runs. Make informed decisions about your org’s Data Pipeline usage requirements by tracking the execution and writeback utilization numbers. Easily find the reasons and the remedies for failed runs.

The messages come with actionable solutions that empower you to fix issues related to definition design, access controls, and runtime platform setup or performance. notes.description: Download the details of the records that definitions failed to write back. You can individually download the failed records for each Writeback Object node with failed records. Record group counts from child tasks roll up to the node's parent task. Unlike tasks for other nodes, Composite Writeback tasks track record groups generated by the node's grouping logic.

notes.feature_name: Advanced Search in Data Processing Engine
notes.description: Use advanced search in the Data Processing Engine builder to jump to the node you want to review or reconfigure. When you select a node from the search results, the canvas automatically centers on the selected node and its neighbors.

notes.description: Enhance the transformation logic of definitions with new functions and learn about the count of records processed by nodes. Admins can now use the MIN and MAX functions in Formula nodes and review the input and output record count of a run.

notes.feature_name: Updated Monitor Workflow Services Objects
notes.description: Do more with the updated Monitor Workflow Services objects. Learn about the stage during which a Data Processing Engine definition's run failed using the new ExecutionStage field on the existing Batch Job object. Learn about the count of records provided as input and processed by a Data Processing Engine definition's run using the new TotalInputRecordCount and TotalProcessedRecordCount fields on the existing Batch Job object.

notes.feature_name: Monitor execution and writeback capacity usage of Data Processing Engine runs
notes.description: Use the new UtilisedExecutionLimit and UtilisedWritebackLimit fields on the existing Batch Job object.

notes.feature_name: Track input, output, and failed record counts of a Data Processing Engine definition's run batch job part
notes.description: Use the new InputRowCount, OutputRowCount, and FailedRowCount fields on the existing Batch Job object.

notes.feature_name: Know the writeback user of a Data Processing Engine definition's run batch job part
notes.description: Use the new UserReference fields on the existing Batch Job object.

notes.feature_name: Capture Assessment Responses with Exact Question Versioning
notes.description: Map every assessment question response to the specific version of the question displayed to the user. Maintain a more precise audit trail of the question text and the responses from the user. Track and analyze customer interactions effectively by maintaining exact version context, resulting in improved decision making and customer service.

notes.feature_name: Generate Context-Specific Questions with Generative AI
notes.description: Reduce the manual effort of creating assessment questions by using the power of Generative AI. Use natural language instructions and AI to generate assessment questions for a form. Edit and refine the generated questions directly in the assessment form to make sure they fit your business needs.

notes.feature_name: AI-driven insights on home page
notes.description: Users access AI-driven insights on their home page with the Einstein Quick Insights component. The Salesforce Context Service provides more comprehensive, relevant insights by accessing a broader set of data. Additionally, users improve efficiency with Retained Output, which keeps the last run prompt and its output after a page refresh.

notes.feature_name: Enhance AI Summaries with Multimodal Inputs
notes.description: Customize your embedded AI experience by using flex prompt templates that take multiple inputs. Create prompts grounded in multiple objects, text, or files, including PDFs, images, and text documents, directly on the component's UI. Generate more powerful, multimodal insights, eliminating inefficient manual workflows and increasing the accuracy of AI-generated summaries.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Sorting and Filtering of Prompt Data with Context Service
notes.description: Improve the reliability of AI-generated summary ranking and prioritization. Use Context Service design time filters to ensure consistent results for your context-driven prompts. Get reliable results by removing the need for the Large Language Model (LLM) to handle sorting and filtering.

notes.description: Time filters have been added to ensure consistent results for context-driven prompts, improving reliability by removing the need for the Large Language Model (LLM) to handle sorting and filtering.

notes.description: Admins can customize the Gift Entry Grid with multiple templates, select an active gift entry template, add or remove columns, and integrate custom Lightning components for payment processing.

notes.feature_name: Support for $0 Gift Transactions
notes.description: Gift entry now supports $0 gift transactions, allowing tracking of non-monetary gifts and in-kind donations. Users can add up to 50 designations to a single gift and backdate transactions for gift commitments.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Gift Visualizations
notes.description: Access eight dynamic visualizations that adapt to the structure of each planned gift type using Flexcards in the Gift Planning app, helping relationship officers assess value, timelines, and stewardship needs quickly.

notes.feature_name: Slack Integration for Research Workflows
notes.description: Integrate research workflows directly with Slack to accelerate decision making and improve prospect strategy.

notes.feature_name: Self-Service Donor Support Agent (Beta)
notes.description: Give your donors the power to instantly manage their own recurring gifts by using an Experience Cloud site. The Donor Support Agent (beta) helps donors to handle common requests like changing a recurring gift’s amount and frequency. Free up your staff’s time to focus on building relationships while providing donors with the fast, modern experience that they expect.
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Tailor the Gift Entry Experience
notes.description: Customize the Gift Entry Grid to match your unique fundraising processes. Admins can create and manage multiple templates, select an active gift entry template on Gift Batch, add or remove columns, and integrate custom Lightning components for tasks like payment processing. Build a targeted and efficient experience that helps your users capture the right gift data quickly and accurately.

notes.feature_name: Streamline Gift Entry with Flexible Tools
notes.description: Improve your gift processing efficiency with key updates to Fundraising objects. Gift entry now supports $0 gift transactions, so that you can track non-monetary gifts and in-kind donations. You can also add up to 50 designations to a single gift and backdate transactions for gift commitments, all from within the Gift Entry Grid.

notes.feature_name: Use Tailored Gift Visualizations for Each Planned Gift Type
notes.description: Access eight dynamic visualizations that automatically adapt to the structure of each planned gift type using Flexcards in the Gift Planning app. These Flexcards present the most important details at a glance, helping relationship officers quickly assess value, timelines, and stewardship needs. Select a gift type to get a layout that shows only the fields that matter, streamlining review and data entry.

notes.feature_name: Strengthen Prospect Strategy by Creating Slack Research Channels and Canvases with Agentforce
notes.description: Integrate research workflows directly with Slack to accelerate decision making and improve collaboration across advancement teams. Give researchers and relationship officers a shared space to evaluate high-impact prospects. Researchers can build channels, publish canvases, and produce insights without leaving Slack. Relationship officers can join prospect-specific channels and review curated canvases.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Objects for Fundraising
notes.description: Do more with the new and updated Fundraising objects. Note: If you're an existing customer and you don't see the new or changed fields, then ask your Salesforce admin to add the fields in the page layout of the respective objects.

notes.feature_name: Mobile-Friendly Form Components
notes.description: To improve completion rates, all form components are now mobile-friendly for a better user experience on any device. You can also require specific file attachments to prevent incomplete applications.

notes.feature_name: Application Form Object
notes.description: Configure your grant application intake process by using the Application Form object, the standard for applications across Agentforce Nonprofit, formerly Nonprofit Cloud, and Industries. The Application Form and related objects support key features such as compliant data sharing, stage management, and form framework. Adopting this standard makes sure that you can leverage future platform enhancements as they're released.

notes.feature_name: Simplified File Management in Forms
notes.description: Management of attachments in forms is simplified with a new component in flows and Flexcards.

notes.feature_name: New and Updated Grantmaking Objects
notes.description: Do more with the new and updated Grantmaking objects. Note: If you're an existing customer and you don't see the new or changed fields, then ask your Salesforce admin to add the fields in the page layout of the respective objects.

notes.feature_name: ApplicationFormEvaluation Object
notes.description: Use the new ApplicationFormEvaluation object to set and store the details of an application form evaluation.

notes.feature_name: ApplicationFormEvalSection Object
notes.description: Use the new ApplicationFormEvalSection object to set and store the details of an application form evaluation section.

notes.feature_name: New Fields on ApplicationForm Object
notes.description: Store pertinent information and associations for the application using the new Title, Purpose, RequestedAmount, ApplicationStatus, ReferenceRecord, Contact, Budget, and UsageType fields on the ApplicationForm object.

notes.feature_name: ApplicationForm Field on FundingAward Object
notes.description: Identify the application form that relates to the funding award using the new ApplicationForm field on the FundingAward object.

notes.feature_name: Industries CPQ Enhancements
notes.description: Industries CPQ delivers unified order management and streamlines complex fulfillment by integrating with the Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) for attribute-based decomposition. Boost cart performance for large bundles with level-based loading and enhanced caching. Gain control over the Industries CPQ Cart with custom record types, pricing precision, and customizable fields. Ensure transactional accuracy by preserving original contract pricing, and correctly retaining asset status during attribute updates.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Invocable Actions User Access with New Permission Set
notes.description: Simplify permission management by granting precise access to the prebuilt invocable actions in the Communication, Media, and Energy & Utilities managed package. To ensure that your users maintain access to the necessary invocable actions, migrate from the managed package licenses to the permission set licenses, and use the CME Agentforce permission set.

notes.feature_name: Integrate DRO with Industries CPQ
notes.description: Enable streamlined order operations by connecting Industries CPQ with Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) within a unified platform. This integration supports existing Enterprise Product Catalog (EPC) structures, without the need for commercial and technical catalog migration. The DRO system facilitates fulfillment by decomposing complex products into technical products based on attribute rules, product hierarchies, custom order fields, and defined decomposition relationships. Use the DRO Decomposition and Fulfillment workspace to streamline your entire order lifecycle by creating detailed, end-to-end orchestration plans. Gain full control over complex scenarios as DRO efficiently processes advanced orders like Change of Plan, In-flight Amendments, and sub-actions. DRO comprises features such as order management console, fallout, and jeopardy management.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Performance for Complex Carts with Level-Based Pagination for Standard Cart APIs
notes.description: Provide an improved user experience for your Industries CPQ Cart with large product bundles with deep hierarchies. Achieve reduced loading time and Apex Governor limit by implementing a level-based approach to loading the cart content. You can load the top-level items first, followed by their first-level children.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Asset to Order Conversion with New Record Type Field
notes.description: Customize orders by defining your preferred record type value in the API payload. Include the RecordTypeId in the InputField parameter when converting an asset to order under the Standard Cart API’s assetToOrder action.

notes.feature_name: Streamline Cart Operations and Data Updates with Advanced Caching
notes.description: Provide an effortless user experience in the Industries CPQ cart operations. Guarantee uninterrupted availability for critical pricing updates and configuration data. This capability extends even to massive datasets with the high-performance Enhanced Caching Mode.

notes.feature_name: Get Pricing Benefits by Retaining Original Asset Price in Standard Cart APIs
notes.description: Provide an elevated user experience by retaining the original contract price. Retain the pricing discounts and minimize billing disputes even when updating the nonimpacting pricing attributes for the user. Manage all the subscriptions and assets while preserving their pricing advantage.

notes.feature_name: Gain More Control Over Your Industries CPQ Cart with New Line Item Fields
notes.description: Elevate your experience with a more relevant Industries CPQ Cart view. With the new Type and Formatter fields, you can personalize the cart as per your preference.

notes.feature_name: Get Accurate Line Item Pricing Values with Improved Decimal Precision
notes.description: Achieve data clarity and consistency with precise line item values up to five decimal points. You can set the preferred precision to control the number of decimal digits appearing in the pricing line item of the Enhanced LWC Cart.

notes.feature_name: Achieve Transactional Integrity with a Single Click
notes.description: Provide a unified experience to global customers, preserving transactional accuracy in your Industries CPQ cart. Prevent potential billing errors for your customers by displaying the order and pricelist currency, regardless of their currency setting.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Unnecessary Action Status Updates During MACD Operations
notes.description: Preserve the Existing status on asset line items when Move, Add, Change, Delete (MACD) rules update attribute properties without altering the actual values. Industries CPQ compares original and current values to ensure only actual data modifications trigger a Change status. This logic prevents unnecessary processing errors in downstream Order Management systems.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Invocable Actions User Access with New Permission Set
notes.description: Simplify permission management by granting precise access to the prebuilt invocable actions in the Communication, Media, and Energy & Utilities managed package. To ensure that your users maintain access to the necessary invocable actions, migrate from the managed package licenses to the permission set licenses, and use the CME Agentforce permission set.

notes.feature_name: Integrate DRO with Industries CPQ
notes.description: Enable streamlined order operations by connecting Industries CPQ with Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) within a unified platform. This integration supports existing Enterprise Product Catalog (EPC) structures, without the need for commercial and technical catalog migration. The DRO system facilitates fulfillment by decomposing complex products into technical products based on attribute rules, product hierarchies, custom order fields, and defined decomposition relationships. Use the DRO Decomposition and Fulfillment workspace to streamline your entire order lifecycle by creating detailed, end-to-end orchestration plans. Gain full control over complex scenarios as DRO efficiently processes advanced orders like Change of Plan, In-flight Amendments, and sub-actions. DRO comprises features such as order management console, fallout, and jeopardy management and order priorities.
notes.edition: All editions with Communications, Media, Energy & Utilities managed package

notes.feature_name: MACDLineItemActionStatus
notes.description: Previously, both value modifications and metadata changes triggered a status update to Change. Distinguishing modification types ensures that the Line Item Action Status remains Existing for behavior changes, offering a clearer view of actual asset modifications. From the CPQ Configuration Setup, enable the MACDLineItemActionStatus setting.

notes.feature_name: Enforce Sharing Rules for Tag Category
notes.description: Prevent users from seeing tag categories that belong to work groups outside of their work group by using sharing rules. When the default internal access for tag categories is set to private, create sharing rules to grant users or groups access to tag categories.

notes.feature_name: List Builder for Data Cloud Segment
notes.description: Make Data Cloud actionable lists available in Data 360 companion orgs to help teams easily manage all customer interactions, from initial engagement to follow-up. Your teams in Data 360 companion orgs can now leverage the same relevant actionable lists that were previously available only in the home org. Engage with prospects and customers seamlessly, documenting responses, completing transactions, and scheduling follow-ups, no matter which org you’re in.

notes.feature_name: Extend Actionable Lists to Your Companion Orgs
notes.description: Your teams in Data 360 companion orgs can now leverage the same relevant actionable lists that were previously available only in the home org. Engage with prospects and customers seamlessly, documenting responses, completing transactions, and scheduling follow-ups, no matter which org you’re in.
notes.edition: Starter, Enterprise, Professional, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Process Compliance Navigator
notes.description: Use Process Compliance Navigator to ensure your organization meets regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry standards. Compliance governance is strengthened with new validation criteria enforcing auditable transitions for controls, regulations, and policies, ensuring consistent evidence. Efficiency is improved by using context definitions for streamlined data access in validation and Compliant Data Sharing for records.

notes.feature_name: Control Compliance Record Access by Using Compliant Data Sharing
notes.description: Record owners in organizations with strict sharing policies can now grant other users access to their records by using Compliant Data Sharing for Process Compliance Navigator. Define record sharing rules for your compliance users so that record owners can share business operations processes, compliance policies, compliance regulations, compliance controls, and validation procedures with participant groups and participant roles.

notes.feature_name: Achieve Audit Readiness with Compliance Control Testing
notes.description: Verify that your compliance controls are successfully mitigating risks and enforcing regulations and policies with compliance testing. This testing evaluates a control’s operating effectiveness, confirms its design function, and captures verifiable evidence during the execution of the test. Use these details to demonstrate to regulators and auditors that your compliance program works as intended.

notes.feature_name: Enforce Compliance Control Testing Status Transition and Validation Criteria
notes.description: Strengthen your compliance framework and create an audit trail with the new Compliance Control Testing Status Transition and Validation Criteria setting. This setting enhances data governance by enforcing mandatory validation and transition rules whenever a user modifies the status of a Compliance Control Version Test Execution record. By locking down key attributes and transitions, this feature ensures compliance integrity.

notes.feature_name: Streamline Data Access with Context Definitions
notes.description: Define business context in your validation procedures with context definitions. A context definition acts as a structured data layer and translator that organizes data so that you can easily map and access relevant information across multiple objects. For example, to enforce compliance and prevent customer harassment, debt collection agencies must follow regulations that limit the number of times that they can call a customer. By using a context definition, you can now validate contact data, such as call frequency and time zone fields, before an agent initiates a call. The validation procedure passes in contact record data to validate it for compliance, ensuring agents adhere to all call limitations.

notes.feature_name: Clarify Purpose with the Renamed Logged-in User Locale Setting
notes.description: To ensure clarity and better reflect its purpose, the User Locale setting is now named Logged-in User Locale. This setting uses the logged-in user’s locale when logging API messages for Business Rules Engine compliance controls. Previously, this setting was called User Locale.

notes.feature_name: Enforce Validation Criteria for Regulations and Policies
notes.description: Maintain an auditable and compliant lifecycle for managing your organization’s regulations and internal policies by using the Regulation and Policy Status Transition and Validation Criteria setting. Acting as a governance gatekeeper for compliance officers, the setting enforces criteria before updating regulation version or compliance policy version.

notes.feature_name: Track Policies and Regulations that Govern Your Assets
notes.description: Improve the traceability of your regulated hardware and software assets by mapping regulation clause versions, compliance policy clause versions, and compliance control versions to an asset. Use this structure to maintain a record of the policies and regulations governing your assets, visualize control relationships, report on coverage gaps, and demonstrate adequate control implementation for compliance.

notes.feature_name: New Agentforce Process Compliance Navigator Jumpstart Bundles
notes.description: Quickly get started with Agentforce Process Compliance Navigator by using preconfigured features and flows designed to reduce setup time and complexity.

notes.feature_name: Control Compliance Record Access by Using Compliant Data Sharing
notes.description: Record owners in organizations with strict sharing policies can now grant other users access to their records by using Compliant Data Sharing for Process Compliance Navigator. Define record sharing rules for your compliance users so that record owners can share business operations processes, compliance policies, compliance regulations, compliance controls, and validation procedures with participant groups and participant roles.

notes.feature_name: Compliant Data Sharing
notes.description: To share records by using Compliant Data Sharing, users need the Compliance User permission set and the Use Compliant Data Sharing system permission, and edit access on the record they’re sharing. To have a record shared with them using Compliant Data Sharing, users need the Compliance User permission set and the Use Compliant Data Sharing system permission.

notes.feature_name: Compliance Control Testing
notes.description: Verify that your compliance controls are successfully mitigating risks and enforcing regulations and policies with compliance testing. This testing evaluates a control’s operating effectiveness, confirms its design function, and captures verifiable evidence during the execution of the test. Use these details to demonstrate to regulators and auditors that your compliance program works as intended.
affected_components: Compliance control version test execution record

notes.feature_name: Compliance Control Testing Status Transition and Validation Criteria
notes.description: Strengthen your compliance framework and create an audit trail with the new Compliance Control Testing Status Transition and Validation Criteria setting. This setting enhances data governance by enforcing mandatory validation and transition rules whenever a user modifies the status of a Compliance Control Version Test Execution record. By locking down key attributes and transitions, this setting prevents the creation of inconsistent or unverifiable test evidence. For example, when the setting is turned on, enforce a rule that if the execution status is completed, a user can’t update it to a different value.
affected_components: Compliance Control Version Test Execution record

notes.feature_name: Renamed Logged-in User Locale Setting
notes.description: To ensure clarity and better reflect its purpose, the User Locale setting is now named Logged-in User Locale. This setting uses the logged-in user’s locale when logging API messages for Business Rules Engine compliance controls.

notes.feature_name: Regulation and Policy Status Transition and Validation Criteria
notes.description: Maintain an auditable and compliant lifecycle for managing your organization’s regulations and internal policies by using the Regulation and Policy Status Transition and Validation Criteria setting. This setting enforces criteria before updating regulation version or compliance policy version, preventing premature activation or incorrect retirement of rules.

notes.feature_name: Mapping Regulation Clause Versions to Assets
notes.description: Improve the traceability of your regulated hardware and software assets by mapping regulation clause versions, compliance policy clause versions, and compliance control versions to an asset.

notes.feature_name: Process Compliance Navigator Enhancements
notes.description: Structure to maintain a record of the policies and regulations governing your assets, visualize control relationships, report on coverage gaps, and demonstrate adequate control implementation for compliance.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Process Compliance Navigator Jumpstart Bundles
notes.description: Quickly get started with Agentforce Process Compliance Navigator by using preconfigured features and flows designed to reduce setup time and complexity. To establish the core platform components for Compliance Collections Jumpstart, install this prerequisite bundle.

notes.feature_name: New Objects in Process Compliance Navigator
notes.description: Do more with these new and updated Process Compliance Navigator objects: Represent the association between an Asset and a Regulation Clause Version using the new AssetRegClauseVersion object; Represent the association between an Asset and a Compliance Policy Clause Version using the new AssetCmplPolicyClVer object; Represent the association between an Asset and a Compliance Control Version using the new AssetCmplControlVersion object; Represent the Compliant Data Sharing participant user or group with whom a business operations process is shared using the new BusOperProcParticipant object.

notes.feature_name: CmplControlParticipant Object
notes.description: Represent the Compliant Data Sharing participant user or group with whom a compliance control is shared. Use the new CmplControlParticipant object.

notes.feature_name: CmplPolicyParticipant Object
notes.description: Represent the Compliant Data Sharing participant user or group with whom a compliance policy is shared. Use the new CmplPolicyParticipant object.

notes.feature_name: CmplVldProcdParticipant Object
notes.description: Represent the Compliant Data Sharing participant user or group with whom a validation procedure is shared. Use the new CmplVldProcdParticipant object.

notes.feature_name: RegulationParticipant Object
notes.description: Represent the Compliant Data Sharing participant user or group with whom a regulation is shared. Use the new RegulationParticipant object.

notes.feature_name: CmplControlVersionTest Object
notes.description: Represent the association between a Compliance Control Version and Compliance Control Test. Use the new CmplControlVersionTest object.

notes.feature_name: ComplianceTest Object
notes.description: Represents a test designed to validate compliance with regulatory requirements. Use the new ComplianceTest object.

notes.feature_name: CmplCtrlVerTestExecution Object
notes.description: Represents the details captured during the execution of a compliance control test. Use the new CmplCtrlVerTestExecution object.

notes.feature_name: IsAiGenerated Field
notes.description: Indicate whether the record was generated using AI. Use the new IsAiGenerated field on the BusOperProcRegClVer, RegClCmplControlVer, and RegClCmplPlcyClVer objects.

notes.feature_name: Guest Access for Program Management
notes.description: Potential participants can now browse your programs and benefits on an Experience Cloud site without creating an account. Guest users can explore your offerings to determine if a program is a good match. When they’re ready, they can easily submit a referral to begin the intake process, which reduces friction and increases engagement with your nonprofit.

notes.feature_name: On-The-Go Attendance Tracking
notes.description: Taking attendance for benefit sessions is now faster and easier for staff working in the field.

notes.feature_name: Optimized Attendance Experience in Mobile App
notes.description: Attendance experience is optimized in the Salesforce mobile app to facilitate quick data capture. Staff can use their phones or tablets to find sessions or participants, update single or multiple participant records at once, and save their work with confidence. Capturing data in real time reduces administrative work and improves accuracy, so that your team spends less time on data entry and more time on your mission.

notes.feature_name: Streamline Participant Intake with a Guided Work Flow
notes.description: The new Intake app guides intake coordinators through a more efficient enrollment process with the Create Application flow to create new intakes quickly. When enrolling a participant in multiple programs, form sections are now deduplicated, so your users only enter overlapping information once. Separately, the Complete Application flow automates the creation of enrollment records and cases, which provides a smooth hand-off to case managers.

notes.feature_name: Confirm Participant Program Eligibility in Real Time
notes.description: Save staff time, reduce manual errors, and improve the participant application experience by checking participant eligibility for programs instantly. Create robust eligibility criteria that are unique to each program, and check a participant’s eligibility against their participant record on an application with the Business Rules Engine. Intake coordinators can see a participant’s status, which helps them make faster decisions and prevent non-compliant enrollments.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Data 360 Readiness for Program and Case Management
notes.description: Easily bring the latest objects and fields into Data 360, formerly Data Cloud, with updates to the existing Program and Case Management data model objects (DMOs). Attributes for Attendance were added to the Benefit Session and Program Enrollment DMOs as well as additional attributes for Benefit Type and Referral DMOs.

notes.security_notes: Admins need the Data Cloud Architect permission set and the Advanced Program Management permission set to configure the Program and Case Management objects and fields.

notes.feature_name: New and Updated Objects in Program and Case Management
notes.description: Do more with the new and updated Program and Case Management objects. Use the new EnrollmentEligibilityCriteria object to log the criteria that defines a participant’s enrollment eligibility for one or more programs. Use the new ProgramRecommendationRule object to set eligibility criteria and recommendations for a program. Use the new ProgramEnrlEligibilityCrit object to set eligibility criteria by using expression sets that relate directly to the program. Use the new EligibilityLastVerifiedDate field on the ProgramEnrollment object to note the date when the enrollee’s program eligibility status was last verified. Use the new ParentTemplate field on the ActionPlanTemplate object to create a hierarchy of action plan templates to use when applying for multiple programs at once.
notes.security_notes: If you’re an existing customer and you don’t see the new or changed fields, then ask your Salesforce admin to add the fields in the page layout of the respective objects.

notes.feature_name: Rollup Definitions
notes.description: Configure multiple record rollup definitions within one LWC component for improved data visualization. Set up on-demand record rollup definitions quickly and efficiently using the guided setup. Help business executives make more informed decisions by using the enhancements to record rollup definitions.

notes.feature_name: On-Demand Record Rollup
notes.description: Save time and improve efficiency for your business executives by enabling them to refresh record rollup results instantly. Help them make better decisions by making sure that the data they're working with is always up-to-date and accurate. Business executives can get the latest rollup results without waiting for scheduled refresh cycles. Enable or disable On-Demand Record Rollup as needed based on your business requirements.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience of multiple Industries clouds

notes.feature_name: View Multiple Record Rollup Results in One Place
notes.description: Save time and effort by configuring multiple record rollup definitions in the new LWC component. Business executives can give more personalized advice to clients by viewing multiple rollup results, such as the assets, financial accounts, and policies associated with a household on the household record page. If on-demand record rollup is enabled for a record rollup definition, your business executives can instantly update the rollup results, enabling them to make informed decisions based on the up-to-date rollup results.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience of multiple Industries clouds
