notes.feature_name: Tailored Workflows for Standardized Service Requests
notes.description: Reduce turnaround times for transactional service requests like new software installations and hardware upgrade requests. Use service requests to manage and track all your high-volume, one-time fulfillment tasks. Anchor your request workflows on the Service Request object with specialized Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to give request fulfillers dedicated insight into fulfillment metrics and the request backlog. Provide request-specific tasks to expedite processing. Empower requestors to self-serve their needs with workflows designed for requests that don't require manual intervention.

notes.feature_name: Guided Template Deployment for Service Process Portability
notes.description: Export and import a complete service process package—including intake forms, flows, eligibility rules, and agent actions—across Salesforce orgs. The deployment wizard guides you through the necessary configurations, which ensures reliability and eliminates manual post-deployment tasks. Use the out-of-the-box templates to recreate service processes that were previously defined in the Service Catalog app. Unified Catalog doesn’t support the migration of those specific Service Catalog-created processes.

notes.feature_name: Direct Control of Service Object Updates in Service Design
notes.description: Service designers can now directly create, view, and select attributes from the service object, then add them as Service Process Attributes. This process eliminates the need to rely on system admins for context definition and mapping. You can specify default values or make these fields available for user entry, ensuring your primary record captures the relevant, up-to-date inputs.

notes.feature_name: Flexible Eligibility Rules with Granular Logic Control
notes.description: Empower your designers to create and manage eligibility rules without technical help, speeding up the process.

notes.feature_name: Verify Product Eligibility on Behalf of Customers and Employees
notes.description: Empower service reps and internal request fulfillers to check whether customers and employees are eligible for a product. Add the Check Product Eligibility Agentforce action to assisted service processes to accelerate fulfillment by offloading entitlement validations to AI agents.

notes.feature_name: Build Tailored Workflows for Standardized Service Requests
notes.description: Reduce turnaround times for transactional service requests like new software installations and hardware upgrade requests. Use service requests to manage and track all your high-volume, one-time fulfillment tasks. Anchor your request workflows on the Service Request object with specialized Service Level Agreements (SLAs) to give request fulfillers dedicated insight into fulfillment metrics and the request backlog. Provide request-specific tasks to expedite processing. Empower requestors to self-serve their needs with workflows designed for requests that don't require manual intervention.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Service Process Portability by Using Guided Template Deployment
notes.description: Export and import a complete service process package—including intake forms, flows, eligibility rules, and agent actions—across Salesforce orgs. The deployment wizard guides you through the necessary configurations, which ensures reliability and eliminates manual post-deployment tasks. Use the out-of-the-box templates to recreate service processes that were previously defined in the Service Catalog app. Unified Catalog doesn’t support the migration of those specific Service Catalog-created processes.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions with Unified Catalog

notes.feature_name: Control Service Object Updates Directly in Service Design
notes.description: Service designers can now directly create, view, and select attributes from the service object, then add them as Service Process Attributes. This process eliminates the need to rely on system admins for context.

notes.feature_name: Define and Map Attributes
notes.description: You can specify default values or make these fields available for user entry, ensuring your primary record captures the relevant, up-to-date inputs.

notes.feature_name: Design Flexible Eligibility Rules with Granular Logic Control
notes.description: Empower your designers to create and manage eligibility rules without technical help, speeding up decision-making and providing only relevant service processes. The intuitive, modular UI guides you through defining complex qualification and disqualification logic across all your service offerings. Designers can now implement flexible conditions at the rule level, giving you control over the logic, freeing you from the limitations of a rigid structure.

notes.feature_name: Verify Product Eligibility on Behalf of Customers and Employees
notes.description: Empower service reps and internal request fulfillers to check whether customers and employees are eligible for a product. Add the Check Product Eligibility Agentforce action to assisted service processes to accelerate fulfillment by offloading entitlement validations to AI agents. The Agentforce action now includes an input to specify the account, contact, or user for product eligibility verification. The enhanced flow that runs the action validates that the service process and the requestor are eligible for the product.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions with Unified Catalog and applicable Agentforce add-on licenses

notes.feature_name: Other Enhancements to Unified Catalog
notes.description: Unified Catalog offers these new enhancements for attributes: Enhanced Organization allows categorizing attributes in separate sections and moving them across these sections. Additional Data Types are now supported, including Lookup, List of Attachments, Email, Multi-Select Values, Time, Range, Radio Button, URL, and Telephone, streamlining the service process designer's ability to configure and build comprehensive catalogs. Enhanced Context Information presents detailed context attribute information on the Attribute Settings page, making configuration and management clearer. Enhanced Display in Case Details allows requestors to view lookup attributes with the record name in case details, providing better visual accessibility compared to the previous format that showed IDs.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions with Unified Catalog

notes.feature_name: Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Marketing Cloud Next (also known as Agentforce Marketing) offers many updates for Growth and Advanced editions in Spring ’26. Changes include support for business units, Agentforce enhancements for campaigns, reusable content blocks, new metrics and conversion analytics, and other enhancements across messaging channels.

notes.feature_name: Marketing Cloud Account Engagement
notes.description: Drive alignment across teams and close deals faster with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement for B2B marketers. Expand your communication channels by sending approved email, SMS, and WhatsApp content, and visualize engagement data in new Tableau Next dashboards. Connect your business units to Data 360 and Marketing Cloud Next with a streamlined setup and enhanced email consent management. Plus, explore improved security for Google Group sends.
notes.security_notes: Improved security for Google Group sends.

notes.feature_name: Marketing Cloud Engagement
notes.description: Marketing Cloud Engagement delivers personalized customer journeys across marketing, advertising, commerce, and service. The Spring ’26 Marketing Cloud Engagement release occurs January 16, 2026 through February 20, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Marketing Intelligence in Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Marketing Intelligence in Marketing Cloud Next delivers more control, flexibility, and insight in Spring ’26. Expand your data model, unify more sources with new API connectors, gain deeper visibility with enhanced dashboard views, and optimize campaigns with improved objective-based insights.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Personalization in Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Drive real-time personalization decisions in mobile experiences using the Personalization module in Data 360 Engagement Mobile SDK. Dynamically adapt your website’s content, imagery, and tone in real-time based on user behavior signals.

notes.feature_name: Loyalty Management in Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Improve member benefits by enabling partner linkage and creating digital passes. Standardize the points expiration process and boost performance with asynchronous processing of high volumes of data. Target your audience better using unified individuals and set up data graphs in companion orgs.

notes.feature_name: Referral Marketing
notes.description: Connect outbound engagements with business units in Marketing Cloud Next. Use unified segments to enhance audience targeting and companion org data graphs to improve data accuracy.

notes.feature_name: Create Grounded, Interactive Campaigns with the Agentforce Campaign Experience
notes.description: Marketers can create campaigns even faster with enhancements that add grounding, branding, content refinement, and previews to the conversation experience. They can also turn one-way email.

notes.feature_name: Partition and Align Data and Marketing Content with Business Units
notes.description: Marketing Cloud Next now supports business units to align marketing operations with organizational structure. Each business unit can be matched to a division, brand, or region to partition and secure data and content. This allows teams to focus on their goals while providing leadership with enterprise-wide visibility. Data separation is ensured by mapping each business unit to a unique data space.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Create and Personalize Content More Efficiently
notes.description: Enhancements allow marketers to create any type of marketing content faster with productivity improvements such as extensions, preconfigured templates, and reusable content blocks. Marketers can build richer, more personalized emails, gain more control over email templates and template sharing, and personalize landing pages and forms with dynamic content and progressive profiling.

notes.feature_name: Reach Your Customers with Messaging Channels
notes.description: Enhancements to messaging channels include capabilities such as targeted in-app messages, two-way emails, UTM links for tracking SMS campaigns, and interactive WhatsApp templates to enhance marketing reach.

notes.feature_name: Drive Better Outcomes with Improved Reporting Tools
notes.description: Improved dashboards for mobile app performance and message deliverability enhance campaign reach and engagement. The new Conversion Analytics dashboard allows users to measure attribution and outcomes.

notes.feature_name: Create Grounded, Interactive Campaigns with the Agentforce Campaign Experience
notes.description: Marketers can create campaigns faster with enhancements that add grounding, branding, content refinement, and previews to the conversation experience. This allows for dynamic, two-way interactions from one-way email broadcasts.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Draft and Preview Briefs and Campaigns in an Agentforce Conversation
notes.description: Marketers can preview campaigns directly in the brief within an Agentforce conversation and return to refine structure and content before final campaign generation. The Refine Campaign Preview agent topic has been added to support these changes.

notes.feature_name: Updated Campaign Flows
notes.description: Updated the Save Campaign and Generate Campaign from Brief flows and the Draft Campaign from Brief Prompt template. Related flows now include improved error handling and campaign preview steps.
affected_components: Draft Campaign from Brief Prompt Template

notes.feature_name: Conversational Email and SMS
notes.description: Turn one-way email broadcasts into dynamic, two-way interactions. Conversational Email and SMS engages customers through responsive, threaded conversations powered by Agentforce agents. Capture high-intent replies, resolve customer queries, and deliver personalized support without leaving the Salesforce platform. Flow Builder enhancements, including Wait Until Response and conversation forwarding, enable customers to convert any existing one-way campaigns to two-way campaigns.

notes.feature_name: Draft Marketing Briefs Based on Existing Strategic Documents
notes.description: To ground a campaign brief in existing content, upload documents, such as PDFs or Word files, into the system.

notes.feature_name: Generate Briefs and Campaign Previews Grounded in the Related Brand
notes.description: When Agentforce drafts a campaign preview, it now uses the tone and identity of the brand that’s related to the brief. Get more relevant campaign drafts that require fewer manual edits.

notes.feature_name: Add Campaign Context with Brief Grounding
notes.description: Add essential context with additional fields to ground your campaign. A custom agent can include primary campaign goal and KPI, priority, calls to action, and guardrails. These additional grounding fields ensure the agent provides targeted and strategic decisions to reduce generic responses.

notes.feature_name: Partition and Align Data and Marketing Content with Business Units
notes.description: Marketing Cloud Next (also known as Agentforce Marketing) now supports business units so that you can align your marketing operations with your organizational structure. To partition and secure data and content, match each business unit to a division, brand, or region. Teams can stay focused on their goals, while leadership enjoys enterprise-wide visibility. To ensure data separation, map each business unit to a unique data space. Create up to 50 business units per org, assign users to one or more business units, align a business unit’s data with its respective data space by adding filters on marketing DLOs automatically, assign campaigns and marketing workspaces to a business unit, assign channels (Email, SMS, WhatsApp, and Mobile App Messaging) and subscriptions to a single or all business units, view marketing performance for a business unit or create a business unit to capture performance at the enterprise level, track visitor activities for your campaign on external web pages at a business-unit level, and use business unit-scoped Einstein features, including Send Time Optimization, Engagement Frequency, and Engagement Scoring.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: Identify Business Unit Agent Action
notes.description: To set the scope for subsequent actions when creating campaigns in the current Agentforce session, use the new Identify Business Unit agent action to determine user access to a business unit. To get the latest updates for business unit support, redeploy your campaign creation agent, topics, or actions.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Setup Progress for Business Units
notes.description: Monitor setup progress for all of your business units on the Assistant Home in Setup. A progress summary highlights required tasks for each business unit, and a graphic shows a status overview of all business units.

notes.feature_name: Productivity Enhancements for Content Creation
notes.description: Create any type of marketing content faster with productivity enhancements including extensions, preconfigured templates, and reusable content blocks. Build richer, more personalized emails, and get more control over email templates and template sharing.

notes.feature_name: Rich Text Editing and Personalization in Emails
notes.description: Marketers can build richer emails with the rich text editing toolbar in paragraph components and by attaching PDFs. Advanced data sources available in emails offer more personalization options. Pro-code email authors can create more sophisticated and deeply personalized messages with Handlebars scripting. To better control and enforce email layouts, marketing managers can lock and unlock elements of email templates. Then, to increase productivity without sacrificing consistency, marketers can share approved email templates outside of their marketing teams.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Content and Progressive Profiling for Landing Pages
notes.description: Personalize landing pages with dynamic content and streamline forms with progressive profiling rules. To give subscribers a consistent experience throughout your campaign, design custom preference pages that reflect your brand.

notes.feature_name: Improve Readability with Extensions
notes.description: Add productivity features, such as third-party generative AI tools, tone and grammar editors, and translators, to the content authoring experience with extensions. Extensions appear in a floating panel in the builder and marketers can use them to draft, revise, or customize the entire content body or individual components. Developers can build extensions for specific content types or for builder components.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced editions, and Marketing Cloud Next for Marketing Cloud Engagement

notes.feature_name: Tailored Templates for Quick and Easy Branding
notes.description: Access a library of preconfigured email and landing page templates that are designed to be applicable to every industry. Marketers can now quickly customize and style the content with ease to align with your campaign goals and branding.

notes.feature_name: Reuse and Customize Content Blocks in Landing Pages and Emails
notes.description: To make sure that landing pages are consistent, content admins or managers can create reusable blocks of content such as banners, footers, or other standard layouts. Use the new Content Block: Landing Page to combine text, images, and buttons into a reusable block that marketers can add to landing pages. To streamline authoring, content blocks are customizable in landing pages and emails. Marketers can convert a content block to a section, and then edit it without impacting the original reusable block.

notes.feature_name: Build Richer, More Personalized Emails and Share Consistent Templates
notes.description: Marketers can build richer emails with the rich text editing toolbar in paragraph components and by attaching PDFs. Advanced data sources available in emails offer more personalization options. Pro-code email authors can create more sophisticated and deeply personalized messages with Handlebars scripting. To better control and enforce email layouts, marketing managers can lock and unlock elements of email templates. Then, to increase productivity without sacrificing consistency, marketers can share approved email templates outside of their marketing teams.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with access to Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Share Marketing-Approved Email Templates with Non-Marketing Users
notes.description: To increase productivity without sacrificing brand consistency, marketers can now share approved email templates built in Marketing Cloud Next with sales reps and other users. After a marketer creates an email template, they can add it to a flow and lock or unlock specific components. Publishing the flow makes the email template available in an easy email composer that’s ready to use. An admin must turn on Distributed Marketing and Alerts in Setup, and adds the required Lightning components to record pages.

notes.feature_name: Enforce Brand Standards with Email Template Locks
notes.description: Marketing managers can now ensure brand consistency by locking specific elements on an email template. Protect critical content—such as subject lines, headers, and legal disclaimers—and prevent accidental changes by authors. While fixed elements remain secure, authors retain the flexibility to customize unlocked areas. Visual indicators in the component tree clearly show which sections are non-editable.

notes.feature_name: Personalize Email Messages with Advanced Data Sources
notes.description: Get more flexibility in personalizing email content with expanded data source support for segment data, Apex classes, and lookup data graphs. Reference Data 360 segment data for data-driven email targeting. Use Apex Classes to pass complex, structured data, such as entire order collections, directly from Flow to your messages, and then build fast, highly personalized transactional messages like order confirmations using that data. Define specialized lookup data graphs that use non-profile data from Data 360, such as product catalogs, to complement the default data graph or unified individual.

notes.feature_name: Attach PDF Documents to Marketing Cloud Next Emails
notes.description: Marketers can now include important business documents such as terms of service, whitepapers, or invoices in emails. In the Property panel, select a PDF from Salesforce CMS that’s 5 MB or less, and attach it to your email.

notes.feature_name: Get Greater Control Over Email Content with Low-Code Scripting
notes.description: For sophisticated content personalization and detailed control over message content, use the industry-standard Handlebars templating language. Designer-developers and advanced marketers can access this low-code scripting language from Code View while they build emails. Convert existing emails to code and then write, view, and edit scripts that add conditional logic or perform lookups for relevant data. As you author, the code view provides syntax validation, inline coding assistance, and search.

notes.feature_name: Style Email Content by Using the Enhanced Rich Text Editor
notes.description: We added more granular control over text styling and spacing for email layouts. Enhancements include emojis, font families, sizes, and line heights; text and background colors; block quotes and horizontal lines.

notes.feature_name: Brand and Personalize Web Content
notes.description: Personalize landing pages with dynamic content and streamline forms with progressive profiling rules. To give subscribers a consistent experience throughout your campaign, design custom preference pages that reflect your brand.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced editions, and Marketing Cloud Next for Marketing Cloud Engagement

notes.feature_name: Personalize Marketing Landing Pages by Using Dynamic Content
notes.description: To personalize a landing page for different audiences, marketers can now create dynamic variations of components, such as headers, sections, and images. To control when a page visitor sees a personalized variation, set rules that identify the target audience. With enhancements to the preview experience, marketers can select a segment and a sample visitor to test variations. To personalize emails and landing pages consistently within a campaign, marketers reuse the same personalization settings by cloning a personalization point.

notes.feature_name: Enable Dynamic Data Collection for Forms
notes.description: Accelerate the form submission process and capture more leads when you apply progressive profiling rules to forms. After someone responds to an item, they’re prompted to provide other details over time. Progressive profiling curates the user experience, asking for details such as job title or phone number only after capturing their email address or name in previous interactions. Form creators must add a data graph or data source to a form, and then configure profiling rules for each field on the Properties panel.

notes.feature_name: Customize Preference Pages to Reflect Your Brand
notes.description: Give your subscribers a consistent and trustworthy experience by designing branded custom preference pages. Enable the Customizable Preference Page feature to create distinct pages tailored to different channels. To ensure subscribers always view a branded page, you can also set a default specific page for your communications.

notes.feature_name: Messaging Channels
notes.description: Enhance your marketing reach with messaging channels featuring capabilities such as targeted in-app messages, two-way emails, UTM links for tracking SMS campaigns, and interactive WhatsApp templates.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: Mobile App Customer Engagement
notes.description: Boost mobile app marketing and engagement with targeted in-app messages and near real-time flash notifications. Gain insights into customer behavior by tracking custom events like clicks, screen views, and purchases.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: SMS Tracking with UTM Links
notes.description: Now, create and use UTM links to track the performance of your SMS campaigns and identify which SMS messages drive the most traffic and conversions. Build personalized URLs with standard UTM and custom parameters while creating your SMS messages. This new enhancement reduces manual errors, helping you make data-driven decisions to enhance your SMS campaign strategies.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: Email Engagement Enhancements
notes.description: Enhance your email marketing and customer engagement with new conversational email capabilities, improved deliverability, and clearer reply management. Create dynamic two-way campaigns, boost inbox placement with streamlined Dedicated IP support.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: WhatsApp Conversations Enhancements
notes.description: Drive engagement with new interactive message templates for time-sensitive offers, business contacts, and stickers. Customers in Brazil can now receive payment options directly in the chat. Also, improve your delivery rates for marketing templates with Marketing Messages Lite.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: In-App Messaging for Mobile Apps
notes.description: Engage your customers in real time while they use your mobile app, and boost your marketing efforts by selecting in-app message types that align with your business objectives. Basic message types include Banner, Modal, and Full Screen, while Advanced message types include Push Primer, which prompts customers to turn on push notifications. You can configure the message display limit in the setup page. Marketers can build in-app messaging content and include the element in flows.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Advanced edition

notes.feature_name: Flash Notifications
notes.description: Enhance mobile app engagement and strengthen brand loyalty by sending time-sensitive flash messages to your customers in near real time. After you turn on the feature, marketers can create flash messages and include the element in flows.

notes.feature_name: Custom Mobile App Events
notes.description: Track customer behavior by defining custom mobile app events for button clicks, screen views, or purchases within your mobile app. Marketers can stream these events in real time from a mobile app via the unified Marketing Cloud SDK. Leverage this data in Data 360 for segmentation and deeper insights, or in Flow Builder to create personalized customer journeys.

notes.feature_name: UTM Links for SMS Tracking
notes.description: Now, create and use UTM links to track the performance of your SMS campaigns and identify which SMS messages drive the most traffic and conversions. Build personalized URLs with standard UTM and custom parameters while creating your SMS messages. This new enhancement reduces manual errors, helping you make data-driven decisions to enhance your SMS campaign strategies.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth or Advanced edition and an add-on for Salesforce Message Credits for SMS or WhatsApp.

notes.feature_name: Email Engagement Enhancements
notes.description: Enhance your email marketing and customer engagement with new conversational email capabilities, improved deliverability, and clearer reply management. Create dynamic two-way campaigns, boost inbox placement with streamlined Dedicated IP support.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with access to Marketing Cloud Next Growth and Advanced editions.

notes.feature_name: Two-Way Conversational Email
notes.description: Turn one-way email broadcasts into dynamic, two-way interactions. Conversational Email engages customers in a more interactive manner.

notes.feature_name: Campaign Agent
notes.description: Use Campaign Agent to easily create two-way conversational campaigns. Provide a user utterance or select an option in the campaign brief, and Campaign Agent generates a preview of a standard two-way email campaign. It automatically includes the flow elements needed to support two-way conversations with the Default Agent.

notes.feature_name: Flow Builder Enhancements
notes.description: Flow Builder enhancements, including Wait Until Response and conversation forwarding enable customers to convert any existing one-way campaigns to two-way campaigns.

notes.feature_name: Managed Dedicated IPs
notes.description: Your email sends are now automatically assigned dedicated sending resources, allowing you to focus on creating engaging messages while Salesforce optimizes delivery in the background. Internal services continuously monitor shared and dedicated IP pools and rebalance traffic to ensure optimal delivery performance. This capability dynamically adjusts IP assignments based on sending volume and delivery trends.

notes.feature_name: Native RMM Forwarding
notes.description: We improved Reply Mail Management (RMM) forwarding to provide customer replies in full HTML formatting, mirroring modern email clients. Marketing specialists see clean, readable emails with preserved context—replacing the previous plain-text experience.

notes.feature_name: WhatsApp Conversations Enhancement
notes.description: Drive engagement with new interactive message templates for time-sensitive offers, business contacts, and stickers. Customers in Brazil can now receive payment options directly in the chat. Also, improve your delivery rates for marketing templates with Marketing Messages Lite.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Growth and Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Contact Messages via WhatsApp
notes.description: To quickly transmit detailed personal or organizational information directly through WhatsApp, use Contact messages. Include details such as name, phone number, email, address, and organization titles for seamless customer follow-up.

notes.feature_name: Send Time-Sensitive Offers
notes.description: Engage customers with time-sensitive promotions and coupons directly through WhatsApp. This new interactive message template includes an expiration setting on offers, which can encourage quick action and boost sales.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Conversations with Stickers
notes.description: Elevate WhatsApp session messages by adding curated stickers, offering a fun and visual way to respond to customers. Marketers create these stickers in WEBP format, and then upload them to Content Builder in Marketing Cloud Next or a public hosting service to get a secure URL. After you send the stickers, your customers can download and forward them.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Marketing Message Delivery with MM Lite
notes.description: To maximize the effectiveness of WhatsApp marketing initiatives, enable Marketing Messages Lite (MM Lite) Setup. These optimizations for outbound marketing template messages are provided by Meta to achieve up to 5% better delivery rates and potentially higher return on ad spend.

notes.feature_name: Send Payment Options in WhatsApp (Brazil Only)
notes.description: WhatsApp payment message templates now support sending payment options to customers. Configure up to two payment methods, including Pix, Boleto, or Payment Links. This message template is currently available only for Brazil.

notes.feature_name: Drive Better Outcomes with Improved Reporting Tools
notes.description: Enhance your campaign reach and engagement with improved dashboards for mobile app performance and message deliverability. Use the new Conversion Analytics dashboard to measure attribution and outcomes.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next Growth and Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Gain Deeper Insights into Mobile App Metrics
notes.description: Monitor mobile app campaign performance with unified dashboards for in-app messaging and push notifications. To view metrics specific to iOS or Android, marketers can now filter by platform. Plus, track delivery rates, dismissals, and CTA clicks to identify issues and improve marketing strategies.

notes.feature_name: Track Deliverability Metrics for SMS, WhatsApp, and Mobile Push
notes.description: You can now identify underperforming campaigns for SMS, WhatsApp, and Mobile Push by using the Low-Performing Campaign view. Apply delivery status filters to visualize activity trends and uncover reasons for unsuccessful deliveries.

notes.feature_name: Measure Campaign Effectiveness with Conversion Analytics Dashboards
notes.description: Gain insights into your marketing campaigns with the new Conversion Analytics dashboard. Track how email and SMS outreach drives specific outcomes, such as orders placed or form fills over a 30-day conversion window. To identify which messages convert customers most effectively, filter by First Touch or Last Touch attribution models.

notes.feature_name: Set Up External Web Tracking in Fewer Steps
notes.description: Use our improved setup process to configure external web tracking with greater speed and efficiency. Now, when you create a web connector, we automatically install and deploy the required data streams. Previously, users had to complete a manual install. You can also reuse the same web connector for multiple campaigns, eliminating the need to create a new connector for each campaign.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Growth and Advanced editions

notes.feature_name: Confidently Test Email Campaigns in a Sandbox
notes.description: To prevent accidentally sending test messages to real customer email addresses, use the blackhole feature in your full or partial sandbox org. When you enable blackhole in a sandbox, the system automatically discards email messages before they’re sent. You can also add exceptions for the recipient domains that need to receive test messages.

notes.feature_name: Marketing Cloud Account Engagement
notes.description: Drive alignment across teams and close deals faster with Marketing Cloud Account Engagement for B2B marketers. Expand your communication channels by sending approved email, SMS, and WhatsApp content, and visualize engagement data in new Tableau Next dashboards. Connect your business units to Data 360 and Marketing Cloud Next with a streamlined setup and enhanced email consent management. Plus, explore improved security for Google Group sends.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition
notes.security_notes: Improved security for Google Group sends.

notes.feature_name: Enhancements to Data 360 for Account Engagement
notes.description: To unify customer interactions across touchpoints, you can now connect Account Engagement data from Data Cloud One companion orgs. Plus, install the required data kits with a single click when you connect an Account Engagement business unit to Data 360. Previously, you had to install or update the engagement activity data streams on a separate page in Data 360 Setup.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition

notes.feature_name: Match Overall Email Marketing Consent with Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Send promotional emails with confidence. You can now match overall email consent between Account Engagement prospects and Marketing Cloud Next records. To track overall email consent changes between the two apps, turn on Consent Matching in the Account Engagement Settings tab in the Lightning App.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition

notes.feature_name: Track Engagement History with Tableau Next
notes.description: Visualize every lead, contact, account, and person account interaction with Unified Engagement History Dashboards. Pull engagement data directly from Tableau Next to get immediate, actionable marketing insights based on your records in Salesforce CRM.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition

notes.feature_name: Send Approved Emails, SMS, and WhatsApp Content
notes.description: Level up your connected Account Engagement content with Marketing Cloud Next. Distributed Marketing and Alerts shares marketing-approved templates with Salesforce Platform users, while Engagement Studio now offers steps that trigger SMS and WhatsApp sends through On-Demand Flows.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition

notes.feature_name: Google Adds 'via' Tag to System Emails
notes.description: System emails that are sent to Google Group email addresses now include a 'via' tag in the From address.

notes.feature_name: Match Overall Email Marketing Consent with Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Send promotional emails with confidence. You can now match overall email consent between Account Engagement prospects and Marketing Cloud Next records. To track overall email consent changes between the two apps, turn on Consent Matching in the Account Engagement Settings tab in the Lightning App.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next for Account Engagement

notes.feature_name: Track Engagement History with Tableau Next
notes.description: Visualize every lead, contact, account, and person account interaction with Unified Engagement History Dashboards. Pull engagement data directly from Tableau Next to get immediate, actionable marketing insights based on your records in Salesforce CRM.
notes.edition: Any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition with access to Tableau Next and with Data 360 enabled

notes.feature_name: Send Approved Emails, SMS, and WhatsApp Content
notes.description: Level up your connected Account Engagement content with Marketing Cloud Next. Distributed Marketing and Alerts shares marketing-approved templates with Salesforce Platform users, while Engagement Studio now offers steps that trigger SMS and WhatsApp sends through On-Demand Flows.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next for Account Engagement

notes.feature_name: Build Email Templates for Non-Marketing Users
notes.description: Distributed Marketing and Alerts is a platform-based feature that functions similarly to Sales Emails and Alerts. Orgs with Marketing Cloud Next for Account Engagement can try it out after an admin enables the feature and adds the required Lightning web components to record pages.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next for Account Engagement

notes.feature_name: Send SMS and WhatsApp Messages in Engagement Studio
notes.description: Upgrade your marketing strategy with expanded messaging functionality. You can now add SMS and WhatsApp message types to your Engagement Studio programs, making it possible to reach prospects on their preferred channels. Extend the automation capabilities of your marketing campaigns by selecting On-Demand Flows from Salesforce to your Engagement Studio programs. To view the On-Demand Flows that are built in Flow Builder, use the Send to Flows action in Engagement Studio. This feature consumes add-on credits for SMS or WhatsApp messages.

notes.feature_name: Google Adds “via” Tag to System Emails
notes.description: System emails that are sent to Google Group email addresses now include a 'via' tag in the From address. The 'via' tag is a security feature that’s added to a message sent on behalf of another sender or domain—in this case, a message from info@pardot.com for your domain. This tag helps prevent email spoofing and enhances security so that recipients can identify an email’s true origin. Old Format—Marketing Cloud Account Engagement <info@pardot.com>; New Format—‘Marketing Cloud Account Engagement’ via Group-Name <YourGroup@Yourdomain.com>.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with any Marketing Cloud Account Engagement edition

notes.feature_name: Transform Your Emails, Campaigns, and Data with Marketing Cloud Next for Engagement
notes.description: New features improve campaign reporting and data compatibility for Marketing Cloud Next. Marketers can now send Engagement emails via flows, create lockable email templates for use by platform users, and view unified reporting in context.

notes.feature_name: Drive Conversions and Engagement with Advanced Messaging Capabilities
notes.description: Connect with customers and improve data accuracy across your messaging channels. You can now guide users with call-to-action URLs, showcase products in catalogs, and process payments in Brazil on WhatsApp. Additionally, get cleaner metrics with SMS bot-click detection, and consistently share contact details via Virtual Contact Files (VCF).

notes.feature_name: Retain Original External Key Value
notes.description: When you deploy entities with Package Manager, the original external key value that’s specified in the originating account is retained. Journey Builder entry sources keep the event definition key value specified in the originating account. This feature makes it easier to deploy objects called by external APIs by removing the need for manual intervention.

notes.feature_name: Improve Event Notification Service (ENS) Reliability
notes.description: The new 7-day retry window prevents users from experiencing dropped batches due to unsuccessful delivery attempts. When a batch of notification events fails to deliver, ENS retries delivery at periodic, decreasing intervals for up to 7 days. After that, retries stop and delivery fails. Previously, ENS suspended callback URLs immediately after a failed delivery.

notes.feature_name: Define Rotation Policies for Client Secrets
notes.description: To improve the security of your API integrations, set a rotation policy for OAuth 2.0 client secrets. When you define a rotation period for an integration’s client secret, your marketing admins get email reminders when a secret is ready to be rotated.

notes.feature_name: Restore Data That was Cleared from a Data Extension
notes.description: The Recycle Bin in Contact Builder now includes a Cleared Data folder. When you use the Clear Records button to remove all records in a data extension, that data moves to the Cleared Data folder and remains there for 30 days. If you unintentionally clear the data from a data extension, you can restore it into a new data extension.

notes.feature_name: Get Einstein Metrics Guard Bot Scoring for Marketing Cloud Engagement
notes.description: Turn on Einstein Metrics Guard to score bot-driven email engagement data in Marketing Cloud Engagement using data from Data 360. This feature provides a clearer picture of campaign performance by identifying non-human opens and clicks.

notes.feature_name: Transform Your Emails, Campaigns, and Data with Marketing Cloud Next for Engagement
notes.description: New features improve campaign reporting and data compatibility for Marketing Cloud Next. Marketers can now send Engagement emails via flows, create lockable email templates for use by platform users, and view unified reporting in context.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited editions with Marketing Cloud Next for Engagement

notes.feature_name: Build Email Templates for Non-Marketing Users
notes.description: Distributed Marketing and Alerts functions similarly to the Distributed Marketing functionality that you’re used to. Orgs with Marketing Cloud Next for Engagement can try it out after an admin turns on the feature and adds the required Lightning web components to record pages.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Campaign Reporting with Related Emails
notes.description: The Marketing Cloud Next campaign record experience continues to evolve for Engagement customers, making it easier for marketers to view, manage, and report on multichannel orchestration. You can now send Marketing Cloud Engagement emails from flows in the Marketing App. On campaign records, we added the Engagement email send element in the Next Steps section and a unified report to the Performance tab.

notes.feature_name: Unify Legacy Engagement Data for Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Now you can unify your legacy Marketing Cloud Engagement data to use with Marketing Cloud Next. To make sure that incoming and existing Engagement data is compatible with newer features, such as Marketing Performance reports, update your data configuration. Previously, some users with an older data model couldn’t unify their Engagement data in Marketing Cloud Next. Where: These changes don’t apply to the majority of Engagement customers. To confirm if your account requires this configuration, from Salesforce Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Marketing Cloud Engagement and then select Unify Data. If Setup doesn’t include a Unify Data page, the changes don’t apply to your org.

notes.feature_name: Drive Conversions and Engagement with Advanced Messaging Capabilities
notes.description: Connect with customers and improve data accuracy across your messaging channels. You can now guide users with call-to-action URLs, showcase products in catalogs, and process payments in Brazil on WhatsApp. Additionally, get cleaner metrics with SMS bot-click detection, and consistently share contact details via Virtual Contact Files (VCF).

notes.feature_name: Guide Customers with Call-to-Action URLs
notes.description: Easily direct your users to relevant resources by including a Call-to-Action URL in your WhatsApp messages. A marketer defines the button text and a specific URL to provide users with a clear next step.

notes.feature_name: Drive Sales with Single and Multi-Catalog Messages
notes.description: Make it easier for customers to purchase items by sending single or multi-product catalog messages directly through WhatsApp. Marketers can configure Multi-Product Templates that display up to 30 products organized in 10 sections, linking directly to your catalog and product IDs.

notes.feature_name: Send Payment Options in WhatsApp (Brazil Only)
notes.description: WhatsApp payment message templates now support sending payment options to customers in Brazil. Configure up to two payment methods, including Pix, Boleto, or Payment Links. This message template is currently available only for Brazil.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Marketing Message Delivery with MM Lite
notes.description: Unified Messaging customers can now maximize the effectiveness of WhatsApp marketing initiatives with Marketing Messages Lite (MM Lite). These optimizations for outbound marketing template messages are provided by Meta to achieve up to 5% better delivery rates and potentially higher return on ad spend.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Contact Saving with Virtual Contact File Support
notes.description: Make it easy for your subscribers to save your business contact information instantly. Marketers can now upload Virtual Contact File (VCF) contact cards in Content Builder and send them as MMS attachments through MobileConnect and Journey Builder.

notes.feature_name: Measure Accurate SMS Engagement with Bot-Click Detection
notes.description: Bot-click detection metric was added to the SMS Link Clicks report and to Journey Builder activities. Assess the true engagement of SMS campaigns with automatic bot-click detection, providing reliable human-validated clicks metrics and eliminating bot-triggered journeys.

notes.feature_name: Retain Original External Key Values in Package Manager
notes.description: When you deploy entities with Package Manager, the original external key value that’s specified in the deployment is retained.

notes.feature_name: Journey Builder Entry Source Event Definition Key
notes.description: The originating account is retained. Journey Builder entry sources keep the event definition key value specified in the originating account. This feature makes it easier to deploy objects called by external APIs by removing the need for manual intervention.
notes.edition: Corporate and Enterprise editions, Professional editions with the Journey Builder add-on, any Marketing Cloud Engagement edition
affected_components: Journey Builder Entry Source Event Definition Key

notes.edition: Marketing Cloud Engagement Pro, Corporate, and Enterprise editions

If you unintentionally clear the data from a data extension, you can restore it into a new data extension.

notes.feature_name: Einstein Metrics Guard Bot Scoring
notes.description: Turn on Einstein Metrics Guard to score bot-driven email engagement data in Marketing Cloud Engagement using data from Data 360. This feature provides a clearer picture of campaign performance by identifying non-human opens and clicks.

notes.feature_name: Unlock Deeper Insights with Improved Data Management
notes.description: Unify custom datasets, streamline processing, and integrate more campaign sources. This release empowers you to extend the Semantic Data Model (SDM) and enrich your data. These updates give you cleaner data and better attribution insights to make more confident decisions.

notes.feature_name: Drive Strategy with Advanced Marketing Analytics Insights
notes.description: We’ve enhanced analytics capabilities to help you uncover actionable insights and make more informed decisions faster.

notes.feature_name: Get a Unified View with the Marketing Intelligence Home Tab
notes.description: We’ve updated the Marketing Intelligence Home page to help you see key results instantly, spot trends quickly, and act on insights faster, all without switching between screens. Get a quick, high-level overview of campaign performance in the My Campaigns Home widget. A toggle lets you switch between individual campaigns and aggregate anchor campaigns, so that you can track results across all campaign groups at a glance.

notes.feature_name: Improve Results with the Enhanced Paid Media Optimization Agent
notes.description: We’ve upgraded the Paid Media Optimization Agent to help you make smarter decisions, optimize campaigns efficiently, and act on insights with speed and clarity.

notes.feature_name: Customize Field Mappings in API Data Pipelines
notes.description: You can now map unmapped source fields from API connectors directly to the Semantic Data Model. Bring additional data into Marketing Intelligence by adding custom destination fields to predefined mappings or create entirely new mappings for unique fields. Standard system mappings remain locked to ensure stability.

notes.feature_name: Run Multi-Touch Attribution per Conversion Event
notes.description: Configure Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) for specific conversion events and their associated engagement signals. Create distinct attribution setups for different conversion events, such as purchases versus sign-ups, within a single Data Space. Compare attribution models side-by-side to analyze how interactions contribute to each unique outcome.

notes.feature_name: Expand the Data Model with Business-Specific Data
notes.description: You can now expand the standard marketing data model to include business-specific entities, such as Influencers, or internal tracking fields like Project Codes. Use custom schema to map these unique data points directly into the Semantic Data Model for a more complete view of your marketing performance.

notes.feature_name: Access More Data Sources with New API Connectors
notes.description: Bring in more campaign and performance data with new API connectors. Simplify data ingestion from additional platforms, making it easier to unify and analyze cross-channel marketing performance. We’ve also increased the reprocessing limit, allowing you to reprocess data for any 30-day date range. New connectors include: Adform, Criteo Marketing, Criteo Retail, Kakao Ads, LinkedIn Company.

notes.feature_name: Drive Strategy with Advanced Marketing Analytics Insights
notes.description: We’ve enhanced analytics capabilities to help you uncover actionable insights and make more informed decisions faster. Where: These changes apply to Lightning Experience in Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Marketing Intelligence in Marketing Cloud Next.

notes.feature_name: Group Related Campaigns for Unified Performance Analysis
notes.description: Simplify campaign management by grouping multi-channel efforts into Anchor Campaigns. Functioning as a strategic parent layer, Anchor Campaigns aggregate data from multiple sources to reveal the true ROI of your initiatives. Use this unified view to optimize campaigns against business objectives and reduce the manual effort needed for faster, data-driven decisions.

notes.feature_name: Explore More Views into Segment and Campaign Performance
notes.description: Gain a broader view of how your marketing performs across channels and attribution models. Segment Intelligence now shows performance across paid channels like Meta and Google, and owned channels like Email and SMS. Compare engagement, conversions, and ROI over time, drill into demographics, and uncover high-performing segments. Attribution dashboards now show B2C and B2B campaigns across multiple attribution models. See channel level performance, spend, conversions, and ROI for each conversion type to compare models, optimize media spend, and act with confidence.

notes.feature_name: Campaign Summary on Dashboards
notes.description: You can now add Campaign Summary to any dashboard you create, giving you a clear, consistent view of campaign performance. The summary updates automatically with all applied filters, so you can quickly see the data that matters most. This helps you spot trends, find opportunities, and optimize ads faster using the Optimize call to action without switching dashboards.

notes.feature_name: Marketing Intelligence Home Tab Update
notes.description: We’ve updated the Marketing Intelligence Home page to help you see key results instantly, spot trends quickly, and act on insights faster, all without switching between screens. Get a quick, high-level overview of campaign performance in the My Campaigns Home widget. A toggle lets you switch between individual campaigns and aggregate anchor campaigns, so that you can track results across all campaign groups at a glance.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions with Marketing Intelligence in Marketing Cloud Next

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Paid Media Optimization Agent
notes.description: We’ve upgraded the Paid Media Optimization Agent to help you make smarter decisions, optimize campaigns efficiently, and act on insights with speed and clarity.
notes.edition: Salesforce Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions with Marketing Intelligence in Marketing Cloud Next

notes.feature_name: Goal Creation Based on Agent Recommendations
notes.description: The Paid Media Optimization agent now recommends goals that align with your filtered data and optimized metrics after campaign optimization is complete. Create these goals directly from the agent, and they appear in the Goals tab where marketers can view or edit them. This enhancement makes it easy to turn optimization recommendations into trackable objectives and monitor performance without extra setup.

notes.feature_name: Campaign Optimization by Marketing Objectives
notes.description: Identify which campaigns support your top objectives, review spend for low performing ads, and use the insights to improve performance. See where your budget has the most impact and make faster decisions that improve results across channels.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Personalization in Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Drive real-time personalization decisions in mobile experiences using the Personalization module in Marketing Cloud Next.

notes.feature_name: 360 Engagement Mobile SDK
notes.description: Dynamically adapt your website’s content, imagery, and tone in real-time based on user behavior signals.

notes.feature_name: Curate Website Content with Agentforce Adaptive Websites
notes.description: Guide your users through every step of their website browsing journey by dynamically curating relevant, context-aware site content in real time. Agentforce Adaptive Websites displays the right recommendations, images, and adapts messaging tone based on real-time user behavior signals from an SDK combined with your data. Keep your customers engaged and assist them in accomplishing their mission without leaving your brand’s site.

notes.feature_name: Extend Marketing Cloud Personalization Data with Marketing Cloud Next for Personalization
notes.description: Using purpose-built tools, quickly and efficiently transfer Marketing Cloud Personalization metadata and catalog data to portable files, and use existing processes to import it into Data 360 for use with Salesforce Personalization.

notes.feature_name: Personalize Mobile Experiences with Engagement Mobile SDK
notes.description: The Personalization module within the Engagement Mobile SDK queries the Personalization service to deliver targeted content to your iOS and Android apps. By integrating with the Data 360 module, you capture customer interactions and build behavior profiles. Use the returned data to drive real-time personalization decisions.

notes.feature_name: Loyalty Management in Marketing Cloud Next
notes.description: Improve member benefits by enabling partner linkage and creating digital passes. Standardize the points expiration process and boost performance with asynchronous processing of high volumes of data.

notes.feature_name: Get Added Benefits by Linking Your Loyalty Memberships
notes.description: Members can now link their membership with partner loyalty memberships to seamlessly access valuable co-branded rewards, such as personalized offers. Linking memberships provides members with additional benefits in the home loyalty program. For example, link a Marriott Bonvoy membership in the Uber app to earn Bonvoy points by taking an Uber ride. Members can use their iOS or Android mobile devices to link their loyalty program memberships from a partner’s app.

notes.feature_name: Integrate Loyalty Programs Seamlessly with Google Wallet
notes.description: Drive customer engagement by integrating your loyalty program with Google Wallet. Members can create digital passes and conveniently access their full loyalty member profile on their mobile device. This ease of use encourages members to use their loyalty rewards and boosts program participation. Members can use their iOS or Android mobile devices to add their digital passes to the Google Wallet app.

notes.feature_name: Global Promotions Management
notes.description: Increase customer cart size with volume-based promotions such as Buy 100 LevelX Batteries to Get 10% Off on 20 Battery Testers. Reward customers with free products with easily relatable promotions such as Buy-One-Get-One-Free (BOGO). Show promotions to store employees, assisted sellers, and customers in their preferred languages. Run promotions on ecommerce sites powered by Experience Cloud. Assign permissions sets to users based on their roles. Create promotions for large product sets with ease. Find eligible promotions for items from across all their categories. Explain to customers and sellers why manually added coupons weren’t applied to carts.

notes.feature_name: Boost Performance with Asynchronous Processing of High-Volume Redemption Transactions
notes.description: Process traceable redemption transactions asynchronously to handle high redemption volumes more effectively. You can enable a setting that processes redemptions in real-time, while the traceability record creation shifts to asynchronous processing.

notes.feature_name: Optimize Point Accounting with Accurate Expiration of Points
notes.description: Use the Expire Fixed Non-Qualifying Points Using Aggregation Ledgers and Traceable Ledgers Data Processing Engine definition template to automate the precise expiration of fixed-type non-qualifying points. Ensure accurate point expiration by processing only points without pending traceability ledgers. The template leverages Aggregated Point Expiration Ledger records to calculate and expire points for members and currencies.

notes.feature_name: Data 360 for Loyalty Management
notes.description: Enhance your audience targeting by using unified individual segments and improve data accuracy by setting up data graphs in companion orgs.

notes.feature_name: Standardize Point Expiration by Using Current Date
notes.description: Standardize your point expiration processes by using real-time calculations with a capability to check whether the run date for a Data Processing Engine definition is in the future. The future run date is automatically replaced with the current date.

notes.feature_name: Refine User Access with New Loyalty Management Permission Sets
notes.description: Update your user assignments with new permission sets to ensure that your admins and loyalty program managers maintain the correct access to Loyalty Management features.

notes.feature_name: Get Added Benefits by Linking Your Loyalty Memberships
notes.description: Members can now link their membership with partner loyalty memberships to seamlessly access valuable co-branded rewards, such as personalized offers. Linking memberships provides members with additional benefits in the home loyalty program. For example, link a Marriott Bonvoy membership in the Uber app to earn Bonvoy points by taking an Uber ride. Members can use their iOS or Android mobile devices to link their loyalty program memberships from a partner’s app.

notes.feature_name: Integrate Loyalty Programs Seamlessly with Google Wallet
notes.description: Drive customer engagement by integrating your loyalty program with Google Wallet. Members can create digital passes and conveniently access their full loyalty member profile on their mobile device. This ease of use encourages members to use their loyalty rewards and boosts program participation. Members can use their iOS or Android mobile devices to add their digital passes to the Google Wallet app. Important Google Wallet Integration with Loyalty Management is a third-party service provider which is integrated with Salesforce Loyalty Management system and Salesforce is enabling its customers to use this at their own option and discretion. Customers will have the option to pass-on the information it opts for its own customers so that the customers experiences can be powered. Customers can invoke the Google Wallet API and the API would consume the information through Loyalty Management system which will be shown on the Google Wallet Digital Pass.

notes.feature_name: Drive Higher Unit Sales with Recurring Incentives
notes.description: Motivate customers to purchase higher quantities of an item by rewarding them with free or discounted units. Delight customers with promotions such as Buy-One-Get-One-Free (BOGO) that customers can apply to their cart multiple times. Scale volume-based discounts with promotions.

notes.feature_name: Show Promotions to People in Their Preferred Language
notes.description: Increase usage of promotions and assist sales motions by showing promotions to in-store employees and sales reps who manage assisted sales in the preferred language. Show customers promotions in their language on Experience Cloud sites.

notes.feature_name: Scan All Categories for Eligible Promotions
notes.description: Increase efficiency by selecting only the parent category that’s eligible for a promotion. Marketing managers can now skip selecting large sets of eligible child categories. The Eligible Promotions API and the Promotion Evaluation and Execution API now check promotion eligibility of products across five levels of its related category hierarchies.

notes.feature_name: Add Rewards for All Eligible Categories and Products
notes.description: Create unit price promotions for a large volume of eligible products and categories in no time. Add one purchase criterion for all eligible products or categories. Configure a uniform reward for all eligible items.

notes.description: Enhance your audience targeting by using unified individual segments and improve data accuracy by setting up data graphs in companion orgs.

notes.feature_name: Run Promotions on Sites Powered by Experience Cloud
notes.description: Show eligible promotions to logged-in customers on Experience Cloud site pages. When customers place an order from site pages, eligible promotions are evaluated and applied on the order.

notes.feature_name: Communicate Reasons for Coupon Ineligibility
notes.description: The Promotion Evaluation and Execution API provides customers and sellers the exact reason why a manual coupon isn't applied on order placement. The reasons can include invalid date of use and exceeded usage limit.

notes.description: Enhance data security and administrative control by transitioning users to new Global Promotions Management permission sets. Assign permission sets in precise groupings to control data access based on business requirements.

notes.feature_name: MuleSoft API Catalog for Salesforce
notes.description: Manage and view your APIs and make them available to use in Salesforce. You can bring APIs into your catalog from several different sources, including MuleSoft, Heroku, Apex, and Named Query API. API Catalog helps you create connections for your APIs and activate actions to use in Salesforce automations, such as flows and Agentforce.

notes.feature_name: MuleSoft API Governance for Salesforce (Beta)
notes.description: Create policies to protect your MuleSoft and Heroku API connections. These policies apply only to the specified APIs.

notes.feature_name: MuleSoft API Catalog for Salesforce
notes.description: Manage and view your APIs and make them available to use in Salesforce. You can bring APIs into your catalog from several different sources, including MuleSoft, Heroku, Apex, and Named Query API. API Catalog helps you create connections for your APIs and activate actions to use in Salesforce automations, such as flows and Agentforce.

notes.feature_name: MuleSoft API Governance for Salesforce
notes.description: Create policies to protect your MuleSoft and Heroku API connections. These policies apply only to agent actions that access the connections. You can control access, set usage limits, and follow best practices for governance. Note that MuleSoft API Governance for Salesforce is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Mobile App - Single Sign-On
notes.description: The Salesforce mobile app now uses single sign-on for faster logins and notifications that lets you work on tasks.

notes.feature_name: Mobile MCP Tools for Lightning Web Components
notes.description: Use natural language to create mobile and offline ready Lightning Web components with Mobile MCP tools.

notes.feature_name: Complete Tasks Directly from Custom Phone Notifications
notes.description: Users can now complete tasks directly from custom phone notifications, enhancing the mobile experience.

notes.feature_name: Access Record Attachments in the Offline App with Files Priming
notes.description: Users can access record attachments in the offline app using files priming, which is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Easily Configure Offline App Landing Pages with Mobile Builder
notes.description: Users can easily configure offline app landing pages using Mobile Builder, which is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Complete Tasks Directly from Custom Phone Notifications
notes.description: Users can now complete tasks directly from custom phone notifications on their Salesforce mobile app. Let’s say your VP of sales wants to approve an expense report. They can do that on the fly just from a notification received on their mobile phone. A task that before took four clicks has now been streamlined into one. Actionable notifications is a pilot or beta service that is subject to the Beta Services Terms at Agreements - Salesforce.com or a written Unified Pilot Agreement if executed by Customer, and applicable terms in the Product Terms Directory. Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Files Priming
notes.description: When you create or update a briefcase to select records to prime for the Offline App (Salesforce Mobile App Plus), you can now also include files attached to the selected records. The Files Priming feature, which was previously in beta, is now generally available. When you prime file attachments for offline use, you enable your mobile workforce to access important attachments even in low-connectivity settings. For example, you can configure a briefcase to prime attached images for offline use, so that technicians can view the images during site visits or service appointments.
affected_components: Salesforce Mobile App Plus for iOS
Salesforce Mobile App Plus for Android

notes.feature_name: Easily Configure Offline App Landing Pages with Mobile Builder
notes.description: With Mobile Builder for Salesforce Mobile App you can customize offline landing pages for your mobile users without writing a single line of code. Now you can show the most important records to your mobile users so they can quickly and easily take relevant actions based on their use cases. Mobile Builder was beta in Spring ’24 and is now generally available.

notes.feature_name: Log In Faster with Single Sign-On
notes.description: Leverage quicker access to the Salesforce Mobile App so you can get straight to work. The Salesforce Mobile App now also supports single sign-on (SSO) when logging in with your email address instead of a username, streamlining your login experience.
notes.timeline: Available for iOS starting January 12, 2026 and Android starting February 23, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Mobile MCP Tools Now Available on Salesforce DX MCP Server
notes.description: The Mobile Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools help developers create Lightning web components that adhere to Mobile Offline design patterns and integrate with device-native features. The Mobile Offline MCP Tools provide comprehensive offline compatibility analysis and guidance for Lightning web components that work with offline-supported apps like Salesforce Mobile App Plus and the Field Service Mobile App. The Mobile Native Capabilities MCP tools provide grounding context for creating Lightning web components that integrate with device-native capabilities such as barcode scanning, location services, contact access, and other mobile-specific features.

notes.feature_name: New Version of Test Harness Now Available
notes.description: The latest version of Test Harness for Android now supports edge-to-edge design on devices running Android 15 (API level 35) and higher. Edge-to-edge takes advantage of the entire screen by drawing the UI under the system bars.

notes.feature_name: New Version of Test Harness Now Available
notes.description: The latest version of Test Harness for Android now supports edge-to-edge design on devices running Android 15 (API level 35) and higher. Edge-to-edge takes advantage of the entire screen by drawing the UI under the system bars.

notes.feature_name: Automate UI Testing for Omniscripts and Flexcards
notes.description: Omnistudio now supports comprehensive UI testing for guided experiences and visual components by using the UI Test Automation Model (UTAM) framework. UTAM improves deployment reliability by validating end-to-end workflows. Write UI-driven tests for Omniscripts and Flexcards that validate full user journeys exactly as they appear on screen. UTAM interacts directly with the interface to test user inputs, navigation, actions, data rendering, and visual states.

notes.feature_name: Get Instant Product Assistance and Troubleshooting with Omnistudio Assistance AI Agent
notes.description: Use the Omnistudio Assistance AI pilot agent to get context-aware guidance directly in the designer. Whether you’re a designer, developer, or implementation specialist, the agent provides instant, relevant information about any Omnistudio component or element that you’re working with. It can also provide a complete build plan that helps architect end-to-end solutions, based on an industry vertical. The agent can also run design-time diagnostics to identify gaps and avoid runtime failures.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Enhancements in Omnistudio
notes.description: Build inclusive user interfaces by using the accessibility enhancements in Flexcard and Omniscript elements. These enhancements cover many accessibility requirements, such as enhanced screen reader announcements, easier navigation, and a more powerful UI experience. Some enhancements are only available when you turn on the Runtime Accessibility setting in the Flexcard and Omniscript designers. For instance, this setting unlocks new properties for elements such as Radio, Radio Group, Block, and Data Table. Other changes apply even without turning on this setting.

notes.feature_name: Is Null Operator in Data Mappers
notes.description: Use the new IS NULL operator in Omnistudio Data Mapper Extract and Turbo Extract to filter null or empty records. Previously, the equality operator (=) didn’t consistently handle null filtering, often requiring complex workarounds. For example, to get records with empty account IDs, a Data Mapper operation such as AccountId = null AND Phone != null was required. With the IS NULL operator, you can explicitly filter blank fields, without adding an additional condition, such as != null.

notes.feature_name: Embed Flexcards and Omniscripts on LWR Experience Cloud Sites
notes.description: Embed Flexcards and Omniscripts on your Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) Experience Cloud sites, which offer enhanced performance and scalability. To create faster guided interactions for your users, use the combined power of LWR’s speed and Omnistudio’s customization options. In Spring ’26, we removed limitations and provided workarounds where a complete fix isn’t available.

notes.feature_name: Removal of Hosted Content for Omnistudio for Managed Packages
notes.description: Some readme files and sample data packs have been removed from Omnistudio for Managed Packages help. We'll let you know if we bring them back.

notes.feature_name: UI Test Automation Model (UTAM) for Omniscripts and Flexcards
notes.description: Omnistudio now supports comprehensive UI testing for guided experiences and visual components by using the UI Test Automation Model (UTAM) framework. UTAM improves deployment reliability by validating end-to-end workflows. Write UI-driven tests for Omniscripts and Flexcards that validate full user journeys exactly as they appear on screen. UTAM interacts directly with the interface to test user inputs, navigation, actions, data rendering, and visual states.

notes.feature_name: Omnistudio Assistance AI Agent (Pilot)
notes.description: Use the Omnistudio Assistance AI pilot agent to get context-aware guidance directly in the designer. Whether you’re a designer, developer, or implementation specialist, the agent provides instant, relevant information about any Omnistudio component or element that you’re working with. It can also provide a complete build plan that helps architect end-to-end solutions, based on an industry vertical. The agent can also run design-time diagnostics to identify gaps and avoid runtime failures.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions where Omnistudio is enabled
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Enhancements in Omnistudio
notes.description: Build inclusive user interfaces by using the accessibility enhancements in Flexcard and Omniscript elements. These enhancements cover many accessibility requirements, such as enhanced screen reader announcements, easier navigation, and a more powerful UI experience. Some enhancements are only available when you turn on the Runtime Accessibility setting in the Flexcard and Omniscript designers.
notes.activation_required: Turn on the Runtime Accessibility setting

notes.feature_name: Runtime Accessibility Enhancements
notes.description: These enhancements make your components meet WCAG 2.2 web accessibility standards, helping screen reader and keyboard-only users navigate your applications more effectively. Specific improvements include improved semantics, enhanced navigation, and better visual feedback. Navigate actions now use real links rather than placeholder links. Screen readers announce when links open in a new window. Keyboard users can now access edit icons in Data Tables on focus. All actions support Space, Enter, and Escape keys. Selected options in Multi-select and Radio elements now display a checkmark for clearer visual indication beyond color alone.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions where Omnistudio is enabled

notes.feature_name: Radio Enhancements
notes.description: Improved keyboard navigation. Support for new attributes: role=radiogroup, aria-required, and aria-invalid. Image and color-pick radio buttons now show a visible checkmark when selected. Users can use arrow keys to navigate color-pick options.

notes.feature_name: Radio Group Enhancements
notes.description: The Set All checkbox now behaves correctly at runtime and can’t be unchecked once set. When the focus is removed from a specific element, validation is triggered. The DOM structure is updated for better accessibility.

notes.feature_name: Block Enhancements
notes.description: You can now configure the heading level (H1-H6) for blocks to enforce a logical document structure. A confirmation prompt is available when deleting items in a block.
