notes.feature_name: Data Table Enhancements
notes.description: Meaningful row labels for screen readers are now supported. Action buttons inside the table now have contextual labels. Screen readers announce updates to the table content dynamically. Improved navigation for edit icons and sort buttons (focus returns to the sort button after activation). Screen readers now announce Loading states.

notes.feature_name: Typeahead
notes.description: An Edit Icon Label field is added so you can specify a name for the name of the edit icon. The default remains Edit, but you can customize the label as per your preference. This change is specific to the edit mode. The option list container’s border maintains the minimum contrast ratio of 3:1 with its background color. This change is specific to SLDS Plus theme. When the dropdown menu opens, focus is automatically set to the first selectable option. This change is specific to the Lookup mode.

notes.feature_name: Action
notes.description: Navigate actions now announce when something opens in a new window. Keyboard navigation is enhanced to mirror mouse click behavior. New ARIA attributes are added for the Select Cards action. They announce checkbox actions such as selection, de-selection, and so on.

notes.feature_name: Set as Disabled Property for Inputs
notes.description: A new Set as disabled property is available for these elements, so that you can explicitly disable them on the pages that they’re used on. This includes Currency, Email, Number, Password, Range, Telephone, Text, Text Area, URL, and Lookup. Checkbox: The Read-Only property is replaced by Set as disabled. Multi-select: The Set as disabled property is added.

notes.feature_name: Select
notes.description: The default placeholder '-- No Value --' is changed to 'Select a value'. Focus remains on the input while typing. Value changes are reflected immediately. The autocomplete input field is added.

notes.feature_name: Lookup
notes.description: With the new Clear Value option, you can clear the pre-selected value when the dropdown opens. The autocomplete input field is added. The search icon is removed from the runtime view.

notes.feature_name: Icon
notes.description: Two new custom attributes are added, namely iconNameLeftAltText and iconNameRightAltText.

notes.feature_name: Telephone
notes.description: Visual contrast is improved for better readability.

notes.feature_name: Multi-Select
notes.description: Image multi-select options now display a visible checkmark.

notes.feature_name: Is Null Operator in Data Mappers
notes.description: Use the new IS NULL operator in Omnistudio Data Mapper Extract and Turbo Extract to filter null values.

notes.feature_name: IS NULL Operator for Null Filtering
notes.description: The IS NULL operator has been introduced to allow explicit filtering of blank fields in the Data Mapper. This change addresses previous inconsistencies with the equality operator (=) in handling null filtering, which often required complex workarounds. For example, to get records with empty account IDs, a Data Mapper operation such as AccountId = null AND Phone != null was required. Now, users can filter records with empty account IDs more straightforwardly.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions where Omnistudio is enabled

notes.feature_name: Embed Flexcards and Omniscripts on LWR Experience Cloud Sites
notes.description: Flexcards and Omniscripts can now be embedded on Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) Experience Cloud sites, enhancing performance and scalability. This feature allows for faster guided interactions by leveraging LWR’s speed alongside Omnistudio’s customization options. Limitations have been removed, and workarounds have been provided where complete fixes are not available.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions where Omnistudio is enabled

notes.feature_name: Omnistudio API Documentation Relocation
notes.description: Omnistudio business APIs, metadata API types, and Apex reference documentation have been relocated to the Industries Common Resources Developer Guide.

notes.feature_name: Removal of Hosted Content for Omnistudio for Managed Packages
notes.description: Some readme files and sample data packs have been removed from Omnistudio for Managed Packages help. The status of these resources will be communicated if they are to be reinstated.

notes.feature_name: Automate Referral Tracking with B2B Referral Flows
notes.description: Use the B2B Referral Lead Flow and B2B Referral Opportunity Flow to create referral entities automatically. The flows manage the referral lifecycle, from lead creation and qualification to opportunity closure and reward issuance. When a partner submits a lead, the Lead flow creates referral records and manages status updates as the lead moves from new to qualified. When an opportunity is won, the Opportunity flow updates the referral records and issues the appropriate rewards.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions where Omnistudio is enabled

notes.feature_name: Create and Track Joint Business Plans with Your Partners
notes.description: A joint business plan, now generally available, helps channel managers and partner reps align on shared goals, KPIs, and actions for a defined planning period. Capture strategic priorities, build measurable objectives, define action plans, and collaborate with partners. This release adds a dedicated joint account plan record type, enhanced objective measure support, Partner Central access, and purpose-built templates for partner planning.

notes.feature_name: Include Referral Codes in Deal Registrations
notes.description: Support tracking and reward attribution by giving partners referral codes to submit when they register a deal. The referral code field is captured on both Lead and Opportunity records for visibility across the sales process.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Partner Success Agent Performance with Agent Analytics
notes.description: Gain a complete overview of your Partner Success Agent’s effectiveness and usage metrics with the Agent Analytics dashboard. Channel leaders can now track partner engagement, deflection rates, and session trends to optimize performance. Filter data by time frame, channel, topic, or action to pinpoint specific insights. Access these metrics directly from the Agent for Studio Analytics tab.

notes.feature_name: Automate Referral Tracking with B2B Referral Flows
notes.description: Use the B2B Referral Lead Flow and B2B Referral Opportunity Flow to create referral entities automatically. The flows manage the referral lifecycle, from lead creation and qualification to opportunity closure and reward issuance. When a partner submits a lead, the Lead flow creates referral records and manages status updates as the lead moves from new to qualified. When an opportunity is won, the Opportunity flow updates the referral records and issues the appropriate rewards.

notes.feature_name: Create and Track Joint Business Plans with Your Partners
notes.description: A joint business plan, now generally available, helps channel managers and partner reps align on shared goals, KPIs, and actions for a defined planning period. Capture strategic priorities, build measurable objectives, define action plans, and collaborate with partners. This release adds a dedicated joint account plan record type, enhanced objective measure support, Partner Central access, and purpose-built templates for partner planning.

notes.feature_name: Include Referral Codes in Deal Registrations
notes.description: Support tracking and reward attribution by giving partners referral codes to submit when they register a deal. The referral code field is captured on both Lead and Opportunity records for visibility across the sales process.
notes.activation_required: Enable referral codes in Partner Cloud setup

notes.feature_name: Monitor Partner Success Agent Performance with Agent Analytics
notes.description: Gain a complete overview of your Partner Success Agent’s effectiveness and usage metrics with the Agent Analytics dashboard. Channel leaders can now track partner engagement, deflection rates, and session trends to optimize performance. Filter data by time frame, channel, topic, or action to pinpoint specific insights. Access these metrics directly from the Agent for Studio Analytics tab.
notes.activation_required: Enable Agentforce and provision Data Cloud in your org. From Setup, navigate to Einstein Audit Analytics and Monitoring Setup to turn on Agent for Session Tracing. Then, install PRM Agent Analytics from the Agent Analytics setup page to view the dashboard.

notes.feature_name: Promotions in Agentforce Revenue Management (Beta)
notes.description: Pricing designers can set up promotions that users apply to transactions. Developers can use objects and APIs to manage promotions on sales transactions.

notes.feature_name: Product Catalog Management
notes.description: Manage product data in the cache by generating, refreshing, or emptying it, offering flexible options to synchronize data efficiently. Product Catalog Management now supports higher configurable limits for searchable and filterable attributes, which improves product discovery for large catalogs. Users can select more than 20 products during product discovery and add them to a transaction.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Pricing
notes.description: Define pricing rules across complex, multi-level quotes by using conditional ascending propagation and cross-field horizontal calculations. Simplify pricing logic with conditional IF statements. Accelerate debugging by using auto-numbered steps and element descriptions in the now-renamed Revenue Cloud Operations Console. Improve troubleshooting accuracy with Advanced Price Log Settings and seamlessly deploy entire pricing workflow structures by packaging procedure plans.

notes.feature_name: Product Configurator
notes.description: Deliver clear, localized troubleshooting guidance with full translation support for every run-time message. Complete complex bundle configurations faster by using a streamlined interface to edit attributes and clone product instances directly from component option cards. Improve configuration performance with non-blocking UI behavior for options, and troubleshoot configurations with configuration logs. Access the Configurator API by using a Lightning web component, and use Lightning Message Service events to update fields in a third-party Configurator component.

notes.feature_name: Transaction Management
notes.description: Manage complex deal structures easily by creating multiple ramp schedule groups, and amend ramped and nonramped assets in a single transaction. Set up quote line import effortlessly in multicurrency orgs, and automatically populate records related to imported quote lines. Handle transactions easily with advanced filtering, automated and persistent line sorting, and faster instant pricing. Process amendment, renewal, or cancellation transactions before the start date of an existing future-dated order.

notes.feature_name: Advanced Approvals
notes.description: As an approval designer, use custom flow logic to auto-approve resubmitted records. Approve high-value record requests faster by overriding approval conditions easily. Enhance your smart approval logic by configuring step conditions with eight additional data types and up to 30 conditions for approval stage and step criteria. Create detailed approval email templates for up to 8 different scenarios.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator
notes.description: Extend orchestration capabilities to any business transaction. Insert custom logic between decomposition and plan generation to derive and update fulfillment data. Prevent callout step failures as they are paused during external system downtime. Migrate rules efficiently between Salesforce orgs. Use Decomposition Workspace for better clarity and graphical rule design for Enterprise Price Catalog products. Orchestrate Industries Configure, Price, Quote orders through direct integration with Enterprise Price Catalog and orchestrate move and change of plan orders.

notes.feature_name: Usage Management
notes.description: Improve the efficiency of your usage model by streamlining product setup using validation tools and automating asset creation for complex usage products. Enhance pricing consistency and accuracy through rate capture, proactively monitor daily usage and overages to mitigate unexpected charges, and expand real-time visibility into customer wallet balances within Experience Cloud sites.

notes.feature_name: Billing
notes.description: Maintain accurate billing, reduce manual effort, and strengthen a reliable quote-to-cash process. Keep billing precise during complex updates and simplify customer inquiry with end-to-end dispute resolution process. Allocate shared charges across all parties and maintain consistent, audit-ready records. Streamline tax reporting with enhanced regional identifiers and product details. Manage payment adjustments easily and define custom rules to retry failed payments. Buyers can save their preferred payment methods for faster checkout.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Contracts
notes.description: Contract authors and template designers have greater control over how they structure, style, and review contract content. Improvements to section behavior, clause formatting, and profile-based access help maintain consistent layouts, protect sensitive content, and make sure that the intended users participate in internal reviews. Expanded reconciliation and token capabilities keep data accurate across contracts, line items, and related records. Large and complex documents are more responsive during editing, comparison, and check-in. Document Template migration improvements further preserve document structure and clause relationships as they move between Salesforce orgs.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Document Generation
notes.description: Generate clearer documents with precise data by applying data filters, transformation logic, and richer token coverage. These updates help make sure that structured content, nested values, and line item details are present accurately. Generate large documents more efficiently, even when they include substantial content or complex formatting. Achieve consistent in-browser previews by using the hybrid file handling setting. Remove interim previews in Omniscripts to keep only the final version and reduce storage use.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce for Revenue Management
notes.description: Support partner quoting with rule-based product recommendations and expand billing data access for internal teams. Improve invoice charge explanations for community users. Identify token over-consumption with automated generation of targeted token pack quotes.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Go Enhancements
notes.description: We've made ease-of-use enhancements with Salesforce Go by supporting more features related to Agentforce, Contracts, Document Generation, and Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator.

notes.feature_name: Promotions in Agentforce Revenue Management
notes.description: Pricing designers can set up promotions that users apply to transactions. Developers can use objects and APIs to manage promotions on sales transactions.

notes.feature_name: Promotions in Agentforce Revenue Management
notes.description: Empower pricing designers to create manual and automatic promotions that offer discounts on products and categories. Designers define promotion eligibility based on rules and sales channels, and specify how to evaluate multiple applied promotions. Show your users, such as sales reps, partners, and customers, these promotions when they browse products and catalogs. Apply automatic promotions to lines when users add products to transactions. Users can apply manual promotions when they configure products and manage lines. They can see applied discounts in the price waterfall and the applied promotions on assets. They can also apply promotions when they amend or renew assets.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST API for Promotions
notes.description: Simplify the sales workflow by verifying and applying discounts accurately by using details of eligible promotions.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Objects for Promotions in Agentforce Revenue Management
notes.description: Store and access promotion-related data with these new objects and changes to existing Agentforce Revenue Management, formerly Revenue Cloud, objects.

notes.feature_name: Specify the date and time when a promotion is applied to an order item
notes.description: Use the AppliedPromotionDate field on the existing OrderItemAdjustmentLineItem object.

notes.feature_name: Specify the coupon code to apply a manual promotion to an order item
notes.description: Use the CouponCode field on the existing OrderItemAdjustmentLineItem object.

notes.feature_name: Specify the date and time when a promotion is applied to a quote line
notes.description: Use the AppliedPromotionDate field on the existing QuoteLinePriceAdjustment object.

notes.feature_name: Specify the coupon code to apply a manual promotion to a quote line
notes.description: Use the CouponCode field on the existing QuoteLinePriceAdjustment object.

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST API for Promotions
notes.description: Simplify the sales workflow by verifying and applying discounts accurately by using details of eligible promotions. Retrieve eligible promotions for specific line items within a quote or an order by making a POST request to the /revenue/transaction-management/sales-transactions/actions/get-eligible-promotions resource. New request body: Get Promotions Info Input. New response body: Eligible Promotions List.

notes.feature_name: Manage product data in the cache
notes.description: Manage product data in the cache by generating, refreshing, or emptying it, offering flexible options to synchronize data efficiently. Product Catalog Management now supports higher configurable limits for searchable and filterable attributes, which improves product discovery for large catalogs. Users can select more than 20 products during product discovery and add them to a transaction.

notes.feature_name: Simplified Product Data Cache Refresh
notes.description: You can now easily manage product data in the cache by generating the cache for all products, refreshing existing products, or emptying the entire cache. This enhancement provides flexible, controlled options to synchronize your data. You can choose the action that best meets your cache management requirements for maximum efficiency. End-users benefit from optimal loading times.

notes.feature_name: Select More Products During Product Discovery
notes.description: Select more than 20 products during product discovery and add them to a transaction. The updated Bulk Product Details API now retrieves comprehensive details for a greater number of products simultaneously. This change benefits customers who frequently select multiple products from a category, leading to faster and more efficient transactions.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Connect REST APIs in Product Catalog Management
notes.description: Specify Enterprise Product Catalog (EPC) as a catalog source, and extend Product Details API to support your unique custom fields and objects. You can also get product classification details for EPC with the new API enhancements.

notes.feature_name: Simplified Product Data Cache Refresh
notes.description: You can now easily manage product data in the cache by generating the cache for all products, refreshing existing products, or emptying the entire cache. This enhancement provides flexible, controlled options to synchronize your data. You can choose the action that best meets your cache management requirements for maximum efficiency. End-users benefit from optimal loading times and access to the latest product details via the Product Detail API.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Product Classification Details Input
notes.description: Get product classification details for EPC. Make a POST request to the /revenue/product-catalog-management/product-classifications/details resource by specifying the catalogSystems input property value as epc.

notes.feature_name: Product Details API Enhancements
notes.description: Specify the name of the catalog system to retrieve product details for a specified product ID. Make a GET request to the /connect/pcm/products/productId resource. New request parameter: catalogSystems. Specify either epc or pcm as the value.

notes.feature_name: Bulk Product Details Input
notes.description: This request body has this new property: catalogSystems —Name of the catalog system to retrieve the details for specified product IDs. You can specify either epc or pcm as the value.

notes.feature_name: Product Details API Customization
notes.description: Improve product data accuracy and customization through partial-period usage details for different product configurations. Get the proration policy details for each product selling model option by specifying the details in Product Details API’s additionalFields property.

notes.feature_name: Pricing Rules Definition
notes.description: Define pricing rules across complex, multi-level quotes by using conditional ascending propagation and cross-field horizontal calculations. Simplify pricing logic with conditional IF statements. Accelerate debugging by using auto-numbered steps and element descriptions in the now-renamed Revenue Cloud Operations Console. Improve troubleshooting accuracy with Advanced Price Log Settings and seamlessly deploy entire pricing workflow structures by packaging procedure plans.

notes.feature_name: Smarter Price Propagation
notes.description: Manage complex, multi-level quotes by defining formulas that calculate and propagate discounts and totals throughout the quote hierarchy. Simplify pricing configuration for complex quote structures.

notes.feature_name: Streamline Complex Quote Calculations with Smarter Price Propagation
notes.description: Manage complex, multi-level quotes by defining formulas that calculate and propagate discounts and totals throughout the quote hierarchy. Simplify pricing configuration for complex quote structures with up to 5 levels of nesting. Build consistent pricing flows by using ascending propagation to conditionally roll up totals and discounts to the parent level. Use horizontal calculations to compute values based on other fields within the same quote line or group.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Package Your Pricing Workflow Seamlessly
notes.description: Migrate entire pricing solutions across Salesforce orgs by adding procedure plans directly to your deployment package. Transfer the complete execution flow of pricing and discovery procedures to reduce manual setup effort. Deploy your validated pricing workflow with speed and accuracy to ensure immediate consistency in every target org.

notes.feature_name: Troubleshoot Pricing Elements with Advanced Price Log Settings
notes.description: Use Advanced Price Log Settings to collect detailed diagnostic data for complex pricing elements. The logs capture input values and complete exception details for elements such as Attribute-Based Price, Derived Price, and other logic-heavy elements. This framework streamlines troubleshooting and performance analysis so that admins can identify the root cause of issues.

notes.feature_name: Build Pricing Logic with Conditional IF Statements
notes.description: Solve complex pricing scenarios by using conditional IF statements and nested logic directly within the Formula-Based Pricing element. Pricing designers can now replicate complex business logic, such as intricate calculations for product pricing by using basis points or advanced logic for promotional discounts, without relying on custom code. This enhancement optimizes procedure readability and accelerates debugging.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Debugging of Pricing Flows
notes.description: Use auto-numbered steps and element descriptions in a pricing procedure to improve readability and provide a clear visual map of the execution path in the Pricing Operations Console. The numbering automatically adjusts when elements are added or moved, reducing manual effort and supporting faster, more accurate troubleshooting across pricing procedures.

notes.feature_name: Pricing Operations Console Is Now Revenue Cloud Operations Console
notes.description: To better align with the data it presents, the Pricing Operations Console is now renamed to Revenue Cloud Operations Console. This change does not affect the console's functionality or user experience. Product documentation and in-app terminology have been updated to reflect this change.

notes.feature_name: Package Your Pricing Workflow Seamlessly
notes.description: Migrate entire pricing solutions across Salesforce orgs by adding procedure plans directly to your deployment package. Transfer the complete execution flow of pricing and discovery procedures to reduce manual setup effort. Deploy your validated pricing workflow with speed and accuracy to ensure immediate consistency in every target org.

notes.feature_name: Troubleshoot Pricing Elements with Advanced Price Log Settings
notes.description: Use Advanced Price Log Settings to collect detailed diagnostic data for complex pricing elements. The logs capture input values and complete exception details for elements such as Attribute-Based Price, Derived Price, and other logic-heavy elements. This framework streamlines troubleshooting and performance analysis so that admins can identify the root cause of issues.
notes.activation_required: From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Salesforce Pricing, and then select Advanced Price Log Settings. Turn on advanced logs for the elements that you want to debug.

notes.feature_name: Build Pricing Logic with Conditional IF Statements
notes.description: Solve complex pricing scenarios by using conditional IF statements and nested logic directly within the Formula-Based Pricing element. Pricing designers can now replicate complex business logic, such as intricate calculations for product pricing by using basis points or advanced logic for promotional discounts, without relying on custom code. This enhancement optimizes procedure readability and accelerates debugging.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Debugging of Pricing Flows
notes.description: Use auto-numbered steps and element descriptions in a pricing procedure to improve readability and provide a clear visual map of the execution path in the Pricing Operations Console. The numbering automatically adjusts when elements are added or moved, reducing manual effort and supporting faster, more accurate troubleshooting across pricing procedures.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Pricing Operations Console Is Now Revenue Cloud Operations Console
notes.description: To better align with the data it presents, the Pricing Operations Console is now renamed to Revenue Cloud Operations Console. This change does not affect the console's functionality or user experience. Product documentation and in-app terminology have been updated to reflect this change.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Product Configurator
notes.description: Deliver clear, localized troubleshooting guidance with full translation support for every run-time message. Complete complex bundle configurations faster by using a streamlined interface to edit attributes and clone product instances directly from component option cards. Improve configuration performance with non-blocking UI behavior for options, and troubleshoot configurations with configuration logs. Access the Configurator API by using a Lightning web component, and use Lightning Message Service events to update fields in a third-party Configurator component.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Troubleshooting for Global Teams with Translation Support for Run-Time Messages
notes.description: Provide your sales reps with localized messages for warnings, errors, or other information in the Configurator. Set up custom labels from Constraint Builder for translating all run-time messages defined within a constraint model. Use bulk label generation to accelerate the label setup. Reuse existing labels easily with autocomplete options in CML Editor and Visual Builder. Boost adoption and reduce confusion with the capability to define clear, understandable messages in local languages for troubleshooting and guidance.

notes.feature_name: Improve Usability with a More Flexible and Intuitive Configurator Interface
notes.description: Sales reps can gain better control of their product configurations with a more streamlined Configurator interface. Make informed decisions faster by viewing, comparing, and editing product attributes and context fields directly on the component option cards.

notes.feature_name: Enable Non-Blocking UI Behavior for Attributes and Options
notes.description: With non-blocking UI behavior for attributes and options, you can change multiple values on a product without waiting for system response, to speed up the configuration process. After the changes load, actions including Save, Save and Exit, Cancel, and Update Prices are available.

notes.feature_name: Use Configuration Logs to Debug Configurations
notes.description: Generate and review configuration logs to analyze configuration behavior and address inefficiencies. Use the configuration logs to make sure that your configurations perform as expected.

notes.feature_name: Access Configurator API More Easily by Using a Lightning Web Component
notes.description: Use a wire adapter with a Lightning web component to access Configurator API. The wire adapter simplifies the process for fetching data, compared to using Connect API. Use Configurator API to build a custom configurator UI and incorporate existing first-party configurator UI components as needed.

notes.feature_name: Update Sales Transaction Fields in a Third-Party Configurator UI
notes.description: Use Lightning Message Service (LMS) events to update all fields on a sales transaction item, including custom fields, for a third-party configurator UI components. With the increased flexibility, third-party components can easily communicate with Data Manager in the product configurator flow.

notes.feature_name: Updates in Default Product Configurator Flow
notes.description: The Default Product Configurator flow has new attributes. If you’ve cloned the Default Product Configurator flow before Spring ’26, manually map the new attributes in your customized flow, or clone the default flow and apply your customizations again.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Troubleshooting for Global Teams with Translation Support for Run-Time Messages
notes.description: Provide your sales reps with localized messages for warnings, errors, or other information in the Configurator. Set up custom labels from Constraint Builder for translating all run-time messages defined within a constraint model. Use bulk label generation to accelerate the label setup. Reuse existing labels easily with autocomplete options in CML Editor and Visual Builder. Boost adoption and reduce confusion with the capability to define clear, understandable messages in local languages for troubleshooting and guidance.

notes.feature_name: Improved Configurator Interface
notes.description: Sales reps can gain better control of their product configurations with a more streamlined Configurator interface. Make informed decisions faster by viewing, comparing, and editing product attributes and context fields directly on the component option cards. Easily add multiple instances of a dynamic product or clone product instances with their current configurations. These enhancements, providing flexibility and a more consolidated view, help sales reps complete bundle configurations faster with fewer clicks and less scrolling. Additionally, in the Configurator interface, you can now review errors and warnings in a persistent error component that remains visible as you scroll, and see more information at a glance with a denser compact layout that reduces whitespace. The new layout prioritizes fixed positioning for key fields: Product Name, Quantity, Product Selling Model, and Net Price. Any custom fields added will be visible upon expanding the option card.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Enable Non-Blocking UI Behavior for Attributes and Options
notes.description: With non-blocking UI behavior for attributes and options, you can change multiple values on a product without waiting for system response, to speed up the configuration process. After the changes load, actions including Save, Save and Exit, Cancel, and Update Prices are available.
notes.breaking_changes: Quantity values are no longer supported for non-blocking UI behavior. Quantity changes are blocked when API calls are in progress.

notes.feature_name: Use Configuration Logs to Debug Configurations
notes.description: Generate and review configuration logs to analyze configuration behavior and address inefficiencies. Use the configuration logs to make sure that your configurations perform as expected.
notes.activation_required: Requires Product Configuration Constraints Designer permission set

notes.feature_name: Access Configurator API More Easily by Using a Lightning Web Component
notes.description: Use a wire adapter with a Lightning web component to access Configurator API.

notes.feature_name: Configurator API
notes.description: Simplifies the process for fetching data, compared to using Connect API. Use Configurator API to build a custom configurator UI and incorporate existing first-party configurator UI components as needed.
notes.security_notes: To use Configurator API, you need the Product Configurator API User user permission.

notes.feature_name: Update Sales Transaction Fields in a Third-Party Configurator UI
notes.description: Use Lightning Message Service (LMS) events to update all fields on a sales transaction item, including custom fields, for a third-party configurator UI components. With the increased flexibility, third-party components can easily communicate with Data Manager in the product configurator flow.

notes.feature_name: Updates in Default Product Configurator Flow
notes.description: The Default Product Configurator flow has new attributes. If you’ve cloned the Default Product Configurator flow before Spring ’26, manually map the new attributes in your customized flow, or clone the default flow and apply your customizations again.
notes.breaking_changes: If you’ve cloned the Default Product Configurator flow before Spring ’26, you need to manually map the new attributes.

notes.feature_name: Transaction Context ID Attribute
notes.description: Use the new Transaction Context ID attribute of the Input type on the Product Configurator Data Manager flow component.

notes.feature_name: Display Option Card Attributes
notes.description: A boolean value that indicates whether to display the product attributes within the option card. Use the new Display Option Card Attributes attribute of the Input type on the Product Configurator Option Groups flow component.

notes.feature_name: Option Card Attributes Limit
notes.description: The number of product attributes to be displayed within the option card. Use the new Option Card Attributes Limit attribute of the Input type on the Product Configurator Option Groups flow component.

notes.feature_name: Display Clone Option
notes.description: A boolean value that indicates whether to display the Clone option within the product option card. Use the new Display Clone Option attribute of the Input type on the Product Configurator Option Groups flow component.

notes.feature_name: Eligible Promotions
notes.description: A collection of Apex ProductConfig__Promotions records that contain the promotions eligible for the product. Use the new Eligible Promotions attribute. It's of Input type on the Product Configurator Summary flow component and of Output type on the Product Configurator Data Manager flow component.

notes.feature_name: Messages in Fixed Position
notes.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the messages component is fixed in position when scrolling. Use the new Messages in Fixed Position attribute. It's of both Input and Output types on the Product Configurator Data Manager flow component, and of Input type on the Product Configurator Messages, Product Configurator Transaction Header, and Product Configurator Summary flow components.

notes.feature_name: Messages
notes.description: A collection of Apex ProductConfig__Message records that contain alerts, warnings, and errors encountered by the component. Use the new Messages attribute of the Input type on the Product Configurator Transaction Header and Product Configurator Summary flow components.

notes.feature_name: Price Total Summary Section Visibility
notes.description: A boolean value that indicates whether the section displaying price totals in the Summary component is shown at run time. Use the new Price Total Summary Section Visibility attribute. It's of Input type on the Product Configurator Summary flow component and of Output type on the Product Configurator Data Manager flow component.

notes.feature_name: Autopopulate Default Child Lines and Attributes During Quote Line Import
notes.description: Speed up quoting and improve accuracy by using the new Data Processing Engine definition to autopopulate default records related to imported quote lines. When users import quote lines from CSV files, the import process populates default child lines for bundled products, and default quote line item attributes and their values. Users can also import static product bundles and products with static attributes.

notes.feature_name: Set Up Quote Line Import Easily When Multiple Currencies Are Enabled
notes.description: Quickly configure quote line imports by using the new prebuilt Data Processing Engine definition template when your Salesforce org uses multiple currencies. This template reduces the manual setup steps previously required to add and map currency fields.

notes.feature_name: Manage Complex Deals and Amendments by Using Multiple Ramp Schedule Groups
notes.description: Enable your users to create and manage multiple, independent ramp schedule groups on a single quote or order to handle complex deal structures. Users can also amend non-ramped and ramped assets—including ramped assets with different asset state period dates—in a single transaction. Sales reps can perform complex actions, such as 'rip and replace,' to remove assets and add new ones in a single transaction.

notes.feature_name: Enrich Navigation by Using Advanced Filtering
notes.description: Your sales reps and partners can now filter all quote and order lines including ramped lines, errored lines, and unconfigured lines by using predefined filters. They can also create advanced filters to target specific fields, operators, and values. They can manage complex transactions easily by applying filters across all groups or selected groups.

notes.feature_name: Automate Consistent Line Item Sequencing on Quotes and Orders (Pilot)
notes.description: Sales reps can control how line items show up on quotes and orders by introducing an automated and persistent sort order. Line items now appear in the sequence in which they're added. Automatic Line Item Sequencing (pilot) maintains item order when converting a quote to an order, and resolves the unpredictable item order shuffling that previously occurred in processing. Sales reps can also manually reorder items, providing the reliable sequencing needed to adjust the order of items to meet specific business needs.

notes.feature_name: Show Precise Discounts in the Price Waterfall
notes.description: Show your sales reps discount percentages and amount adjustments in the price waterfall with the correct decimal precision. Percentage discounts show up to two decimal places, and amount adjustments follow the currency scale. Help sales reps understand discount values accurately and remove the confusion caused by rounded percentages.

notes.feature_name: Track Product Swap, Upgrade, and Downgrade Amendments
notes.description: Make sure that transactions are transparent and accurately track the intent of every sale change. Agentforce Revenue Management now natively supports Swaps, Upgrades, and Downgrades as distinct amendment types, which boosts the efficiency of your sales reps. New connections among the related quote line items, order items, and asset actions make sure that these transactions are recognizable and auditable. Sales reps save time and effort used in the previous method that simply recorded them as a cancellation and new product sale.

notes.feature_name: Edit Orders with Future Start Dates
notes.description: Edit any order that has a future start date to reflect customer-requested changes. Save sales reps time and effort used in the previous method that recorded the changes as a cancellation and new product sale. Your sales team can now perform all transaction amendment types, including adding, swapping, upgrades, or product quantity changes to orders with future start dates. Keep customer orders up-to-date and accurate.

notes.feature_name: Restrict User Access to Sensitive Data When Pricing Quotes and Orders
notes.description: Give your users the ability to price quotes and orders even when they don’t have access to underlying sensitive data required for pricing. Enhance security and limit the access to sensitive data, such as product costs.

notes.feature_name: Instant Pricing Active by Default
notes.description: Instant Pricing provides users the ability to recalculate prices immediately when they edit a line, instead of only upon saving the transaction. Simplify transaction management by turning on Instant Pricing by default on quote and order pages. Users can turn off Instant Pricing if needed.

notes.feature_name: Changed UserUIPreference Object in Transaction Management
notes.description: Do more with the changed UserUIPreference object in Transaction Management.

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST API in Transaction Management
notes.description: Enable troubleshooting and improve the reliability of transaction processing.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Invocable Actions in Transaction Management
notes.description: Get flexible and granular control over grouped asset pricing during renewal. Also, streamline the process of replacing existing assets.

notes.feature_name: Changed Tooling API Object in Transaction Management
notes.description: Gain more control over rate synchronization and ensure pricing consistency across transactions.

notes.feature_name: Autopopulate Default Child Lines and Attributes During Quote Line Import
notes.description: Speed up quoting and improve accuracy by using the new Data Processing Engine definition to autopopulate default records related to imported quote lines. When users import quote lines from CSV files, the import process populates default child lines for bundled products, and default quote line item attributes and their values. Users can also import static product bundles and products with static attributes.

notes.feature_name: Set Up Quote Line Import Easily When Multiple Currencies Are Enabled
notes.description: Quickly configure quote line imports by using the new prebuilt Data Processing Engine definition template when your Salesforce org uses multiple currencies. This template reduces the manual setup steps previously required to add and map currency fields.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Manage Complex Deals and Amendments by Using Multiple Ramp Schedule Groups
notes.description: Enable your users to create and manage multiple, independent ramp schedule groups on a single quote or order to handle complex deal structures. Users can also amend non-ramped and ramped assets—including ramped assets with different asset state period dates—in a single transaction. Sales reps can perform complex actions, such as 'rip and replace,' to remove assets and add new ones in a single transaction.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Advanced Filters for Sales Transaction Line Editor
notes.description: Users can filter configured and unconfigured lines by using predefined filters. They can also create advanced filters to target specific fields, operators, and values. This allows for easier management of complex transactions by applying filters across all groups or selected groups.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Automate Consistent Line Item Sequencing on Quotes and Orders
notes.description: Sales reps can control how line items show up on quotes and orders by introducing an automated and persistent sort order. Line items now appear in the sequence in which they're added. Automatic Line Item Sequencing maintains item order when converting a quote to an order, resolving the unpredictable item order shuffling that previously occurred. Sales reps can also manually reorder items to meet specific business needs.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer’s sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Show Precise Discounts in the Price Waterfall
notes.description: Show your sales reps discount percentages and amount adjustments in the price waterfall with the correct decimal precision. Percentage discounts show up to two decimal places, and amount adjustments follow the currency scale. Help sales reps understand discount values accurately and remove the confusion caused by rounded percentages.

notes.feature_name: Track Product Swap, Upgrade, and Downgrade Amendments
notes.description: Make sure that transactions are transparent and accurately track the intent of every sale change. Agentforce Revenue Management now natively supports Swaps, Upgrades, and Downgrades as distinct amendment types, which boosts the efficiency of your sales reps. New connections among the related quote line items, order items, and asset actions make sure that these transactions are recognizable and auditable. Sales reps save time and effort used in the previous method that simply recorded them as a cancellation and new product sale.

notes.feature_name: Modify Upcoming Orders with Future-Dated Amendments
notes.description: Edit any order that has a future start date to reflect customer-requested changes. Save sales reps time and effort used in the previous method that recorded the changes as a cancellation and new product sale. Your sales team can now perform all transaction amendment types, including adding, swapping, upgrades, or product quantity changes to orders with future start dates. Keep customer orders up-to-date and accurate.

notes.feature_name: Restrict User Access to Sensitive Data When Pricing Quotes and Orders
notes.description: Give your users the ability to price quotes and orders even when they don’t have access to underlying sensitive data required for pricing. Enhance security and limit the access to sensitive data, such as product costs.

notes.feature_name: Save Time by Setting Instant Pricing to Active by Default
notes.description: Instant Pricing provides users the ability to recalculate prices immediately when they edit a line, instead of only upon saving the transaction. Simplify transaction management by turning on Instant Pricing by default on quote and order pages. Users can turn off Instant Pricing if needed.

notes.feature_name: Changed Object in Transaction Management
notes.description: Do more with the changed UserUIPreference object in Transaction Management.

notes.feature_name: Track asynchronous sales transaction requests made by a user
notes.description: Use the new AsyncOperationTrackers field on the existing UserUIPreference object.

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST API in Transaction Management
notes.description: Enable troubleshooting and improve the reliability of transaction processing. Retrieve the asynchronous errors that occur during a sales transaction request by making a GET request to the /revenue/transaction-management/sales-transactions/

notes.feature_name: New response body: Place Sales Transaction Async Error
notes.description: Introduced a new response body for handling errors in the Place Sales Transaction Async process.

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Invocable Actions in Transaction Management
notes.description: Get flexible and granular control over grouped asset pricing during renewal. Streamline the process of replacing existing assets. Add selected assets to a group ramp by specifying additional ramp options using the new rampOptionDetails field on the initiateRenewal action. Initiate asset swaps by creating a quote or an order for a target account or an associated contract using the new initiateAssetSwap action.

notes.feature_name: Changed Tooling API Object in Transaction Management
notes.description: Gain more control over rate synchronization and ensure pricing consistency across transactions. Specify whether to fetch and save catalog rates during quote creation using the RatingPreference field on the existing TransactionProcessingType object.

notes.feature_name: Advanced Approvals
notes.description: As an approval designer, use custom flow logic to auto-approve resubmitted records. Approve high-value record requests faster by overriding approval conditions easily. Enhance your smart approval logic by configuring step conditions with eight additional data types and up to 30 conditions for approval stage and step criteria. Create detailed approval email templates for up to 8 different notification reasons, giving reviewers all the necessary context to act on the request directly from their email.

notes.feature_name: Previous Related Record Details Invocable Action
notes.description: This feature allows the use of the Previous Related Record Details invocable action within the flow to easily capture the previously submitted record's details. The new Use Custom Auto Approval Logic field on the approval step then stores the custom flow’s decision value to determine if the step is auto-approved.

notes.feature_name: Custom Email Templates for Approval Reviews
notes.description: Approval designers can now use Lightning or Visualforce email templates associated with specific approval steps or the entire workflow. These templates can be configured for up to 8 different notification reasons relevant to approval submitters and reviewers, allowing for advanced formatting capabilities and support for custom submitter emails.

notes.feature_name: Skip Condition Checks in Smart Approvals
notes.description: Approval designers can now skip the evaluation of entry conditions in an approval step within a smart approval process, saving approval processing time by avoiding unnecessary condition checks during resubmission evaluation.

notes.feature_name: Additional Data Types for Approval Logic
notes.description: Approval designers can now configure approval step entry conditions using nine additional data types, including Date Time, Boolean, and Currency, allowing for more complex and precise smart approval logic.

notes.feature_name: Increased Conditions for Approval Workflows
notes.description: Approval designers can now define up to 30 conditions for an approval stage exit, approval step entry, and approval step exit in an approval workflow, increasing the previous limit of 10 conditions.

notes.feature_name: Custom Logic for Auto-Approving Resubmissions
notes.description: Approval designers can implement custom logic for auto-approving resubmitted records, overriding smart approval conditions. This allows urgent, high-value records to move quickly through the approval process, with the ability to evaluate necessary criteria using the new Get Previous Related Record Details invocable action.

notes.feature_name: Custom Flow in Background Step
notes.description: Create a custom flow in a background step. Open an approval step. On the step’s properties tab, select Set custom logic for auto-approvals, and specify the decision value of your custom flow in the Auto-Approve Step field.
notes.edition: Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management, formerly Revenue Cloud, with the Revenue Cloud Growth or Revenue Cloud Advanced license where Advanced Approvals is enabled.

notes.feature_name: Custom Email Templates for Key Approval Paths
notes.description: Give approval designers the ability to use Lightning or Visualforce email templates. Designers can associate these templates with specific approval steps or the entire workflow. They can configure these templates for up to 8 different notification reasons that are relevant to approval submitters and reviewers. Previously, the custom email templates configured within the approval workflow lacked advanced formatting capabilities and didn’t support custom submitter emails. Use the new templates to show complex record data in structured formats, such as tables and images, so that your approval reviewers have all the necessary context to act on the requests directly from their email.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management, formerly Revenue Cloud, with the Revenue Cloud Growth or Revenue Cloud Advanced license where Advanced Approvals is enabled.

notes.feature_name: Skip Condition Checks in Smart Approvals
notes.description: Give approval designers the option to skip the evaluation of the entry conditions in an approval step within a smart approval process. Help them save approval processing time by skipping unnecessary condition checks from resubmission evaluation based on your workflow’s context. For instance, if the submitted record description is empty during resubmission, designers can skip the condition if it’s irrelevant to the evaluation.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management, formerly Revenue Cloud, with the Revenue Cloud Growth or Revenue Cloud Advanced license where Advanced Approvals is enabled.

notes.feature_name: Skip Conditions from Smart Approval Evaluation
notes.description: To skip conditions from smart approval evaluation in an approval workflow, you need the Manage Flow user permission. From Setup, in the Quick Find box, find and select Flows. Open the flow that has Smart Approvals turned on, and then open the approval step’s Properties tab. In the Smart Approval Skip Conditions field, enter the sequence numbers of the entry conditions that you want to skip from smart approval evaluation, separated by commas.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Define Complex Smart Approval Logic with More Data Types
notes.description: Configure the approval step entry conditions in an approval workflow by using nine additional data types, such as Date Time, Boolean, and Currency. Previously, you could define conditions for only the Text and Number data types. Help approval designers build complex and precise smart approval logic that aligns closely with your business rules, and reduce manual review time. For example, set a Date step entry condition that requires an approval step during resubmission only if the resubmission date is after a certain date.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Manage Complex Workflows Easily by Adding More Conditions
notes.description: Define up to 30 conditions for an approval stage exit, approval step entry, and approval step exit in an approval workflow. Previously, you defined a maximum of 10 conditions. Give approval designers the flexibility to build workflows that manage complex approval requests and minimize manual reviews for their users.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New and Changed Objects for Advanced Approvals
notes.description: Store and access more data with these new Advanced Approvals objects and changes to existing Advanced Approvals objects. Store the mapping that links specific user-created email templates to different notification events within a workflow using the new ApprovalAlertContentDef object.

notes.feature_name: Specify whether custom logic automatically approves an approval work item in a workflow
notes.description: Use the new DoesUseCustomAutoAppvlLogic field on the existing ApprovalWorkItem object.

notes.feature_name: Specify whether a condition should be skipped in the auto-approval evaluation
notes.description: Use the new IsExcludedFromAutoApproval field on the existing ApprovalWorkItemCondition object.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator
notes.description: Extend orchestration capabilities to any business transaction. Insert custom logic between decomposition and plan generation to derive and update fulfillment data. Prevent callout step failures as they are paused during external system downtime. Migrate rules efficiently between Salesforce orgs. Use Decomposition Workspace for better clarity and graphical rule design for Enterprise Price Catalog products. Orchestrate Industries Configure, Price, Quote orders through direct integration with Enterprise Price Catalog and orchestrate move and change of plan orders.

notes.feature_name: Extend Orchestration to All Business Transaction Types
notes.description: Design and run orchestration for any business process with the usage type framework. Bring your own context definition and automate new business processes for non-sales transactions. For example, automate the Dunning process using the Collections Plan object. Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) further automates generation of a generic, product-independent plans for orders.

notes.feature_name: Plug Custom Logic Between Decomposition and Plan Generation
notes.description: Insert custom logic to update the fulfillment order line item data between the order decomposition and plan generation processes. Gain greater control over the fulfillment process and align your order data with specific fulfillment requirements to craft a more efficient plan. Use the individual invocable actions to run decomposition and orchestration as separate processes independent of each other.

notes.feature_name: Design Decomposition Rules Seamlessly by Using the Enhanced Workspace
notes.description: View the product class-based decomposition rules inherited by a product alongside the product’s decomposition rules in the Decomposition workspace. The canvas also shows the complete hierarchy of the technical bundle structure when products decompose into technical product bundles. This enhanced visibility provides a more comprehensive view of the decomposition rules with increased clarity.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Callout Failures During External System Downtime
notes.description: Configure callout fulfillment steps to stop execution automatically when the external system is under maintenance. This configurable offline support puts the steps on hold to prevent fatal failures. Callout steps on hold appear on the fulfillment plan for fulfillment operators and managers to track and act on.

notes.feature_name: Migrate Rules Between Salesforce Orgs
notes.description: Speed up your deployment cycles and keep data consistent by easily moving decomposition rules and associated condition data between Salesforce orgs.

notes.feature_name: Orchestrate Industries Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) Orders by Using Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO)
notes.description: Use the advanced orchestration capabilities of DRO for Industries CPQ orders. As the platform is preintegrated with Industries CPQ, you can adopt DRO without migrating your commercial product data out of Enterprise Price Catalog (EPC). The preintegrated platform establishes accurate data exchange and a smooth transition.

notes.feature_name: Design and Visualize Decomposition Rules for Enterprise Price Catalog Products
notes.description: Create and manage decomposition rules for Enterprise Price Catalog (EPC) products and product classes by using the graphical interface in the Decomposition Workspace. View the complete hierarchy of the technical bundle structure and make the design process intuitive and user-friendly.

notes.feature_name: Orchestrate Move and Change of Plan Orders from Industries Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ)
notes.description: Develop specialized fulfillment scenarios to manage asset transfers and plan changes in Industries CPQ. Manage asset movement between locations or accounts, and handle upgrades, downgrades, or plan switches after the initial purchase. With Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator, design precise fulfillment logic to manage services effectively, and establish proper execution and dependency management for all related tasks.

notes.feature_name: New Invocable Actions in Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator
notes.description: Manage complex sales transactions more effectively by decomposing and orchestrating quotes or orders independently. Use the new invocable actions to improve the operational efficiency of a sales process.

notes.feature_name: Extend Orchestration to All Business Transaction Types
notes.description: Design and run orchestration for any business process with the usage type framework. Bring your own context definition and automate new business processes for non-sales transactions. For example, automate the Dunning process using the Collections Plan object. Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator (DRO) further automates generation of a generic, product-independent plans for orders.

notes.feature_name: Plug Custom Logic Between Decomposition and Plan Generation
notes.description: Insert custom logic to update the fulfillment order line item data between the order decomposition and plan generation.

notes.feature_name: Plan Generation Processes
notes.description: Gain greater control over the fulfillment process and align your order data with specific fulfillment requirements to craft a more efficient plan. Use the individual invocable actions to run decomposition and orchestration as separate processes independent of each other.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Workspace for Decomposition Rules
notes.description: View the product class-based decomposition rules inherited by a product alongside the product’s decomposition rules in the Decomposition workspace. The canvas also shows the complete hierarchy of the technical bundle structure when products decompose into technical product bundles. This enhanced visibility provides a more comprehensive view of the decomposition rules with increased clarity.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Callout Failures During External System Downtime
notes.description: Configure callout fulfillment steps to stop execution automatically when the external system is under maintenance. This configurable offline support puts the steps on hold to prevent fatal failures. Callout steps on hold appear on the fulfillment plan for fulfillment operators and managers to track and act on.

notes.feature_name: Migrate Rules Between Salesforce Orgs
notes.description: Speed up your deployment cycles and keep data consistent by easily moving decomposition rules.

notes.feature_name: Data API Migration for Revenue Management
notes.description: Use Data API to migrate Product Fulfillment Decomposition Rule, Product Fulfillment Scenario, Fulfillment Step Definition, and Fulfillment Task Assignment Rule records between Salesforce orgs. Use bulk APIs to transfer a large number of records.

notes.feature_name: Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator for Industries CPQ Orders
notes.description: Use the advanced orchestration capabilities of DRO for Industries CPQ orders. The platform is preintegrated with Industries CPQ, allowing adoption of DRO without migrating commercial product data out of Enterprise Price Catalog (EPC). This establishes accurate data exchange and a smooth transition.

notes.feature_name: Decomposition Rules for Enterprise Price Catalog Products
notes.description: Create and manage decomposition rules for Enterprise Price Catalog (EPC) products and product classes using the graphical interface in the Decomposition Workspace. View the complete hierarchy of the technical bundle structure to make the design process intuitive and user-friendly.

notes.feature_name: Orchestrate Move and Change of Plan Orders from Industries Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ)
notes.description: Develop specialized fulfillment scenarios to manage asset transfers and plan changes in Industries CPQ. Manage asset movement between locations or accounts, and handle upgrades, downgrades, or plan switches after the initial purchase. With Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator, design precise fulfillment logic to manage services effectively, and establish proper execution and dependency management for all related tasks.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New Invocable Actions in Dynamic Revenue Orchestrator
notes.description: Manage complex sales transactions more effectively by decomposing and orchestrating quotes or orders independently. Use the new invocable actions to improve the operational efficiency of a sales process. Decompose a sales transaction, such as a quote or an order using the new decomposeSalesTransaction action. Orchestrate a sales transaction, such as a quote or an order using the new orchestrateSalesTransaction action.

notes.feature_name: Changed Metadata Type
notes.description: The Flow metadata type has these new actionType values to manage complex sales transactions. Decompose a sales transaction, such as a quote or an order using the new decomposeSalesTransaction value in the existing actionType field, which is on the FlowActionCall subtype of the Flow metadata type. Post a credit memo in Draft status, and update the status to Posted using the new orchestrateSalesTransaction value in the existing actionType field, which is on the FlowActionCall subtype of the Flow metadata type.

notes.feature_name: Condition Field on ProductFulfillmentDecompositionRule
notes.description: Identify the condition for executing the product fulfillment decomposition. Use the new Condition field on the existing ProductFulfillmentDecompositionRule object.

notes.feature_name: Condition Field on ProductFulfillmentScenario
notes.description: Identify the condition for executing the product fulfillment scenario. Use the new Condition field on the existing ProductFulfillmentScenario object.

notes.feature_name: ExecuteOnCondition Field on FulfillmentStepDefinition
notes.description: Identify the condition for executing the fulfillment step. Use the new ExecuteOnCondition field on the existing FulfillmentStepDefinition object.

notes.feature_name: ResumeOnCondition Field on FulfillmentStepDefinition
notes.description: Identify the condition for resuming the paused fulfillment step. Use the new ResumeOnCondition field on the existing FulfillmentStepDefinition object.

notes.feature_name: ConditionData Field on FulfillmentTaskAssignmentRule
notes.description: Identify the condition for executing the fulfillment task assignment rule. Use the new ConditionData field on the existing FulfillmentTaskAssignmentRule object.

notes.feature_name: Action Field on FulfillmentLineSourceRel
notes.description: Identify the action to be performed on the asset fulfillment decomposition record. Use the new Action field on the existing FulfillmentLineSourceRel object.

notes.feature_name: IsUsedForFulfmtAssetActivation Field on AssetFulfillmentDecomp
notes.description: Identify if internal jobs are allowed to activate the related fulfillment asset. Use the new IsUsedForFulfmtAssetActivation field on the existing AssetFulfillmentDecomp object.

notes.feature_name: Usage Product Validator
notes.description: Verify cross-object configurations when you set up Usage and Rating objects on your product record pages. Eliminate manual navigation across multiple related records by making sure that critical issues are flagged early during setup.

notes.feature_name: Automatic Rate Card Entry Generation
notes.description: Provide accurate and consistent usage pricing by generating rate card entries for quotes and orders whenever quotes are saved. The system captures catalog rates when the quote is saved.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Rate Changes
notes.description: This feature prevents rate changes even if the catalog is updated later. It maintains stable pricing during quote reloads and also preserves backward compatibility.

notes.feature_name: Generate Assets for Usage Products with Order Item Action
notes.description: Use the Create or Update Asset From Order Item Action API to create assets for usage-based products. Create assets directly from order products, including products with grant binding and rate selection. This method correctly assetizes usage products, preserves binding relationships, and automatically applies the appropriate rates during asset creation.

notes.feature_name: Avoid Unexpected Charges by Monitoring Daily Usage and Overages
notes.description: View your current usage and updated overages on your summaries throughout the billing period. Find the provisional balance on the Wallets page under your usage summary, which updates daily to reflect your current consumption and remaining balance. Help users make informed decisions about purchasing additional packs or commitments. Manage costs more efficiently by avoiding unexpected overage charges before invoice generation.

notes.feature_name: Provide Customers Visibility into Their Wallet Balances
notes.description: Improves self-service adoption by giving your customers access to real-time wallet balances and existing consumption records. The Billing Self-Service Portal template now includes a wallet page where users can access wallet details without additional configuration.

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST APIs
notes.description: Improve data integrity and compliance with enhanced validation for usage-based products. Access detailed consumption insights for accurate billing and reporting.

notes.feature_name: Expedite Product Setup by Using Usage Product Validator
notes.description: Verify cross-object configurations when you set up Usage and Rating objects on your product record pages. Eliminate manual navigation across multiple related records by making sure that critical issues are flagged early during setup.

notes.feature_name: Save Quote and Order Rate Card Entries Automatically
notes.description: Provide accurate and consistent usage pricing by generating rate card entries for quotes and orders whenever quotes are saved. The system captures catalog rates when the quote is saved, which prevents unexpected rate changes.

notes.feature_name: Stable Pricing During Quote Reloads
notes.description: This feature maintains stable pricing during quote reloads and also preserves backward compatibility.

notes.feature_name: Generate Assets for Usage Products with Order Item Action
notes.description: Use the Create or Update Asset From Order Item Action API to create assets for usage-based products. Create assets directly from order products, including products with grant binding and rate selection. This method correctly assetizes usage products, preserves binding relationships, and automatically applies the appropriate rates during asset creation.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Daily Usage and Overages
notes.description: View your current usage and updated overages on your summaries throughout the billing period. Find the provisional balance on the Wallets page under your usage summary, which updates daily to reflect your current consumption and remaining balance. Help users make informed decisions about purchasing additional packs or commitments. Manage costs more efficiently by avoiding unexpected overage charges before invoice generation.
notes.activation_required: Requires deactivation of older cloned versions of flows
notes.timeline: For Salesforce orgs set up before Winter '26
notes.breaking_changes: Ensure that you deactivate the older cloned versions of the Generate Usage Ratable Summary and Generate Liable Summary flows, and clone and activate the new versions.

notes.feature_name: Provide Customers Visibility into Their Wallet Balances
notes.description: Improves self-service adoption by giving your customers access to real-time wallet balances and existing consumption records. The Billing Self-Service Portal template now includes a wallet page where users can access wallet details without additional configuration.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New Connect REST APIs
notes.description: Improve data integrity and compliance with enhanced validation for usage-based products. Access detailed consumption insights for accurate billing and reporting. Validate cross-object relationships and business rules for usage-based products by making a POST request to the /revenue/usage-management/usage-products/actions/validate resource. New request body: Usage Product Validation Input. New response body: Usage Product Validation. Trace consumption details for a specified list of liable summary IDs by making a POST request to the /revenue/usage-management/consumption/actions/trace resource. New request body: Consumption Traceabilities Input. New response body: Consumption Traceabilities.

notes.feature_name: Billing Enhancements
notes.description: Maintain accurate billing, reduce manual effort, and strengthen a reliable quote-to-cash process. Keep billing precise during complex updates and simplify customer inquiry with end-to-end dispute resolution process. Allocate shared charges across all parties and maintain consistent, audit-ready records. Streamline tax reporting with enhanced regional identifiers and product details.

notes.feature_name: Payment Method Management
notes.description: Import pre-generated payment method tokens into your Salesforce org either individually or in bulk. Bring in your own payment methods generated by externally developed UI components. Retry failed payments, and set up rules to automatically apply credits and payments to the right invoices.

notes.feature_name: Unified Workflow for Billing Inquiries
notes.description: Manage billing inquiries and disputes through a unified workflow and streamlined dispute resolution process. Give customers a comprehensive financial history to settle accounts.

notes.feature_name: Billing Schedule Management
notes.description: Bill individual order items as they’re delivered. Keep billing schedules consistent with the changes in billing frequency while also accounting for any partial periods.

notes.feature_name: Accurate Billing Schedules
notes.description: Maintain accurate billing schedules during rollbacks, term or price changes, product swaps, and line-level date updates. Align billing schedules with changes to future-dated orders and quotes, and generate precise billing for multiple ramp deals.

notes.feature_name: Tax Management Enhancements
notes.description: Maintain financial accuracy by canceling and voiding credit memos and by supporting regional requirements with tax identifiers, tax codes, and header-level tax totals.

notes.feature_name: Invoice Management Improvements
notes.description: Assign shared costs to the right billing account and split invoice charges accurately across multiple parties. Generate individual invoice documents with billing profile-specific templates.

notes.feature_name: Credit Memo Management
notes.description: Apply unique sequential numbers to credit memos to keep records traceable, consistent, and audit-ready.

notes.feature_name: New Billing Objects and API Enhancements
notes.description: Manage complex billing scenarios with new APIs for billing arrangement, payment and credit application based on predefined rules, and credit memo voidance. Generate on-demand invoices and comprehensive financial statements for transparent, complete financial reporting.

notes.feature_name: Updated BillingAdvanced Apex Class
notes.description: Use the updated BillingAdvanced Apex class to void a credit memo, enabling the creation of a debit memo.

notes.feature_name: Updated BillingSettings Metadata
notes.description: The updated BillingSettings metadata settings type enhances billing operations. It provides compliant sequential numbering for credit memos and automatic retry attempts for failed payments. You can track and resolve billing disputes, and settle invoices automatically by applying rule-based payments and credits.

notes.feature_name: New Invocable Actions in Billing
notes.description: Improve financial accuracy and reduce manual effort by automating the credit and payment application and the credit memo voidance processes.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Resolve Billing Inquiries and Disputes Efficiently
notes.description: Manage billing inquiries and disputes through a standardized, end-to-end dispute management process. Install pre-built service process templates easily from the Unified Catalog. Billing specialists or customer service representatives can initiate cases, and quickly capture, validate, and resolve common inquiries, all from a single catalog. Billing portal users can raise service requests through the self-service portal.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Summarize Billing Transactions with a Statement of Account
notes.description: Use Generate Account Statement API to generate a single account statement that summarizes invoices, payments, credits, debits, and refunds of an account and its related accounts. Give customers a unified view of all billing activity in their account and its hierarchy. Automate the generation of these account statements by using the Generate Statement of Account invocable action in custom flows.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management
affected_components: Generate Statement of Account invocable action

notes.feature_name: Billing Admin permission set
notes.description: To manage billing inquiries and resolve disputes, you need the Billing Operations User or the Billing Customer Service User permission set.
