To use the Self-Service Billing portal, your users need these permissions: UnifiedCatalogCommunityUserPsl permission set group, Unified Catalog Community User permission set, Omnistudio User permission set, Billing Experience Cloud User permission set.

notes.feature_name: Summarize Billing Transactions with a Statement of Account
notes.description: Use Generate Account Statement API to generate a single account statement that summarizes invoices, payments, credits, debits, and refunds of an account and its related accounts. Give customers a unified view of all billing activity in their account and its hierarchy. Automate the generation of these account statements by using the Generate Statement of Account invocable action in custom flows.

notes.feature_name: Gain More Flexibility with Order Item Billing
notes.description: Improve billing accuracy and cash flow by billing order items and creating separate billing schedules for each item. Generate invoices for delivered goods or services immediately, instead of waiting until the entire order is billed.

notes.feature_name: Offer Flexible Billing Frequencies for Quotes and Orders
notes.description: Your sales representatives can now select a billing frequency on a transaction that differs from the product’s pricing frequency. Convert shorter pricing terms, such as monthly or quarterly, into longer billing cycles such as semi-annual or annual. Get accurate billing for partial periods based on the actual number of days a product or subscription is used.

notes.feature_name: Gain More Flexibility with Order Item Billing
notes.description: Improve billing accuracy and cash flow by billing order items and creating separate billing schedules for each item. Generate invoices for delivered goods or services immediately, instead of waiting until the entire order is billed.

notes.feature_name: Offer Flexible Billing Frequencies for Quotes and Orders
notes.description: Your sales representatives can now select a billing frequency on a transaction that differs from the product’s pricing frequency. Convert shorter pricing terms, such as monthly or quarterly, into longer billing cycles such as semi-annual or annual. Get accurate billing for partial periods based on the actual number of days a product or subscription is used.

notes.feature_name: Billing Amendments
notes.description: Maintain accurate billing schedules during rollbacks, term or price changes, product swaps, and line-level date updates. Align billing schedules with changes to future-dated orders and quotes, and generate precise billing for multiple ramp deals.

notes.feature_name: Align Billing Dates with Order Item Detail and Quote Line Detail Records
notes.description: Get precise billing for orders and quotes that have multiple start and end periods. Billing prioritizes the start and end dates found on Quote Line Detail and Order Item Detail records. If no dates are specified on the detail records, then Billing uses the dates from the parent order or quote item.

notes.feature_name: Align Billing with Subscription Term Updates
notes.description: Generate precise billing schedules automatically when your customer extends or shortens a subscription term during an amendment. Keep billing in sync with revised contractual terms by aligning billing schedules with the updated start and end dates on the order product.

notes.feature_name: Align Billing with Changes to Future-Dated Orders and Quotes
notes.description: Support dynamic customer needs by processing billing for amendments and renewals that occur before a scheduled future-dated order or quote. Get accurate billing schedules for the amended or renewed assets under termed, evergreen, and one-time products. Ensure alignment with future billing periods and eliminate the need for manual reconciliation.

notes.feature_name: Capture Accurate Billable Amounts After Rollbacks
notes.description: Update billing schedules automatically when customers roll back a future-dated amendment, renewal, or cancellation. The rollback adds adjusting billing schedules to negate the previous change, ensuring that the schedule shows the correct view of what to bill next. Maintain accurate billing and a clean, reliable schedule history without manual corrections.

notes.feature_name: Generate Precise Billing for Multiple Ramp Deals
notes.description: Extend group ramps to support multiple billing schedules with accuracy and consistency. For each product ramp ID in a ramp deal, Billing creates a billing schedule group. For every segment in the product ramp schedule, Billing creates a billing schedule in the billing schedule group to represent the group’s ramping and timeline. Support accurate billing for independent ramp schedule groups across mixed asset types while keeping multi-asset amendments consistent.

notes.feature_name: Maintain Billing Accuracy During Price Changes
notes.description: Automatically update billing amounts to reflect any changes in product pricing. Generate accurate billing schedules and invoices that capture any increase or decrease in the prices of termed, evergreen, or one-time product subscriptions.

notes.feature_name: Ensure Billing Accuracy During Product Swaps
notes.description: Ensure billing accuracy when you swap one-time, evergreen, termed, and bundled products. Get auto-generated billing schedules for the products that are swapped out and swapped in.

notes.feature_name: Align Billing Dates with Order Item Detail and Quote Line Detail Records
notes.description: Get precise billing for orders and quotes that have multiple start and end periods. Billing prioritizes the start and end dates found on Quote Line Detail and Order Item Detail records. If no dates are specified on the detail records, then Billing uses the dates from the parent order or quote item.

notes.feature_name: Align Billing with Subscription Term Updates
notes.description: Generate precise billing schedules automatically when your customer extends or shortens a subscription term during an amendment. Keep billing in sync with revised contractual terms by aligning billing schedules with the updated start and end dates on the order product.

Get accurate billing schedules for the amended or renewed assets under termed, evergreen, and one-time products. Ensure alignment with future billing periods and eliminate the need for manual reconciliation.

The rollback adds adjusting billing schedules to negate the previous change, ensuring that the schedule shows the correct view of what to bill next. Maintain accurate billing and a clean, reliable schedule history without manual corrections.

notes.feature_name: Generate Precise Billing for Multiple Ramp Deals
notes.description: Extend group ramps to support multiple billing schedules with accuracy and consistency. For each product ramp ID in a ramp deal, Billing creates a billing schedule group. For every segment in the product ramp schedule, Billing creates a billing schedule in the billing schedule group to represent the group’s ramping and timeline. Support accurate billing for independent ramp schedule groups across mixed asset types while keeping multi-asset amendments consistent.

notes.feature_name: Maintain Billing Accuracy During Price Changes
notes.description: Automatically update billing amounts to reflect any changes in product pricing. Generate accurate billing schedules and invoices that capture any increase or decrease in the prices of termed, evergreen, or one-time product subscriptions.

notes.feature_name: Ensure Billing Accuracy During Product Swaps
notes.description: Ensure billing accuracy when you swap one-time, evergreen, termed, and bundled products. Get auto-generated billing schedules for the products that are swapped out and swapped in.

notes.feature_name: Maintain Tax Compliance with Credit Memo Voiding and Recovery
notes.description: Improve financial accuracy by recovering credit memos that are in error or pending states. You can also void posted credit memos and automatically create debit memos for them.

notes.feature_name: Calculate Precise Tax for Products with Enhanced Tax Treatment Item Resolution
notes.description: Achieve greater flexibility when calculating taxes for different products across legal entities. Use tax treatment items within a tax treatment to assign specific tax codes to each product, supporting countries that require product-specific tax codes.

notes.feature_name: Support Regional Tax Compliance by Capturing Header-Level Tax Totals
notes.description: Maintain financial accuracy by canceling and voiding credit memos and by supporting regional requirements with tax identifiers, tax codes, and header-level tax totals.

notes.feature_name: Calculate Taxes with the Standard Tax Engine
notes.description: Configure and apply taxes directly in the Billing app with the standard built-in tax engine for simple tax use cases. Capture multiple tax rates, set tax effective dates, and configure the priority of tax calculation.

notes.feature_name: Meet Tax Compliance by Capturing Tax Identification Details
notes.description: Meet regional compliance regulations by using tax identifiers and other tax details on the billing account. Send this information automatically to tax engines when using our tax interface to support tax compliance.

notes.feature_name: Maintain Tax Compliance with Credit Memo Voiding and Recovery
notes.description: Improve financial accuracy by recovering credit memos that are in error or pending states. You can also void posted credit memos and automatically create debit memos for them. To recover credit memos, from the App Launcher, find and select Credit Memos. Open a credit memo in the pending or error state. Then click Recover Credit Memo. For credit memos with tax, the action creates a debit memo and voids the credit memo. For credit memos with no tax, the action simply cancels the credit memo. To void a posted credit memo, open the credit memo record and click Void Credit Memo.

notes.feature_name: Calculate Precise Tax for Products with Enhanced Tax Treatment Item Resolution
notes.description: Achieve greater flexibility when calculating taxes for different products across legal entities. Use tax treatment items within a tax treatment to assign specific tax codes to each product, supporting countries that require product-specific tax codes.

notes.feature_name: Support Regional Tax Compliance by Capturing Header-Level Tax Totals
notes.description: Add efficiency to tax reporting by adding flexibility to your existing tax strategy. Prevent rounding discrepancies that can occur on transactions with thousands of tax lines. Capture overall tax totals in the transaction header while preserving detailed calculations at the line level.

notes.feature_name: Calculate Taxes with the Standard Tax Engine
notes.description: Configure and apply taxes directly in the Billing app with the standard built-in tax engine for simple tax use cases. Capture multiple tax rates, set tax effective dates, and configure the priority of tax calculation.

notes.feature_name: Meet Tax Compliance by Capturing Tax Identification Details
notes.description: Meet regional compliance regulations by using tax identifiers and other tax details on the billing account. Send this information automatically to tax engines when using our tax interface to support tax compliance.

notes.feature_name: Configure Tax Identification Details
notes.description: To configure tax identification details for your account, you need the Billing Admin or the Billing Operations User permission set. Update the Billing Account fields such as tax identification number and tax exemption number. Define dynamic picklist values for tax exemption status and delivery terms to map them correctly to your external tax adapter. During tax calculation, Billing gets tax information from the billing account’s default billing profile.

notes.feature_name: Allocate Invoice Charges Across Multiple Billing Accounts with Billing Arrangements
notes.description: Support shared business models by separating the account that owns a service or asset from the account that’s invoiced for it. Configure billing arrangements to allocate billing amounts to a specific billing account or distribute costs among several billing accounts, based on fixed percentages. Facilitate precise invoicing for complex business scenarios such as a parent account billed for subsidiary accounts, where the owning and billing accounts are different. Ensure that invoices are charged to the correct billing accounts for cross-departmental charge allocations, or when services or assets shared among multiple parties. Help organizations model complex financial relationships by automating allocation of invoice charges.

notes.feature_name: View Invoices in a Centralized List on Order Records
notes.description: View all the invoices related to an order directly on the Order record page. The new All Invoices related list acts as a single source of truth, showing invoices generated by using invoice batch runs, Invoice Ingestion API, Invoice Creation API, and the Generate Invoice button. The list also includes invoices for the subsequent Amend, Renewal, or Cancellation orders.

notes.feature_name: Generate Personalized On-Demand Invoice Documents
notes.description: Respond to customer needs faster by generating an individual invoice PDF with a single click. Generate urgent invoices without waiting for invoice batch runs. Meet business and compliance requirements by configuring customer-specific invoice templates in billing profiles, which override the Salesforce org default templates.

notes.feature_name: Void Posted Invoices Directly from the Invoice Record with a Quick Action
notes.description: Simplify invoice corrections with the Void Invoice quick action. Billing users can now void posted invoices directly from the Invoice record, in addition to using the existing API-based approach.

notes.feature_name: Automated Allocation of Invoice Charges
notes.description: Ensure that invoices are charged to the correct billing accounts for cross-departmental charge allocations, or when services or assets shared among multiple parties. Help organizations model complex financial relationships by automating allocation of invoice charges.

notes.feature_name: View Invoices in a Centralized List on Order Records
notes.description: View all the invoices related to an order directly on the Order record page. The new All Invoices related list acts as a single source of truth, showing invoices generated by using invoice batch runs, Invoice Ingestion API, Invoice Creation API, and the Generate Invoice button. The list also includes invoices for the subsequent Amend, Renewal, or Cancellation orders.

notes.description: Respond to customer needs faster by generating an individual invoice PDF with a single click. Generate urgent invoices without waiting for invoice batch runs. Meet business and compliance requirements by configuring customer-specific invoice templates in billing profiles, which override the Salesforce org default templates.

notes.feature_name: Assign Preferred Invoice Document Template
notes.description: To assign a preferred invoice document template for an account, from the App Launcher, find and select Billing Accounts. Configure the billing account to include an invoice document template. To generate an invoice document, from the App Launcher, find and select Invoices. Open a posted invoice record, and click Generate Invoice Document.

notes.feature_name: Void Posted Invoices Directly from the Invoice Record
notes.description: Billing users can now void posted invoices directly from the Invoice record, in addition to using the existing API-based approach. To void an invoice, from the App Launcher, find and select Invoices. Open the posted invoice and click Void Invoice.
notes.security_notes: Requires Billing Admin or Billing Operations User permission set.

notes.feature_name: Organize Credit Memos by Using Sequential Numbering
notes.description: Create traceable, consistent, and compliant credit memo records by assigning unique sequential numbers to posted credit memos. Manage bookkeeping and maintain legally compliant credit memo numbering.

notes.feature_name: Gapless Sequential Numbering for Billing
notes.description: To assign sequential numbers to Credit Memo records, configure Gapless Sequential Numbering for Billing.

notes.feature_name: Mandate Sequence Policy for Posted Credit Memos
notes.description: To assign a credit memo number to each posted credit memo, turn on Mandate Sequence Policy for Posted Credit Memos.

notes.feature_name: Import Pre-Generated Payment Method Tokens
notes.description: Import pre-generated payment method tokens into your Salesforce org either individually or in bulk. Bring in your own payment methods generated by externally developed UI components. Retry failed payments, and set up rules to automatically apply credits and payments to the right invoices.

notes.feature_name: Add and Manage Saved Payment Methods by Using Pre-Tokenized Data
notes.description: Bring your existing payment methods from native and third-party payment gateways into your Salesforce org by migrating the corresponding payment method tokens. You can import specific payment method tokens either individually or use a CSV file to upload multiple tokens into your Salesforce org. Map the tokens to specific payment types, including emerging options, such as digital wallets. Use the saved payment methods, without any further configuration, for both batch payment processing and in the Sale, Authorize, and Capture APIs.

notes.feature_name: Apply Credit Memos and Payments Automatically Based on Rules
notes.description: Prevent revenue leakage, improve customer trust, and reduce the manual effort required for cash reconciliation with rule-based application of credit and payments. Prioritize applying either credits or payments to settle the invoices of customer accounts. Specify allocation rules in an order of your choice to settle the invoices of your account. Use the allocation rules to match invoices by the invoice ID or invoice balance, or prioritize oldest invoices or the ones with the highest balances.

notes.feature_name: Custom Payment Retries
notes.description: Define rules to automatically retry payments that fail due to specific errors, such as an expired card or a temporary bank issue. Set up rules to reprocess failed payments based on the reason for the failure. Define the retry interval and the total number of attempts before a payment is finally considered as failed. Capture more revenue and reduce manual collections work for your accounts receivables team.

notes.feature_name: Convert Debit Memos to Invoices
notes.description: Bring any outstanding amount into your accounts receivables workflow by generating invoices from debit memos. Convert standalone debit memos to invoices by using Invoice Ingestion API. This feature helps to simplify and accelerate payment collections.

notes.feature_name: Add and Manage Saved Payment Methods by Using Pre-Tokenized Data
notes.description: Bring your existing payment methods from native and third-party payment gateways into your Salesforce org by migrating the corresponding payment method tokens. You can import specific payment method tokens either individually or use a CSV file to upload multiple tokens into your Salesforce org. Map the tokens to specific payment types, including emerging options, such as digital wallets. Use the saved payment methods, without any further configuration, for both batch payment processing and in the Sale, Authorize, and Capture APIs. Integrate payment methods into your Salesforce org by bringing in external UI components from vendors of your choice.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Capture Transaction Amounts and Summary Records in Functional Currency
notes.description: Give your customers the ability to view functional currency equivalents of their billing transaction amounts. Calculate the opening and closing balance summaries for general ledger accounts in a legal entity accounting period by using functional currency.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: New Objects for Billing
notes.description: Store and access more data with these new Billing objects and changes to existing Billing objects. Use the new BillingArrangement object to get details about how a transaction’s billing amount is allocated to one or more accounts.

notes.feature_name: DebitMemoLineTax
notes.description: Use the new DebitMemoLineTax object to get tax information associated with a debit memo line.

notes.feature_name: ExpressionSet
notes.description: Use the new ExpressionSet object to get information about an expression set.

notes.feature_name: PaymentRetryRule
notes.description: Use the new PaymentRetryRule object to get information about the payment retry rule applied when a payment schedule item fails.

notes.feature_name: PaymentRetryRuleSet
notes.description: Use the new PaymentRetryRuleSet object to get information about the payment retry policy that defines how failed payments are retried based on error codes across different retry categories.

notes.feature_name: TaxRate
notes.description: Use the new TaxRate object to get information about the tax rate applied to a transaction, determined by the applicable tax code and country.

notes.feature_name: TaxTreatmentItem
notes.description: Use the new TaxTreatmentItem object to get tax code information used by a specific tax engine to calculate tax for a product.

notes.feature_name: AdditionalTaxIdentificationDetails
notes.description: Use the new AdditionalTaxIdentificationDetails field on the existing BillingAccount object to specify additional tax identification details.

notes.feature_name: DeliveryTerms
notes.description: Use the new DeliveryTerms field on the existing BillingAccount object to specify the standard code in internal trades that’s used to define shipping responsibilities.

notes.feature_name: InvoiceDocumentTemplate

notes.description: Specify whether an error occurred while processing a void credit memo or an invoice batch run rule-based credit and payment application request. Use the new supported values VoidCreditMemo and InvoiceBatchRunRuleBasedCreditandPaymentApplication in the existing Category field on the RevenueTransactionErrorLog object.

notes.feature_name: SequencePolicy TargetObject field
notes.description: Specify whether the sequence policy is applied to a credit memo record. Use the new supported value CreditMemo in the existing TargetObject field on the SequencePolicy object.

notes.feature_name: ShouldCaptureTaxesAtHeader
notes.description: Use the new ShouldCaptureTaxesAtHeader field on the existing TaxEngine object.

notes.feature_name: RevenueStandardTaxEngine
notes.description: Use the new supported value RevenueStandardTaxEngine in the existing Type field on the TaxEngine object.

notes.feature_name: ShouldUseTaxTreatmentItems
notes.description: Use the new ShouldUseTaxTreatmentItems field on the existing TaxTreatment object when requesting tax calculations.

notes.feature_name: Removal of TaxCode field
notes.description: The TaxCode field on the DebitMemoLineTax object is removed from API version 66.0 and later. Instead, use the JurisdictionTaxCode field on the existing DebitMemoLineTax object.
notes.breaking_changes: TaxCode field removed; use JurisdictionTaxCode instead.

notes.feature_name: New APIs for Billing Arrangement
notes.description: Manage complex billing scenarios with new APIs for billing arrangement, payment and credit application based on predefined rules, and credit memo voidance. Generate on-demand invoices and comprehensive financial statements for transparent, complete financial reporting.

notes.feature_name: Get Billing Arrangement
notes.description: Make a GET request to the /revenue/billing/billing-arrangement/billingArrangementId resource. New response body: Billing Arrangement.

notes.feature_name: Apply Payments and Credits
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /revenue/billing/transactions/actions/apply resource. New request body: Rules Application Input. New response body: Rules Application.

notes.feature_name: Void Posted Credit Memo
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /commerce/billing/credit-memos/creditMemoId/actions/void resource. New request body: Void Posted Credit Memo Input.

notes.feature_name: Void Posted Credit Memo
notes.description: New response body for voiding posted credit memos.

notes.feature_name: On Demand Document Generation
notes.description: Generate an invoice document for a record, and update any junction object record by making a POST request to the /revenue/billing/document/actions/generate resource.

notes.feature_name: Statement Of Account
notes.description: Generate comprehensive financial statements with transaction history and balance information by making a POST request to the /revenue/billing/accounts/accountId/statement resource.

notes.feature_name: Connect REST API Request Bodies Changes
notes.description: Changed request bodies for the Connect REST API to improve functionality.

notes.feature_name: Invoice Ingestion Input Update
notes.description: This request body has an update. referenceEntityId —Specify the debit memo ID to convert debit memos to invoices.

notes.feature_name: Sequence Policy Input Update
notes.description: This request body has an update. targetObject —Use the new CreditMemo enum value to create a sequence policy for a credit memo.

notes.feature_name: Sequence Gap Reconciliation Input Update
notes.description: This request body has an update. targetObjects —Use the new CreditMemo enum value to identify gaps in gapless-enabled sequences for a credit memo.

notes.feature_name: Changed Connect in Apex Class in Billing
notes.description: Use the updated BillingAdvanced Apex class to void a credit memo, enabling the creation of a debit memo. This new method is available in the ConnectApi.BillingAdvanced class. Void a credit memo in posted state using voidPostedCreditMemo(voidPostedCreditMemoInputRepresentation). New input class: ConnectApi.VoidPostedCreditMemoInputRepresentation. New output class: ConnectApi.VoidPostedCreditMemoOutputRepresentation.

notes.feature_name: Changed Metadata Types in Billing
notes.description: The updated BillingSettings metadata settings type enhances billing operations. It provides compliant sequential numbering for credit memos and automatic retry attempts for failed payments. You can track and resolve billing disputes, and settle invoices automatically by applying rule-based payments and credits. Apply unique sequence numbers to credit memo records using the new enableCreditMemoSequenceService field on the existing BillingSettings metadata type. Retry payments that failed due to errors using the new enableFailedPaymentsRetry field on the existing BillingSettings metadata type. Track and resolve billing inquiries, service requests, and invoice-related disputes using the new enableBillingDisputeManagement field on the existing BillingSettings metadata type. Settle posted invoices automatically by applying rule-based payments and credits using the new ruleBasedCrAndPymtAppln field on the existing BillingSettings metadata type.

notes.feature_name: New Invocable Actions in Billing
notes.description: Improve financial accuracy and reduce manual effort by automating the credit and payment application and the credit memo voidance processes. Apply payments and credits to posted invoices by adhering to specified rules using the new applyPaymentsAndCreditsByRules action. Void a posted credit memo to a credit memo using the new voidPostedCreditMemo action.

notes.feature_name: New Classes in RulesAppln Namespace
notes.description: Get details of the rule application using the new RulesAppln.RulesApplicationResponse class. Get output of the applyPaymentsAndCreditsByRules invocable action using the new RulesAppln.RulesApplicationSummaryResponse class. Get error code and error message details using the new RulesAppln.RulesApplicationErrorResponse class.

notes.feature_name: CommerceTax Namespace Enhancements
notes.description: The CommerceTax namespace has enhancements that eliminate rounding errors during the calculation of total tax for an invoice.

notes.feature_name: Capture taxes at the invoice header level
notes.description: Use the new isHeaderTaxRequested property of the TaxTransactionRequest method in the CommerceTax.TaxTransactionRequest class.

notes.feature_name: Control Section Name Visibility When Inserting Content
notes.description: Template designers and contract authors can choose whether a section name appears in the generated document. Previously, section name always appeared. They can now delete section names in the Microsoft 365 editor when they don’t want it to appear in the generated document. The section name remains visible under the Section tab in the Microsoft 365 add-in panel to manage section content.

notes.feature_name: Preserve Formatting When Inserting Clauses
notes.description: Clauses now retain their defined indentation, line spacing, lists, fonts, and other rich text formatting defined in the clause library when inserted into a document. Previously, inserting clauses into a Microsoft 365 template and contract document caused the document styles to override the clause’s original formatting.

notes.feature_name: Assign Profile-Based Access for Sections
notes.description: Control who can update sensitive content, including token values, by limiting section-level access to specific profiles. During template creation, the designer can select which profiles can edit a section for contract authoring and internal review.

notes.feature_name: Control Internal Reviewers Based on Users or Profiles
notes.description: Contract authors can choose between a user-based or profile-based mode when initiating internal reviews. Prevent unintended edits and keep review activities focused on the appropriate participants.

notes.feature_name: Reconcile More Data with Expanded Data True-Up Capacity
notes.description: The Microsoft 365 Word Data True-Up feature now handles more than 200 field tokens and includes support for line item tokens, improving reconciliation across contract fields and detailed line item values. Data True-Up also supports reconciling data sourced from related records, such as quotes and opportunities.

notes.feature_name: Review Redline Differences in a Comparison Document
notes.description: Get full visibility of changes when reviewing contract versions. You can generate a comparison document that highlights added, edited, and deleted content relative to the base version. This enhancement makes it easier to understand changes introduced during redlining across contract document versions.

notes.feature_name: Improve Document Accuracy with Advanced Data True-Up Enhancements
notes.description: Data True-Up token processing now supports nested object structures and reference fields up to one level, including related objects, such as opportunities and quotes. You can pull token values from related records rather than only from contracts, improving reconciliation accuracy for complex data. Support for reference fields on custom objects also helps keep contract data aligned with information stored across your data model.

notes.feature_name: Migrate Templates Across Salesforce Environments
notes.description: Move Microsoft 365 document templates between Salesforce orgs while preserving clause references and section-level access controls. For example, move templates from a sandbox to a production org. This process helps maintain template integrity across orgs and environments. Before migrating templates, use a data migration tool to transfer the clause records, clause versions, and profile data to the target org. After you migrate the template, the built-in key mapping aligns the clause and profile references with the corresponding clause records in the target org.

notes.feature_name: Manage Document Check-In Behavior with Configurable Async Processing
notes.description: Reduce latency and timeouts when checking in large documents with asynchronous processing. Check-in occurs asynchronously when a document contains more than 200 doc elements, such as sections, clauses, and tokens in the Microsoft 365 document. Async check-in is enabled by default, but you can disable it to make all check-ins run synchronously.

notes.feature_name: Find Content in Sections and Clauses Faster
notes.description: Contract authors can navigate large documents more easily with the new search field on the Sections and Standalone Clauses tabs of the Microsoft 365 add-in. The search results update with each keystroke and show only matching items in the panel, helping you locate the right content quickly without manual scrolling. Search also expands collapsed sections when it finds relevant results.

notes.feature_name: Changed Connect REST API Request Bodies in Salesforce Contracts
notes.description: The Content Link Load and Data Sync APIs include enhancements to reduce multiple per-field queries into a single grouped fetch request for improved performance.

notes.feature_name: Control Section Name Visibility When Inserting Content
notes.description: Template designers and contract authors can choose whether a section name appears in the generated document. Previously, section name always appeared. They can now delete section names in the Microsoft 365 editor when they don’t want it to appear in the generated document. The section name remains visible under the Section tab in the Microsoft 365 add-in panel to manage section content.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Control Internal Reviewers Based on Users or Profiles
notes.description: Contract authors can choose between a user-based or profile-based mode when initiating internal reviews. Prevent unintended edits and keep review activities focused on the appropriate participants. The user-based option adds any internal users for parallel review, while the profile-based option limits participation to users from a selected profile. For example, selecting the Legal profile limits participation and edits to Legal team members.

notes.security_notes: To initiate internal reviews, you need the Microsoft 365 Word User permission set.

notes.feature_name: isBulkRequest
notes.description: Specify whether the API must group and fetch fields associated with the same object ID together in a single bulk request.

notes.feature_name: Document Generation Enhancements
notes.description: Generate clearer documents with precise data by applying data filters, transformation logic, and richer token coverage. These updates help make sure that structured content, nested values, and line item details are present accurately. Generate large documents more efficiently, even when they include substantial content or complex formatting. Achieve consistent in-browser previews by using the hybrid file handling setting. Remove interim previews in Omniscripts to keep only the final version and reduce storage use.

notes.feature_name: Filter Context Data for Document Generation
notes.description: Apply a context filter in the template designer so that generated documents include only the data that meets your criteria. Select from predefined filters that support up to 5 conditions to fetch precise and relevant data from your context definitions. Adding a filter at design time avoids extra inputs, reduces errors, and delivers consistent and high-quality document output. For example, filter order items to include only products priced above a certain threshold, and sort them by quantity so that the generated document highlights the most relevant items. Document Generation in the Omnistudio managed package doesn’t support Context Service.

notes.feature_name: Transform Context Data Before Generating Documents
notes.description: Generate documents with clean, standardized, and business-ready data content by transforming the context data using the sample Apex plug-in. Run the Apex plug-in after context hydration to adjust formatting, grouping, string manipulation, token value changes, and other lightweight changes to meet business needs. This capability enables advanced transformation logic for scenarios that filtering alone can’t address. For example, transform flat line items into a bundle with child products so that the document shows each bundle with its related components. You can also group line items by category or region so that the document presents organized sections with related items together. Document Generation in the Omnistudio managed package doesn’t support this Apex plug-in.

notes.feature_name: Generate Larger Documents with Expanded File Size Support
notes.description: Scale document generation to support larger outputs, generating single PDF, DOCX, or PPTX files up to 200 MB. This enhancement enables high-volume, media-rich, and evidence-heavy use cases and helps you generate complete documents in one pass without splitting content or assembling files outside Salesforce.

notes.feature_name: Preview Documents by Using Hybrid Setting Across Contracts and Omniscripts
notes.description: The PDF document previewer provides secure in-browser previewing when you configure Salesforce file upload and download security settings. The PDF previewer now works with the hybrid file handling setting instead of relying only on the execute-in-browser option. The hybrid file handling setting improves preview consistency across browsers and Experience Cloud sites.

notes.feature_name: Filter Context Data for Document Generation
notes.description: Apply a context filter in the template designer so that generated documents include only the data that meets your criteria. Select from predefined filters that support up to 5 conditions to fetch precise and relevant data from your context definitions. Adding a filter at design time avoids extra inputs, reduces errors, and delivers consistent and high-quality document output. For example, filter order items to include only products priced above a certain threshold, and sort them by quantity so that the generated document highlights the most relevant items. Document Generation in the Omnistudio managed package doesn’t support Context Service.

notes.feature_name: Transform Context Data Before Generating Documents
notes.description: Generate documents with clean, standardized, and business-ready data content by transforming the context data using the sample Apex plug-in. Run the Apex plug-in after context hydration to adjust formatting, grouping, string manipulation, token value changes, and other lightweight changes to meet business needs. This capability enables advanced transformation logic for scenarios that filtering alone can’t address. For example, transform flat line items into a bundle with child products so that the document shows each bundle with its related components. You can also group line items by category or region so that the document presents organized sections with related items together. Document Generation in the Omnistudio managed package doesn’t support this Apex plug-in.

notes.feature_name: Generate Larger Documents with Expanded File Size Support
notes.description: Scale document generation to support larger outputs, generating single PDF, DOCX, or PPTX files up to 200 MB. This enhancement enables high-volume, media-rich, and evidence-heavy use cases and helps you generate complete documents in one pass without splitting content or assembling files outside Salesforce.

notes.feature_name: Preview Documents by Using Hybrid Setting Across Contracts and Omniscripts
notes.description: The PDF document previewer provides secure in-browser previewing when you configure Salesforce file upload and download security settings. The PDF previewer now works with the hybrid file handling setting instead of relying only on the execute-in-browser option. The hybrid file handling setting improves preview consistency across browsers and Experience Cloud sites.

notes.feature_name: Manage Preview Document Storage in Omniscripts
notes.description: Document reviews often involve regenerating the preview several times, resulting in multiple stored files and increased storage consumption. You can now easily discard intermediate previews by clicking the delete icon in Omniscripts to keep only the final version, reducing costs and achieving storage organization.

notes.feature_name: Get Product Recommendations While Adding Products (Beta)
notes.description: Help sales reps discover and add relevant or complementary products more efficiently when building a quote. Use predefined configuration rules to guide them with recommendations that lead to more complete and accurate quotes.

notes.feature_name: Explain Invoice Charges Faster with Conversational AI
notes.description: Clarify invoice charges and answer basic questions related to billing through the Billing Service.

notes.feature_name: Billing Employee Assistant
notes.description: Access critical billing information through conversational AI. Help billing teams retrieve payment plan details, latest bill details, account summaries and outstanding balances quickly. Billing teams can identify upcoming payment due dates and amounts within the assistant, without checking individual Billing records. Make it easier to respond to billing queries that require reviewing multiple invoice and payment records. Accelerate response time and reduce manual navigation across billing records.

notes.feature_name: Token Overages Identification
notes.description: Eliminate the manual effort involved in identifying token overages. Agentforce identifies token overage at the account level and helps in creating quotes with appropriate token packs, which enables sales teams to upsell token packs easily.

notes.feature_name: Revenue Quote Management Agent Template
notes.description: Help your partner users accelerate their sales cycle with the Revenue Quote Management agent template. By connecting the Agentforce Employee agent to their site by using Embedded Messaging, partners gain access to powerful, advanced quoting agent actions.

notes.feature_name: Get Product Recommendations While Adding Products (Beta)
notes.description: Help sales reps discover and add relevant or complementary products more efficiently when building a quote. Use predefined configuration rules to guide them with recommendations that lead to more complete and accurate quotes. This change applies to Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management with the Agentforce Employee Agent add-on.
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Billing Service Assistant
notes.description: Clarify invoice charges and answer basic questions related to billing through the Billing Service Assistant. Help your customers receive detailed charge breakdowns for ambiguous invoice line items, without needing to contact support. This change applies to Lightning Experience and Experience Cloud in Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management, formerly Revenue Cloud. It requires the Revenue Cloud Billing license, Einstein GPT, the Agentforce Service Agent add-on, the Flex Credits Metering add-on, and the Usage Management add-on.

notes.feature_name: Resolve Common Billing Inquiries Quickly with Billing Employee Assistant
notes.description: Access critical billing information through conversational AI. Help billing teams retrieve payment plan details, latest bill details, account summaries and outstanding balances quickly. Billing teams can identify upcoming payment due dates and amounts within the assistant, without checking individual Billing records. Make it easier to respond to billing queries that require reviewing multiple invoice and payment records. Accelerate response time and reduce manual navigation across billing records.

notes.feature_name: View Your Consumption Overages in Tokens
notes.description: Eliminate the manual effort involved in identifying token overages. Agentforce identifies token overage at the account level and helps in creating quotes with appropriate token packs, which enables sales teams to upsell token packs easily.

notes.feature_name: Consumption Management in Agentforce Revenue Management
notes.description: To retrieve consumption details for a token resource, go to Agentforce Revenue Management and open an account. Click the Agentforce icon and enter your request in the chat. If needed, Agentforce asks for clarification and then provides token details. You can then use the consumption details to generate a quote for review and revision.

notes.feature_name: Revenue Quote Management agent template
notes.description: Help your partner users accelerate their sales cycle with the Revenue Quote Management agent template. By connecting the Agentforce Employee agent to their site by using Embedded Messaging, partners gain access to powerful, advanced quoting agent actions.

notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions of Agentforce Revenue Management

notes.feature_name: Generative ECI
notes.description: Get your generative AI features bundled together with Generative ECI, which combines the call summary and generative conversation insight capabilities under a single feature. We’re also making speedy call processing more widely available with Vendor Transcript Processing. If you have Salesforce 1 Sales Edition, access deal closing recaps. More ECI data is available on the Salesforce Platform. Your sales teams can use call transcripts from Gong with ECI. And we’ve improved participant matching for Microsoft Teams video calls.

notes.feature_name: Sales Performance Management
notes.description: Refine territory design in complex markets by assigning shared boundaries to multiple sales areas.

notes.feature_name: Distribute Financial Targets
notes.description: Distribute financial targets directly to accounts while accounting for existing bottom-up goals. Streamline the sales planning process by generating quota plans based on territory alignments to keep data synchronized.

notes.feature_name: Sync Email as Salesforce Activity
notes.description: Capture and report on email as an activity with the Sync Email as Salesforce Activity feature. Accurately monitor event and email syncing with detailed insights and reports.
notes.breaking_changes: Prepare for the retirement of Exchange Web Services and its impact on email-related features and products. Salesforce for Outlook retires in December 2027.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Inbound Lead Generation
notes.description: Create and deploy an agent to automate your lead generation process.

notes.description: Set up and test Agentforce Lead Nurturing all in one place with fewer clicks. See agent performance with the SDR Agent Analytics Dashboard and assign more prospects to an agent at once.

Streamline follow-up tasks with post-meeting suggestions. Save time and effort on configuration with Pipeline Management setup in Salesforce Go. notes.feature_name: Inbound Lead Generation
notes.description: Effortlessly capture inbound web and messaging leads, answer inquiries, and schedule meetings with your prospects by setting up Inbound Lead Generation.

notes.description: Guarantee continued engagement with prospects by automating lead handoffs between the Inbound Lead Generation and Lead Nurturing sales agents. Prospects created by the Inbound Lead Generation agent who don’t schedule a meeting can automatically get assigned to the Lead Nurturing agent for a faster follow-up and to maximize conversion rates.

notes.description: Qualify the ideal prospects for your business within the guided setup of both Agentforce Inbound Lead Generation and Agentforce Lead Nurturing.

notes.description: Seamlessly qualify leads and build a stronger pipeline with Agentforce for Sales. This enhancement allows your Agent to determine how strong of a fit a prospect is based on their conversation and how well they meet your Ideal Customer Profile (ICP). Qualification helps sales reps focus on high-potential deals, improving overall efficiency and conversion rates.
notes.availability: Available on a rolling basis starting on January 6, 2025.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with the Sales Cloud and Einstein for Sales
notes.timeline: Available on a rolling basis starting on January 6, 2025.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Lead Nurturing
notes.description: Set up and test Agentforce Lead Nurturing all in one place with fewer clicks. See agent performance with the SDR Agent Analytics Dashboard and assign more prospects to an agent at once.

notes.feature_name: Set Up Agentforce Lead Nurturing Faster with Guided Configuration
notes.description: When you’re ready to create a Lead Nurturing agent, the new guided setup experience in Salesforce Go saves you time and simplifies the process by automating several steps.

notes.feature_name: Scale Up Lead Nurturing Activity with Automatic Limit Management
notes.description: Agentforce now manages the Lead Nurturing prospect outreach queue automatically so that agents can nurture large numbers of prospects simultaneously while respecting email send and LLM request limits.

notes.feature_name: Build Pipeline Faster by Assigning Prospects to Agentforce Lead Nurturing in Bulk
notes.description: Users can now assign up to 200 prospects at once to a Lead Nurturing agent from list views. Agentforce adds assignments that exceed email send or LLM limits to a managed queue that’s visible in the Agent Command Center. Previously, you could only assign records one at a time or by using assignment rules in the agent configuration. Adding more than 30 prospects at a time sometimes caused an error. The managed queue eliminates these errors.

notes.feature_name: Control and Customize Agent Behavior Faster with Modular Topics and Actions
notes.description: You can now directly view and modify each step of the Lead Nurturing agent workflow, eliminating the need for complex prompt engineering. In Agentforce Builder, the agent's logic appears as discrete, configurable topics and actions that are easy to navigate and edit.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with the Agentforce SDR add-on

notes.feature_name: Set Up Agentforce Lead Nurturing Faster with Guided Configuration
notes.description: When you’re ready to create a Lead Nurturing agent, the new guided setup experience in Salesforce Go saves you time and simplifies the process by automating several steps. The guided setup process reduces the number of steps and lets you configure and test your agent all in one place. Setup takes care of tasks like creating a user record for the agent, assigning it permissions, and configuring Einstein Activity Capture.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with the Agentforce SDR add-on

notes.feature_name: Scale Up Lead Nurturing Activity with Automatic Limit Management
notes.description: Agentforce now manages the Lead Nurturing prospect outreach queue automatically so that agents can nurture large numbers of prospects simultaneously while respecting email send and LLM request limits. Previously there was a maximum number of prospects assignments per day. Now, users can keep adding prospects while Agentforce manages the queue automatically. The queue gives highest priority to reply emails, then intro emails and nudges.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited editions with Sales Cloud and the Agentforce Lead Nurturing add-on

Agentforce adds assignments that exceed email send or LLM limits to a managed queue that’s visible in the Agent Command Center. Previously, you could only assign records one at a time or by using assignment rules in the agent configuration. Adding more than 30 prospects at a time sometimes caused an error. The managed queue eliminates these errors.

notes.description: Users can assign up to 200 prospects at once from list views. Agents that use a Gmail account can have a maximum of 25,200 prospects assigned. Agents that use an Outlook account can have a maximum of 137,200 prospects assigned.

Sellers can review and approve the suggestions to ensure prompt and personalized communication with prospective customers.

Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer's sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Get Your Agentic Sales Org Ready in a Few Clicks
notes.description: AI-Powered Selling Initial Setup simplifies configuration for new and existing orgs. It automatically turns on base Sales features and agents and assigns your sellers the correct permissions. Your sales teams get a consistent, ready-to-use sales environment immediately.

notes.feature_name: Guide Your Daily Activities with an AI-Driven Workspace
notes.description: Give sellers clarity on their goals and help them take the right actions faster with a consolidated workspace that surfaces key metrics, AI-driven recommendations, and actionable insights in one place. When you turn on Sales Workspace, it replaces the traditional Seller Home to provide a smarter, more proactive daily selling experience.

It replaces the traditional Seller Home to provide a smarter, more proactive daily selling experience.

notes.feature_name: Generative ECI
notes.description: Generative ECI combines the call summary and generative conversation insight capabilities under a single feature. It works across both voice and video calls, is available to all users without additional licenses, and is automatically enabled for orgs using generative AI features.

notes.feature_name: Vendor Transcript Processing
notes.description: Vendor Transcript Processing allows sales teams to quickly access call summaries and critical call insights. Sales managers can quickly deliver coaching tips to their reps and see how they’re doing.

notes.feature_name: Opportunity Closing Recaps
notes.description: Unlock scalable sales intelligence and trend analysis by replacing unstructured, manual notes with generative AI for closing recaps. Generated recaps automatically capture the specific drivers behind deal outcomes, such as pricing, competitors, or product gaps.
notes.activation_required: Auto-enabled for new customers; existing customers can toggle the feature on.

notes.feature_name: Einstein Conversation Insights Data Storage
notes.description: Einstein Conversation Insights (ECI) data for new customers is now stored natively on the Salesforce Platform. For existing ECI customers, data migration to the Salesforce Platform is scheduled to begin in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Improved Participant Matching for Microsoft Teams
notes.description: We’ve improved participant matching for Microsoft Teams video calls. You no longer need your email matched to your data source. We’re more effectively using calendar and meeting data to get email participant info, so record matching for these calls works better automatically.

notes.feature_name: Use Call Transcripts from Gong
notes.description: You can now use call transcripts from Gong with Einstein Conversation Insights and Salesforce's agentic platform. Use Gong transcripts with our out-of-the-box agents like Agentic Prospecting agent, Sales Management agent, and throughout the platform.

notes.feature_name: Generative ECI Call Summaries and Insights
notes.description: We’re combining the call summary and generative conversation insight features together with Generative ECI. The feature works across both voice and video calls, is available to all users without additional licenses, and is automatically enabled for orgs using generative AI features. This feature requires Einstein Conversation Insights and is available in Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Agentforce 1 Sales editions.
notes.activation_required: Auto-enabled for orgs using generative AI features.

notes.feature_name: Custom Insights for Video Calls
notes.description: Admins can also create custom insights for their video calls. Using generative AI, get answers to things such as customer sentiment or deal terms surfaced for sales conversations automatically. We’ve increased the limit of available generative insights to eight.

notes.feature_name: Generative ECI
notes.description: Generative ECI is automatically enabled for orgs already using Call Summaries or Generative Conversation Insights. No new permission sets are required. References to Call Summary and Generative Insights as separate standalone features are no longer shown in Setup.

notes.feature_name: Vendor Transcript Processing
notes.description: With Vendor Transcript Processing, your sales teams can quickly access call summaries and critical call insights. Sales managers can quickly deliver coaching tips to their reps and see how they’re doing. Existing ECI customers can toggle the feature on. New customers have it auto-enabled and can’t turn it off. Use vendor transcripts for video call processing instead of our native transcription service to speed up processing time.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Agentforce 1 Sales editions
notes.breaking_changes: The feature can’t be turned off after it’s enabled.

notes.feature_name: Opportunity Closing Recaps
notes.description: Unlock scalable sales intelligence and trend analysis by replacing unstructured, manual notes with generative AI for closing recaps. Generated recaps automatically capture the specific drivers behind deal outcomes, such as pricing, competitors, or product gaps.

notes.feature_name: Opportunity Closing Recap
notes.description: Deal recap provides a deeper understanding of your pipeline health by transforming unstructured opportunity data, conversation insights, and so on, into actionable data. By automatically compiling conversation and activity details into structured deal recaps, sales reps save time while capturing specific drivers behind deal outcomes. With this structured approach, managers gain instant clarity on individual deals, and sales leaders can identify and act on trends across the entire organization.

notes.feature_name: Einstein Conversation Insights Data Migration
notes.description: Einstein Conversation Insights (ECI) data for new customers is now stored natively on the Salesforce Platform. For existing ECI customers, data migration to the Salesforce Platform is scheduled to begin in Summer ’26. Starting in January 2026, standard Salesforce objects for ECI are turned on by default for all new customers. Data stored in these records count toward your organization’s data storage capacity.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and as an add-on in Enterprise Edition for more than 10 users
notes.timeline: Data migration scheduled to begin in Summer ’26; Standard objects turned on by default starting January 2026.
notes.breaking_changes: Analytics for Conversation Insights is scheduled for retirement in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Improved Participant Matching for Microsoft Teams
notes.description: We’ve improved participant matching for Microsoft Teams video calls. You no longer need your email matched to your data source. We’re more effectively using calendar and meeting data to get email participant info, so record matching for these calls works better automatically.

notes.feature_name: Use Call Transcripts from Gong
notes.description: You can now use call transcripts from Gong with Einstein Conversation Insights and Salesforce's agentic platform. Use Gong transcripts with our out-of-the-box agents like Agentic Prospecting agent, Sales Management agent, and throughout the platform.

notes.feature_name: Enablement for Sales Teams
notes.description: Discover and set up Enablement for your sales teams in a unified experience with Salesforce Go. Assign permissions directly in Salesforce Go, and monitor usage to ensure users are getting the most out of Enablement.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Einstein 1 Sales, Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Boost Sales Performance with Enablement Programs
notes.description: Provide sales teams in your territories targeted training and relevant resources through Enablement programs. Bulk assign users to a program based on the users’ roles. When you assign territory roles to a program, users with those roles are automatically assigned to the program. Previously, you manually assigned individual territory users to an Enablement program.

notes.feature_name: Bulk User Removal from Enablement Programs
notes.description: Save time and effort while removing users from your Enablement programs. With the automated bulk user removal flow, you can filter and remove a large number of users from your programs with less manual work. Previously, you could remove only one user at a time from a program.

notes.feature_name: ECI Measures Availability with New ECI Setup
notes.description: If you set up ECI for Enablement in Spring ’26, the prebuilt ECI measures aren't available to your sales teams. Teams that have ECI configured in earlier releases can continue to access ECI measures.
notes.breaking_changes: Prebuilt ECI measures are not available with the new ECI setup for Enablement.

notes.description: Provide sales teams in your territories targeted training and relevant resources through Enablement programs. Bulk assign users to a program based on the users’ roles. When you assign territory roles to a program, users with those roles are automatically assigned to the program. Previously, you manually assigned individual territory users to an Enablement program.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Einstein 1 Sales, Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Remove Multiple Users from Enablement Programs Efficiently
notes.description: Save time and effort while removing users from your Enablement programs. With the automated bulk user removal flow, you can filter and remove a large number of users from your programs with less manual work. Previously, you could remove only one user at a time from a program.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Einstein 1 Sales, Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Prebuilt ECI Measures Aren’t Available with the New ECI Setup for Enablement
