notes.feature_name: Action Hub Tab in Automation Lightning App
notes.description: Find which Agentforce agents and prompt templates reference standard and custom invocable actions by using the Action Hub tab in the Automation Lightning app. This new feature provides visibility into flow performance with the new Flow Logs tab in the Automation Lightning app. Previously, the Action Hub tab only showed action usage across Flow Builder. Users can check the Usage tab to view specific agents and prompt templates that reference an action before making changes, and track execution counts for flows, Apex, and REST invocations that use this action.

notes.feature_name: Flow Logs Tab
notes.description: Gain visibility into flow performance with the new Flow Logs tab in the Automation Lightning app. Data 360 stores flow run metrics and provides real-time flow performance insights. Use the Flow Logs tab to set up Data 360, configure flow logging, and track performance for enabled flows.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer

notes.feature_name: Action Hub Tab
notes.description: Find which Agentforce agents and prompt templates reference standard and custom invocable actions by using the Action Hub tab in the Automation Lightning app. Previously, the Action Hub tab only showed action usage across Flow Builder. Check the Usage tab to view specific agents and prompt templates that reference an action before you make changes. Track execution counts for flows, Apex, and REST invocations that use this action.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer
notes.security_notes: Use of this pilot or beta service is at the Customer’s sole discretion.

notes.feature_name: Set Up and Monitor Flow Logging in One Place
notes.description: Gain visibility into flow performance with the new Flow Logs tab in the Automation Lightning app. Data 360 stores flow run metrics and provides real-time flow performance insights. Use the Flow Logs tab to set up Data 360, configure flow logging, and track performance for enabled flows.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: MuleSoft for Flow: Integration
notes.description: MuleSoft for Flow: Integration is a no-code solution that connects your flows to external systems that use third-party connectors. Use these connectors as triggers or actions, creating seamless data and information exchange between systems.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Data Exchange with a Newly Added Third-Party Connector
notes.description: Use the newly added Plaid third-party connector in flows for no-code connectivity. Use this third-party connector to facilitate data and information exchange between different systems.

notes.feature_name: Use Third-Party Connectors with Full Support (Generally Available)
notes.description: Use this now fully supported, previously-beta third-party connector in flows for no-code connectivity to external systems.

notes.feature_name: Third-Party Connector Triggers
notes.description: Use new third-party connector triggers to poll your External System Change-Triggered flows to check the external system for matching triggers and process the changes.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, Unlimited

notes.feature_name: Third-Party Connector Actions
notes.description: Use new third-party connector actions in any flow type to integrate your flow with an external system.

notes.feature_name: Plaid Third-Party Connector
notes.description: Use the newly added Plaid third-party connector in flows for no-code connectivity. Use this third-party connector to facilitate data and information exchange between different systems.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, Unlimited

notes.feature_name: Full Support for Previously-Beta Third-Party Connector
notes.description: Use this now fully supported, previously-beta third-party connector in flows for no-code connectivity to external systems.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, Unlimited

notes.feature_name: Get More Ways to Trigger Flows with Third-Party Connectors
notes.description: Use new third-party connector triggers to poll your External System Change-Triggered flows to check the external system for matching triggers and process the changes.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Get More Ways to Act on Flows with Third-Party Connectors
notes.description: Use new third-party connector actions in any flow type to integrate your flow with an external system.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Extract Data from Digital and Scanned Documents by Using MuleSoft for Flow: IDP
notes.description: Use MuleSoft for Flow: IDP to transform unstructured and semistructured data into structured, actionable output, enabling automation of document-based workflows. Organizations get lots of unstructured and semistructured documents that have important business data. But getting and processing this information by hand is time-consuming and can introduce mistakes.

notes.feature_name: Flow: IDP
notes.description: IDP you define what data to extract through custom configurations. You set confidence thresholds for automatic processing, and route low-confidence results for human review to verify accuracy. Manage your document processing configurations on the Document Processing tab in the Automation app.
notes.edition: Professional (with API access add-on), Performance, Enterprise, and Unlimited editions

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Backup & Recover
notes.description: Salesforce Backup & Recover is now a native app. Manage backups and recover data directly in your org with a refreshed user interface and automatic region detection.

notes.feature_name: Redirections end for legacy host names
notes.description: Redirections end for legacy host names, including instanced host names in API calls. If a third party serves your custom domain, update the target host name.
notes.breaking_changes: Redirections for legacy host names are no longer supported.

notes.feature_name: Connected app creation disabled by default
notes.description: Connected app creation is disabled by default for all Salesforce orgs. The Salesforce-managed app for the X (formerly Twitter) auth provider is being retired. Create a Canvas app with an external client app. Migrate SAML-enabled connected apps to external client apps.
notes.breaking_changes: Connected app creation is now disabled by default.

notes.feature_name: Health Check
notes.description: Health Check now provides deeper insight by tracking seven new configurable security settings, including MFA status, SAML enablement, and session management controls. Users can also configure who receives notifications whenever your Salesforce security health check score changes.

notes.feature_name: Privacy Center
notes.description: Explore Privacy Requests as a new way to fulfill Right to Be Forgotten (RTBF) requests from your customers.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Shield Enhancements
notes.description: Shield product enhancements make it easier for you to extend security policies to more of your data. Database Encryption is generally available in all regions. Data Detect now scans 100 objects and unlimited fields and Field Audit Trail storage limit increases from 60 to 200. Real-Time Event storage is turned on by default. The Shield app now has setup assistants and simpler access requirements.

notes.feature_name: Security Center
notes.description: Optimize your security posture with centralized alerting across all tenants and enhanced visibility into Login Anomalies via dedicated dashboards. Gain deeper insights into permission assignments while streamlining response times through consolidated investigations and automated remediation plans.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Backup & Recover
notes.description: Salesforce Backup & Recover is now a native app. Manage backups and recover data directly in your org with a refreshed user interface and automatic region detection.
notes.availability: Available on a rolling basis starting in Spring ’26

notes.feature_name: Protect and Recover Your Data with the Backup & Recover App
notes.description: Salesforce Backup & Recover is now a native Salesforce feature that helps you safeguard your Salesforce data by automatically generating daily backups of your data. Use these backups to identify and recover quickly from data loss or corruption. Rather than manage your backups externally, you can enable and manage them directly in your org.
notes.availability: Available on a rolling basis starting in Spring ’26

notes.feature_name: Update References to Legacy Host Names (Release Update)
notes.description: Prevent disruption for your customers and end users when the temporary redirection of legacy (non-enhanced) Salesforce host names ends. With this release update, those redirections end in all orgs. First available in Spring ’25, this update is enforced in Spring ’26.
notes.edition: Group, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Replace Instanced URLs in API Traffic
notes.description: To prevent disruption after infrastructure updates that change your instance name, replace instanced URLs in API traffic with your org’s My Domain login URL. Support for instanced URLs in API traffic ends in Summer ’26.
notes.breaking_changes: Support for instanced URLs in API traffic ends.

notes.feature_name: Switch to a Stable Target Host Name for Your Custom Domain
notes.description: If a third-party service or content delivery network (CDN) serves your custom domain, simplify your maintenance. Work with your third-party provider to change the target host name to your org’s My Domain login URL.

notes.feature_name: Regional Edge Routing Label Was Changed
notes.description: To help you select a routing method for Salesforce Edge Network, the label for the regional method now includes your region name. The functionality and availability of this option are unchanged.

notes.feature_name: Redirections from the My Domain page in Setup
notes.description: This update allows users to review changes related to redirections from the My Domain page in Setup. To review this update, from Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Release Updates, and then select Release Updates.

notes.feature_name: Replace Instanced URLs in API Traffic
notes.description: To prevent disruption after infrastructure updates that change your instance name, replace instanced URLs in API traffic with your org’s My Domain login URL. Support for instanced URLs in API traffic ends in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Switch to a Stable Target Host Name for Your Custom Domain
notes.description: If a third-party service or content delivery network (CDN) serves your custom domain, simplify your maintenance. Work with your third-party provider to change the target host name to your org’s My Domain login URL.

notes.feature_name: Custom Domain Warning for Salesforce Edge Network
notes.description: To reduce the risk of outages during the move to Salesforce Edge Network, we added a warning on the My Domain page when you edit the Routing and Policies section. If your org isn’t on Salesforce Edge Network and a third party serves at least one of the custom domains in the org, you see this warning.

notes.feature_name: Regional Edge Routing Label Change
notes.description: To help you select a routing method for Salesforce Edge Network, the label for the regional method now includes your region name. The functionality and availability of this option are unchanged.
notes.edition: Group, Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Creation of New Connected Apps Is Disabled by Default
notes.description: The ability to create new connected apps is disabled by default for all Salesforce orgs. This change improves security by removing the risks associated with connected apps. This update does not affect any existing connected apps, which will continue to function normally. Also, packaged, existing connected apps that are deployed in a new org aren't affected. We recommend using external client apps for all new integrations and migrating existing connected apps to external client apps.

notes.feature_name: Configure Canvas Plugin for External Client App
notes.description: You can now create a Canvas app using the external client app framework, which is a more secure and modern replacement for connected apps. Existing connected apps with Canvas integrations continue to function normally, including those that are packaged and deployed. We recommend using external client apps for all new Canvas integrations.

notes.feature_name: Track Attempts to Use Uninstalled Connected Apps
notes.description: You can now track denied attempts to use connected apps that aren't installed in your org (uninstalled apps for short). By tracking these denied attempts, you can identify both legitimate and suspicious attempts to use uninstalled apps. You can decide whether to allow usage of the app or to block it entirely.

notes.feature_name: New and Updated Security Alerts for OAuth Flows
notes.description: To discourage users from connecting unfamiliar third-party apps to Salesforce, we added security alerts for OAuth flows. These security alerts appear when a user connects a device to Salesforce via the OAuth 2.0 device flow. We also updated the security alert on the page where users authorize access to their data via OAuth 2.0 flows.

notes.feature_name: Device Activation Is Required for Single Sign-On
notes.description: As part of ongoing measures to uplift security, we’re enforcing a new device activation requirement for users who log in via single sign-on (SSO). We’ll require device activation if the SSO provider doesn’t use authentication methods that meet Salesforce security standards. We’re enforcing this requirement in phases based on the type of identity provider.

notes.feature_name: API-Only Users Are Blocked from Bridging into UI Sessions
notes.description: To improve security, users with the API Only User permission can no longer bridge into UI sessions by using the frontdoor URL generated by the /services/oauth2/singleaccess endpoint, also known as UI Bridge API. This change can break integrations that unintentionally grant UI access to API-only users.
notes.breaking_changes: This change can break integrations that unintentionally grant UI access to API-only users.

notes.feature_name: Set Up Passwordless Login with Passkeys (Beta)
notes.description: Give users a fast, easy, and phishing-resistant alternative to passwords. You can now enable passwordless login with passkeys. With this feature, users can log in with a built-in authenticator.

notes.feature_name: Migrate SAML-Enabled Connected Apps to External Client Apps
notes.description: Bring the improved usability and security of the external client apps framework to your SAML single sign-on (SSO) configurations. With a few clicks, you can now transform SAML-enabled connected apps into external client apps. After migration, you get an identical external app with all of your SAML configurations, while your old connected app remains in read-only mode.

notes.feature_name: Migrate to a Multiple-Configuration SAML Framework
notes.description: If you see this release update, your Salesforce instance is using our original single-configuration SAML framework, which supports single sign-on (SSO) with only one identity provider. We’re giving you a final reminder that with Summer ’26, we’re no longer supporting the single-configuration SAML framework. To make sure that your SSO configurations don’t break, migrate to our newer multiple-configuration SAML framework, which supports SSO with multiple identity providers instead of just one. If you don’t migrate, your SAML SSO configurations will stop working when this release update is enforced in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce-Managed X (Formerly Twitter) Authentication Provider Retirement
notes.description: The Salesforce-managed app for the X (formerly Twitter) authentication provider is being retired. This update breaks any single sign-on (SSO) configurations that use the Salesforce-managed X app. To avoid disruptions, create a custom X app and update your SSO configurations.

notes.feature_name: New LinkedIn Authentication Providers Use LinkedIn API v2
notes.description: To stay up to date with the latest LinkedIn API version, new LinkedIn authentication providers now use LinkedIn API v2. Configurations that you created before Spring ’26 still use LinkedIn API v1. Also, new and existing authentication providers that use the Salesforce-managed LinkedIn app still use LinkedIn API v1.

notes.feature_name: Triple DES for SAML Single Sign-On Stops Working
notes.description: In Summer ’26, SAML single sign-on (SSO) configurations that use the Triple Data Encryption Standard (Triple DES) algorithm will stop working. This change applies to all SSO configurations that use the Triple DES algorithm, whether you use Salesforce as an identity provider or as a service provider. To improve security, use the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithms, AES 128 or AES 256, instead.

notes.feature_name: Sandbox Users with Non-Unique Usernames Can't Be Unfrozen
notes.description: You can't unfreeze a sandbox user if their username exists in another sandbox instance. This change prevents duplicate usernames for active, unfrozen users. To unfreeze a user with a non-unique username, update the username to a unique value.

notes.feature_name: Creation of New Connected Apps Is Disabled by Default
notes.description: The ability to create new connected apps is disabled by default for all Salesforce orgs. This change improves security by removing the risks associated with connected apps. This update does not affect any existing connected apps, which will continue to function normally. Also, packaged, existing connected apps that are deployed in a new org aren't affected. We recommend using external client apps for all new integrations and migrating existing connected apps to external client apps.

notes.feature_name: Disabling Creation of Connected Apps
notes.description: With Spring '26, the ability to create connected apps is disabled. The Allow creation of connected apps preference in External Client App Settings is also removed. To enable creation of new connected apps, contact Salesforce Customer Support.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer
notes.breaking_changes: Creation of new connected apps is disabled.
notes.security_notes: This change addresses an ongoing security threat that takes advantage of connected apps.

notes.feature_name: Configure Canvas Plugin for External Client App
notes.description: You can now create a Canvas app using the external client app framework, which is a more secure and modern replacement for connected apps. Existing connected apps with Canvas integrations continue to function normally, including those that are packaged and deployed. We recommend using external client apps for all new Canvas integrations.
notes.security_notes: With an external client app, you get full metadata compliance and second-generation packaging (2GP) support, with package installation and creation performance that's substantially faster than connected apps.

notes.feature_name: Track Attempts to Use Uninstalled Connected Apps
notes.description: You can now track denied attempts to use connected apps that aren't installed in your org (uninstalled apps for short). By tracking these denied attempts, you can identify both legitimate and suspicious attempts to use uninstalled apps. You can decide whether to allow usage of the app or to block it entirely. This change applies to Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) in all editions. To prevent unauthorized access to your data, Salesforce automatically denies attempts to use uninstalled connected apps unless a user has the Approve Uninstalled Connected Apps user permission. This user permission is intended only for highly trusted users, like admins. As a result, non-admin users can be blocked from using uninstalled apps that have legitimate use cases. Now that you can track denied attempts, you can easily see when a user is stuck in this situation. To allow these users to access legitimate apps from trusted developers, install these apps. By tracking denied attempts, you can also see if a threat actor is trying to use connected apps to get access to your org. To tighten security, block suspicious apps. Blocking a connected app ends all sessions and prevents further usage, even for users with the Approve Uninstalled Connected Apps user permission. On the Connected Apps OAuth Usage page in Setup, review the Denied Attempts Due to Usage Restriction column. You can also review the date and time of the most recent denied attempt.

notes.feature_name: New and Updated Security Alerts for OAuth Flows
notes.description: To discourage users from connecting unfamiliar third-party apps to Salesforce, we added security alerts for OAuth flows. These security alerts appear when a user connects a device to Salesforce via the OAuth 2.0 device flow. We also updated the security alert on the page where users authorize access to their data via OAuth 2.0 flows. This change applies to Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) in all editions.

notes.feature_name: Security Alerts for Device Flow
notes.description: During the device flow, users are prompted to enter a code from the device or app that they're connecting. A security alert has been added to the page where users enter their code, to the page that indicates a successful connection, and to the page that indicates a denied connection. Additionally, the security alert on the page where users authorize an app to access their data via an OAuth flow has been updated.

notes.feature_name: Device Activation Requirement for Single Sign-On
notes.description: As part of ongoing measures to uplift security, a new device activation requirement is enforced for users who log in via single sign-on (SSO). Device activation will be required if the SSO provider doesn’t use authentication methods that meet Salesforce security standards. This requirement will be enforced in phases based on the type of identity provider.

notes.feature_name: Single Sign-On (SSO) Enhancements
notes.description: Starting on January 20, 2026, Salesforce will begin a staggered rollout of the first phase of SSO configurations that use predefined authentication provider types. This includes OpenID Connect (OIDC) providers that do not use a custom authentication provider plug-in. The predefined authentication providers include Apple, Bitbucket, Concur, Facebook, GitHub, Google, Janrain, LinkedIn, Microsoft, Microsoft Access Control Service, MuleSoft, OpenID Connect, Salesforce, Slack, and Twitter (X). Custom provider types are not included in the first phase. Future phases will include other SSO providers, including SAML identity providers.
notes.activation_required: Device activation required if the authentication provider doesn’t use MFA or doesn’t use a strong MFA method.
notes.security_notes: Salesforce checks the AMR claim in the ID token to determine whether to require device activation. Enforced differently based on org type: Active production and sandbox orgs are enforced only for oversized IP ranges, while non-revenue orgs are enforced for all orgs regardless of IP ranges.

notes.feature_name: Changes to Device Activation for Single Sign-On (SSO) Logins
notes.description: To improve security, users with the API Only User permission can no longer bridge into UI sessions by using the frontdoor URL generated by the /services/oauth2/singleaccess endpoint, also known as UI Bridge API. This change can break integrations that unintentionally grant UI access to API-only users. If you call the /services/oauth2/singleaccess endpoint with an access token that was issued to an API-only user, the call fails with a Bad_OAuth_Token error. To allow these users to bridge into UI sessions via frontdoor URLs, remove the API Only User permission.
notes.breaking_changes: API-only users can no longer bridge into UI sessions, which may affect integrations.

notes.feature_name: Set Up Passwordless Login with Passkeys (Beta)
notes.description: Give users a fast, easy, and phishing-resistant alternative to passwords. You can now enable passwordless login with passkeys. With this feature, users can log in with a built-in authenticator (such as Touch ID or Face ID) or a security key (such as a YubiKey or mobile device). This feature is available only for internal users, such as employees, who log in to your Salesforce org. It isn't available for Experience Cloud site users. Passkeys are phishing-resistant, making them more secure than password-based authentication. They're also more convenient for users. Because passkeys inherently use multiple factors for authentication, they satisfy the Salesforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) requirement.

notes.feature_name: Passwordless Login with Passkeys
notes.description: You can enable passwordless login with passkeys on the Identity Verification page in Setup. Passwordless login with passkeys is available only for users with a registered built-in authenticator or security key, and only for saved usernames. To log in, users click on their saved username and then use their built-in authenticator or security key.

notes.feature_name: Migrate SAML-Enabled Connected Apps to External Client Apps
notes.description: Bring the improved usability and security of the external client apps framework to your SAML single sign-on (SSO) configurations. With a few clicks, you can now transform SAML-enabled connected apps into external client apps. After migration, you get an identical external app with all of your SAML configurations, while your old connected app remains in read-only mode. External client apps are a more secure, modern replacement for connected apps. We recommend that you use external client apps instead of connected apps whenever possible. Previously, the external client apps migration tool supported only the OAuth plugin. Now, you can migrate apps that use the SAML plugin.

notes.feature_name: Migrate to a Multiple-Configuration SAML Framework
notes.description: If you see this release update, your Salesforce instance is using our original single-configuration SAML framework, which supports single sign-on (SSO) with only one identity provider. We’re giving you a final reminder that with Summer ’26, we’re no longer supporting the single-configuration SAML framework. To make sure that your SSO configurations don’t break, migrate to our newer multiple-configuration SAML framework, which supports SSO with multiple identity providers instead of just one. If you don’t migrate, your SAML SSO configurations will stop working when this release update is enforced in Summer ’26.
notes.timeline: Enforced for production instances in Summer ’26; enforced for sandboxes in Summer ’24.
notes.breaking_changes: If you don’t migrate, your SAML SSO configurations will stop working when this release update is enforced in Summer ’26.

notes.feature_name: Migration to Multiple-Configuration SAML Framework
notes.description: Salesforce is removing support for the single-configuration SAML SSO framework. All SAML SSO configurations must migrate to the newer multiple-configuration framework, which allows integration with multiple external identity providers. If migration is not completed, existing SAML SSO configurations will break when the update is enforced.
notes.breaking_changes: Salesforce login URL changes, SAML responses must include the audience attribute, Salesforce generates a new self-signed certificate for signing SAML requests, and unparseable SAML responses will not be recorded in login history.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of Salesforce-Managed X Authentication Provider
notes.description: The Salesforce-managed app for the X (formerly Twitter) authentication provider is being retired, which will break any SSO configurations using this app. Users are advised to create a custom X app and update their SSO configurations to avoid disruptions.
notes.timeline: Salesforce enforces this update in Summer ’26

notes.feature_name: Salesforce-managed X App Retirement
notes.description: Salesforce removed the ability to use the Salesforce-managed X app for new authentication providers, but continued to support it for existing authentication providers created before Spring ’24. Now, the Salesforce-managed X app is being fully retired. Instead, you must use a custom X app and specify its consumer key and secret in your authentication provider configuration. With a custom X app, you have more control over your SSO configuration.
notes.breaking_changes: If an X authentication provider uses the Salesforce-managed app, it stops working when this release update is enforced. Users can no longer use the authentication provider to log in via SSO.

notes.feature_name: New LinkedIn Authentication Providers Use LinkedIn API v2
notes.description: To stay up to date with the latest LinkedIn API version, new LinkedIn authentication providers now use LinkedIn API v2. Configurations created before Spring ’26 still use LinkedIn API v1. Also, new and existing authentication providers that use the Salesforce-managed LinkedIn app still use LinkedIn API v1.

notes.feature_name: Triple DES for SAML Single Sign-On Stops Working
notes.description: In Summer ’26, SAML single sign-on (SSO) configurations that use the Triple Data Encryption Standard (Triple DES) algorithm will stop working. This change applies to all SSO configurations that use the Triple DES algorithm, whether you use Salesforce as an identity provider or as a service provider. To improve security, use the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithms, AES 128 or AES 256, instead.
notes.timeline: Triple DES will stop working in Summer ’26.
notes.security_notes: To improve security, use AES 128 or AES 256 instead of Triple DES.

notes.feature_name: Update SAML Configurations for Security
notes.description: It is recommended to update your SAML configurations to use the AES 128 or AES 256 algorithms instead of the Triple DES algorithm, which uses a cryptographic key that’s too short to be secure. The AES algorithms use longer keys that make them harder to attack. Before Summer ’26, update your configurations based on whether you use Salesforce as an identity provider or as a service provider.
notes.security_notes: Update your configurations to use AES 128 or AES 256 algorithms.

notes.feature_name: Sandbox Users with Non-Unique Usernames Can't Be Unfrozen
notes.description: You can't unfreeze a sandbox user if their username exists in another sandbox instance. This change prevents duplicate usernames for active, unfrozen users. To unfreeze a user with a non-unique username, update the username to a unique value.

notes.feature_name: Update and Delete Named Credentials from Apex
notes.description: You can now update or delete a named credential, an external credential, or an external auth identity provider from Apex. ISVs and partners that build managed package apps can use these new Apex methods for automated setup and more flexible management of external system integrations. If a customer uses a managed package that programmatically updates the endpoint URL for a named credential or any URL fields on its related external credential or auth identity provider, the Enabled for Callouts field on the named credential is turned off until an admin manually reviews and enables it.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.security_notes: If the named credential Enabled for Callouts field is turned off, the customer admin must review any endpoint changes to the named credential or its related external credential or external auth identity provider and manually enable the field.

notes.feature_name: New Configurable Settings Added to Health Check
notes.description: Health Check now provides deeper insight by tracking seven new configurable security settings, including MFA status, SAML enablement, and session management controls.

notes.feature_name: Stay Secure with Proactive Health Check Notifications
notes.description: Configure who receives notifications whenever your Salesforce security health check score changes. Notifications help admins stay informed and take action quickly.

notes.feature_name: Delete Records in Your Org and Data 360 with Privacy Requests
notes.description: When fulfilling Right to Be Forgotten (RTBF) requests from your customers, you can now delete records across your Salesforce org and Data 360 with a single, integrated solution. Use Privacy Requests to find and selectively delete records for a data subject. Easily search for records using flexible criteria, see record details and relationships, and make informed decisions about data deletion.

notes.feature_name: Get Shield Setup Assistants and Usage Insights
notes.description: The Shield app now includes Setup Assistants for Data Detect, Field Audit Trail, Event Monitoring, and Platform Encryption. Maximize your Shield implementation by staying up to date on key setup tasks, ranging from user access to feature activation. Monitor and maintain your setup with at-a-glance insights, including usage metrics, data trends, and job statuses.

notes.feature_name: Simplify How Users Access the Shield App
notes.description: If your users have the required permissions to access either Data Detect, Event Monitoring, or Platform Encryption, then they can view the Shield app by default. Previously, the View Shield App Pages user permission was required to view the app. Now, that permission is required only for users who lack other Shield-related access privileges.

notes.feature_name: Event Monitoring
notes.description: Strengthen your security posture with automatic data storage by default for Report, ListView, Login, LoginAs, and Logout events, ensuring critical audit data is available from day one.

notes.feature_name: Operation field in ApiEvent
notes.description: Operation field in ApiEvent now tracks delete activities, providing deeper insight into critical data changes.

notes.feature_name: Data Detect
notes.description: Data Detect scan scope and scale increase to handle 100 objects with unlimited fields. You can now scan for custom keywords alongside structured sensitive data to improve regulatory compliance and flag sensitive internal terminology. With the availability of a Standalone License for Data Detect, you can understand your Personally Identifiable Information (PII) exposure. Or, run a scan without needing to purchase the full Shield bundle.

notes.feature_name: Field History Explorer
notes.description: Field History Explorer enables users to download metadata and revert changes to tracked fields. The increased limit of 200 tracked fields per object further supports broader auditing needs and stricter compliance standards.

notes.feature_name: Database Encryption
notes.description: Reduce friction in the encryption process with Database Encryption, now generally available in all regions. Bring Your Own Key for Data 360 opens more root key management options.

notes.feature_name: Shield Setup Assistants and Usage Insights
notes.description: The Shield app now includes Setup Assistants for Data Detect, Field Audit Trail, Event Monitoring, and Platform Encryption. Maximize your Shield implementation by staying up to date on key setup tasks, ranging from user access to feature activation. Monitor and maintain your setup with at-a-glance insights, including usage metrics, data trends, and job statuses.

notes.feature_name: Simplify How Users Access the Shield App
notes.description: If your users have the required permissions to access either Data Detect, Event Monitoring, or Platform Encryption, then they can view the Shield app by default. Previously, the View Shield App Pages user permission was required to view the app. Now, that permission is required only for users who lack other Shield-related access privileges.

notes.feature_name: Automatic Storage for Select Real-Time Events
notes.description: Data storage is now enabled by default for Report Event, ListView Event, Login Event, LoginAs Event, and Logout Event. This ensures that critical security and audit event data is captured automatically from day one.

notes.feature_name: New Grant Login Access Event
notes.description: To help protect sensitive data in production and sandbox environments, you can now monitor the Grant Account Login Access setting. Use this new event to trigger Transaction Security Policies (TSP) that automatically alert your admins or block access.

notes.feature_name: Delete Operation Tracking for ApiEvent
notes.description: ApiEvent now tracks delete operations. The Operation field has been expanded to capture these critical activities for improved security monitoring.

notes.feature_name: Delete Operation Tracking for ApiEvent
notes.description: ApiEvent now tracks delete operations. The Operation field has been expanded to capture these critical activities for improved security monitoring.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.security_notes: This change enables users to protect sensitive data integrity and prevent unauthorized changes.

notes.feature_name: Data Detect Scan Scope and Scale Increase
notes.description: Data Detect scan scope and scale increase to handle 100 objects with unlimited fields. You can now scan for custom keywords alongside structured sensitive data to improve regulatory compliance and flag sensitive internal terminology.
notes.security_notes: With the availability of a Standalone License for Data Detect, you can understand your Personally Identifiable Information (PII) exposure.

notes.feature_name: Scan for Custom Keywords with Data Detect
notes.description: Improve operational and regulatory compliance by identifying specific, sensitive exact words or phrases within your data. You can now optionally scan for custom keywords alongside structured sensitive data (custom patterns) when creating a Data Detect policy.

notes.feature_name: Purchase a Standalone License for Data Detect
notes.description: You can now acquire Data Detect without purchasing the full Shield bundle. The system is configured to validate the presence of this new, dedicated license and provide access to all Data Detect functionality.

notes.feature_name: Access and Run Data Detect Scans and Results with REST APIs
notes.description: Use programmatic access with Salesforce Data Detect with two new REST APIs that can run and view scan results. Retrieve (GET) returns the list of existing Data Detect policies with their details. Scan posts the DataDetect policy scan for execution.

notes.feature_name: Scan for Custom Keywords with Data Detect
notes.description: Improve operational and regulatory compliance by identifying specific, sensitive exact words or phrases within your data. You can now optionally scan for custom keywords alongside structured sensitive data (custom patterns) when creating a Data Detect policy.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Salesforce Shield or Data Detect Licenses

notes.feature_name: Purchase a Standalone License for Data Detect
notes.description: You can now acquire Data Detect without purchasing the full Shield bundle. The system is configured to validate the presence of this new, dedicated license and provide access to all Data Detect functionality.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Salesforce Shield or Data Detect Licenses

notes.feature_name: Access and Run Data Detect Scans and Results with REST APIs
notes.description: Use programmatic access with Salesforce Data Detect with two new REST APIs that can run and view scan results. Retrieve (GET) returns the list of existing Data Detect policies with their details. Scan posts the DataDetect policy scan for execution.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with the Salesforce Shield or Data Detect Licenses

notes.feature_name: Field Audit Trail
notes.description: Field History Explorer enables users to download metadata and revert changes to tracked fields. The increased limit of 200 tracked fields per object further supports broader auditing needs and stricter compliance standards.

notes.feature_name: Increasing the Field Audit Trail Limit Beyond 60
notes.description: Track more fields and meet compliance needs more efficiently with a significantly increased Field Audit Trail limit of 200 tracked fields.

notes.feature_name: Enhancements to Field History Tracking
notes.description: Users can now download metadata and revert changes to tracked fields with the Field History Explorer feature of Field Audit Trail.

notes.feature_name: Database Encryption (GA Release)
notes.description: Database Encryption is generally available worldwide. It began its deployment in Winter '26. Database Encryption allows you to sort, filter and reference encrypted data without functional or performance tradeoffs. You can still apply Field Level Encryption to individual fields if required.

notes.feature_name: Bring Your Own Key to Data 360
notes.description: Platform Encryption for Data 360 customers can now make use of the Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) feature of Shield Platform Encryption. When you supply your own root key, you get the benefits built into Salesforce Shield Platform Encryption, plus the extra assurance that comes from exclusively managing your own key material. For Data 360, BYOK supports root keys only. Data 360 then manages all DEK creation and wrapping using the root key.

notes.feature_name: Encrypt Your Entire Database
notes.description: Database Encryption is generally available worldwide. It began its deployment in Winter '26. Due to the pace of the controlled release, some regions lagged in enabling the new feature. Database Encryption allows you to sort, filter and reference encrypted data without functional or performance tradeoffs. You can still apply Field Level Encryption to individual fields if required.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Bring Your Own Key to Data 360
notes.description: Platform Encryption for Data 360 customers can now make use of the Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) feature of Shield Platform Encryption. When you supply your own root key, you get the benefits built into Salesforce Shield Platform Encryption, plus the extra assurance that comes from exclusively managing your own key material. For Data 360, BYOK supports root keys only. Data 360 then manages all DEK creation and wrapping using the root key. To be compatible with Salesforce BYOK, use a PKCS#8 encrypted, Base64 encoded 4096 RSA key pair with appropriate headers and footers.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Data 360 enabled

notes.feature_name: Security Center
notes.description: Optimize your security posture with centralized alerting across all tenants and enhanced visibility into Login Anomalies via dedicated dashboards. Gain deeper insights into permission assignments while streamlining response times through consolidated investigations and automated remediation plans.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Login Anomaly Events Across Environments
notes.description: A new Login Anomaly event is now available in the Threat Detection metric and dashboard, significantly enhancing the monitoring of suspicious logins.

notes.feature_name: New Permission Metrics for Comprehensive Monitoring
notes.description: Gain more granular control and deeper security insight with new permission metrics.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Login Anomaly Events Across Environments
notes.description: A new Login Anomaly event is now available in the Threat Detection metric and dashboard, significantly enhancing the monitoring of suspicious logins. This change improves visibility and control over an organization's security posture.

notes.feature_name: New Permission Metrics for Comprehensive Monitoring
notes.description: Gain more granular control and deeper security insight with new permission metrics. Monitor expanded permission assignments, including details on when and how a permission was assigned, covering security, connected applications, and AI agents. This change significantly improves visibility and control over an organization's security posture.

notes.feature_name: Set Alerts at the Child Tenant Level
notes.description: Set up alerts easily across all organizations, whether they are parent or child tenants.

notes.feature_name: Distinguish Between Blocked and Reported CSP Violations
notes.description: See at a glance whether a recent violation blocked a resource request or redirection with the new Impact field on the Trusted URL and Browser Policy Violations list. Violations with an impact of Reported block that resource request only when you enable a stricter CSP policy, such as when you enable Adopt Updated CSP Directives in Session Settings. Previously, you used the DISPOSITION field of the CSP Violation Event Type object to determine whether a violation was enforced or reported.
affected_components: Trusted URL and Browser Policy Violations

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Sites Display the Specified Favicon Only
notes.description: Salesforce Sites now support an empty value in the Site Favorite Icon field.

notes.feature_name: Salesforce Sites Display the Specified Favicon Only
notes.description: Salesforce Sites now support an empty value in the Site Favorite Icon field.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Organize Articles and Improve Navigation with Knowledge Maps (Generally Available)
notes.description: Knowledge Maps are now generally available to help organize articles and improve navigation.

notes.feature_name: Identify and Address Gaps in Your Knowledge Base with Self Learning Knowledge (Generally Available)
notes.description: Self Learning Knowledge is now generally available to help identify and address gaps in your knowledge base.

notes.feature_name: Guide Your Users Through Interactive Troubleshooting for Proactive Scenarios
notes.description: This feature allows users to navigate through troubleshooting processes interactively, enhancing their ability to resolve issues proactively.

notes.feature_name: Help Experience Cloud Site Users Track Their History with a Personalized Activity Timeline
notes.description: Users can now track their history through a personalized activity timeline, enhancing their experience on the Experience Cloud site.

notes.feature_name: Guide Experience Cloud Site Users with a Proactive Pending Task Banner
notes.description: This feature introduces a proactive pending task banner to guide users on the Experience Cloud site.

notes.feature_name: Bill AI Self-Service Usage More Accurately with Session-Based Tracking
notes.description: This enhancement allows for more accurate billing of AI self-service usage through session-based tracking.

notes.feature_name: Improve Dynamic Q&A Performance with Persisted Questions and Answers for Authenticated Users
notes.description: This enhancement improves the performance of dynamic Q&A by allowing persisted questions and answers for authenticated users.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Proactive Service Campaign Performance
notes.description: This feature allows users to monitor the performance of proactive service campaigns.

notes.feature_name: Service Setup and Service Setup Assistant Retiring in New Orgs
notes.description: The Service Setup and Service Setup Assistant will be retired in new organizations.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Your Hybrid Service Team with Command Center for Service
notes.description: This feature allows monitoring of hybrid service teams through the Command Center for Service.

notes.feature_name: Route Voice Conversations to External Bots
notes.description: This feature enables the routing of voice conversations to external bots.

notes.feature_name: AI Agents for Service Cloud
notes.description: AI Agents for Service Cloud help employees complete common business tasks quickly and assist service reps in closing cases faster with guidance.

notes.feature_name: Customer Signals Intelligence
notes.description: This enhancement streamlines the setup experience and empowers reps with real-time insights to address customer needs effectively.

notes.feature_name: Einstein Service Replies
notes.description: Translate customer replies to inquiries automatically, and have your service reps responses translated automatically for customers.

notes.feature_name: Entitlements and Milestones
notes.description: Define rules to automatically pause milestone timers when the next step is outside a service rep's control. Use Agentforce SLA Summary for comprehensive performance analytics. Get real-time visibility into milestone status across parent and child records to ensure better coordination and alignment across all teams contributing to resolution.

notes.feature_name: Feedback Management
notes.description: Enable deeper customization and reliability for your surveys. Drive brand consistency using Custom CSS for flexible styling, and ensure better readability on desktops and small screens with the revamped Matrix Survey Question View. You can now configure partial response saving for up to 999 days, and save partial responses automatically for unauthenticated guest users.

notes.feature_name: HR Service
notes.description: Onboard new users with Unified Employee License (UEL), a standard license with simplified administration and wall-to-wall coverage that expands feature support for new users. Provide a trusted channel for all employees with confidential case reporting for secure management of workplace issues.

notes.feature_name: Knowledge Maps
notes.description: Organize articles hierarchically with Knowledge Maps for easier navigation. Create knowledge articles efficiently with the enhanced Lightning Article Editor. Unified Knowledge retires in Summer ’26, so migrate to Data 360 connectors.
notes.timeline: Retirement of Unified Knowledge in Summer '26

notes.feature_name: Self Service Enhancements
notes.description: Deliver smarter, more efficient customer service with improved proactive detection, AI-guided troubleshooting, real-time personalization, and streamlined Self-Service. Enhanced detection tools, interactive troubleshooting, unified profiles, Activity Timelines, and a personalized Pending Task banner create more contextual experiences, while Agentic Portals offer accurate session-based AI billing and faster Dynamic Q&A, boosting responsiveness and reducing support needs.

notes.feature_name: AI Agents for Service Cloud
notes.description: With the AI Agents for Service, employees quickly complete common business tasks with Agentforce Employee Agent, and service reps close cases faster using case resolution guidance provided by Agentforce Service Assistant.

notes.feature_name: Expand Agentforce Service Assistant Capabilities
notes.description: Expand the capabilities of Agentforce Service Assistant by adding the Case Feed and Messaging Session and Voice Call records as grounding sources to improve service plan accuracy and relevance. We've also added translation support, allowing service plans to be presented in the service rep's preferred language.

notes.feature_name: Draft Service Plans in Service Rep's Preferred Language
notes.description: Have service reps work Cases faster using service plans that are translated into their preferred language. When service reps draft a service plan, the plan is generated in your company’s preferred language. Additionally, when Real-Time Translations are enabled, the service plan is then translated into the service rep's preferred language.

notes.feature_name: Use Case Feed as the Latest Grounding Source
notes.description: Adding Case Feed data to Service Assistant improves the accuracy and relevance of Service Plans. This richer, more contextual case activity enables the assistant to deliver more informed, relevant recommendations.

notes.feature_name: Add More Context to Service Plans
notes.description: Enhance the accuracy and details of service plans by grounding Service Assistant in Messaging Session and Voice Call records. When these records are attached to a case, Service Assistant analyzes the transcripts to create a case summary that summarizes what took place in the conversation and drafts a service plan that continues from where the conversation ended. The grounding process boosts rep productivity by ensuring the service plan continues exactly from where the prior interaction left off and avoids repeating steps and manual context gathering.

notes.feature_name: Draft Comprehensive Service Plans with Expanded Data Access
notes.description: Service Assistant now drafts all service plans based on the permissions of the ServicePlanner User (the digital agent), rather than the individual service rep. This ensures that every service plan contains the most detailed information, regardless of an individual rep's field-level access or sharing rules.

notes.feature_name: Real-Time Translations for Service Assistant
notes.description: Translation of service plans into your service reps preferred language is available only with Agentforce for Service and Agentforce 1 editions. Service Assistant automatically drafts service plans in your company's preferred language when the language is supported in Prompt Builder. When the Real-Time Translations feature is turned on, Service Assistant translates service plans into your service reps’ preferred language. Service Assistant supports the same languages as Real Time Translations.
notes.activation_required: Salesforce admins need the Service Planner Builder permission set to turn on Real-Time Translations for Service Assistant. Service reps need the Service Plan Translation and Service Plan User permission sets to view service plans in their preferred language.

notes.feature_name: Real-Time Translations for Service Plans
notes.description: Translation of service plans into your company’s preferred language is automatically enabled. However, the language must be a part of the Prompt Builder supported languages. To turn on Real-Time Translations, go to the Real-Time Translations Setup page and turn on the feature for Service Assistant. After, assign your service reps the Service Plan Translation permission set.

notes.feature_name: Use Case Feed as the Latest Grounding Source to Strengthen Service Plans
notes.description: Adding Case Feed data to Service Assistant improves the accuracy and relevance of Service Plans. This richer, more contextual case activity enables the assistant to deliver more informed, relevant recommendations.
notes.activation_required: Salesforce admins need the Service Planner Builder permission set to enable Case Feed Grounding for Service Assistant.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Einstein for Service, Agentforce for Service, and Agentforce 1 editions.
notes.security_notes: Service Planner User permission set is required for service reps to draft service plans with information from Case Feed.

notes.feature_name: Add More Context to Service Plans with Messaging Session and Voice Call Record Grounding
notes.description: Enhance the accuracy and details of service plans by grounding Service Assistant in Messaging Session and Voice Call records. When these records are attached to a case, Service Assistant analyzes the transcripts to create a case summary that summarizes what took place in the conversation and drafts a service plan that continues from where the conversation ended. The grounding process boosts rep productivity by ensuring the service plan continues exactly from where the prior interaction left off and avoids repeating steps and manual context gathering.
notes.activation_required: Requires Service Planner Builder permission set
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Einstein for Service, Agentforce for Service, and Agentforce 1 editions
notes.security_notes: To set up Messaging Session and Voice Call record grounding for Service Assistant, Salesforce admins need the Service Planner Builder permission set. To ground service plans in Messaging Session or Voice Call records, the ServicePlanner User needs the Conversation Grounding Access custom permission set that has these permissions: App permission: Access Conversations Entries, View All Voice and Video Calls; Messaging Session object permission: Read, View All Records. To view Messaging Session or Voice Call information in a service plan, service reps need the Service Planner User permission set.

notes.feature_name: Draft Comprehensive Service Plans with Expanded Data Access
notes.description: Service Assistant now drafts all service plans based on the permissions of the ServicePlanner User (the digital agent), rather than the individual service rep. This ensures that every service plan contains the most detailed information, regardless of an individual rep's field-level access or sharing rules. Service plans now include all fields and object information set in your Service AI Grounding configuration, even if the service rep doesn’t have field-level access. Plan steps are always grounded in your relevant knowledge articles, even when the service rep doesn’t have access to the articles used to create the plan.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer editions with Einstein for Service, Agentforce for Service, and Agentforce 1 editions

notes.feature_name: Boost SLA Compliance by Using Agentforce SLA Summary
notes.description: Get a complete view of your Service Level Agreement (SLA) performance with Agentforce SLA Summary. Track essential metrics including SLA breach data and trends, milestone performance, and service representative workload and efficiency. Quickly identify risk indicators, monitor average response and resolution times against defined targets, and identify records that are closest to missing an SLA.

notes.feature_name: Boost SLA Compliance by Using Agentforce SLA Summary
notes.description: Get a complete view of your Service Level Agreement (SLA) performance with Agentforce SLA Summary. Track essential metrics including SLA breach data and trends, milestone performance, and service representative workload and efficiency. Quickly identify risk indicators, monitor average response and resolution times against defined targets, and identify records that are closest to missing an SLA.
notes.edition: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Collaboration Channels
notes.description: IT support teams can now access critical CMDB data directly in Microsoft Teams to investigate and triage issues with better context. MS Teams now natively supports approvals, notifications, and record channels, and apps are renamed for better clarity. Transition your Teams workspace from legacy ticketing to a modern, conversational AI experience.

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Database and Service Graph Enhancements
notes.description: Improve configuration accuracy, streamline attribute management, and gain better visibility into service dependencies with new Configuration Management Database (CMDB) enhancements. Use the unified Configuration Item (CI) Attributes Manager to define and organize configuration item attributes and attribute sets from a single workspace. Extend attribute modeling with the type Lookup Relationship to link CIs to important business objects. Highlight important details on CI records with Key Attributes. Configure CI data faster with import improvements. Build tailored service map layouts to visualize dependencies in ways that align with your operational needs. Review and track how CIs change over time by using the CI History tab in a CI record page.

notes.feature_name: Discovery for Salesforce CMDB and Service Graph Enhancements
notes.description: Automate asset tracking and gain better visibility into configuration item activity with new Discovery enhancements. Integrate Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB to bring more device data into your configuration management processes. Use new Discovery audit fields on configuration items to understand when an asset was first discovered, updated, or rescanned. Review installed software and system components from the new Components tab on each configuration item record. These enhancements improve asset coverage, simplify operations, and give you better insights across your IT environment.

notes.feature_name: New Canonical GraphQL API in Configuration Management Database
notes.description: Use the Canonical GraphQL API to query and manage configuration items in the Agentforce IT Service configuration management database (CMDB).

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Catalog Deployment with Ready-to-Use Service Templates
notes.description: Speed up your service catalog rollout by deploying predefined workflows for standardized IT requests. Benefit from prestructured attributes, intake forms, and automated fulfillment flows with templates that span critical areas, including IT, hardware, software, facilities, employee lifecycle, and identity management. Eliminate ad hoc communication, reduce help desk workload, and track and audit every request automatically.

notes.feature_name: Automate Access and Streamline Provisioning with External Integrations
notes.description: Deploy service catalog items that use direct API integration with external systems, dramatically reducing complex configuration. Eliminate manual error in data collection with enhanced intake flows that use external connectors to query third-party data, such as a list of available software. Reduce help desk workload and eliminate user wait times by automating high-frequency requests, such as account unlocking and secure access provisioning, with fulfillment flows.

notes.feature_name: Prioritize Issues Using Service Management Privileges
notes.description: Ensure critical employee issues receive immediate attention by using Service Management Privileges. Admins can now assign privileges to employees and set a specific access threshold to identify incidents requiring special handling. When an incident is created or reported by an employee whose access level meets this threshold, a banner is displayed on the Incident record page of the fulfillers. The distinct visual cue streamlines triage, ensuring your most important stakeholders receive prioritized resolution without manual intervention.

notes.feature_name: Demote Major Incidents When Business Impact Changes
notes.description: Maintain flexibility in your support processes by de-escalating major incidents when impact and severity decrease. Authorized users can demote a major incident back to a standard incident without disrupting existing approval work items or ongoing resolution efforts. Align your IT help desk's response with the actual business needs, and allow for dynamic adjustments as situations stabilize.

notes.feature_name: Prevent Outages with CI-Based Change Conflict Detection
notes.description: Reduce change failure rates and ensure a stable IT environment by gaining early visibility into potential conflicts. When multiple change requests target the same configuration item (CI) during an overlapping implementation timeframe, conflicts are identified and captured automatically. Change fulfillers and managers can view these records to collaborate and resolve them. Replace manual cross-referencing and prevent IT teams from inadvertently disrupting the same CI simultaneously.

notes.feature_name: Create Incidents as Service Requests when Appropriate
notes.description: IT teams can create incidents as service requests when the reported issue represents a user need, such as access or provisioning, rather than a service disruption. Creating a service request routes the request through the correct fulfillment workflow, and avoids incident-specific timelines and SLAs.

notes.feature_name: Track IT Service Requests Using Dedicated Service Request Records
notes.description: Manage IT service requests using the new Service Request record instead of the generic Case record. IT teams can use a specialized data model that includes attributes designed specifically for request fulfillment, to manage high-volume, repeatable tasks efficiently. By distinguishing service requests from cases and incidents, you ensure the right process, SLAs, and reporting model is applied to every IT task.

notes.feature_name: Access Comprehensive Employee Data with Employee 360 Insights
notes.description: Give your IT help desk a centralized, 360-degree view of all employee assets, service requests, support cases, and historical interactions to maximize operational efficiency. Support reps can quickly access comprehensive employee data.

notes.feature_name: Default Field Validations for Changes and Releases
notes.description: Admins can now activate default field validations for change requests and releases to automatically prevent common errors, such as invalid date ranges or missing required fields. These preconfigured checks enforce data consistency during both record creation and updates. By safeguarding data integrity without manual oversight, IT teams can maintain accurate, reliable, and auditable records.

notes.feature_name: Extended Release Schedules and General Events
notes.description: Release managers can now plan and schedule IT service releases and related calendar events without a 14-day duration limit. This gives teams more flexibility to plan, track, and manage longer-running releases without changing existing release behavior or using workarounds.

notes.feature_name: Ready-to-Use Service Templates
notes.description: Speed up your service catalog rollout by deploying predefined workflows for standardized IT requests. Benefit from prestructured attributes, intake forms, and automated fulfillment flows with templates that span critical areas, including IT, hardware, software, facilities, employee lifecycle, and identity management. Eliminate ad hoc communication, reduce help desk workload, and track and audit every request automatically.

notes.feature_name: Automate Access and Streamline Provisioning with External Integrations
notes.description: Deploy service catalog items that use direct API integration with external systems, dramatically reducing complex configuration. Eliminate manual error in data collection with enhanced intake flows that use external connectors to query third-party data, such as a list of available software. Reduce help desk workload and eliminate user wait times by automating high-frequency requests, such as account unlocking and secure access provisioning, with fulfillment flows.
notes.activation_required: Requires MuleSoft for Flow: Integrations add-on license

notes.feature_name: Manage Integrations Connections Permission
notes.description: To create, view, edit, and delete connections, users need the Manage Integrations Connections permission. This feature allows templates integrated with connector APIs and actions to drastically cut the time IT and security teams spend on service requests.

notes.feature_name: Unified Employee License (UEL)
notes.description: Streamline the provisioning of new employees and simplify access management by utilizing the IT Service Portal Employee User permission set license (PSL), Unified Employee License (UEL) and the standard Unified Employee profile. This new licensing model replaces the need for custom Customer licenses.

notes.feature_name: Unified Employee License (UEL)
notes.description: Streamline the provisioning of new employees and simplify access management by utilizing the IT Service Portal Employee User permission set license (PSL), Unified Employee License (UEL) and the standard Unified Employee profile. This new licensing model replaces the need for custom Customer Community Plus (CCP) profiles, and you can create an Employee record from a User record with a single click. This process applies only when you create new employee users. Existing users modeled as employees with a CCP license and profile are unaffected. New UEL users maintain the same access and permissions as existing CCP users.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Chat Setup Automation
notes.description: Accelerate your IT service management configuration with a new automated setup for Enhanced Chat that configures queues, flows, and routing instantly. Take advantage of the two simplified solution bundles to clearly distinguish between core IT processes and enhanced features such as AI and Analytics. These updated bundles include streamlined initial setup critical components, and sample data to significantly reduce manual configuration time.

notes.feature_name: Consolidated Solution Bundles for IT Service
notes.description: Get your IT Service organization up and running faster with a consolidated, single-card experience. We have combined previous solution bundles into one Agentforce IT Service Initial Setup card, significantly simplifying the installation process. Admins can now select which solution bundle to deploy and also they can deploy both data and metadata or only metadata.
affected_components: Agentforce IT Service Initial Setup card

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Chat Setup for Agentforce IT Service
notes.description: Streamline the deployment of the Enhanced Chat feature for IT Service with a new setup experience. Replace a series of complex manual configurations by using the new section Set Up Enhanced Chat on the Agentforce for IT Service feature Set Up page. This setup enables and configures necessary Omni-Channel settings, and creates routing configurations and queues for your inbound chat requests. It also activates and deploys the IT Service Employee Agent template, and creates the underlying flows required for routing conversations to the appropriate agent. By handling the complex tasks automatically, this new setup leaves only the security-specific tasks such as adding trusted URLs to CORS for manual completion.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce IT Service Initial Setup Card

notes.feature_name: AI for IT Teams and Employees
notes.description: Use the predictive intelligence suite to forecast the likelihood of major incidents, SLA breaches, and change failures, and use Einstein to take quick actions that improve IT support reps productivity. Enhancements to proactive assistance and service assistant help IT teams to shift from reactive firefighting to proactive, data-driven risk mitigation. Additional agent actions for employees and IT teams enhance employee satisfaction and streamline your IT processes.

notes.feature_name: AI Chat for Employee Self-Service
notes.description: Integrate AI into the support workflow with Agentforce to reduce the need for employees to go through traditional IT help desk queues. Employees can now easily add comments or reopen resolved tickets using Agentforce, eliminating manual navigation. New enhancements allow employees to retrieve ticket status by description, automatically associate assigned assets, and create and manage service catalog requests conversationally. The Agentforce integration into employee self-service provides a seamless, conversational support workflow, leading to higher employee satisfaction with IT services.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce Summaries and Intelligent Attribute Audits
notes.description: Boost your IT service management efficiency with Agentforce actions that remove the need for manual data processing. Automatically create release summaries and post-incident reports, transforming technical details into clear updates for stakeholders. Ensure accurate ticket routing.

notes.feature_name: Proactive IT Management with Predictive Intelligence Suite
notes.description: Enhance service stability and proactively manage risk across Incident and Change Management by implementing three new, dynamic predictive models. The Major Incident Likelihood Score, SLA Breach Likelihood Score, and Change Risk Score provide fulfillers and change managers with quantifiable, real-time risk assessments on a 0–100 scale, enabling effective prioritization, prediction of service failures, and objective assessment of change failure probability, ultimately reducing business disruption.

notes.feature_name: Optimize IT Operations with Priority-Based Proactive Assistance
notes.description: Admins can now configure proactive assistance to trigger actions only on specific priority levels for incidents and problems. By limiting automated actions to specific records, ensure that your AI resources are focused on high-impact issues. Consequently, IT teams get a data-driven head start on critical issues, and avoid unnecessary processing of low-severity tickets.

notes.feature_name: Diagnose Root Causes Faster with Proactive Assistance for Problems
notes.description: Automatically trigger AI actions when a Problem record is created and eliminate the need for IT support reps to converse with Agentforce or manually perform actions. Use proactive assistance to summarize the problem, validate status and impact, identify and associate similar problems, and get proposed root cause and resolution summaries. By delivering customized service plans and recommended tasks for a problem, proactive actions help IT support reps spend less time on administration and more on root cause resolution.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Incident Resolution with Quick Actions in Service Plan
notes.description: Integrate quick actions into the Incident Service Plan to resolve common steps instantly. The designated buttons appear within the executable resolution plan, allowing fulfillers to complete repetitive tasks such as logging communication or updating a record with a single click. Quick actions simplify the entire resolution process, leading to faster and more efficient incident resolution.

notes.feature_name: Automate Problem Routing and Change Request Creation
notes.description: Reduce administrative overhead and allow teams to focus on root cause analysis with Einstein actions. Einstein now analyzes historical data to route problems to the correct queue instantly, without manual intervention. IT teams can also create change requests directly from incidents or problems with significantly less effort. Einstein prefills these change requests with relevant data, eliminating repetitive manual entry.

notes.feature_name: Link Affected Configuration Items Faster with Einstein Suggestions
notes.description: Use Einstein to analyze ticket descriptions, similar issues, correlated metadata, and complex discovery logs to identify the source of service disruption. By predicting affected assets across incidents, problems, changes, and releases, Einstein ensures your Configuration Management Database (CMDB) remains accurate and up to date. IT support reps can select from a ranked list of the suggested configuration items and link them to issues. Eliminate manual research and reduce cognitive load for your IT team, and help them meet SLAs sooner during critical changes.

notes.description: Integrate AI into the support workflow with Agentforce to reduce the need for employees to go through traditional IT help desk queues. Employees can now easily add comments or reopen resolved tickets.

notes.feature_name: Collaboration Channels
notes.description: IT support teams can now access critical CMDB data directly in Microsoft Teams to investigate and triage issues with better context. MS Teams now natively supports approvals, notifications, and record channels, and apps are renamed for better clarity. Transition your Teams workspace from legacy ticketing to a modern, conversational AI experience.

notes.feature_name: Unify Service Workflows Within Microsoft Teams
notes.description: Integrate your IT service processes directly into Microsoft Teams to create a high-productivity workspace for employees and support reps. Employees can now resolve issues independently through a conversational AI experience powered by Agentforce, which provides instant troubleshooting and knowledge browsing. Managers can accelerate service delivery by approving or rejecting employee requests natively via actionable notifications, while IT support reps can rapidly swarm complex incidents by collaborating with experts in dedicated, record-linked channels.

notes.feature_name: Accelerate Diagnosis with the Integrated CI Hub in Microsoft Teams
notes.description: Empower your IT support reps to perform deep technical investigations without leaving Microsoft Teams. The CI Hub is a centralized workspace providing access to critical Configuration Management Database (CMDB) data such as Configuration Item (CI) details, associated incidents, and change histories. Support teams can swiftly diagnose service disruptions by visualizing CI relationships on embedded service maps that provide a rich, interactive view of assets and their dependencies. The CI Hub streamlines incident response and ensures that the most relevant infrastructure data is always available.

notes.feature_name: Find Tasks Quickly with New App Names in Microsoft Teams
notes.description: The Employee Hub and Fulfiller Hub apps in Microsoft Teams are now Salesforce IT Service and Salesforce IT Desk, respectively. The new names clearly identify the target user for each app, helping users quickly find the right tools for their specific business tasks. While the names have changed to improve clarity and adoption, this visual update does not impact existing functionality or workflows.
