notes.description: Improve configuration accuracy and streamline CI modeling with the Unified CI Attributes Manager. Manage attributes and attribute sets from a single workspace that reduces configuration effort and eliminates navigation friction. Define, group, and assign attributes more efficiently during CMDB setup. This unified experience helps admins maintain consistency, reduce redundancy, and accelerate CI data standardization across the environment.

notes.feature_name: Extend Attribute Configuration with Lookup Relationship Type in Attributes
notes.description: Bring richer business context into CMDB by creating lookup relationship attributes that link Configuration Items (CI) to important Salesforce objects such as accounts, cost centers, and business units. Use these attributes to remove duplication and allow CI data to reflect organizational structures accurately. Teams gain deeper insights into ownership, financial alignment, and business dependencies directly from the CI records.

notes.feature_name: Speed Up CMDB Setup with Import Enhancements
notes.description: Set up CMDB faster with improvements to the Configuration Item (CI) import workflow. Updated field mapping, clearer validations, and intuitive guidance reduce errors during data onboarding. Teams can upload CI records with greater accuracy and fewer iterations, helping organizations move from initial data load to operational readiness sooner while maintaining high data quality from the start.

notes.feature_name: Highlight Important Configuration Details with Key Attributes
notes.description: Help your teams focus on the attributes that matter the most by marking selected Configuration Item (CI) fields as key attributes. You can switch to a concise view that highlights critical operational details, improving decision-making during troubleshooting, audits, and impact assessments. Key attributes make CI records easier to interpret during time-sensitive work.

notes.feature_name: Create Tailored Service Map Layouts to Focus on the Insights That Matter
notes.description: Visualize service dependencies the way that your teams need them with configurable service map layouts. Select Configuration Item (CI) types and CI relationships to create focused dependency layouts that support troubleshooting, planning, and impact analysis. Custom layouts help different teams see the right level of detail and understand operational risks quickly and accurately.

notes.feature_name: Track Configuration Changes with the CI History Tab
notes.description: Review how Configuration Items (CIs) change over time by using the CI History tab in a CI record page. The History tab shows who made each update, when it occurred, and what changed. Discovery updates also appear as part of the audit trail. Validate data accuracy, troubleshoot unexpected changes, and maintain a clear record of CI activity across manual edits and discovery processes.

notes.feature_name: Find Relevant Configuration Items Swiftly with List View Filters
notes.description: Improve productivity and reduce search time by filtering Configuration Items (CIs) directly from the list view. New filter options lets you narrow down CI lists based on key attributes such as ownership, type, and dates. Use filters to focus on the records that matter for troubleshooting, audits, and day-to-day operations.

notes.feature_name: Expand Data Cloud Insights with CMDB Data Streams
notes.description: Enrich your Data Cloud instance with core Configuration Management Database (CMDB) information using new data model objects (DMOs) and their corresponding data streams. The data streams in the CMDB data kit allow you to sync configuration item data to Data Cloud to prepare the data for analysis, build reports, and apply transformations. The data model objects available are Configuration Item, Configuration Item Relationship, Configuration Item Attribute, Configuration Item Attribute Value, and Configuration Item Type Definition.

notes.feature_name: Discovery Enhancements for Salesforce CMDB
notes.description: Automate asset tracking and gain better visibility into configuration item activity with new Discovery enhancements. Integrate Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB to bring more device data into your configuration management processes. Use new Discovery audit fields on configuration items to understand when an asset was first discovered, updated, or rescanned. Review installed software and system components from the new Components tab on each configuration item record.

notes.feature_name: Integration of Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB
notes.description: Connect Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB to bring device inventory data into your configuration management processes. Intune syncs key attributes such as device identifiers, operating system details, and ownership information to enrich CMDB records and improve asset coverage.

notes.feature_name: Understand Asset Discovery Activity by Using the Discovery Sources Card
notes.description: View and analyze asset discovery activity by using the Discovery Sources card in a Configuration Item (CI) record. Use audit fields to understand when a configuration item was first discovered, last updated, or rescanned by each discovery source. The Discovery card on the CI record also displays timestamps for agentless scans, agent scans, cloud connectors, and API-based integrations. The fields give you insights into asset freshness and help verify that discovery jobs are running as expected.
notes.edition: Unlimited, Enterprise, and Performance Editions with Agentforce IT Service where Discovery is enabled

notes.feature_name: Analyze Installed Software and System Components with the New Components Tab
notes.description: Review and analyze installed software and system components by using the Components tab on a configuration item (CI) record. Review installed software, system processes, network adapters, certificates, and other component data collected during discovery. The tab organizes component inventory into structured categories and provides a searchable, filterable table. You can also add components manually when required.

notes.feature_name: Extend Asset Coverage by Integrating Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB
notes.description: Connect Microsoft Intune with Salesforce CMDB to bring device inventory data into your configuration management processes. Intune syncs key attributes such as device identifiers, operating system details, and ownership information. Use the integration to enrich CMDB records, improve asset completeness, and reduce manual effort during asset onboarding. Integrating Intune expands asset discovery coverage across managed devices managed by Intune. The integration improves CMDB accuracy, reduces gaps in asset data, and unifies device inventory across cloud and on-premises sources.

Admins clone a template and customize its conditions and assignments instead of building rules from scratch.

notes.feature_name: Extend Assignment Rules to Service Requests
notes.description: Assignment rules now support service requests, enabling IT teams to route requests automatically to the right user or queue based on defined criteria when a service request is created. Admins can configure rules to evaluate request attributes, ensure consistent ownership, and reduce manual reassignment.

notes.feature_name: Role-based Notifications
notes.description: Role-based notifications keep the right people informed in the right way, reducing delays. For example, for incident updates, you can notify employees in Slack or Teams, send in-app alerts to fulfillers, and send emails to team managers, ensuring each stakeholder gets updates in the most effective channel for them.
notes.security_notes: To create notifications, users need the Design Notifications user permission.

notes.feature_name: IsVipUserImpacted Field
notes.description: Track whether an incident impacts high-priority users to ensure they receive immediate attention. Use the new IsVipUserImpacted field on the Incident object.

notes.feature_name: Demoted Picklist Value
notes.description: Track when a major incident is downgraded to a standard record. Use the new Demoted picklist value for the MajorIncidentStatus field on the Incident object.

notes.feature_name: MilestoneTimer Field
notes.description: Track time remaining or overdue duration for incident milestones. Helps agents stay compliant with service level targets by showing the time left or overdue for current milestones. Use the new MilestoneTimer field on the Incident object.

notes.feature_name: NextMilestone Field
notes.description: Identify the specific action required to complete a milestone. Enables users to see the action needed to meet a deadline, such as 'Acknowledge Within' or 'Resolve Within.' Use the new NextMilestone field on the Incident object.

notes.feature_name: CreatedFromRecord Field
notes.description: Identify the source record used to generate a Service Catalog Request to trace the original Case or Incident ID from which it was created. Use the new CreatedFromRecord field on the Service Catalog Request object.

notes.feature_name: Change Request Conflict Object
notes.description: Store information about scheduling clashes between a change request and other planned activities or deployments. Enables proactive risk mitigation by providing visibility into overlapping schedules to prevent service disruptions. Use the Change Request Conflict object.

notes.feature_name: Service Management Privilege
notes.description: Use the Service Management Privilege object to store the specific service management privileges assigned to individual employees and define the direct relationship between a user and their held permissions.

notes.feature_name: Employee Service Management Privilege
notes.description: Use the Employee Service Management Privilege object to store information about requests for products or services provided by a service catalog. Helps companies manage and fulfill requests while tracking the lifecycle of the service delivery.

notes.feature_name: Service Request
notes.description: Use the Service Request object to store information about requests for products or services provided by a service catalog. Helps companies manage and fulfill requests while tracking the lifecycle of the service delivery.

notes.feature_name: Configuration Item Type Identification Rule
notes.description: Use the Configuration Item Type Identification Rule object to store the definition of a rule used to identify whether a configuration item (CI) already exists in the CMDB or needs to be created as a new record.
affected_components: Configuration Item Type Identification Rule object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Item Type Identification Field Mapping
notes.description: Use the Configuration Item Type Identification Field Mapping object to store the mapping of configuration item attributes used in an identification rule to evaluate whether a discovered item already exists in CMDB.
affected_components: Configuration Item Type Identification Field Mapping object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Service Map Layout
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Service Map Layout object to store the business specific layout in a service graph. A layout specifies which configuration item types and relationship types are included or excluded.
affected_components: Configuration Management Service Map Layout object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Service Map Configuration Item Type
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Service Map Configuration Item Type object to store the relationship between a service map layout and a configuration item type definition.
affected_components: Configuration Management Service Map Configuration Item Type object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Service Map Relationship Type
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Service Map Relationship Type object to store the relationship between a service map and a configuration item relationship type definition.
affected_components: Configuration Management Service Map Relationship Type object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Discovery Target Field Mapping
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Discovery Target Field Mapping object to store the field mapping between a discovery target and Configuration Item (CI) fields in the CMDB.
affected_components: Configuration Management Discovery Target Field Mapping object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Discovery Target Flow
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Discovery Target Flow object to store the relationship between a discovery target and their linked automation flows.
affected_components: Configuration Management Discovery Target Flow object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Discovery Target Scan Document
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Discovery Target Scan Document object to store the documents associated with a specific discovery target scan.
affected_components: Configuration Management Discovery Target Scan Document object

notes.feature_name: Configuration Management Data Bundle
notes.description: Use the Configuration Management Data Bundle object to store the specific bundle that has been installed for a customer. Includes details such as bundle type, version, industry context, and installer identity.

notes.feature_name: New Canonical GraphQL API in Configuration Management Database
notes.description: Use the Canonical GraphQL API to query and manage configuration items in the Agentforce IT Service configuration management database (CMDB).

notes.feature_name: Query a configuration item by its unique identifier
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /service/itsm/v1/cmdb/graphql resource using the ciById query. New request body: Query Configuration Item by ID Input. New response body: Query Configuration Item by ID Output.

notes.feature_name: Search configuration items with pagination, filtering, and sorting
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /service/itsm/v1/cmdb/graphql resource using the searchCI query. New request body: Search Configuration Item Input. New response body: Search Configuration Item Output.

notes.feature_name: Retrieve the status of a previously submitted asynchronous job
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /service/itsm/v1/cmdb/graphql resource using the getStatus query. New request body: Get Status of Operation Input. New response body: Get Status of Operation Output.

notes.feature_name: Create or update configuration items in bulk
notes.description: Make a POST request to the /service/itsm/v1/cmdb/graphql resource using the upsertCI mutation. New request body: Upsert Configuration Items Input. New response body: Upsert Configuration Items Output.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced tools for case management
notes.description: Give your reps enhanced tools to streamline case management and accelerate communication. Provide instant context through a unified Case Timeline, Quick Text for standardized responses, and original attachment visibility directly on the case record.

notes.feature_name: Gain Instant Case Context with Case Timeline
notes.description: Give your reps a single, unified, and intelligent timeline component for cases. This new component replaces the current fragmented collection of feeds and related lists with a single curated view of case-related events. Reps get instant context with a proactive workspace that intelligently organizes customer conversations, internal team collaboration, and key case milestones. The new timeline brings together channels like emails, chats, and messages into a clean, threaded view. Pre-configured Timeline Templates are available immediately for use in the Timeline feature, requiring no configuration.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer (with Industries Service Excellence enabled)

notes.feature_name: Use Quick Text in Case Comments
notes.description: With Quick Text, reps can quickly add predefined text snippets, including dynamic merge fields to Case Comments. Quick Text standardizes internal and external communication, keeps notes consistent, and saves time by reducing repetitive manual typing.

notes.feature_name: Easily View Original Case Attachments
notes.description: Reps can now view the original case attachments directly from the case details page. Original attachments include any files added by the customer in the initial message at the time of case creation. This feature eliminates the need for reps to navigate to the Attachments related list to locate these files.

notes.feature_name: Enhance Your Security of Organization-Wide Email Addresses
notes.description: Organization-Wide Email Addresses (OWA) are now required to be verified before sending Case emails with custom content. This security enhancement prevents unauthorized use of the <noreply@salesforce.com> address and protects against potential phishing attempts.
notes.security_notes: Requires verification of Organization-Wide Email Addresses before sending emails.

notes.feature_name: Use Quick Text in Case Comments
notes.description: With Quick Text, reps can quickly add predefined text snippets, including dynamic merge fields to Case Comments. Quick Text standardizes internal and external communication, keeps notes consistent, and saves time by reducing repetitive manual typing. Admins create and store Quick Text messages in shared folders. Reps can insert these messages which can contain dynamic merge fields, like Contact.FirstName that are automatically replaced with data based on the related case contact.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer

notes.feature_name: Easily View Original Case Attachments
notes.description: Reps can now view the original case attachments directly from the case details page. Original attachments include any files added by the customer in the initial message at the time of case creation. This feature eliminates the need for reps to navigate to the Attachments related list to locate these files.
notes.edition: Essentials, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer

notes.feature_name: Enhance Your Security of Organization-Wide Email Addresses
notes.description: Organization-Wide Email Addresses (OWA) are now required to be verified before sending Case emails with custom content. This security enhancement prevents unauthorized use of the <noreply@salesforce.com> address and protects against potential phishing attempts. This update ensures that all customers configure and verify their Organization-Wide Email Address before sending Case emails containing custom content. Previously, some organizations could bypass this requirement, creating a security risk where unauthorized users could potentially send malicious emails using the trusted @salesforce.com domain. This enhancement closes that security gap by enforcing verification requirements across all organizations.
notes.edition: All Salesforce editions that support Case email functionality
notes.security_notes: Organizations must configure a verified Organization-Wide Email Address before sending emails with custom content.

notes.feature_name: Email Across Languages with Real-Time Translations
notes.description: Let service reps translate Service Email conversations, expanding customer support across languages. A rep can translate an end user’s email into the rep’s language, as well as translate their response into the end user’s language before sending. Previously, a Service Email rep had to speak the same language as an end user in order to assist. Where: This change applies to Service Email. View required editions. How: Go to the Real-Time Translations node in Setup, and turn on Translate Service Email. Optionally, upload a custom terminology file to assist with translation of your business terminology. A Service rep can translate an end-user’s email in the case feed by clicking the dropdown to the right of the email and selecting Translate Email Body.

notes.feature_name: Agent Session Continuity is Improved for Case-Related Email Threads
notes.description: An Agentforce Agent session now remains associated with a case and all of its related emails over a three-day period. This preserves crucial information and context variables, such as user verification status or variables set by previous actions. Previously, a new session was opened for every inbound email, causing AI to lose conversation history and requiring repeated reinterpretation of earlier interactions.

notes.feature_name: Inbound Limit for Service Agent Emails is Extended
notes.description: Inbound emails handled by the Service agent count against your Agentforce for Service on Email daily transaction limit, which is 5,000 by default. You can ask Salesforce Customer Support to raise this limit. Previously, this checked against the org's single email limit, which is shared with Apex and flow emails.

notes.feature_name: Email Composer is Modernized with New Button Colors
notes.description: As part of a TinyMCE upgrade, the email composer button icons changed from grey to blue. This brings the composer up to our Salesforce Lightning Design System standards.

notes.feature_name: Real-Time Translation for Service Responses
notes.description: A Service rep can translate their response to a customer by writing it in the case composer, highlighting it, and clicking the Translate action. If the output looks good, they click Insert, and then send their text.

notes.feature_name: Improved Agent Session Continuity for Case-Related Emails
notes.description: An Agentforce Agent session now remains associated with a case and all of its related emails over a three-day period. This preserves crucial information and context variables, such as user verification status or variables set by previous actions. Previously, a new session was opened for every inbound email, causing AI to lose conversation history and requiring repeated reinterpretation of earlier interactions.

notes.feature_name: Inbound Limit for Service Agent Emails is Extended
notes.description: Inbound emails handled by the Service agent count against your Agentforce for Service on Email daily transaction limit, which is 5,000 by default. You can ask Salesforce Customer Support to raise this limit. Previously, this checked against the org's single email limit, which is shared with Apex and flow emails.

notes.feature_name: Email Composer is Modernized with New Button Colors
notes.description: As part of a TinyMCE upgrade, the email composer button icons changed from grey to blue. This brings the composer up to our Salesforce Lightning Design System standards.

notes.feature_name: Accept Clearer Terms and Conditions in Enhanced Chat
notes.description: Read and accept a modernized Terms and Conditions page when you create a new Enhanced Chat channel or activate an inactive one. Get the information you need quicker with shorter, simplified text and links.

notes.feature_name: Save Money by Hiding the Real-Time Translations Preview Bar
notes.description: Reduce calls to Agentforce Speech Foundation, each of which can consume flex credits if your free limit is reached, by hiding the Real-Time Translations preview bar. When the bar is hidden, a service rep won’t see a translation preview as they type, but their message will be translated when sent to the end user, calling Agentforce Speech Foundation just once.

notes.feature_name: Protect Service Reps’ Privacy in Business-Initiated Outbound Messaging
notes.description: Replace your Service reps’ first and last name with your Company Name in the disclaimer that’s sent to a Message End User the very first time that you send them a Business-Initiated Outbound message. Use this in conjunction with Aliases to ensure that reps’ private information is protected.

notes.feature_name: Educate Service Reps About Chat Exit Behavior
notes.description: Enable confirmation modals to provide Service reps with more information about what happens when they exit a chat.

notes.feature_name: Take Ownership of your Data Residency on Unified WhatsApp
notes.description: Define the specific country or region where your WhatsApp data is stored at rest on Meta's side. By giving you control over data residency for each individual phone number, we help you meet your internal compliance and regulatory requirements.

notes.feature_name: Increase Familiarity and Rapport in WhatsApp with Read Receipts and Typing Indicators
notes.description: Improve the transparency of a WhatsApp customer interaction by showing read receipts to Service reps and showing typing indicators to end users.

notes.feature_name: Review De-Duplication Activity for Unified WhatsApp
notes.description: New logic ensures that you contact the most recently added individual in a Unified WhatsApp channel, and new error codes explain why other duplicate individuals weren’t contacted. Previously, there wasn’t logic to choose an Individual, and there weren’t error codes to explain why we made the choice.

notes.feature_name: Accept Clearer Terms and Conditions in Enhanced Chat
notes.description: Read and accept a modernized Terms and Conditions page when you create a new Enhanced Chat channel or activate an inactive one. Get the information you need quicker with shorter, simplified text and links.
notes.activation_required: To accept Terms and Conditions for a new Enhanced Chat channel, go to the Messaging Settings page in Setup and click the option to create a new channel. You’ll see the Terms and Conditions in the setup flow. To accept Terms and Conditions for a newly-activated Enhanced Chat channel, go to the Messaging Settings page in Setup and click the name of your messaging channel. Then, click Activate.

notes.feature_name: Save Money by Hiding the Real-Time Translations Preview Bar
notes.description: Reduce calls to Agentforce Speech Foundation, each of which can consume flex credits if your free limit is reached, by hiding the Real-Time Translations preview bar. When the bar is hidden, a service rep won’t see a translation preview as they type, but their message will be translated when sent to the end user, calling Agentforce Speech Foundation just once.

notes.feature_name: Protect Service Reps’ Privacy in Business-Initiated Outbound Messaging
notes.product_area: Enhanced In-App Chat and Enhanced Messaging
notes.description: Replace your Service reps’ first and last name with your Company Name in the disclaimer that’s sent to a Message End User the very first time that you send them a Business-Initiated Outbound message. Use this in conjunction with Aliases to ensure that reps’ private information is protected.

notes.feature_name: Educate Service Reps About Chat Exit Behavior
notes.product_area: Enhanced In-App Chat and Enhanced Messaging
notes.description: Enable confirmation modals to provide Service reps with more information about what happens when they select Leave Chat or End Chat in various scenarios. We added confirmation modals to let Service Reps know what happens when they click End Chat in the following scenarios: Non-conference mode, agent clicks End Chat; Conference mode, owner clicks End Chat for all; Conference mode, participant (non-owner) clicks Leave Chat.

notes.feature_name: Take Ownership of your Data Residency on Unified WhatsApp
notes.description: Define the specific country or region where your WhatsApp data is stored at rest on Meta's side. By giving you control over data residency for each individual phone number, we help you meet your internal compliance and regulatory requirements.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited Editions for Marketing Cloud Engagement Growth and Advanced Editions

notes.feature_name: Increase Familiarity and Rapport in WhatsApp with Read Receipts and Typing Indicators
notes.description: Improve the transparency of a WhatsApp customer interaction by showing read receipts to Service reps and showing typing indicators to end users.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited Editions for Marketing Cloud Engagement Growth and Advanced Editions, Service Cloud WhatsApp

notes.feature_name: Review De-Duplication Activity for Unified WhatsApp
notes.description: New logic ensures that you contact the most recently added individual in a Unified WhatsApp channel, and new error codes explain why other duplicate individuals weren’t contacted. Previously, there wasn’t logic to choose an Individual, and there weren’t error codes to explain why we made the choice.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions for Marketing Cloud Engagement Growth and Advanced Editions

notes.feature_name: Unified Individual Contact Error Codes
notes.description: If a Unified Individual has multiple associated individuals, each with the same phone number, we only contact one Individual. We chose the latest Individual that was created with that phone number. We introduced three new error codes to help explain why an individual wasn’t contacted: SF-3025 - The message wasn't sent because the recipient's phone number wasn't a valid E.164 number. Correct the phone number and try again. SF-3045 - The message wasn't sent because the recipient's phone number is associated with a different individual ID. SF-3035 - The message wasn't sent because a contact record wasn't found.

notes.feature_name: Migration to External Client Apps for Bring Your Own Channel
notes.description: External client apps (ECAs) are the next generation of connected apps, designed to improve security and address packaging and distribution issues. While existing connected apps for Bring Your Own Channel integrations will continue to work, you won’t be able to create new connected apps without first requesting the ability from Salesforce Support starting with Spring ’26. This step is part of a Salesforce plan to eventually replace connected apps with ECAs. Consider migrating to an external client app for Bring Your Own Channel.

notes.feature_name: Changes to Event-Driven Settings Fields in Bring Your Own Channel
notes.description: To improve the scalability of Bring Your Own Channel messaging services, we implemented changes to event-driven settings fields in the ConversationChannelDefinition and CustomMsgChannel objects. New fields are available in Winter ’26 (API version 65.0), and old fields are removed in Spring ’26 (API version 66.0). These are breaking changes.
notes.timeline: Old fields removed in Spring '26 (API version 66.0)
notes.breaking_changes: Old fields are removed in Spring ’26 (API version 66.0).

notes.feature_name: Migration to ECAs for Bring Your Own Channel
notes.product_area: Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging and CCaaS
notes.description: Inventory your connected apps and begin migrating to ECAs to prepare for the end of support. Use second-generation (2GP) packaging for a Bring Your Own Channel integration that uses an external client app. If you must create a new connected app, contact Salesforce Support to request access to this functionality.
affected_components: Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging
Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS

notes.feature_name: Maintain Service for Your Bring Your Own Channel Integration by Migrating Settings Fields
notes.product_area: Bring Your Own Channel for Messaging and CCaaS
notes.description: To improve the scalability of Bring Your Own Channel messaging services, changes were implemented to event-driven settings fields in the ConversationChannelDefinition and CustomMsgChannel objects. New fields are available in Winter ’26 (API version 65.0), and old fields are removed in Spring ’26 (API version 66.0). These are breaking changes. Customers must update their managed package to one that contains supported fields by Spring ’26.
notes.timeline: Changes must be made by Spring ’26.
notes.breaking_changes: Deprecated fields are IsInboundReceiptsEnabled, IsRoutingWorkResultEnabled, and IsTypingIndicatorDisabled in ConversationChannelDefinition; HasInboundReceipts and HasTypingIndicator in CustomMsgChannel. Customers must migrate to new fields.

notes.feature_name: EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorDisabled
notes.description: Use EventCapabilitiesIsTypingIndicatorDisabled instead of HasTypingIndicator. If you don’t make required updates by Spring ’26 or if customers use a managed package version with removed fields starting in Spring ’26, your implementation will break.
notes.breaking_changes: Implementation will break if required updates are not made by Spring ’26.

notes.feature_name: Scale Your VoiceCall Object with More Custom Fields
notes.description: For greater flexibility, the maximum number of custom fields for the standard VoiceCall object is increased to 300. This update improves data capacity and avoids the architectural complexity of creating custom objects or polling other standard objects to store voice-related data.

notes.feature_name: Manage Contact Center Groups and Queues in Bulk
notes.description: Admins can now use the Bulk API to create contact center groups and queues in bulk. This enhancement improves admin efficiency, supports large contact centers, and enables more comprehensive data management.

notes.feature_name: Add Flexibility to Unified Routing Transfers by Routing Calls to a Flow
notes.description: This Omni-Channel Unified Routing enhancement unlocks more dynamic routing capabilities, allowing you to use complex business logic and skill-based criteria within a flow to determine the next transfer target.

notes.feature_name: Route Voicemails and Desk Phone Calls with Unified Routing
notes.description: Unified Routing now supports voicemails and desk phone calls. This feature reduces wait times, improves rep productivity, and provides an efficient Omni-Channel experience. You can use this feature only if your telephony provider supports it.

notes.feature_name: Minimize Abandoned Calls with Queued Callbacks for Omni-Channel Unified Routing
notes.description: Respect customers’ time, save telephony minutes, and keep callers from abandoning their calls by giving them the option to request a callback without losing their place in a queue. When a rep accepts a contact request in Omni-Channel, an outbound call to the customer starts automatically. The initial inbound call, contact request, and outbound call are all linked for easy rep reference. This feature is available for contact centers using Omni-Channel Unified Routing.

notes.feature_name: Use Voicemail Drop for Outbound Calls (Beta)
notes.description: When an outbound call reaches voicemail, you can disconnect the call to automatically leave your default pre-recorded message. While the system plays the message, you can move on to your next task immediately, increasing your productivity. You can record multiple messages and select one as your default.

notes.feature_name: Link Voice Calls to Their Source Records Automatically
notes.description: When you initiate an outbound call by using Click-to-Dial from a custom object, or a contact role on a Case or Opportunity, the resulting VoiceCall record now automatically establishes a lookup relationship to the source record. This change removes the need for manual linking and reduces the need for customization with Flows or Apex triggers. Previously, this automatic linking was available only for Account, Case, Contact, Lead, Opportunity, CollectionPlan, and ContactRequest records.

notes.feature_name: Get Actionable Error Messages for Failed Outbound Calls
notes.description: When an outbound call fails to connect, reps now have descriptive and actionable error messages directly in the Omni-Channel widget, which helps them to take immediate corrective action. This feature improves rep productivity and helps increase successful call connection rates.

notes.feature_name: Get the Latest Enhancements for Your Amazon Connect Contact Center
notes.description: Update your contact center to version 20.0 to unlock the latest Service Cloud Voice features. This version introduces a Lambda layer for running service health checks, and contact flows and subflows for voicemail drop. To test the updates before they go live in production, deploy them to your sandbox first.

notes.feature_name: Update Your United States AWS Billing Address for Accurate Emergency Calling Fees
notes.description: As of March 1, 2025, AWS charges emergency calling fees for Amazon Connect based on the subaccount billing address. By default, Salesforce uses its own address for Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect customers with companies in the United States. To ensure correct charges and compliance with local regulations, update your AWS account to reflect your company’s address instead.

notes.feature_name: Scale Your VoiceCall Object with More Custom Fields
notes.description: For greater flexibility, the maximum number of custom fields for the standard VoiceCall object is increased to 300. This update improves data capacity and avoids the architectural complexity of creating custom objects or polling other standard objects to store voice-related data.

notes.feature_name: Manage Contact Center Groups and Queues in Bulk
notes.description: Save time and reduce manual data entry when managing your contact center. Admins can now use the Bulk API to create contact center groups and queues in bulk. This enhancement improves admin efficiency, supports large contact centers, and enables more comprehensive data management.
affected_components: Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect
Service Cloud Voice with Partner Telephony from Amazon Connect
notes.security_notes: If you integrate Voice manually by importing the XML file, you need the Connect Management role to create contact center groups using the Bulk API.

notes.feature_name: Add Flexibility to Unified Routing Transfers by Routing Calls to a Flow
notes.description: Simplify the decision process for your reps by configuring voice call transfers with Omni-Channel Flows. This Omni-Channel Unified Routing enhancement unlocks more dynamic routing capabilities, allowing you to use complex business logic and skill-based criteria within a flow to determine the next transfer target.
affected_components: Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect
Service Cloud Voice with Partner Telephony from Amazon Connect

Service Cloud Voice with Partner Telephony from Amazon Connect

notes.feature_name: S3 Role for Voicemail Drop
notes.description: Introduces an S3 role to perform CRUD operations in the S3 bucket for voicemail drop.

notes.feature_name: Lambda Optimizations for Unified Routing
notes.description: Includes Lambda optimizations to support unified routing transfers.

notes.feature_name: Update AWS Billing Address for Emergency Calling Fees
notes.description: As of March 1, 2025, AWS charges emergency calling fees for Amazon Connect based on the subaccount billing address. By default, Salesforce uses its own address for Service Cloud Voice with Amazon Connect customers in the United States. To ensure correct charges and compliance with local regulations, update your AWS account to reflect your company’s address instead.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of Legacy Chat
notes.description: Legacy chat is scheduled for retirement on February 14, 2026, and is in maintenance mode until then. You can continue to use chat until that date, but we recommend transitioning to Messaging for In-App and Web for modernized customer communication. Messaging offers many of the chat features that you love plus asynchronous conversations that can be picked back up at any time.

notes.feature_name: Transition to Messaging for In-App and Web
notes.description: As of February 14, 2026, legacy chat will be removed and you can’t access or use chat. To avoid service interruptions to your customers, migrate to Messaging for In-App and Web before that date.
notes.edition: Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience in all editions
notes.breaking_changes: Legacy chat will no longer be accessible after February 14, 2026.

notes.feature_name: Streamlined Setup Experience for Customer Signals Intelligence
notes.description: Get going faster with a more streamlined setup experience. Empower your reps to address customer needs more effectively with real-time insights. Updated prompts that you can further edit for your specific business needs. Enable faster performance for large data volumes with improved capacity and higher processing limits while reducing costs.

notes.feature_name: Real-Time Insights During Customer Interactions
notes.description: Give your reps and supervisors immediate visibility into customer interactions by showing sentiment for cases as they happen. This real-time intelligence helps your reps make quick decisions and respond effectively to customer needs.

notes.feature_name: Customize Out-of-the-Box AI Insights Prompts
notes.description: Work with more accurate insights based on updated out-of-the-box insights prompts that are now more effective. Modify the out-of-the-box insights prompts to accommodate unique use cases based on your specific business needs. Easily adjust insights prompts and also quickly revert to default templates, leading to more relevant and actionable intelligence.

notes.feature_name: Process Large Data Volumes
notes.description: Scale your implementation to handle increased usage and larger data volumes without slowing down performance. Staging transformation, increased LLM processing limits, and the newly introduced Small Language Model (SLM), help reduce credit consumption and prevent activation failures during onboarding. Channel-specific data pipelines process data faster for your users.

notes.feature_name: Channel Activation Options in Setup
notes.description: Easily turn channels on and off with the new channel activation options in setup.
notes.edition: Lightning Experience in Enterprise, Unlimited editions with Data Cloud enabled, and the Customer Exprc Intel add-on

notes.feature_name: Uncover Real-Time Insights During Customer Interactions
notes.description: Give your reps and supervisors immediate visibility into customer interactions by showing sentiment for cases as they happen. This real-time intelligence helps your reps make quick decisions and respond effectively to customer needs.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited editions with Data Cloud enabled, and the Customer Exprc Intel add-on

notes.feature_name: Customize Out-of-the-Box AI Insights Prompts
notes.description: Work with more accurate insights based on updated out-of-the-box insights prompts that are now more effective. Modify the out-of-the-box insights prompts to accommodate unique use cases based on your specific business needs. Easily adjust insights prompts and also quickly revert to default templates, leading to more relevant and actionable intelligence.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited editions with the Einstein for Platform, or Einstein or Agentforce for Sales or Service add-on, or Agentforce Foundations, and with Data Cloud enabled and the Customer Exprc Intel add-on

notes.feature_name: Process Large Data Volumes
notes.description: Scale your implementation to handle increased usage and larger data volumes without slowing down performance. Staging transformation, increased LLM processing limits, and the newly introduced Small Language Model (SLM), help reduce credit consumption and prevent activation failures during onboarding. Channel-specific data pipelines process data faster for your users.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited editions with Data Cloud enabled

notes.feature_name: Get Role-Based Case Overviews with Enhanced Summaries
notes.description: Quickly catch up on cases with dynamic, AI-generated summaries tailored to your specific role and context. By surfacing only the essential information, Enhanced Summaries helps service reps and managers see precisely what is required for their role, reducing the time spent interpreting data and driving quicker, more informed customer interactions.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Agentforce for Service add-on or Agentforce 1 Edition

notes.feature_name: Work Summaries for Case (Beta) Is Being Retired
notes.description: Work Summaries for Case (beta) is scheduled for retirement on June 30, 2026, and is in maintenance mode until then. You can continue to use Work Summaries for Case (beta) until that date, but we recommend transitioning to Enhanced Summaries. Enhanced Summaries offers role-specific summaries and more summarization features, which will help your service reps work more efficiently.

notes.feature_name: Track AI Performance with Service AI Adoption & Analytics
notes.description: Access business impact and adoption of Einstein for Service with a dashboard that directly correlates AI usage with operational key performance indicators (KPIs). Track agent performance by analyzing key metrics such as Average Handle Time (AHT) and As-Is Usage to identify where AI usage drives positive outcomes and efficiency. Use these insights to enhance decision-making, track ROI, manage AI features, and provide data-driven coaching for your service reps.

notes.feature_name: Enhanced Summaries
notes.description: In Setup, go to the Enhanced Summaries page and turn on Enhanced Summaries. In the Available Objects section, on the Case tab, turn on the toggle for Case. Then, set up case summary configurations for different roles, such as Service Rep or Manager.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Einstein for Service add-on or Einstein 1 Edition

notes.feature_name: Work Summaries for Case (Beta) Retirement
notes.description: Work Summaries for Case (beta) is scheduled for retirement on June 30, 2026, and is in maintenance mode until then. You can continue to use Work Summaries for Case (beta) until that date, but we recommend transitioning to Enhanced Summaries. Enhanced Summaries offers role-specific summaries and more summarization features, which will help your service reps work more efficiently.
notes.breaking_changes: As of June 30, 2026, Work Summaries for Case (beta) will be removed and you can’t access or use Case Summaries. To avoid service interruptions, switch to Enhanced Summaries before that date.

notes.feature_name: Track AI Performance with Service AI Adoption & Analytics
notes.description: Access business impact and adoption of Einstein for Service with a dashboard that directly correlates AI usage with operational key performance indicators (KPIs). Track agent performance by analyzing key metrics such as Average Handle Time (AHT) and As-Is Usage to identify where AI usage drives positive outcomes and efficiency. Use these insights to enhance decision-making, track ROI, manage AI features, and provide data-driven coaching for your service reps.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, Developer editions of Service Cloud, Einstein for Service Edition
notes.security_notes: Requires Data Cloud admin permission set, Tableau Limited Viewer license and permission sets, and Service data kit.

notes.feature_name: Einstein Service Replies
notes.description: Translate customer replies to inquiries automatically, and have your service reps responses translated automatically for customers. Decrease Response Time for Global Service Representatives with Translate Service Replies. Allow service representatives to translate end-user messages and their own responses before sending them. Service reps can now view customer replies in their local language, respond, and have that response translated back into the customer’s preferred language.
notes.activation_required: In Setup, under Einstein Service Replies, enable the Translate Service Replies toggle.
notes.edition: Enterprise and Unlimited editions with the Agentforce for Service add-on, Agentforce 1 Service Edition
notes.security_notes: Translate Service Replies is only available for customers with MIAW enabled and the Real Time Translation Permission set.

notes.feature_name: Improve SLA Reporting by Using Rule-based Milestone Pause
notes.description: Free up your service reps from the manual overhead of stopping a record when the next step is outside their purview. Admins can set rules to automatically pause milestones when the defined conditions are met. For example, a milestone can be paused automatically if the case status is 'Waiting for Customer.' The milestone timer stops during the pause duration and resumes when the pause conditions change. The target date is reevaluated when the milestone unpauses. This helps with more accurate SLA reporting and clearly highlights delays.

notes.feature_name: Keep Departments Aligned on SLA Commitments with Bidirectional Milestone Visibility
notes.description: Get real-time visibility into Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Operation Level Agreements (OLAs) commitments and status by viewing milestones across parent and child records. This feature enables transparent, real-time visibility into child and parent milestone statuses. This allows for better coordination and alignment on SLA and OLA commitments and timelines when departments or vendors besides the service reps also contribute to resolutions.

notes.feature_name: Optimize SLA Compliance by Using Agentforce SLA Summary
notes.description: Get a complete view of Service Level Agreement (SLA) adherence with Agentforce SLA Summary. Track key metrics like SLA breach data and trends, milestone performance, service rep performance.

notes.feature_name: Improve SLA Reporting by Using Rule-based Milestone Pause
notes.description: Free up your service reps from the manual overhead of stopping a record when the next step is outside their purview. Admins can set rules to automatically pause milestones when the defined conditions are met. For example, a milestone can be paused automatically if the case status is 'Waiting for Customer.' The milestone timer stops during the pause duration and resumes when the pause conditions change. The target date is reevaluated when the milestone unpauses. This helps with more accurate SLA reporting and clearly highlights delays.

notes.feature_name: Keep Departments Aligned on SLA Commitments with Bidirectional Milestone Visibility
notes.description: Get real-time visibility into Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Operation Level Agreements (OLAs) commitments and status by viewing milestones across parent and child records. This feature enables transparent, real-time visibility into child and parent milestone statuses. This allows for better coordination and alignment on SLA and OLA commitments and timelines when departments or vendors besides the service reps also contribute to resolutions.

notes.feature_name: Optimize SLA Compliance by Using Agentforce SLA Summary
notes.description: Get a complete view of Service Level Agreement (SLA) adherence with Agentforce SLA Summary. Track key metrics like SLA breach data and trends, milestone performance, service rep performance and workload, and risk indicators. You can also monitor average response and resolution times against SLA targets, and see which records are close to missing an SLA.

notes.feature_name: Agentforce SLA Summary
notes.description: Agentforce SLA Summary is available to admins and supervisors. From Setup, find and select Agentforce Agents. Open Agentforce Employee Agent in Builder and add the SLA Insights topic to it. Save, test, and activate the agent.
notes.edition: Service and Developer editions with the Service Cloud

notes.feature_name: Revamped Matrix Survey Question View
notes.description: Improve survey readability on desktops and smaller screens with the revamped view for matrix questions. The new design presents options for each question in a dedicated dropdown menu, making it easier to read the full question and select an option.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions where Feedback Management - Starter or Growth is enabled

notes.feature_name: Save Partial Survey Responses for up to 999 days
notes.description: You can now save partially completed survey responses for up to 999 days, extending the time window from the previous 15-day limit. You can configure this duration from anywhere between 1 and 999 days. The Partial Survey Settings are also located in the Default Settings.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions where Feedback Management - Starter or Growth is enabled

notes.feature_name: Save Partial Survey Responses from Guest Users
notes.description: Partially Completed Survey Responses are saved automatically for unauthenticated guest users. Previously, this functionality was available only for authenticated users.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions where Feedback Management - Starter or Growth is enabled

notes.feature_name: Customize Your Surveys with Custom CSS
notes.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) offer flexible styling for your surveys. Custom CSS lets you define the fonts, colors, layout, padding between elements, and icon alignment and size of the survey beyond the default settings of the Survey Builder. You can use Custom CSS to create surveys that perfectly align with your branding.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions where Feedback Management - Starter or Growth is enabled

notes.feature_name: Redesigned Matrix Question View
notes.description: The redesigned view resolves issues with readability and selection on mobile and desktop devices by giving each matrix question its own dropdown, significantly enhancing readability and simplifying the process of selecting options.

notes.feature_name: Save Partial Survey Responses for up to 999 days
notes.description: You can now save partially completed survey responses for up to 999 days, extending the time window from the previous 15-day limit. This duration can be configured from anywhere between 1 and 999 days. The response status changes from Started to Partially Completed after the configured window period, and these responses are stored in survey objects.

notes.feature_name: Save Partial Survey Responses from Guest Users
notes.description: Partially Completed Survey Responses are saved automatically for unauthenticated guest users. Previously, this functionality was available only for authenticated users.

notes.feature_name: Customize Your Surveys with Custom CSS
notes.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) offer flexible styling for your surveys. Custom CSS lets you define the fonts, colors, layout, padding between elements, and icon alignment and size of the survey beyond the default settings of the Survey Builder. You can use Custom CSS to create surveys that perfectly align with your branding.

notes.feature_name: Unified Employee License (UEL)
notes.description: Onboard new users with Unified Employee License (UEL), a standard license with simplified administration and wall-to-wall coverage that expands feature support for new users. UEL streamlines administration, delivers wall-to-wall employee coverage, and provides the right level of access for efficient work. It now includes Manager Provisioning along with support for Agentforce actions, employee provisioning, Unified Catalog items, and employee enablements.

notes.feature_name: Confidential Case Reporting
notes.description: Give your employees a secure channel to report confidential workplace issues, such as harassment, discrimination, or misconduct. Employees can report these issues directly from the employee portal or with Agentforce. Agentforce detects sensitive language and creates a confidential case for tracking to ensure that the case is automatically flagged and discreetly routed only to authorized HR reps. Admins manage access and routing of cases based on case categories to ensure employee privacy and accurate resolution.

notes.feature_name: Confidential Case Reporting
notes.description: Employees can report confidential issues using the employee portal or Agentforce. On the Employee Portal, users can go to the Help Center tab and click New Confidential Case to provide details, review, and submit the case for a case ID. A corresponding public complaint record is automatically created to route the issue discreetly to the right personnel. In Agentforce, sensitive language in chat is detected, offering a confidential case or human HR connection. If a case is created, it’s flagged as confidential and routed discreetly.

notes.feature_name: Organize Articles and Improve Navigation with Knowledge Maps
notes.description: Organize your knowledge articles into a hierarchical structure to make it easier for users to find and navigate content. This feature helps to keep your knowledge base consistent and well-structured, enhancing user experience and efficiency. This feature is now generally available and includes some changes since the pilot release.

notes.feature_name: Get More Done in the Lightning Article Editor
notes.description: With the improved Lightning Article Editor, users can write knowledge articles more efficiently. The streamlined features allow for the creation of top-notch content.

notes.feature_name: Unified Knowledge Is Being Retired
notes.description: Unified Knowledge is scheduled for retirement in Summer ’26. Users can continue using it until then, but it is recommended to migrate to Data 360 connectors to ingest external knowledge into Salesforce, helping Agentforce deliver accurate responses. Data 360 connectors offer many features from Unified Knowledge, plus improved file size handling, enhanced innovation, and better data storage and pipeline capabilities.

notes.feature_name: Identify and Address Gaps in Your Knowledge Base with Self Learning Knowledge
notes.description: Self Learning Knowledge gathers and analyzes detailed customer data from channels like surveys, voice, chat, and cases to learn about customer behavior and preferences. It uses information from past cases and conversations to help support teams decide where to update or add information.

notes.feature_name: Organize Articles and Improve Navigation with Knowledge Maps
notes.description: Organize your knowledge articles into a hierarchical structure to make it easier for users to find and navigate content. This feature helps to keep your knowledge base consistent and well-structured, enhancing user experience and efficiency. This feature, which is now generally available, includes some changes since the pilot release.

notes.feature_name: Get More Done in the Lightning Article Editor
notes.description: With the improved Lightning Article Editor, write knowledge articles more efficiently. Take advantage of the streamlined features to create top-notch content.

notes.feature_name: Dark Mode in Article Editor
notes.description: You can now use Dark Mode in the article editor, making it easier to edit content in low-light environments.

notes.feature_name: Improved Editing on iPad
notes.description: Editing articles on the iPad is now easier. The expanded toolbar in narrow layouts no longer blocks your editing space, allowing full access to toolbar options while you edit.

notes.feature_name: Consistent Editor Toolbar
notes.description: The editor toolbar is now visually consistent. Split buttons now match the size and look of the other buttons.

notes.feature_name: Edit Smart Links in Lists
notes.description: You can now edit smart links in bulleted or numbered lists in knowledge articles without affecting the formatting of the list.

notes.feature_name: Switching Numbering Styles
notes.description: You can now easily switch between numeric (1, 2, 3) and alphabetic (a, b, c) numbering styles in nested lists. Previously, switching from alphabetic back to numeric wasn't easy.

notes.feature_name: Resolved Formatting Issues
notes.description: We've resolved general formatting issues with numbered and bulleted lists in the article editor.

notes.feature_name: Consistent List Formatting
notes.description: The format and alignment of bulleted lists are now the same in the draft version and the published article.

notes.feature_name: Consistent Paragraph Spacing
notes.description: The paragraph spacing is now consistent in the article editor and accurately reflects the spacing in the published article.

notes.feature_name: Smooth Scrolling for Anchor Links
notes.description: Anchor links in Knowledge articles now smoothly scroll to the target section, giving readers a better experience in long articles.

notes.feature_name: Fixed Drag-and-Drop Scrolling Issue
notes.description: In Chromium browsers like Chrome, Edge, Opera, and Brave, dragging content in the article editor caused unexpected scrolling. This issue is now fixed, making drag-and-drop much better.

notes.feature_name: Tooltip Behavior Improvement
notes.description: The tooltips on toolbar buttons now disappear as expected when you move your mouse away.

notes.feature_name: Accessibility Improvements for Screen Readers
notes.description: Screen reader users can now give article feedback more easily. Screen readers correctly announce 'Was this article helpful?' when they reach the Like or Dislike buttons on the article.

notes.feature_name: Increased Contrast Ratio
notes.description: We increased the contrast ratio for non-text elements like icons, buttons, and borders in the article editor to meet accessibility standards, making the interface easier to use for users with low-vision.

notes.feature_name: Word Count Feature for Screen Readers
notes.description: The article editor now shows the word count and includes ARIA label, making it easy for screen reader users to track their word count as they write.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of Unified Knowledge
notes.description: Unified Knowledge is scheduled for retirement in Summer ’26. You can continue using it until then, but we recommend migrating to Data 360 connectors to ingest your external knowledge into Salesforce, helping Agentforce deliver accurate responses. Data 360 connectors offer many of the features that you love from Unified Knowledge, plus improved file size handling, enhanced innovation, and better data storage and pipeline capabilities. Currently, they support Agentforce grounding, and more functionalities will be added before the expected deprecation.

notes.feature_name: Retirement of Unified Knowledge Connectors
notes.description: In June 2026, support for Unified Knowledge connectors will be removed and you won’t be able to access or use Unified Knowledge connectors. To avoid service interruptions, migrate to Data 360 connectors before they retire.
notes.edition: Unlimited Edition and all other editions with the Knowledge add-on license
notes.breaking_changes: Unified Knowledge connectors will no longer be accessible.

notes.feature_name: Self Learning Knowledge
notes.description: Self Learning Knowledge gathers and analyzes detailed customer data from channels like surveys, voice, chat, and cases to learn about customer behavior and preferences. It uses the information in past cases and conversations to help your support team decide where to update or add information.
notes.activation_required: Requires setup in Customer Signals Intelligence
notes.edition: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Professional Editions with Customer Signals Intelligence enabled

notes.feature_name: Improved Proactive Service Features
notes.description: Deliver smarter, more efficient customer service with improved proactive detection, AI-guided troubleshooting, real-time personalization, and streamlined Self-Service. Enhanced detection tools, interactive troubleshooting, unified profiles, Activity Timelines, and a personalized Pending Task banner create more contextual experiences.

notes.feature_name: New Detection and Segmentation UI
notes.description: Configure the what and who of proactive service scenarios with a new detection UI that helps you define event-based or scheduled triggers and dynamically identify affected customers. This capability completes the detection stage of the Proactive Service lifecycle and supports rule-based outreach powered by Data Cloud and event activity.

notes.feature_name: Interactive Troubleshooting for Proactive Scenarios
notes.description: Help service reps proactively resolve customer issues by generating AI-driven troubleshooting plans when no automation exists. Service reps define a scenario prompt during campaign planning, and Agentforce Service agent uses it to guide customers through a tailored troubleshooting session after they open an outreach.

notes.feature_name: Give Your Users Personalized Self-Service with a Unified Customer Profile
notes.description: Surface a real-time, unified customer profile to deliver personalized, context-aware self-service. You can read up-to-date attributes, activity history, and insights like sentiment and automatically write new activity data as users interact. Your users benefit from fewer forms to fill out, faster completion, and a more relevant self-service journey.

notes.feature_name: Help Experience Cloud Site Users Track Their History with a Personalized Activity Timeline
notes.description: Give your Experience Cloud site users a clear view of their activity history with an in-page timeline that highlights logins, case updates, messages, Website Engagement, and Web Search Engagement events. They can quickly understand what has happened, where they left off, and what has changed since their last visit, without navigating multiple pages.

notes.feature_name: Guide Experience Cloud Site Users with a Proactive Pending Task Banner
notes.description: The personalized Pending Task banner on the Experience Cloud site homepage helps users see and act on high-priority tasks as soon as they log in. These recommendations are based on the user’s profile, recent activity, and AI-powered insights. For enhanced, insight-driven task recommendations, you can activate the new AI Experiences tile.

notes.feature_name: Bill AI Self-Service Usage More Accurately with Session-Based Tracking
notes.description: Get more accurate billing for AI powered Self Service activity by tracking usage per authenticated login session. This feature groups all AI interactions, like Knowledge Article Summary or Dynamic Q&A within a single session, providing usage reports that reflect how customers engage with Agentic Portal features.

notes.feature_name: Improve Dynamic Q&A Performance with Persisted Questions and Answers for Authenticated Users
notes.description: Dynamic Q&A now loads faster and reduces Large Language Model (LLM) calls by persisting generated questions and answers for authenticated users. Previously, Dynamic Q&A regenerated a new set of questions each time an authenticated user viewed an article. The feature now stores the generated questions, which improves performance and gives users quicker access to relevant answers.

notes.feature_name: Monitor Proactive Service Campaign Performance
notes.description: Gain a unified view of your service campaign performance with the campaign analytics dashboard. You can monitor outreach, open rates, completion rates, bounce rates, and individual customer progress to assess campaign health and week-over-week trends. Use these insights to identify issues, follow up with customers, and measure campaign return on investment (ROI).

notes.feature_name: Build Proactive Service Scenarios with the New Detection and Segmentation UI
notes.description: Configure the what and who of proactive service scenarios with a new detection UI that helps you define event-based or scheduled triggers and dynamically identify affected customers. This capability completes the detection stage of the Proactive Service lifecycle and supports rule-based outreach powered by Data Cloud and event activity.

notes.feature_name: Proactive Service Detection and Segmentation
notes.description: Proactive Service identifies customer-impacting issues before they are reported. The detection and segmentation UI makes it easier for you to set up event-based and scheduled-based detection, define affected customers, and prepare outreach and fulfillment plans more accurately. This enhancement improves detection quality, expands use cases, and ensures timely, targeted communications.
affected_components: Proactive Service Detection and Segmentation page

notes.feature_name: Interactive Troubleshooting for Proactive Scenarios
notes.description: Help service reps proactively resolve customer issues by generating AI-driven troubleshooting plans when no automation exists. Service reps define a scenario prompt during campaign planning, and Agentforce Service agent uses it to guide customers through a tailored troubleshooting session after they open an outreach. This approach broadens coverage of proactive issues, accelerates resolution, and captures conversation traces to improve future troubleshooting plans.

notes.feature_name: Unified Customer Profile for Personalized Self-Service
notes.description: Surface a real-time, unified customer profile to deliver personalized, context-aware self-service. You can read up-to-date attributes, activity history, and insights like sentiment and automatically write new data.

notes.feature_name: Unified Profile Data Model for Self-Service
notes.description: This change allows Self-Service journeys to reflect each customer’s history and current context by utilizing profile attributes, behavioral activity, and computed insights. It enables the adaptation of UI elements, pre-filling of forms, and intelligent guidance for users. The configuration can be done from Setup by mapping customer profile fields to form inputs and enabling activity writeback for real-time updates in the customer’s activity stream.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Professional, Unlimited, Developer with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions

notes.feature_name: Personalized Activity Timeline for Experience Cloud Users
notes.description: This feature provides Experience Cloud site users with an in-page timeline that highlights their activity history, including logins, case updates, messages, Website Engagement, and Web Search Engagement events. This consolidated view helps users track their past interactions, understand their progress, and resume tasks without navigating multiple pages.

notes.feature_name: Guide Experience Cloud Site Users with a Proactive Pending Task Banner
notes.description: The personalized Pending Task banner on the Experience Cloud site homepage helps users see and act on high-priority tasks as soon as they log in. These recommendations are based on the user’s profile, recent activity, and AI-powered insights. For enhanced, insight-driven task recommendations, you can activate the new AI Experiences tile.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Professional, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.security_notes: Admins configuring the Pending Task banner must have permissions to manage Experience Cloud and Data Cloud personalization settings.

notes.feature_name: Bill AI Self-Service Usage More Accurately with Session-Based Tracking
notes.description: Get more accurate billing for AI powered Self Service activity by tracking usage per authenticated login session. This feature groups all AI interactions, like Knowledge Article Summary or Dynamic Q&A within a single session, providing usage reports that reflect how customers engage with Agentic Portal features.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Professional, Unlimited, and Developer editions
notes.security_notes: Users must have access to Agentic Portal capabilities, including AI Knowledge Article Summary and Dynamic Q&A.

notes.feature_name: Improve Dynamic Q&A Performance with Persisted Questions and Answers for Authenticated Users
notes.description: Dynamic Q&A now loads faster and reduces Large Language Model (LLM) calls by persisting generated questions and answers for authenticated users. Previously, Dynamic Q&A regenerated a new set of questions each time an authenticated user viewed an article. The feature now stores the generated questions, which improves performance and gives users quicker access to relevant answers.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Professional, Unlimited, and Developer editions

notes.feature_name: Monitor Proactive Service Campaign Performance
notes.description: Gain a unified view of your service campaign performance with the campaign analytics dashboard. You can monitor outreach, open rates, completion rates, bounce rates, and individual customer progress to assess campaign health and week-over-week trends. Use these insights to identify issues, follow up with customers, and measure campaign return on investment (ROI).

notes.feature_name: Service Setup and Service Setup Assistant Retiring in New Orgs
notes.description: In Salesforce orgs created in Spring ‘26 or later, including sandbox orgs, the Service Setup app and Service Setup Assistant will no longer be available. These features will still be available in maintenance mode in orgs created before Spring '26.

notes.feature_name: Command Center for Service
notes.description: Omni-Channel Supervisor is now Command Center for Service. Only the name has changed. You retain all the features and tools you already use to monitor your teams and optimize performance, now available under Command Center for Service.

notes.feature_name: Route Voice Conversations to External Bots
notes.description: Route voice conversations to your preferred external bots by using the Route Work action in Omni-Channel flows. You can use external bots that are tailored to your specific needs and preferences.

notes.feature_name: Command Center for Service
notes.description: Omni-Channel Supervisor is now Command Center for Service. Only the name has changed. You retain all the features and tools you already use to monitor your teams and optimize performance, now available under Command Center for Service.

notes.feature_name: Route Voice Conversations to External Bots
notes.description: Route voice conversations to your preferred external bots by using the Route Work action in Omni-Channel flows. You can use external bots that are tailored to your specific needs and preferences. AI agents answer questions 24/7, reducing wait times and improving accessibility for customers. AI agents handle frequently asked questions, enabling service reps to focus on more complex tasks. Integrate external bots, such as Google CCAI, and customize them to meet your specific business requirements.
notes.edition: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, Developer with Foundations or Agentforce 1 Editions where Service Cloud Voice and Agentforce are enabled

notes.feature_name: Customer Success Score Enhancements
notes.description: Technical Health expansion: Boost your system's Technical Health with enhanced security insights. Our new 'Security' subcategory provides deeper visibility into technical performance, helping you identify vulnerabilities and optimize system reliability. Additional signals: Gain a comprehensive understanding with enhanced product adoption visibility. Get a more holistic view of your product adoption through additional signals to provide a more complete view of your adoption and usage metrics.
